The past and future history of the modern world

A puzzle whose pieces are spread across time and space.

By one of the 21st century's greatest historians.

This will be a perpetual work in progress. Found a typo, cringe, out-of-date entry, or want a specific event or video added? Contact me.

Support this noncommercial project on Patreon.

Definitions: (tap)
  • Economics:
    • Ebidta: Earnings before interest, debt, taxes, and amortization.
    • GilDollar: one year of economic activity for one average human, rounded down to 2021 equivalent $63,500. So 2021 equivalent $100,000 is 1.57 GD (100000/63500).
    • GilCent: one working day of economic output, or 1/250 of one GilDollar, as 2021 equivalent $254. So 2021 equivalent $1270 is 5 GC.
  • Geography:
    • MegaAcre (MAcre): 1 million acres (4,046 km2, 1562.5 mi2, 0.4 MHectares). This measurement of area is somewhere between Rhode Island (1,045 mi2 or 0.7 MAcres) and Delaware (1,954 mi2 or 1.3 MAcres).
    • MegaHectare (MHectare): 1 million hectares (10k km2, 3861 mi2, 2.5 MAcres). This measurement of area is slightly smaller than Kosovo (10.9k km2, 4.2k mi2, 1.1 MHectares, 2.7 MAcres).
    • River rate: One CR = 7,500 m3/s (265,000 ft3/s) - this is the Columbia River's average flow rate.
    • Titles: (Ocean, Sea, River, Mountain, etc) If it's in the 90th percentile for size or cultural significance, then the title goes before, otherwise it goes after.
  • Humans:
    • Name: JobTitle FirstName(# of their name) LastName [Translation] Titles/Epithets [Translation] (Country) - "Leader of the local human governance institution" is a job title.
    • Person: A legal being, as recognized by a government.
  • Legends: stories of all kinds, from mythology to tradition to bedtime stories to major feature-length productions.
  • Nation abbreviations:
    • DPR(N)Korea - The Democratic People's Republic of (North) Korea - is reunification just a dream?
    • HREmpire, HREmperor, etc: Holy Roman Et cetera.
    • NSGermany: National Socialism was a major disaster that resulted in millions of uninstalls. The existential crisis of this national movement was a fundamental insecurity about their equality with other humans, and this stems from the inherent ranking system that comes with an irrational obsession with arbitrary attributes.
    • PRChina - 中国 (Zhōngguó) [Central Country] People's Republic of China holds the Yellow River Valley into the 21st century.
    • ROChina - 中華 (Zhōnghuá) [Central Flower] Republic of China held the Yellow River Valley kinda between WW1 and WW2.
    • RO(S)Korea - The Republic of (South) Korea - is reunification just a dream?
  • Powers: Groups of humans which perform historical events and/or have an impact on other humans, and meet the following criteria. May also be a Polity.
    • Limited but functional government (maybe just one person)
    • Well-defined boundaries, that may be highly mobile (i.e. geographical borders of the currently-inhabited area).
    • Shared defense and resources.
    • Common goals and mutual interest.
    Examples:
    • Empire: Power large enough that one person alone cannot effectively provide goverance, and governmental power is split between several individuals.
      • Horizontal Empire: Split your state in half and give an ally full control over that half, but you're still friends.
      • Vertical Empire: Get an ally to handle the day-to-day tasks while you focus on larger strategic matters.
      • Federation: Vertical empire with multiple allies split horizontally as peers.
      • Confederacy: Horizontal empire with a friendship club of leaders.
    • Micropower: Small or medium group of mobile humans, like a mobile nation or state.
      • Government is often one person or a small committee.
      • Boundaries may be highly mobile.
  • Square brackets [] contain translations.
  • Temple - from the Latin templum - is a building reserved for spiritual rituals and activities such as prayer and sacrifice.
  • Workdays: 250 days per year, from rounding down the 250.2422 working days in a year (365.2422 minus 104 weekend days and 11 holidays).
  • Uninstall: We play Life on Super Hardcore Mode - it bans you from the server and deletes itself so you can't play again.
    • Covid-day is 8270 uninstalls, rounded from 5.58 million uninstalls in 675 days = 8267.
    • Covid-rate is x/Covid-days uninstalls per day. For 1000 uninstalls per day, this is 12.09% Covid-rate.
King
DayMonthYearEventReferenceNotes
-13.8 billionUniverse formed.(2021) YT: MBS - Age of Universe(Big Bang and Universal Inflation)
-4.68 billionSol star formation beginsWiki: Geologic times
-4.63 billionSol star formation completesWiki: Geologic times
-4.6 billionSun formation.(2021) YT: MBS - Age of UniverseOur Sol star was formed from the gravitational collapse (accretion) of matter within a large molecular cloud.
-4.6 billionEarly Bombardment Phase begins.Wiki: Geologic timesThis phase gets its name from the lunar geologic timescale when the Nectaris Basin and other greater lunar basins form by big impact events. (Gets easier after the Moon forms out of the Earth, after it also forms.)
-4.57 billionEarth begins forming.Wiki: Geologic times
-4.56717 billionEarth formation completes, starting the Hadean eon.Wiki: Geologic times(According to Billy Joel, this is the approximate start point of "The Fire".)
-4.54 billionEarth formation.(2021) YT: MBS - Age of UniverseThis date might be Earth's originating material, core formation, or final accretion.
-4.533 billionEnd of the Early Bombardment Phase, Moon begins to form.Wiki: Geologic timesProbably from giant impact with Theia at the end of the Early Bombardment Phase. Asteroids and comets bring water to Earth.
-4.527 billionMoon formation complete.Wiki: Geologic times
-4.5 billionJupiter's orbit decreased towards the sun, letting it pull material from the orbits of Ceres and Mars.(2021) YT: BBC-EL - JupiterThis prevented Ceres from forming as one body, and instead became the asteroid belt. Also prevented Mars from growing to full size - one or both may have been the "super-Earths" we see in other solar systems. Then Saturn (pre-rings) also decreases towards the sun, until it nearly reaches Jupiter - and through the magic of orbital mechanics, orbits of both Jupiter and Saturn increase. (Jupiter and Saturn kept going out until they orbitally rebounded against Neptune, pushing it into the Kuiper Belt and possibly causing the Late Heavy Bombardment. Ceres and the Asteroid Belt are still constantly disturbed by Jupiter - and the Kuiper Belt disturbed by Neptune, even in the 21st century, occasionally causing new comets and asteroids.)
-4.5 billionMost common meteorites formed.(2021) YT: SM - Rocks from MarsThese formed in the solar system alongside the planets - maybe in the asteroid or Kuiper belts, or Oort cloud - and minorly impacted Earth at some point.
-4.404 billionZircon, the oldest known mineral, forms somewhere on Earth.Wiki: Geologic times
-4.28 billionPossible first appearance of plate tectonics.Wiki: Geologic timesEarliest evidence for life based on unusually high amounts of light isotopes of carbon, a common sign of life.
-4.13 billionIndirect photosynthetic evidence (e.g., kerogen) of primordial life.Wiki: Geologic timesThis era overlaps the beginning of the Late Heavy Bombardment of the Inner Solar System, produced possibly by the planetary migration of Neptune into the Kuiper belt as a result of orbital resonances between Jupiter and Saturn.
-4.031 billionOldest known Earth rocks began to form.Wiki: Geologic times
-4 billionHadean eon ends and Eoarchean era begins the Archean eonWiki: Geologic timesSimple single-celled life (probably bacteria and archaea). Oldest probable microfossils. The first life forms and self-replicating RNA molecules evolve. Napier Orogeny in Antarctica. (Early life were basically interstellar nucleobases and self-replicating RNA in a soap bubble trenchcoat.)
-4 billionMars's iron core cools, and its magnetosphere reduces in magnitude.(2021) YT: CSS - Starship (ep7)This allowed the solar wind to blow away the majority of its atmosphere, including most water.
-3.9 billionLarge asteroid impacts Mercury, creating a 1600 km (1000 mi) diameter impact crater.(2022) YT: GH - Asteroid causes eruptionsOn the antipode [other side of the planet], there is a large land uplift, a common sign of volcanic activity.
-3.7 billionLake Eridania (Mars) has geothermal vents beneath.(2021) YT: BBC-EL - Largest WaterfallEridania Basin in the 21st century. Were abiogenesis to occur on Mars, it would have been in a very fertile soup like this one.
-3.6 billionEoarchean era ends and Paleoarchean era begins.Wiki: Geologic timesFirst known oxygen-producing bacteria. Oldest definitive microfossils. Oldest cratons on Earth (such as the Canadian Shield and the Pilbara Craton) may have formed during this period. Rayner Orogeny in Antarctica.
-3.6 billionMars enters an ice age and becomes more volcanically active.(2021) YT: BBC-EL - Largest WaterfallLiquid water had either froze on the surface or underground, then was flash-thawed and caused massive flooding on the highlands. It flowed to Hebes Chasma, where it formed a massive waterfall 10 km (6.21 mi) wide and 1 km (.62 mi) tall. After this, the water disappears, and some would eventually be transported to Mars' poles, forming the giant ice caps we see in the 21st century. (Most would be lost beyond the circumference of the atmosphere, as Mars' magnetic field is smaller than its atmosphere - Venus too - allowing the solar wind to literally blow away their water molecules. Another reason Earth is so weird - our magnetic field is gigantic, much larger than our atmosphere, safely guarding most of our water from the solar wind.)
-3.58 billionOldest known Earth rocks completed forming.Wiki: Geologic times
-3.2 billionPaleoarchean era ends and Mesoarchean era begins.Wiki: Geologic timesBlake River Megacaldera Complex begins forming in present-day Ontario and Quebec. First stromatolites (probably colonial cyanobacteria). Oldest macrofossils. Humboldt Orogeny in Antarctica.
-2.8 billionMesoarchean era ends and Neoarchean era begins.Wiki: Geologic timesStabilization of most modern cratons; possible mantle overturn event. Abitibi greenstone belt in present-day Ontario and Quebec begins to form. Insell Orogeny begins.
-2.696 billionBlake River Megacaldera Complex completes forming in present-day Ontario and Quebec.Wiki: Geologic times
-2.6 billionAbitibi greenstone belt in present-day Ontario and Quebec stabilizes.Wiki: Geologic times
-2.5 billionNeoarchean era ends the Archaen eon, and the Oxygen catastrophe begins the Siderian era of the Protozoic eon.Wiki: Geologic timesBanded iron formations form. They're shiny and do not corrode in this weakly-reducing pre-oxygenation atmosphere. Insell Orogeny ceases.
-2.5 billionOxygenation event begins Proterozoic eon.(2021) YT: MBS - Age of Universe
-2.43 billionSleaford Orogeny on Australian continent, Gawler Craton.Wiki: Geologic times
-2.4 billionGreat Oxidation Event - Earth's atmosphere and the shallow ocean first experienced a rise in oxygen.Wiki: Great Oxidation EventGeological, isotopic, and chemical evidence suggest that biologically produced molecular dioxygen (O2, from cyanobacteria) started to accumulate in Earth's atmosphere and changed it from a weakly reducing atmosphere to an oxidizing atmosphere, causing many existing species on Earth to uninstall. (Also causing rust in all exposed iron such as banded iron formations. This is another reason why Earth is so weird - the very high concentration of dinitrogen and dioxygen in the atmosphere. The planet reeks of cyanobacteria farts.)
-2.3 billionSiderian period ends and Rhyacian period begins.Wiki: Geologic timesBushveld Igneous Complex forms. Huronian glaciation.
-2.05 billionRhyacian period ends and Orosirian period begins.Wiki: Geologic timesThe atmosphere becomes oxygenic. Vredefort and Sudbury Basin asteroid impacts. Much orogeny, very mountain forming, wow. Penokean and Trans-Hudsonian Orogenies in North America. Kimban Orogeny, Gawler craton in Australian continent begins.
-2.005 billionGlenburgh Orogeny, Glenburgh Terrane, Australian continent begins.Wiki: Geologic times
-2 billionEarly Ruker Orogeny in Antarctica begins.Wiki: Geologic times
-1.92 billionGlenburgh Orogeny, Glenburgh Terrane, Australian continent completes.Wiki: Geologic times
-1.8 billionOrosirian period ends and Statherian period begins.Wiki: Geologic timesFirst complex single-celled life: protists with nuclei, Francevillian biota. Columbia is the primordial supercontinent. Kimban Orogeny in Australian continent ends. Yapungku Orogeny on Yilgarn craton, in Western Australia.
-1.7 billionEarly Ruker Orogeny in Antarctica completes.Wiki: Geologic times
-1.68 billionMangaroon Orogeny begins on the Gascoyne Complex in Western Australia.Wiki: Geologic times
-1.65 billionKararan OrogenyWiki: Geologic times Gawler Craton, South Australia.
-1.62 billionMangaroon Orogeny ends.Wiki: Geologic times
-1.6 billionVishnu Schist period in American Southwest.(2019) YT: SciShow - Missing 1.2by
-1.6 billionStatherian period ends and Calymmian period begins.Wiki: Geologic timesPlatform covers expand. Barramundi Orogeny, McArthur Basin, Northern Australia, and Isan Orogeny, Mount Isa Block, Queensland
-1.5 billionFungi diverged from other life on EarthWiki: Evolution of fungi
-1.4 billionCalymmian period ends and Ectasian period begins.Wiki: Geologic timesPlatform covers continue to expand. Green algae colonies in the seas. Grenville Orogeny in North America.
-1.2 billionEctasian period ends and Stenian period begins.Wiki: Geologic timesNarrow highly metamorphic belts due to orogeny as Rodinia supercontinent forms. Sveconorwegian orogeny starts. Late Ruker / Nimrod Orogeny in Antarctica possibly begins.
-1.08 billionMusgrave Orogeny, Musgrave Block, Central Australia.Wiki: Geologic times
-1 billionStenian period ends and Tonian period begins.Wiki: Geologic timesRodinia supercontinent persists. Sveconorwegian orogeny ends. Trace fossils of simple multi-celled eukaryotes. First radiation of dinoflagellate-like acritarchs. Grenville Orogeny tapers off in North America. Pan-African orogeny in Africa. Deposition of Adelaide Superbasin and Centralian Superbasin begins on Australian continent.
-920 millionLake Ruker / Nimrod Orogeny in Antarctica, Edmundian Orogeny, Gascoyne Complex, Western Australia begins.Wiki: Geologic times
-850 millionLake Ruker / Nimrod Orogeny in Antarctica, Edmundian Orogeny, Gascoyne Complex, Western Australia completes.Wiki: Geologic times
-720 millionTonian period ends and Cryogenian period begins.Wiki: Geologic timesPossible Snowball Earth period. Fossils still rare. Rodinia landmass begins to break up. Late Ruker / Nimrod Orogeny in Antarctica tapers off.
-650 millionEntire planet covered in ice.(2019) YT: SciShow - Missing 1.2by"Snowball Earth" theory.
-635 millionCryogenian period ends and Ediacaran period begins.Wiki: Geologic timesGood fossils of the first multi-celled animals. Ediacaran biota flourish worldwide in seas. Simple trace fossils of possible worm-like Trichophycus, etc. First sponges and trilobitomorphs. Enigmatic forms include many soft-jellied creatures shaped like bags, disks, or quilts (like Dickinsonia). Taconic Orogeny in North America. Aravalli Range orogeny in Indian Subcontinent. Beginning of Petermann Orogeny on Australian continent.
-633 millionBeardmore Orogeny in Antarctica begins.Wiki: Geologic times
-620 millionBeardmore Orogeny in Antarctica completes.Wiki: Geologic times
-562 millionExplosion of shell-less undersea animal life.(2016) YT: Economist - CambrianEdiacaran period.
-543 millionPetermann Orogeny on the Australian continent tapers off.Wiki: Geologic times
-542 millionEarth's surface is still barren.(2016) YT: Economist - CambrianEverything changed when the Cambrian period attacked. Oxygen levels may have been too low to support large animals before this - scant evidence beyond "Snowball Earth" causing heavy erosion during melts. Visual optics, eyes, begin to evolve.
-541 millionEdiacaran period ends the Proterozoic eon and Cambrian period begins the Paleozoic era of the Phanerozoic eonWiki: Geologic timesMajor diversification of life in the Cambrian Explosion. Numerous fossils; most modern animal phyla appear. First chordates appear, along with a number of extinct, problematic phyla. Reef-building Archaeocyatha abundant; then vanish. Trilobites, priapulid worms, sponges, inarticulate brachiopods (unhinged lampshells), and numerous other animals. Anomalocarids are giant predators, while many Ediacaran fauna uninstall. Prokaryotes, protists (e.g., forams), fungi and algae continue past 21st century. Gondwana emerges. Atmospheric CO2 content roughly 15 times Holocene levels (6000 ppmv compared to 21st century's 400 ppmv)
-541 millionProliferation of complex life ends Proterozoic eon and begins Phanerozoic (current).(2021) YT: MBS - Age of UniverseAbundant plant and animal life.
-540 millionFirst echinoderms appear.(2016) YT: Economist - CambrianStarfish and sea urchins are their descendants.
-540 millionLachlan Orogeny on Australian continent begins.Wiki: Geologic times
-530 millionFirst brachiopods appear.(2016) YT: Economist - CambrianTrilobytes come soon after.
-525 millionCambrian Period in American Southwest.(2019) YT: SciShow - Missing 1.2byEnd of Cambrian period.
-514 millionRoss Orogeny in Antarctica & Delamerian Orogeny begin.Wiki: Geologic times
-490 millionRoss Orogeny in Antarctica & Delamerian Orogeny complete.Wiki: Geologic times
-485.4 millionCambrian period ends and Ordovician period begins.Wiki: Geologic timesInvertebrates diversify into many new types (e.g., long straight-shelled cephalopods). Early corals, articulate brachiopods (Orthida, Strophomenida, etc.), bivalves, nautiloids, trilobites, ostracods, bryozoa, many types of echinoderms (crinoids, cystoids, starfish, etc.), branched graptolites, and other taxa all common. Conodonts (early planktonic vertebrates) appear. First green plants and fungi on land.
-443.4 millionOrdovician period ends and Silurian period begins.Wiki: Geologic timesIce age.
-440 millionLachlan Orogeny on Australian continent completes.Wiki: Geologic times
-440 millionLate Ordovician Mass Extinction.(2021) YT: LEMMiNO - Apocalypse70% of marine species and 45% of marine genera went extinct. This might have been due to a gamma ray burst.
-423 millionFirst vascular plants (the rhyniophytes and their relatives), first millipedes and arthropleurids on land.Wiki: Geologic timesFirst jawed fishes, as well as many armoured jawless fish, populate the seas. Sea-scorpions reach large size. Tabulate and rugose corals, brachiopods (Pentamerida, Rhynchonellida, etc.), and crinoids all abundant. Trilobites and mollusks diverse; graptolites not as varied. Beginning of Caledonian Orogeny for hills in England, Ireland, Wales, Scotland, and the Scandinavian Mountains. Also continued into Devonian period as the Acadian Orogeny, above. Taconic Orogeny tapers off. Lachlan Orogeny on Australian continent tapers off.
-419.2 millionSilurian period ends and Devonian period begins.Wiki: Geologic times
-372.2 millionFirst clubmosses, horsetails and ferns appear, as do the first seed-bearing plants (progymnosperms), first trees (the progymnosperm Archaeopteris), and first (wingless) insects.Wiki: Geologic timesStrophomenid and atrypid brachiopods, rugose and tabulate corals, and crinoids are all abundant in the oceans. Goniatite ammonoids are plentiful, while squid-like coleoids arise. Trilobites and armoured agnaths decline, while jawed fishes (placoderms, lobe-finned and ray-finned fish, and early sharks) rule the seas. First tetrapods still aquatic. Old Red Continent of Euramerica. Beginning of Acadian Orogeny for Anti-Atlas Mountains of North Africa, and Appalachian Mountains of North America, also the Antler, Variscan, and Tuhua Orogeny in New Zealand.
-360 millionCarboniferous period begins.(2021) YT: SH - PlasticNatural selection invented wood trunks with bark, which requires lignin, which nothing could digest. For millions of years, they were buried in sediment and became coal.
-360 millionCrab-like decapod crustaceans first evolve.(2020) YT: PBSE - Why Crabs?Late Devonian Period of the Paleozoic era. The first was Paleopalaemon (paleo-pa-layman).
-358.9 millionDevonian period ends and Carboniferous period begins.Wiki: Geologic times
-330.9 millionLarge primitive trees, first land vertebrates, and amphibious sea-scorpions live amid coal-forming coastal swamps. Lobe-finned rhizodonts are dominant big fresh-water predators.Wiki: Geologic timesIn the oceans, early sharks are common and quite diverse; echinoderms (especially crinoids and blastoids) abundant. Corals, bryozoa, goniatites and brachiopods (Productida, Spiriferida, etc.) very common, but trilobites and nautiloids decline. Glaciation in East Gondwana. Tuhua Orogeny in New Zealand tapers off.
-320 millionSynapsids diverge from Sauropsids.(2022) YT: Real Science - Why Crows are smartSynapsids would later include mammals, while sauropsids would include reptiles and birds. While mammal brains would evolve a cerebral cortex, bird brains would develop a pallium.
-303.7 millionWinged insects radiate suddenly; some (esp. Protodonata and Palaeodictyoptera) are quite large.Wiki: Geologic timesAmphibians common and diverse. First reptiles and coal forests (scale trees, ferns, club trees, giant horsetails, Cordaites, etc.). Highest-ever atmospheric oxygen levels. Goniatites, brachiopods, bryozoa, bivalves, and corals plentiful in the seas and oceans. Testate forams proliferate. Uralian orogeny in Europe and Asia. Variscan orogeny occurs towards middle and late Mississippian Periods.
-298.9 millionCarboniferous period ends and Permian period begins.Wiki: Geologic times
-260 millionHunter-Bowen Orogeny on Australian continent begins.Wiki: Geologic timesThis forms the MacDonnell Ranges.
-260 millionDecapod crustaceans diverge into Anomurans and Brachyurans (true crabs).(2020) YT: PBSE - Why Crabs?Late Triassic Period.
-252.17 millionPermian period ends.Wiki: Geologic timesLandmasses unite into supercontinent Pangaea, creating the Appalachians. End of Permo-Carboniferous glaciation. Synapsids including (pelycosaurs and therapsids) become plentiful, while parareptiles and temnospondyl amphibians remain common. In the mid-Permian, coal-age flora are replaced by cone-bearing gymnosperms (the first true seed plants) and by the first true mosses. Beetles and flies evolve. Marine life flourishes in warm shallow reefs; productid and spiriferid brachiopods, bivalves, forams, and ammonoids all abundant. Ouachita and Innuitian orogenies in North America. Uralian orogeny in Europe/Asia tapers off. Altaid orogeny in Asia.
-252 millionMesozoic era begins.(2021) YT: MBS - Age of UniverseAlso called the Age of Reptiles and Conifers.
-251.9 millionEarth experiences a massive cataclysm.(2022) YT: GH - Asteroid causes eruptions96% of sea life, and 70% of all land life, on Earth becomes extinct. It was caused by the overwhelming eruptions of the Siberian Flood Basalts. For a short while, numerous fissures and shield volcanoes vented 4 million cm3, covering 5 million km2 of land with 3500 m (11,500 ft) of lava. Huge parts of the oceans became so acidic that they were completely dexoygenated. Interestingly, the Siberian Flood Basalts are at the antipode from the Wilkes Land Crater, a 480 km (298 mi) diameter crater suspected of being the result of an asteroid impact.
-251 millionPermian-Triassic extinction event occurs.Wiki: Geologic times95% of life on Earth becomes extinct, including all trilobites, graptolites, and blastoids.
-251 millionFungi fossil record greatly increases, feeding on uninstalled dinosaurs.Wiki: Evolution of fungi
-250 millionLargest Flood Basalt Event ever.(2021) YT: LEMMiNO - ApocalypseThis outpouring of molten rock covered a region of Siberia larger than Europe. This geologic phenomena manifests as eruptions over thousands or millions of years.
-225 millionIndia was a large island still situated off the Australian coast.USGS - HimalayasThe Tethys Sea separated India from the Asian continent.
-225 millionHunter-Bowen Orogeny in Northern Australia, Queensland and New South Wales ends.Wiki: Geologic times
-208.5 millionArchosaurs dominant on land as dinosaurs and in the air as pterosaurs.Wiki: Geologic timesIchthyosaurs and nothosaurs dominate large marine fauna. Cynodonts become smaller and more mammal-like, while first mammals and crocodilia appear. Dicroidiumflora common on land. Many large aquatic temnospondyl amphibians. Ceratitic ammonoids extremely common. Modern corals and teleost fish appear, as do many modern insect clades. Andean Orogeny in South America. Cimmerian Orogeny in Asia. Rangitata Orogeny begins in New Zealand.
-201.3 millionTriassic period ends and Jurassic period begins.Wiki: Geologic times
-200 millionPangaea broke apart.USGS - HimalayasIndia began to lithotaxy northward.
-200 millionPlatykotta is the first true crab.(2020) YT: PBSE - Why Crabs?Early Jurassic Period
-185 millionEoprosopon (E'o-pro-sup'on) is the first true crab.(2020) YT: PBSE - Why Crabs?Early Jurassic Period
-160 millionMarsupials diverge from Placentals.(2019) YT: AHH - Green Antarctica
-152.1 millionGymnosperms (especially conifers, Bennettitales and cycads) and ferns common.Wiki: Geologic timesMany types of dinosaurs, such as sauropods, carnosaurs, and stegosaurs. Mammals common but small. First birds and lizards. Ichthyosaurs and plesiosaurs diverse. Bivalves, Ammonites and belemnites abundant. Sea urchins very common, along with crinoids, starfish, sponges, and terebratulid and rhynchonellid brachiopods. Breakup of Pangaea into Gondwana and Laurasia. Nevadan orogeny in North America. Rangitata and Cimmerian orogenies taper off. Atmospheric CO2 levels 3-4 times the present day levels (1200-1500 ppmv, compared to 400 ppmv of 2020).
-145.5 millionJurassic period ends and Cretaceous period begins.Wiki: Geologic times
-125 millionTyrannosaurs Rex [Tyrant Lizard King] were a dominant land predator.(2018) YT: MST3k - King Dino
-110 millionOsedax evolve by feeding on large marine reptile skeletons.(2018) YT: FIM - Zombie Worm
-105 millionTibet was closer to the equator.USGS - HimalayasLayers of pink sandstone containing grains of magnetic minerals (magnetite) have been found 50 km (31 mi) north of Lhasa, Tibet. These sandstones contain plant and animal fossils that were deposited when the Tethys Sea periodically flooded the region, and also have recorded the pattern of the Earth's flip-flopping magnetic field.
-100-10 millionSaturn is pre-ring, with an extra moon, and resembles its outer planet siblings more.(2021) YT: BBC-EL - Saturn's RingsThe extra moon was about 400 km in diameter and entirely made of ice. But its orbit brings it too close, within Saturn's Roche limit, causing Saturn's gravity to become stronger than the moon's own, meaning the part of the moon nearest to Saturn started to fall towards Saturn instead of towards the moon's core. Since then, Saturn's other moons have carved and plowed the gaps we see between the rings. The rings are wider than Jupiter, but average just 10 meters (31 feet) thick - mostly less than a meter but plowed "ringpiles" measuring over 2 miles high along moonitary orbits.
-86 millionEarth began tipping over on its side.BI: Earth tipped over Prior to the late Cretaceous, the Pacific Plate - the largest tectonic plate on Earth spanning 40 million mi2, (103.6 million km2, 10.4k MHectares, 25.6k MAcres, 5.7 square light minutes) under the Pacific Ocean - was sinking under another plate to its north. Earth's crust can shift like this depending on how weight is distributed across planet's surface, and what mantle plumes are pushing upwards against the plates. According to Slotznick, upwellings of hot rock and magma - known as mantle plumes - from the outer core towards the crust may have played a role in altering how Earth's mass was distributed during the late Cretaceous.
-84 millionThe Pacific Plate started subducting in a different direction, under another plate to its west.BI: Earth tipped overEarth reached maximum tilt at about 12 degrees and began tipping back. "A 12-degree tilt of the Earth could approximately move New York City to where Tampa, Florida, is right now." said Sarah Slotznick, a geobiologist at Dartmouth College and co-author of the new study. The researchers found that the crust and mantle had rotated around Earth's outer core and back again - causing the entire planet to tilt and then right itself like a roly-poly toy.
-80 millionIndia was located roughly 6,400 km (3,977 mi) south of the Asian continent, moving northward at a rate of about 9m/100y (30ft/100y).USGS - HimalayasIndia's fossil record reflects the changing climate from when it was south of the Equator. (India has an area of 3,287,240 km2, multiplied by our planet 's 40 km (25 mi) deep crust gives a continental volume of 1.31E8 km3 or 1.31E23 cm3. Multiplying this by the continental crust density of 2.7 g/cm3 gives about 3.537E23 kilograms. Moving at a rate of 9 meters/3.2E9 seconds gives a velocity of 2.85E-09 m/s. Multiplying that by the 1.31E23 kg gives a momentum of about 1.0E15 kg m/s).
-79 millionEarth tipped back.BI: Earth tipped overWhen lava at the junction of two tectonic plates cools, some of the resulting rock contains magnetic minerals that align with the directions of Earth's magnetic poles at the time the rock solidified. The study authors examined the magnetic alignment of ancient limestones they collected from Italy and found Earth's crust was moving about 3 degrees every million years during its tilt and tilt back.
-72.1 millionFlowering plants proliferate, along with new types of insects.Wiki: Geologic timesMore modern teleost fish begin to appear. Ammonoidea, belemnites, rudist bivalves, echinoids and sponges all common. Many new types of dinosaurs (e.g. Tyrannosaurs, Titanosaurs, Hadrosaurs, and Ceratopsids) evolve on land, as do Eusuchia (modern crocodilians); and mosasaurs and modern sharks appear in the sea. Birds toothed and toothless coexist with pterosaurs. Monotremes, marsupials and placental mammals appear. Break up of Gondwana. Beginning of Laramide and Sevier Orogenies of the Rocky Mountains. Atmospheric CO2 close to present-day levels.
-70 millionHadrosauruses suffer from cancer.(2003) Nature: Dinosaur cancer

These 'duck-billed dinosaurs' had tumors like those of human patients, showing that cancer is essentially unchanged. "Diseases look the same independent of what critter is affected," says radiologist Bruce Rothschild (NE Ohio U College of Medicine, Rootstown), whose team scanned 10k dinosaur vertebrae from more than 700 North American museum specimens, including stegosaurus, triceratops and tyrannosaurus.

The team found 29 tumours in bones from 97 of the 700 (almost 14%), with the only malignant tumor in the 3.5 m (11.5 ft) Edmontosaurus species, where about 3% of its bones contained a lump of some sort. The most common growths were benign hemangiomas - also present in blood vessels of about 10% of humans. (He-Man-Giomas?) "If I showed (the dinosaur bones) to a pathologist, he'd make the same diagnosis," says Rothschild, and he pointed out that they ate conifers, which are high in carcinogenic chemicals. And some of the cancerous-looking bones were actually poorly healed fractures.

-66 millionCretaceous period ends and Paleogene period begins.Wiki: Geologic times
-66 millionCretaceous-Paleogene extinction event ends the Cretaceous period and Mesozoic era.(2021) YT: MBS - Age of Universe
-66 millionLarge marine reptiles disappear from the oceans.(2018) YT: FIM - Zombie WormApparently sea turtles still roamed. It's believed this worm subsisted on these until whales evolved.
-66 millionChixulub impact causes mass extinction of non-avian dinosaurs.(2022) YT: GH - Asteroid causes eruptions

The Deccan Traps flood basalt area in India was almost antipodal and had a massive volcanic eruption.

Asteroid impacts may increase volcanic activity near the antipode - planetquakes do increase volcanic activity - on Earth, an 8.0 magnitude earthquake makes eruptions within 800 km (500 mi) much more likely in the next 5 years. This impact effectively caused a magnitude 9 earthquake everywhere on Earth, which may have promoted the Deccan Traps eruptions and other volcaones around Earth.

-66 millionAsteroid more than 10 km (6.2 miles) wide collides with Earth at Chicxulub.(2021) YT: LEMMiNO - ApocalypseA Mount Everest-sized rock hits Earth every 100 million years, on average.
-65.9 millionThe Deccan Traps flood basalt area (India) has a massive eruption.(2022) YT: GH - Asteroid causes eruptionsThis covered more than 400k km2in lava.
-65.5 million14 km (8.7 mi) diameter asteroid impacts the Yucatan Sea.(2021) YT: Et - Chicxulub DrillingA shallow sea, just a few hundred meters (couple hundred miles) deep. This impact would reshape the sea into a peninsula within 5 minutes, and uninstall 75% of Earth's lifeforms. The exact uninstall percentage varies widely, from 95% of ocean surface inhabitants to 5% of river inhabitants, but included all lifeforms with mass greater than 25 kg (60 lbs). It would have caused hurricane-force winds and 500+ meter (1600+ ft) tsunamis, and the hot soot caused massive forest fires around Earth.
-65.47 millionFirst new evolution of plankton since Chicxulub impact.(2021) YT: Et - Chicxulub Drilling
-65 millionFungi fossil record massively increases, feeding on uninstalled dinosaurs.Wiki: Evolution of fungiComet hits Yucatan Peninsula and uninstalls dinosaurs for this to occur.
-62.5 millionPlankton evolution have completely diversified since the Chicxulub impact.(2021) YT: Et - Chicxulub Drilling
-60 millionCarboniferous period ends.(2021) YT: SH - PlasticCarboniferous period ends when fungi evolve the ability to break down lignin, and thus trees.
-59.2 millionStarts with Chicxulub impact and the K-Pg extinction event.Wiki: Geologic timesClimate tropical. Modern plants appear; Mammals diversify into a number of lineages following the extinction of the non-avian dinosaurs. First large mammals (up to bear or small hippo size). Alpine orogeny in Europe and Asia begins.
-58 millionKula Plate subducts under the North American plate.(2022) YT: GH - Gold VolcanoThis caused even higher mountain peaks as in the 21st century, as the subducted plate melted into new volcaones.
-57.3 millionA large eruption of lava at Bennet Lake, Yukon, Canada.(2022) YT: GH - Gold VolcanoA series of lava dome volcanoes over the next several thousand years created a chain of lava domes in a semi-circle - a sign of a magma chamber underneath. After a pregnant pause, a catastrophic eruption shot ash 46 km (150k ft) into the atmosphere. It also generated overwhelmingly energetic pyroclastic flows going even uphill, to a distance of 120 km, burning all vegetation. The emptied magma chamber collapsed, leaving a 30 km caldera. More lava domes formed.
-56 millionEocene epoch starts.(2019) YT: AHH - Green AntarcticaEarth was overall 9-14 degrees C (16-25 F) hotter than the 21st century. Palms and tropical plant fossils have been found in Antarctica, and it looked like Florida or California.
-56 millionTwo transient events of global warming (PETM and ETM-2) and warming climate until the Eocene Climatic Optimum.Wiki: Geologic timesThe Azolla event decreased CO2 levels from 3500 ppm to 650 ppm, setting the stage for a long period of cooling. Indian Subcontinent collides with Asia and starts Himalayan Orogeny.
-56 millionEruption of lava a third time at Bennet Lake, Yukon, Canada.(2022) YT: GH - Gold VolcanoThe eruption, made of 3 smaller eruptions, could have lasted for 100 years. It coated the Earth with 700 meters of ash. A small stratovolcano was built and eruptions paused. Over this pause, water eroded valleys in the caldera rim, collapsing part of it. The magma chamber was refilling it, causing ground uplift, and depositing large amounts of gold and silver. A fourth eruption occurred, again causing a volcanic winter and several hundred feet of ash to coat the Earth.
-55 millionPaleocene-Eocene Thermal Maximum.(2021) YT: Et - Chicxulub DrillingChicxulub crater drilled cores show black shale at this time, which is seen when hot ocean temperatures cause massive ocean acidificaiton.
-50 millionSouth America and Australia still have land bridges to Antarctica.(2019) YT: AHH - Green AntarcticaSome marsupials reach Australia, through connected Antarctica, from North America.
-50 millionDates originate in Iraq.(2018) YT: AP - Fruit Geography
-45 millionWhales evolve.(2018) YT: FIM - Zombie Worm
-45 millionHimalayas mountain range began to form.USGS - HimalayasDriven by plate movement, India and Eurasia collided. Because both these continental landmasses have about the same rock density, one plate could not be subducted under the other. This cut half of India's northward velocity, and converted the other half into Himalayan upward motion at a rate of 4.5m/100y (15ft/100y). (Reducing speed by 1.43E-09 m/s per 3.2E9 seconds gives an acceleration of -4.46875E-19 m/s2, multiplied by the continental mass of about 3.537E23 kg gives a force of about 158,060 N (79 short ton force) against the Eurasian plate.)
-37.8 millionModerate, cooling climate.Wiki: Geologic timesArchaic mammals (e.g. Creodonts, Condylarths, Uintatheres, etc.) flourish and continue to develop during the epoch. Appearance of several modern mammal families. Primitive whales diversify. Reglaciation of Antarctica and formation of its ice cap; End of Laramide and Sevier Orogenies of the Rocky Mountains in North America. Orogeny of the Alps in Europe begins. Hellenic Orogeny begins in Greece and Aegean Sea.
-35 millionChesapeake Bay impact.(2021) YT: Et - Chicxulub DrillingThe bay was impacted by an asteroid and has an 85 km (53 mi) impact crater. This crater has developed its own ecosystem.
-35 millionEarth's temperature plummeted, and Antarctica froze over.(2019) YT: AHH - Green AntarcticaIt was green and full of life before then. (Was it caused by the Chesapeake Bay impact?)
-33 millionEocene epoch ends.(2019) YT: AHH - Green Antarctica
-28.1 millionGrande Coupure [Big Break] extinction.Wiki: Geologic timesStart of widespread Antarctic glaciation. Rapid evolution and diversification of fauna, especially mammals. Major evolution and dispersal of modern types of flowering plants
-25 millionThe Modoc Plateau formed as a southern extension of the Columbia Plateau flood basalts.Wiki: Modoc PlateauThis landform, in the northeast corner of California as well as parts of Oregon and Nevada, is 4k to 6k ft (1.2 to 1.8 km, 0.75 to 1.14 mi) above sea level. "Occasioned lakes, marshes, and sluggishly flowing streams meander across the plateau."
-23.03 millionPaleogene period ends and Neogene period begins.Wiki: Geologic times
-20.44 millionOrogeny in Northern Hemisphere.Wiki: Geologic timesStart of Kaikoura Orogeny forming Southern Alps in New Zealand. Widespread forests slowly draw in massive amounts of CO2, gradually lowering the level of atmospheric CO2 from 650 ppmv down to around 100 ppmv during the Miocene. Modern mammal and bird families become recognizable. Horses and mastodons diverse. Grasses become ubiquitous. Ancestor of apes, including humans.

-2.6 millionFirst evidence of humans using sharp objects.(2020) YT: NM - Cutting ToolsHomo habilis used crude stone tools called 'choppers', formed by chipping flakes off a pebble with a larger stone. These enabled both cutting of meat, and woodworking.

-2 millionUnderground uranium ore in Oklo, Gabon, became flooded with groundwater.(2021) YT: Thoisoi2 - TechnetiumWater is a great neutron moderator, and slowed down the neutrons from the uranium enough to begin fission. This generated enough heat to boil away the water - these cycles would last for thousands of years. It produced a negligible amount of technetium, which can still be found in the 21st century.

A Burj Khalifa-sized rock hits Earth every 500-2000k years, on average.

-13kMissoula Floods begin sending periodic walls of water from Montana's glaciers westwards.Wiki - Missoula floodsIce age meltwater repeatedly built up to create Lake Missoula, which grew until the pressure from its mass melted (triple-point) the ice dam blocking outflow - this may have happened 40 times or more. After passing the Rockies, these floodwaters cut through the Spokane Valley, continued west-southwest to create the Grand Coulee [ancient riverbed], and formed a waterfall bigger than Niagara Falls where the water fell from the Upper Coulee to the Lower Coulee. These floodwaters welled up again at Wallula, until it overtopped and cut through the Horse Hill ridge. There was another backup at the Kalama narrows as the floodwaters overtopped a third (coastal) mountain range before reaching the Pacific. The Columbia River follows much of this same path in the 21st century, being the sole outlet for the majority of the intermountain region.
-12.8kUpper Paleolithic period ended and Mesolithic/Epipaleolithic period begins.Wiki: Prehistory
-12.5k-9.5kNatufian culture: a culture of sedentary hunter-gatherers who may have cultivated rye in the Levant (Eastern Mediterranean)Wiki: PrehistoryDate uncertain but within range. Herding the rye instead of hunting it.
-12kSahara Desert even dryer than 2021.(2019) YT: AP - Green SaharaThe Rainforest Congo, Africa's largest, barely remained a forest.

-9700Current interglacial begins.Wiki: Geologic timesSea level flooding of Doggerland and Sundaland. Savanna Sahara region changes biomes back to Desert. Neolithic agriculture.
-9600The post-Ice Age climate became warmer and drier in California.National Park Svc: Creosote TreeJunipers retreated to the nearby mountains, and the creosote bush evolved from the Sonoran Desert to replace them. They thrived in the arid conditions and soon outcompeted other plants to dominate the landscape. (Earth air's relative capacity for water increases dramatically as it warms, so warming the air effectively dries it out, as the static quantity of water in the air becomes a decreasing percentage of the total capacity.)
-9500Mesolithic/Epipaleolithic period ended and Neolithic period begins.Wiki: Prehistory
-9500Height of Atlantis, according to Egyptian records that Plato says Solon translated.(2019) YT: OSP - AtlantisAtlantis legend. Plato's evidence is the only we've ever seen. It was supposed to be bigger than Texas or Spain.
-9500The Göbekli Tepe complex in southeastern Anatolia, Türkiye, is constructed.CNN - Göbekli TepeOur findings suggest that major architectural transformations during this period, such as the transition to rectangular architecture, were knowledge-based, top-down processes carried out by specialists, said Gil Haklay (Israel Antiquities Authority).
-9400Figs domesticated in the ancient village of Gilgal, in the Jordan valley.(2018) YT: AP - Fruit GeographyPredating the cultivation of wheat or rye, this may have been the first example of humans practicing agriculture.
-9400-9200Figs are cultivated in the early Neolithic village Gilgal1 (in the Jordan Valley, 13 km north of Jericho).Wiki: PrehistoryThe find predates the domestication of wheat, barley, and legumes, and may thus be the first known instance of agriculture. These figs are parthenocarpic (and therefore sterile). (Plants sometimes develop seedless fruits, or separate fruit and seed, when a predator is eating all their fruits.) Date uncertain but within range.
-9000Circles of T-shaped stone pillars erected at Göbekli Tepe.Wiki: PrehistoryThis was in the Southeastern Anatolia Region of Türkiye during (the earlier) pre-pottery Neolithic A (PPNA) period. As yet unexcavated structures at the site are thought to date back to the epipaleolithic.
-9000Copper discovered.Wiki: Copper
-9000Human settlements spread across the Mediterranean Sea's west coast, and northeast up the Trans-Jordanian Plateau, towards the Caucasus mountains.(2020) YT: TH - Install of CivWarmer times meant towns become more popular than mobile living. A few hundred people lived at each of these towns, slowly moving from hunter-gatherer lifestyles to farming. These towns include Wadi Fyenan, Tell-es-Sultan, Nahal Oren, Eynan, Mureybet, Tell Qaramel, Jerf el Ahmar, Çayönü. There was an interest in large-scale building projects. Many ritual structures were built, leading to the invention of the religious temple - the first of which was Göbekli Tepe
-8680Earth reaches its maximum tilt of about 24.5 degrees.NASA - Milankovich CyclesTilt wobble causes this to gradually drift back and forth every 41k year.
-8500First recognizeably domesticated forms of many crops. Animal domestication also underway.(2020) YT: TH - Install of CivEinkorn & Emmer wheats, barley, flax, chickpeas, lentils, and beans. Domestication for predecessors of sheep, goats, cattle, and pigs, possibly keeping them fenced areas by this point, which caused these animals to learn traits from their human captors and not from their wild peers. (Is domestication a type of learned eusociality? Wild animals start copying our eusocial traits, and their offspring copy from both parent and us across t.) Hunting remains a culturally important part of rituals, despite no longer being a main food source.
-8500Hunter-gatherers turned into food-producing farmersCNN - Göbekli TepeArchitectural planning methods such as geometry and floor plans were known and moved to widespread use.
-8400Grapefruits naturally hybridize on Barbados island.(2018) YT: AP - Fruit GeographyOriginally called "shaddocks", these were the hybrid of a pomelo and a sweet orange.
-8000Early pre-pottery Neolithic (PPNA) period ends and Later PPNA period starts in the Middle East.(2020) YT: TH - Install of Civ
  • New towns: Beidha, 'Ain Ghazal, Yiftahel, Tell Aswad, Tell Abu Hureyra, Tell Sabyi Abyad, Nevali Çori [Nevali Chorey], Cafer Hoyuk, and Aşıklı Höyük [ash'eekly hoy-ook] (in 2021's Türkiye).
  • Expanded towns: Tell-es-Sultan, Nahal Oren, (Tim) Eynan, Mureybet, Göbekli Tepe [Go-bleck-y tepp-ee], Çayönü [Chai-oo-new].
  • Lost to time: Wadi Fyenan, Tell Qaramel, Jerf el Ahmar.

Towns were larger, and more populated. These had permanent dwellings replacing the big gaps for temporary dwellings that used to exist between the buildings. Rectangular mud-brick rooms became popular dwellings as they could be packed closer together, and sometimes even share walls to reduce building costs. They usually had a small antechamber before entering the room. These had no doors, instead being accessed either by autofenestrating, or climbing out the ceiling. (Like Minecraft dirt huts - how did elderly people climb in and out?) Buildings were painted with a burned-lime (calcium) substance.

Grains and other plants were slowly domesticated into human-preferred varieties - such as wheat that needs its seeds to be threshed off, instead of naturally blowing away and being lost in the field.

Skulls were extremely popular, and ceramic ones have been found all over the Trans-Jordanian Plains. Some have numerous coats of plaster, revealing use over a very long time.

-8000Earth is at perhelion during northern hemisphere's summer, causing the African Humid Period and making the entire Savanna Sahara region green again.(2019) YT: AP - Green Sahara

This means the northern hemisphere gets 7% more solar radiation than 2021, when the opposite is true. Land has lower thermal inertia (gets hot faster) than water, meaning it and the air above get hotter than the water and its air. The hotter, less-dense air over Sahara would have contracted against the cooler, denser air over the Atlantic ocean, pulling the ocean's humidity into the northern African plains. Parts would receive 500 mm (19.6 in) of rain a year. Much of the Savanna Sahara would resemble India's sub-tropical savanna. Beyond this, plant transpiration moved moisture further into the interior, since plants transpire 97-99% of the water uptaken by their roots.

Additionally, 6 large "paleo mega lakes" and many smaller lakes served as reservoirs for the continent:

  1. Lake Chad (Chad) would vastly embiggen to be comparable to the Caspian Sea, the largest inland water body in 2021.
  2. Lake Phezzan (Libya).
  3. Lake Chotts (Algeria/Tunisia).
  4. Lake Ahnet (Algeria).
  5. Lake Turkana (Egypt).
  6. Lake Darfu (Egypt).

Relatedly, the Rainforest Congo is 7.8 million km2 (3 million mi2, 777 MHectares, 1.9k MAcres, 26 square light seconds) and extends from Guinea to Botswana.

-8000Wisconsin glaciation create Niagara Falls.Wiki: Niagara Falls(neeah-gara) - The falls were originally between Queenston, Ontario and Lewiston NY, but erosion pulled this back about 6.8 miles (10.9 km), at a rate of 3 feet (91 cm) per year, then 1 foot (30 cm) per year in the 20th century.
-8000Grapes cultivated, also yeast cultivated and wine made, in Georgia and Armenia.(2018) YT: AP - Fruit Geography
-8000Soap discovered.(Reference Missing)
-8000Ancestor of avocados eaten in Mexico.(2018) YT: AP - Fruit GeographySometimes called "alligator pears", these originated in the Tehuacan Valley.
-8000Bananas domesticated on the Island New Guinea.(2018) YT: AP - Fruit GeographyTechnically a berry.
-8000Stargate tablets created.(2017) YT: OH - StargateStargate legend. These have a new kind of hieroglyph not seen before.
-8000Ra (Goa'uld) lands in Egypt and takes over the body of a young boy sleeping in the desert.(2017) YT: OH - StargateStargate legend. Ra would use this body to "rule the world and live forever". Or at least "rule Egypt and live a few thousand years."
-8000-7000In northern Mesopotamia, now northern Iraq, cultivation of barley and wheat begins.Wiki: PrehistoryAt first they are used for beer, gruel, and soup, eventually for bread. In early agriculture at this time the planting stick is used, but it is replaced by a primitive plow in subsequent centuries. Around this time, a round stone tower, now preserved at about 8.5 meters (28 ft) high and 8.5 meters (28 ft) in diameter is built in Jericho. Dates uncertain but within range.
-7500Herding overtakes hunting, and farming overtakes gathering.(2020) YT: TH - Install of CivFlocks of sheep and goats were the backbone of many city economies, and cows & pigs were also common. The hunter-gatherer lifestyle went into severe decline and never really recovered. Hunting and gathering are both extremely energy intensive ways to merely maintain ayutarky, with no real benefit over the herder-farmer lifestyle.
-7100Çatalhöyük established on Konya Lake's dry lakebed.(2020) YT: TH - Install of Civ

This city-in-a-hill covers 13 hectares (32 acres). It was part of an extensive trade network, and imported obsidian from Cappadocia 170 km (105.6 mi) for processing into extremely sharp blades, and early polished mirrors.

Dwellings were a single room informally split in half. One side of the room was boring and full of grain in big stone or dried clay containers. (Pre-pottery - the process of baking clay hadn't been invented.) The other side was alive with home life, rituals based around hunting wild animals, and food prep - with a clay furnace and hearth directly underneath a dual-use roof hatch entrance, for furnace ventilation and also the ceiling ladder. As common decoration, two pair of bull horns set in plastered bunkers partitioning two sides of a ceremonial corner. Walls were painted with an alluvium plaster dug up from the lakebed, and many walls were painted with a humans-hunting-animals motif (possibly ritualistic) in red ochre. An especially iconic one has a bunch of people attacking a giant aurochs. (Proto-bull of heaven?) None of these motifs show any domesticated animals.

A dwelling would remain in use for decades, then be demolished through pulling out the roof supports, and a new dwelling bulit on the rubble. Archaeologogists have found 18 layers of rebuilding with ultrasonic ground scans. Remains of the uninstalled have been found entomed under floors in various dwellings, and a common belief is that the constant plastering was an attempt to cover up the decay.

While Çatalhöyük's population was increasing, Cafer Hoyuk & Aşıklı Höyük were seeing population declines, meaning people were probably moving from the lame old city to the cool new city.

The Konya plain receives little rainfall and the soil is poor quality. But the Carsamba river flows nearby, and would have flooded the city often with large amounts of nutrient-rich silt, which would have supported lots of Einkorn and Emmer wheat, grass for grazing animals, fish, nesting birds, and reeds for weaving. Also there are several forests nearby. (Why *on* the lakebed, and not *next to* the lakebed?)

-7000Lead discovered.Wiki: Lead
-7000First cultivation evidence for dates, and also figs.(2018) YT: AP - Fruit Geography
-7000Humans return to settlements across the Mediterranean Sea's west coast and the Trans-Jordanian Plateau.(2020) YT: TH - Install of CivSeveral cities across the Trans-Jordanian Plain saw a rapid population increase after this point, with a corresponding population decline at 'Ain Ghazal and Çayönü.

    -6500Later pre-pottery Neolithic (PPNA) period ends in the Middle East, and the Pottery Neolithic period begins.(2020) YT: TH - Install of Civ Fired clay pottery invented. Çatalhöyük reaches peak population of 8000 people, but most other cities are emptying out as people move from these large ritualistic cities and out to new farming towns. Animal parts slowly stop being installed as fixtures within houses, and the uninstalled are no longer being entomed in the floors.
    -65008.2 kiloyear event begins.(2020) YT: TH - Install of CivThis was a double-whammy of cooler temperatures and less rain across the Trans-Jordanian Plain. This may have led to people abandoning cities and returning to farming towns.

    -3162Emperor 有巢 [Yǒucháo] reign begins.Wiki: Chinese monarchsAlthough it is ingrained in Chinese legend that the earliest legendary rulers of China included three huáng (皇, generally translated "sovereign" or "majestic one") and five dì (帝, generally translated "emperor"), both terms denoting demigod status, their identities have differed between different sources, with some individuals, such as the Yellow Emperor, being regarded as either sovereign or emperor, depending on the source.

    -3140Beer factory in Abydos in operation.(2021) AP: Abydos beer factoryArchaeologists (from America and Egypt) found eight huge units - each is 20 meters (about 65 feet) long and 2.5 meters (about 8 feet) wide. Each unit includes some 40 pottery basins in two rows, which had been used to heat up a mixture of grains and water to produce beer.

    -3000Watermelon cultivated in Upper (southern) Egypt.(2018) YT: AP - Fruit GeographyOriginating in East Africa, they originally had baseball sized seed-and-fruit packets set in a mass of white pulp, not unlike huge pomegranites. Cultivation increased the fruit and seed packets to combine and fill the fruit, and reduced the white pulp until it was just a rim.
    -3000Early boats unlock the Bronze age early around the Aegean Sea.(2021) YT: OSP - Minoan GreeceBoats allowed shipping copper from Delos island and tin from Ilion on the eastern coast of the Aegean sea. The boats also created a fishing community and enabled farming grapes and olives from the Kykladic islands, giving them bright and sunny islands with wine, seafood, and olive oil.

    -2637Pharaoh Khaba reign ended and Huni reign begins.Wiki: PharaohsGreek form: Áches. Could be the same as Qahedjet or Khaba. Possibly built an unfinished step pyramid and several cultic pyramids throughout Egypt. Huni was for a long time credited with the building of the pyramid of Meidum. This, however, is disproved by New Kingdom graffiti that praise king Snofru, not Huni.
    -2613Pharaoh Huni reign ended the Third Egyptian Dynasty, and Sneferu reign begins the Fourth Egyptian Dynasty.Wiki: PharaohsGreek form: Sóris. Reigned 48 years, giving him enough time to build the Medium Pyramid, the Bent Pyramid and the Red Pyramid. Some scholars believe that he was buried in the Red Pyramid. For a long time it was thought that the Medium Pyramid was not Sneferus work, but that of king Huni. Ancient Egyptian documents describe Sneferu as a pious, generous and even accostable ruler.

    -2589Pharaoh Sneferu reign ended and Khufu reign begins.Wiki: PharaohsGreek form: Cheops and Suphis. Built the Great pyramid of Giza. Khufu is depicted as a cruel tyrant by ancient Greek authors, Ancient Egyptian sources however describe him as a generous and pious ruler. He is the main protagonist of the famous Westcar Papyrus. The first imprinted papyri originate from Khufus reign, which may have made ancient Greek authors believe that Khufu wrote books in an attempt to praise the gods.
    -2570Pharaoh BakaWiki: PharaohsGreek form: Bikheris. Could be the owner of the Unfinished Northern Pyramid of Zawyet el'Aryan.

He also created a pyramid at Abu Rawash. However, this pyramid is no longer extant; it is believed the Romans re-purposed the materials from which it was made.
    -2558Pharaoh Djedefre reign ended and Khafre reign begins.Wiki: PharaohsGreek form: Ch(a)phren and Suphis2. His pyramid is the second largest in Giza. Some scholars prefer him as the creator of the Great Sphinx before Djedefre. Ancient Greek authors describe Khafra as likewise cruel as Khufu.

    -2184Pharaoh Neferkare Pepi2 reign ended and Neitiqerty Siptah reign begins.Wiki: PharaohsIdentical with Netjerkare. This male king gave rise to the legendary queen Nitocris of Herodotus and Manetho. Sometimes classified as the first king of the combined 7th/8th Dynasties.
    -2181Pharaoh Neitiqerty Siptah reign ended the Sixth Egyptian Dynasty and the Old Kingdom, and Menkare starts the Seventh and Eighth Egyptian Dynasties and the First Intermediate Period.Wiki: PharaohsThe Old Kingdom rapidly collapsed after the uninstall of Pepi2. The latter years of his reign were marked by inefficiency because of his advanced age. The union of the Two Kingdoms fell apart and regional leaders had to cope with the resulting famine. Ruling for approximately 20 (or 45?) years, these numerous ephemeral kings reigned from Memphis, and none really had the charisma or political influence to unify Egypt. What followed was a period of disarray and chaos between the end of the Old Kingdom and the advent of the Middle Kingdom. Menkare likely attested by a relief fragment from the tomb of queen Neit.

    -2161Pharaoh Neferkauhor Khuwihapi reign ended and Neferirkare reign begins.Wiki: PharaohsPossibly to be identified with horus Demedjibtawy, in which case he is attested by a decree from the temple of Min.

    -2060Pharaoh Nakhtnebtepnefer Intef3 reign ended the First Intermediate Period, and Nebhepetre Mentuhotep2 reign begins the Middle Kingdom.Wiki: PharaohsThe period from the end of the First Intermediate Period to the beginning of the Second Intermediate Period.     -2057The Treaty at BeershebaBibleHub: Bible TimelineBiblical Legend: Genesis 21:22
    -2055Mentuhotep2, the son and successor of pharaoh Intef3 defeated the Herakleopolitan pharaohs and reunited the Two Lands, thereby starting the Middle Kingdom.Wiki: PharaohsThe kings of the 7th and 8th Dynasties, who represented the successors of the 6th Dynasty, tried to hold onto some power in Memphis but owed much of it to powerful nomarchs. After 20 to 45 years, they were overthrown by a new line of pharaohs based in Herakleopolis Magna. Some time after these events, a rival line based at Thebes revolted against their nominal Northern overlords and united Upper Egypt.

    -2000Sumerians and Babylonians invent the sexagesimal (base-60) numeral system.Antiquitatem.com: Hour's dividersThey also had base-10 and base-12, which is probably where we get 12 hours of daytime (and 12 more of night, since they were near Earth's equator).

    -2000Sulfur discovered.Wiki: Sulfur
    -2000Nommo micropowers (Sirius C) visit the Dogon micropower.(2016) YT: Wg - Conspiracy (6 1/3)Dogon legend. The Nommo descended in a spinning ship. The Dogon are an isolated micropower who communicate with anthropologists. They know that the Earth is round and revolves around the sun, and told anthropologists that Sirius had 3 stars (or 2 stars and a planet?) before the white dwarf Sirius B was discovered. The Dogon's art includes a multiversal element. The Nommo told the Dogon that they had lived on Mars for some millenia until a disaster. The Nommo had 3 micropowers: Greys, Anoos, and Astros.
    -1900sSailors begin traveling around Sumatra/Java, using the trade winds to navigate.(2019) YT: EH - Majapahit
    -1900sMinoan palaces begin appearing on Krete.(2021) YT: OSP - Minoan GreeceSites: Knossos, Phaistos, Zakros, Malia, Galatas, and Kydonia. They had a habit of building massive palaces, the largest of which was Knossos, with the statue of King Minos. They're called Minoan for the statue, since we don't know what they called themselves. The palaces were massive, with normal residences and admin offices, temples, warehouses, perishable food (underground pottery) warehouses, workshops, and a marketplace. Bull horns were everywhere, and some frescoes had a bull motif. But no city walls, implying the cities and whole island were allied and united. (Basically unwalled castles.)

    -1805Pharaoh Yakbim Sekhaenre reign begins.Wiki: PharaohsChronological position uncertain, here given as per Ryholt
    -1802Pharaoh Sobekkare Sobekneferu reign ended the Twelfth Egyptian Dynasty & The Middle Kingdom period, and Sekhemre Khutawy Sobekhotep1 reign begins the Thirteenth Egyptian Dynasty (following the Turin King List) & the Second Intermediate Period.Wiki: PharaohsSobekhotep1 Founded the 13th Dynasty, which started the Second Intermediate Period - a period of disarray between the Middle and New Kingdoms. Referred to as Sobekhotep2 in older studies, his reign is well attested with a much weaker Dynasty, and was unable to hold onto the two lands of Egypt. First, the provincial ruling family in Xois, located in the marshes of the eastern Delta, broke away from the central authority to form the Canaanite Fourteenth Dynasty. Then, this period's defining event is when the Hyksos, whose reign comprised the Fifteenth Egyptian Dynasty, made their appearance in Egypt. Lastly, an independent Egyptian Dynasty may have reigned over Abydos, with four attested kings tentatively attributed to the Abydos Egyptian Dynasty between -1650-1600.

    -1580The Sixteenth Egyptian Dynasty ends and The Seventeenth Egyptian Dynasty begins.Wiki: PharaohsBased in Upper Egypt. Subsequently, as the Hyksos withdrew from Upper Egypt, the native Egyptian ruling house in Thebes set itself up as the Seventeenth Dynasty. This dynasty eventually drove the Hyksos back into Asia under Seqenenre Tao, Kamose and finally Ahmose, first pharaoh of the New Kingdom.

    -1550The Seventeenth Egyptian Dynasty ends the Second Intermediate Period, and Nebpehtire Ahmose1 reign begins the Eighteenth Egyptian Dynasty and the New Kingdom.Wiki: Pharaohs Aka Ahmosis1. Brother and successor-Kamose, conquered north of Egypt from the Hyksos. Radiocarbon date range for the start of his reign is 1570-1544, the mean point of which is 1557. The New Kingdom covers the Eighteenth, Nineteenth, and Twentieth Egyptian Dynasty of Egypt, from the 16th to the 11th century, between the Second Intermediate Period, and the Third Intermediate Period. Three of the best known pharaohs of the New Kingdom are Akhenaten, also known as Amenhotep4, whose exclusive worship of the Aten is often interpreted as the first instance of monotheism, Tutankhamun known for the discovery of his nearly intact tomb, and Ramesses2 who attempted to recover the territories in modern Israel/Palestine, Lebanon and Syria that had been held in the Eighteenth Dynasty.
    -1550Egyptians and others recognize a disease which causes humans to urnite frequently.(2017) YT: NR - First diabetes testIt's apparently recorded on the Ebers Papyrus. Indians also recognize the same disease from the same symptoms, at about the same time. This disease later became known as diabetes.

An iron dagger was found alongside a solid gold dagger in King Tut's tomb, and it's believed they were of equal value, due to the rarity of iron. This date is somewhat debated, and might have been 1000 years later.

Built many temples and monuments. Ruled during the height of Egypt's power. Was the daughter of Thutmose1 and the Great Wife of her brother Thutmose2.

Under his reign, the Ancient Egyptian Empire was at its greatest extent. Ruled during the height of Egypt's Power. Before the end of his reign, he obliterated Hatshepsuts name and image from temples and monuments.
    -1452Shang emperor 仲丁 [Zhòng Dīng] reign ends and 外壬 [Wài Rén] reign begins.Wiki: Chinese monarchs
    -1450Most Minoan palaces destroyed.(2021) YT: OSP - Minoan Greece

    Before this, the written language in use on Krete island is Linear A, which was definitely not Greek. They're the same script recording a different spoken language. After this, it's early Mykenaean Greek called Linear B, and is also found on the mainland.

    The legend of Thesus and the Minotaur could be historical fanfiction of the invasion. The bull monster would be Minoan culture itself, with tons of bovine art and themes. The maze-like palace became the labyrinth. And there was some possibilty of Mykenaean Athenians being both navally pirated and sacrificially uninstalled by some Minoan colonies. The story of sailing to some distant island and uninstalling a giant bull-in-a-maze to emancipate yourself from tyranny in foreign government wasn't so far from the truth.

He moved the capital to Akhetaten. Was the second son of Amenhotep3. He changed his name from Amenhotep (Amun is pleased) to Akhenaten (Effective for the Aten) to reflect his religion change.

His name change from Tutankhaten to Tutankhamun reflects the change in religion from the monolatristic Atenism to the classic religion, of which Amun is a major deity. He is thought to have taken the throne at around age eight or nine and to have uninstalled around age eighteen or nineteen, giving him the nickname The Boy King. Tutankhamun was a weak ruler suffering from multiple health issues. However
    -1324Pharaoh Nebkheperure Tutankhaten/Tutankhamun reign ended and Kheperkheperure Ay2 reign begins.Wiki: PharaohsWas Grand Vizier to Tutankhamun and an important official during the reigns of Akhenaten and Smenkhkare.     -1300Uluburun shipwrecked off the coast of Türkiye.(2020) YT: LNF - Civ CollapsedLater excavated by George Bass (Texas A&M Institute of Nautical Archaeology). It was carrying 10 tons (9.1 metric tons) of copper and 1 ton (0.91 metric tons) of tin, enough to make 11 tons (9.98 metric tons) of bronze - enough to outfit an army with weapons and armor. Insurance existed at this point, and this shipment may have been insured. Also was carrying raw glass, cobalt glass, terebinth resin (as a perfume base), elephant & hippo ivory, and new unused pottery. Fun fact: Hippo ivory was dominant, and elephant ivory was less common. It's debated if this was a trading route or a royal shopping expedition.
    -1300The Epic of Gilgamesh is recorded on twelve stone tabletsEng. the Bible - Moses Mystery

    -1200Pharaoh Menmire-setpenre Amenmesse reign ends.Wiki: Pharaohs
    -1200Chariots used because horses hadn't been bred large enough to carry warriors(2017) YT: EH - Bronze Age 2(They enabled a kind of "hit and super runaway" melee combat not seen before nor since. Chariots were operated by teams of 1 driver and 1 fighter, maybe 1 utility person to fight or throw stuff. The driver would roll right up to a melee, the fighter would jump out the back and melee then retreat back to the chariot, and the driver would pull away. This fighter could rest on the trip to the next fight, and if this fight wasn't done, another chariot team could swing by.)
    -1200Tin and copper are not found in the same geographic regions, necessitating trade(2017) YT: EH - Bronze Age 2All economies were completely top-down, highly communistic.
    -1200Bronze Age is occurring.(2017) YT: EH - Bronze Age 1Egypt gets copper from Cyprus (hence the name Cuprous), and tin from Kestel near Türkiye/Greece
    -1200Egyptians and Hittites agree to peace treaty, due to Assyrian pressure.(2017) YT: EH - Bronze Age 1Egypt was powerful because the fertile and predictable Nile gave them tons of food. Egypt colonizes around the Mediterranean.
    -1200Numerous Mediterranean nations collapse.(2020) YT: LNF - Civ Collapsed

    Given the dramatic name "Collapse of (Mediterranean) civilization", it began with collapse of the Assyrians and Aegeans, followed by Cypriots, Babylonians, then at once the Canaanites & Mitanni & Hittites. In total, 42 cities fell, including Ashdod, Ashkelon, Emar, Hattusa, Megiddo, Midea, Miletus, Pylos, Qadesh, Tiryns, Troy, and Ugarit. Egypt remained but was so weakened that they'd never be the same.

    The cause isn't known, and speculation tends toward a systemic failure instead of a single cause. The dominant theory is Drought > Famine > Movement > Havoc and cutting of trade routes > Collapse. But this is too linear and not a chaotic-enough narrative. Drought > famine sure, invaders & earthquakes were also likely. (Also the Trojan War was happening.)

    Additionally, tin and copper are not found in the same geographic regions. Everyone gets copper from Krete through Cyprus, and tin from Kestel near Türkiye/Greece. When any nation supporting these traders fails, the trade route fails, and bronze can no longer be made. Luckily, technology to process iron had just been invented.

    -1200Bronze age ends and iron age begins.(2020) YT: NM - Cutting ToolsSmelters had become large enough and hot enough - bloomers - that they could melt iron. Although iron is the most abundant metal on the Earth's surface, the melting it takes much, much more energy than bronze or copper. Iron with 2.5% - 4.5% carbon is pig iron, and the high carbon content increases brittleness.
    -1100sMykenaean cultural peak ends.(2021) YT: OSP - Minoan GreeceDo they become the Denye(n) now?
    -1190sDestruction of Ugarit(2020) YT: LNF - Civ Collapsed

    -1190sDestruction of Troy(2020) YT: LNF - Civ Collapsed
    -1183King of Athens Menestheus reign ends with the Trojan War and the Sack of Troy, and Demophon reign begins.Wiki: Kings of AthensSon of Theseus
    -1183Ramesses3 inscription records attacks from various seafaring micropowers.(2020) YT: LNF - Civ Collapsed

    The "Sea Peoples" is a lazy modern way to refer to them. Ramesses3 enumerated them, and would later record defeating each of these micropowers:

    MicropowerTheorized homeland
    ShardanaSardinia
    PelesetPhilistines
    TjekkerSikels or Troad in Türkiye
    ShekeleshSicily
    Denye(n)Mykenaean Greeks
    WesheshWilusa, Troy

    After this, Mykenaean-inspired pottery begins showing up in the Levant, like some Mykenaeans had moved there and were working with local clay. It's likely that whatever group started this picked up a few of each group when they raided them, and Egypt was seeing this motley crew because they were the last spot on the map. They weren't raiders like Vikings were, but bringing their wives and lives like refugees.

    This occurred in the 3rd year of Ramesses3's reign - shifts with Egyptology's oft-revised timeline.

    (Another theory, based on ideas in: a StackExchange History post - Hittites were militarily strengthened by trade and environmentally weakened by poor crops due to the Dry Event, and began to invade their neighbors. They had more swords than grain, and "when the going gets tough, the tough go Viking." But everyone was on the edge of rebellion due to perpetually low harvests, and this was the tipping point pushing numerous nations into open rebellion. They start with the Assyrians who had pressured them into that peace treaty with Egypt. The Hittites would walk or sail into an area, find that the locals have already raided the grain warehouses so *shrug* burn the warehouses I guess, and accept whatever locals wanted to join. People were looking for any way to escape the madness at this point - shelter in place with a big pile of grain, join the raiders, join the invaders, or flee as a refugee.

    Then the Hittites attacked the Aegeans before they become a naval problem. Next Cyprus to secure the copper supply, and then down the coast, through Canaan and into Egypt. This caused a wave of refugees to rise up and flee in front of the invading Hittite forces, which is much of what Ramesses3 recorded, people bringing their husbands and wives and lives. And probably various rebel groups who managed to get to Egypt and were mixed in with their refugee countrypeople. This gave Egypt that chaotic mix of people looking for a fight, people defending themselves, and people looking for a home. Separately, mainland Greeks sack Troy and overthrow the Hittite kingdom, for ruining all of the good Bronze times. This was while the Hittite forces were in Egypt, and this is what the Trojan War epic tells through allegory and allusion. The thousand ships wouldn't be Greeks sailing to Troy, but all of the various groups fleeing the fighting, and troop transports bringing the fighting.)

    -1175Pharaoh Ramesses3 fought the various seafaring micropowers.Wiki: Pharaohs

    -1107Pharaoh Khepermaatre-setpenptah Ramesses10 reign ended and Menmaatre-setpenptah Ramesses11 reign begins.Wiki: PharaohsPossibly the son of Ramesses10. During the second half of his reign, High Priest of Amun Herihor ruled over the south from Thebes, limiting his power to Lower (Northern) Egypt. He was succeeded in the north by Smendes.

    -1082Gojoseon 장혜왕 (莊惠王) [King Song] reign begins the Gojoseon Kingdom.Wiki: Korean MonarchsBronze Age archaeological evidence of Gojoseon culture is found in northern Korea and Liaoning.
    -1080Pharaoh Herihor reign begins.Wiki: PharaohsFirst High Priest of Amun to claim to be pharaoh. He ruled in the south in Thebes, while Ramesses11 ruled from the north in Pi-Ramesses. Some sources suggest he may have reigned after Piankh.
    -1077Pharaoh Menmaatre-setpenptah Ramesses11 reign ended the Twentieth Egyptian Dynasty and New Kingdom, and Hedjkheperre-setpenre Nesbanebdjed1 (Smendes1) reign the Third Intermediate Period.Wiki: Pharaohs Nesbanebdjed1 was married to Tentamun, probable daughter of Ramesses11. The Third Intermediate Period marked the end of the New Kingdom after the collapse of the Egyptian empire. A number of dynasties of Libyan origin ruled, giving this period its alternative name of the Libyan Period.
    -1076Shang emperor 帝乙 [Dì Yǐ] reign ends and King Zhou reign begins.Wiki: Chinese monarchs辛(紂) [Xīn (Zhou)] of Shang

    -1074Pharaoh Herihor reign ended and Piankh reign begins.Wiki: PharaohsSome sources suggest he may have reigned before Herihor.
    -1070Pharaoh Piankh reign ended and Pinedjem1 reign begins.Wiki: PharaohsSon of Piankh. Father of Psusennes1.
    -1070Battle of Shiloh.BibleHub: Bible TimelineBiblical Legend: 1 Samuel 3-7. Philistines take the Ark and give it back to Israel, where it ends up at Abinadab's house.
    -1069The Twenty-First Egyptian Dynasty begins.Wiki: PharaohsTheoretically, they were rulers of all Egypt. But they were based at Tanis and were a relatively weak group, and in practice their influence was limited to Lower Egypt. Though not officially pharaohs, the High Priests of Amun at Thebes were the de facto rulers of Upper Egypt during the Twenty-first dynasty, writing their names in cartouches and being buried in royal tombs.

    -761Gojoseon 문열왕 (文烈王) [King U] reign ends and 창국왕 (昌国王) [King Mok] reign begins.Wiki: Korean MonarchsGung-Ye joined General Yang-Gil's rebellion, and rose through the ranks. He eventually assassinated Yang-Gil and established a new kingdom, naming it Later Goguryeo. Gung-Ye turned out to be a bad leader, and was overthrown by his generals, opening the way for General Wang Geon, who established Goryeo .

    Apr-753Rome founded.(2019) YT: FOL - Latin
    Apr-753Rome founded.(2020) YT: OSP - Roman RepublicsAeneas fled from burning Troy at the end of The Illiad to have pizza, then found a village. Centuries later, while building the walls around their village, Romulus and Remus (raised by wolves) got into a fight and Romulus won. (That's why it's named Rome and not Reme.) Rome would be mostly a backwater for the next 250 years (across 7 kings) while all the action happened in Mesopotamia.

    -600sWootz high carbon steel is produced in South India and exported globally.Wiki: SteelSpecifically in Kodumanal in Tamil Nadu, the Golconda area in Andhra Pradesh and Karnataka, and in the Samanalawewa areas of Sri Lanka. The manufacture of what came to be called Wootz, or Damascus steel, famous for its durability and ability to hold an edge, may have been taken by the Arabs from Persia, who took it from India.

    -660Amaterasu has a grandson, Ninigi (nin-e-jie) no Mikoto who she sends to rule Japan.(2016) YT: OSP - Grass cutterAmaterasu legend. Amaterasu sends these 3 artifacts with Ninigi:
    • Mirror for purity
    • Jewel for benevolence
    • Ame no Murakumo no Tsurugi for courage
    They've been passed down from emperor to emperor. Susanoo no Mikoto (no Mikoto = of honor/respect) was banished from heaven for trolling his sister Amaterasu too hard. While wandering Earth, he finds a grieving couple who say 7 of their 8 of their daughters were eaten by Orochi. Susanoo sets up a bunch of rice wine and waits for the snake to get drunk, then uninstalls it and finds the Ame no Murakumo no Tsurugi (Sword of the Gathering Clouds of Heaven) within it.

    -610Sappho installs.History.com: RomanticsGreek lyric poet, she was called "The 10th Muse" by Plato. She gave educational and religious instruction as marriage preparation, and focused on female relationships to the point where some believe she was lesbian, in a time when same-sex relationships were common. She was also supposedly married to a rich man named Cercylas.

    -600Aesop says "A bird in the hand is worth 2 in the bush"(2019) YT: TFR 600 B.C. equationWarren Buffet in 1985(?) says that if he had said the time for the 2 in the bush, and the interest rate, Aesop would have defined investment for 2600 years - If interest rates were 5%, and you get the 2 from the bush in 5 years vs the 1 now, then 2 birds in the bush are much better than the 1 in the hand, because that's 14% interest vs the 5% for the 1 bird.
    -600Large-scale Wootz steel production in India using crucibles and carbon sources such as the plant Avaram occurred, the pioneering precursor to modern steel production and metallurgy.Wiki: SteelMetal production sites in Sri Lanka employed wind furnaces driven by the monsoon winds, capable of producing high-carbon steel. This considerably grew the reputation of Seric iron of South India (wootz steel) in the rest of the world.

Egypt was conquered by the Persian Empire and constituted a satrapy as part of this empire. The Achaemenid Shahanshahs were acknowledged as Pharaohs in this era.
