    15May884Pope Marinus1 papacy ends and Pope St Adrian3 (HADRIANVS Tertius) (Italian) papacy begins 2 days later.Wiki: List of PopesFeast day 8 July. Adrian1 was possibly his ancestor.
    884Japanese 陽成天皇 [Emperor Yōzei] reign ends and 光孝天皇 [Emperor Kōkō] reign begins.Wiki: Emperors of Japan
    884黃齊 [Emperor Qi] reign ends and Huang Chao reign ends.Wiki: Chinese monarchs
    15Sep885Pope St Adrian3 papacy ends and Pope Stephen5 (STEPHANVS Quintus) (Italian) papacy begins.Wiki: List of PopesSometimes called Stephen6.
    29Aug886Roman emperor Basil1 the Macedonian (Βασίλειος) reign ends and Leo6 the Wise (Λέων ὁ Σοφός) reign begins.Wiki: List of Roman emperorsLeo6 was son of Basil1 (potentially in reality the son of Michael3), co-emperor since 870.
    886King of Wessex Alfred the Great becomes King of the Anglo-Saxons.Wiki: English monarchsHouse of Wessex. Married to Ealhswith of Gainsborough 868 5 children. Son of Æthelwulf of Wessex Treaty of Wedmore
    886Silla 헌강왕 (憲康王) [King Heongang] reign ends and 정강왕 (定康王) [King Jeonggang] reign begins.Wiki: Korean Monarchs
    887Charles the Fat overthrown.(2020) YT: FOL - CharleMagne
    887Japanese 光孝天皇 [Emperor Kōkō] reign ends and 宇多天皇 [Emperor Uda] reign begins.Wiki: Emperors of Japan
    887Silla 정강왕 (定康王) [King Jeonggang] reign ends and 진성여왕 (眞聖王) [King Jinseong] reign begins.Wiki: Korean Monarchs
    888Tang Emperor 僖宗 [Xizong] reign ends and 昭宗 [Zhaozong] reign begins.Wiki: Chinese monarchs
    13Jan888HREmperor Charles3 the Fat reign ends the Carolingian dynasty.Wiki: HRE
    889Seibal king Wat'ul Chatel and Tikal king Jasaw Chan K'awiil2 reigns end.Wiki: Maya rulersafter 889
    890Chichen It zá king K’ak’upakal K’awiil reign ends.Wiki: Maya rulersPossibly ruler or a high-ranked official.
    4Sep891Pope Stephen5 papacy ends and Pope Formosus (FORMOSVS) (Italian) papacy begins 32 days later.Wiki: List of PopesIn early 897 posthumously ordered to be uninstalled following the Cadaver Synod. His body was reburied with full Christian honors in 897.
    21Feb891HREmperor Guy3/1 of Spoleto crowned by Pope Stephen5 in Rome, Italy and Guy3/1 reign begins the Widonid dynasty.Wiki: HREGuy3/1, great2-grandson of Charles1. King of Italy, Duke of Spoleto
    30Apr892HREmperor Lambert2/1 of Spoleto crowned by Pope Formosus in Ravenna, Italy and Lambert2/1 reign begins.Wiki: HRELambert2/1, son of Guy3/1. King of Italy, Duke of Spoleto
    12Dec894HREmperor Guy3/1 reign ends.Wiki: HRE
    895Balhae king 대현석 (大玄錫) [Dae Hyeonseok] reign ends and king 대위해 (大瑋瑎) [Dae Wihae] reign begins.Wiki: Korean Monarchs
    4Apr896Pope Formosus papacy ends and Pope Boniface6 (BONIFATIVS Sextus) (Italian) papacy begins 7 days later.Wiki: List of Popes
    26Apr896Pope Boniface6 papacy ends and Pope Stephen6 (STEPHANVS) (Italian) papacy begins 26 days later.Wiki: List of PopesSometimes called Stephen7. Held the infamous Cadaver Synod.
    22Feb896HREmperor Arnulf (Carinthia) crowned by Pope Formosus in Rome, Italy, beginning the Carolingian dynasty.Wiki: HREArnulph, nephew of Charles3. King of Italy, East Francia
    14Aug897Pope Stephen6 papacy ends and Pope Romanus (ROMANVS) (Italian) papacy begins.Wiki: List of Popes
    Nov897Pope Romanus papacy ends and Pope Theodore2 papacy ends 50 days later. (Greek)Wiki: List of Popes
    20Dec897Pope Theodore2 papacy ends and Pope John9 (IOANNES Nonus) papacy begins 49 days later.Wiki: List of Popes
    897Japanese 宇多天皇 [Emperor Uda] reign ends and 醍醐天皇 [Emperor Daigo] reign begins.Wiki: Emperors of Japan
    897Emperor 馬殷 [Ma Yin] reign begins.Wiki: Chinese monarchs
    897Silla 진성여왕 (眞聖王) [King Jinseong] reign ends and 효공왕 (孝恭王) [King Hyogong] reign begins.Wiki: Korean Monarchs
    15Oct898HREmperor Lambert1 reign ends the Widonid dynasty.Wiki: HRE
    26Oct899King of the Anglo-Saxons Alfred the Great reign ends and Edward the Elder reign begins.Wiki: English monarchsMarried to (1) Ecgwynn 893 2 children(2) Ælfflæd 900 8 children(3) Eadgifu of Kent 919 4 children. Son of Alfred
    8Dec899HREmperor Arnulph reign ends the Carolingian dynasty.Wiki: HRE
    5Jan900Pope John9 papacy ends and Pope Benedict4 (BENEDICTVS Quartus) (Italian) papacy begins 27 days later.Wiki: List of Popes
    900By this point, almost all of Sappho's works have been lost, and memory of her is reduced to quotations by later authors.History.com: Romantics
    900Mexico's Classic period ends and their Postclassic period reign begins.SFGate - Olmecs to Toltecs
    900sCrucible steel was produced in Merv (Alexandria).Wiki: SteelFormed by slowly heating and cooling pure iron and carbon (typically in the form of charcoal) in a crucible.
    900sMandarin oranges originate in southeastern China.Harvest To Table - Orange Types
    900HuBaekje 훤 (甄萱) (Gyeon Hwon) Begins the HuBaekje Kingdom. Wiki: Korean MonarchsGyeon Hwon was a general during Later Silla's period of decline. Thus began the Later Three Kingdoms period.
    900Old Cahokia expands in Woodland culture.(2022) YT: AA - CahokiaThe Mississippi floodplains in the area were very fertile and they farmed maize [corn].
    901Toniná Ruler 10 reign occurs.Wiki: Maya rulers
    22Feb901HREmperor Louis3 crowned by Pope Benedict4 in Rome, Italy and Louis3 the Blind reign begins the Bosonid dynasty 7 days later.Wiki: HRELouis3, the Blind, grandson of Louis2. King of Italy, Provence, was crowned by Pope Benedict4 in Rome, Italy, or the 22nd
    901Later Goguryeo King 궁예 (弓裔) [Gung-ye] reign begins.Wiki: Korean MonarchsLater Goguryeo, also known as Ma-jin or Taebong, was established by Gung-ye, an outcast prince of Silla.
    30Jul903Pope Benedict4 was deposed and uninstalled, and Pope Leo5 (LEO Quintus) (Italian) papacy begins.Wiki: List of Popes
    Oct903Antipope Christopher (CHRISTOFORO) (Italian) papacy begins.Wiki: List of PopesIn opposition to Leo5.
    Dec903Pope Leo5 papacy ends and Pope Sergius3 (SERGIVS Tertius) (Italian) papacy begins 59 days later.Wiki: List of Popes
    Jan904Antipope Christopher papacy ends.Wiki: List of Popes"Saeculum obscurum" begins. The first pope to be depicted with the Papal Tiara.
    904Tang Emperor 昭宗 [Zhaozong] reign ends and 景宗 [Jingzong], Wuyue Emperor 錢鏐 [Qian Liu] and Yang Wu Emperor 楊行密 [Yang Xingmi] reign begins.Wiki: Chinese monarchs
    905Emperor 楊行密 [Yang Xingmi] reign ends and 楊渥 [Yang Wo] reign begins.Wiki: Chinese monarchs
    21Jul905HREmperor Louis3 the Blind reign ends the Bosonid dynasty.Wiki: HRE
    906Balhae king 대위해 (大瑋瑎) [Dae Wihae] reign ends and king 대인선 (大諲譔) [Dae Inseon] reign begins.Wiki: Korean Monarchs
    907唐朝 [Tang dynasty] dynasty ends and 馬楚 (Ma Chu), 後梁 [Later Liang], and 前蜀 [Former Shu] dynasties begin the 十國 (Ten Kingdoms) period of the 五代十國 (Five Dynasties and Ten Kingdoms) period.Wiki: Chinese monarchs
    908Tamna 경직왕 (敬直王) [King Gyeongjik] reign ends and 민왕 (岷王) [King Min] reign begins.Wiki: Korean Monarchs
    909閩 [Min] dynasty begins.Wiki: Chinese monarchs
    909La Amelia king Aj Took reign occurs.Wiki: Maya rulersAj Took, last known ruler of the city.
    14Apr911Pope Sergius3 papacy ends and Pope Anastasius3 (ANASTASIVS Tertius) (Italian) papacy begins.Wiki: List of Popes
    11May912Roman emperor Leo6 the Wise (Λέων ὁ Σοφός) reign ends and Alexander (Ἀλέξανδρος) reign begins.Wiki: List of Roman emperorsAlexander was another son of Basil1, co-emperor since 879.
    912Silla 효공왕 (孝恭王) [King Hyogong] reign ends and 신덕왕 (神德王) [King Sindeok] reign begins.Wiki: Korean Monarchs
    6Jun913Roman emperor Alexander (Ἀλέξανδρος) reign ends and Constantine7 (Κωνσταντῖνος) reign begins.Wiki: List of Roman emperorsAlexander uninstalled from exhaustion after a game of tzykanion. Constantine7 was son of Leo6, co-emperor since 908.
    Jun913Pope Anastasius3 papacy ends and Pope Lando (LANDO) (Italian) papacy begins 37 days later.Wiki: List of Popes
    5Feb914Pope Lando papacy ends and Pope John10 (IOANNES Decimus) (Italian) papacy begins 23 days later.Wiki: List of Popes
    Dec915HREmperor Berengar1 reign begins the Unruoching dynasty.Wiki: HREBerengar1, grandson of Louis1. King of Italy, Margrave of Friuli. Berengar crowned by Pope John10 in Rome, Italy
    916遼朝 [Liao dynasty] begins.Wiki: Chinese monarchs
    917南漢 [Southern Han] dynasty begins.Wiki: Chinese monarchs
    917Silla 신덕왕 (神德王) [King Sindeok] reign ends and 경명왕 (景明王) [King Gyeongmyeong] reign begins.Wiki: Korean Monarchs
    918Goguryeo king 궁예 (弓裔) [Gung-ye] Ends the Goguryeo kingdom, and 왕건 (王建) [King Geon] begins the Goryeo Kingdom.Wiki: Korean MonarchsGoryeo was ruled by the Wang Dynasty. The first ruler had the temple name Taejo, which means "great progenitor", and was applied to the first kings of both Goryeo and Joseon, as they were also the founders of the Wang and Yi Dynasties respectively. Starting with Gwangjong, rulers of Goryeo styled themselves emperors, with the first three rulers elevated to that title posthumously. With the Mongol conquest, however, the title of the ruler was demoted to a 왕 (王, wáng) [king]. The next twenty-three kings (until Wonjong) are also referred to by their temple names, ending in jong. Beginning with Chungnyeol (the twenty-fifth king), all the remaining kings of Goryeo had the title 왕 (王, wáng) [king] as part of their temple names. The name "Goryeo" would later develop into the country name "Korea".
    17Dec920Roman emperor Romanos1 Lekapenos (Ῥωμανὸς Λεκαπηνός) reign begins.Wiki: List of Roman emperorsRegent for the young Constantine7, crowned himself senior emperor during Constantine7's minority. Proclaimed his three sons Christopher, Stephen and Constantine as co-emperors. Was overthrown by Stephen in 944, who briefly ruled as senior emperor (for a few weeks) until he himself was overthrown by Constantine7.
    20May921Roman emperor Christopher Lekapenos (Χριστόφορος Λακαπηνός) reign begins.Wiki: List of Roman emperorsSon of and co-regent with Romanos1
    921Ibn Fadlan writes of the funeral rituals of the Viking Rus.(2020) YT: VOTP - Ibn FadlanHe describes them: tall like trees. They wear cloaks that leave one arm bare. Women wear a small fine metal box tied to their breasts, with a ring with a knife tied to her breasts too. Husband buys the wife a neckring for every 10k durams he's earned. They don't wash their hands or clean themselves after pooping or sex. Except for in the morning, where a female slave brings to the eldest male fresh water, which he washes himself and spits and blows his nose into - then she takes this to the next eldest male, who does the same, through the household. They practice basically shintoism, leaving offerings to wood with a face carved or painted on it - sometimes a whole cow, and when wolves came to eat the cow, they would feel their spiritual lord was satisfied. Thiefs were vertically uninstalled from trees until the elements wore the bones bare. Funerals - poor people get a simple boat burial like LOTR with simple funeral garb, while rich people had their assets split in 3: 1/3 to household, 1/3 to funeral garb, and 1/3 to the alcohol to celebrate their life/uninstall. "They are addicted to alcohol" writes Ibn Fadlan, "they drink it night and day. Sometimes, one of them uninstalls, cup in hand." At uninstall, a poor person's slave uninstalls to be cremated with them - for rich people with several slaves, one of them would volunteer.
    923後梁 [Later Liang] dynasty ends and 後唐 [Later Tang] dynasty begins.Wiki: Chinese monarchs
    924Roman emperor Stephen Lekapenos (Στέφανος Λακαπηνός) and Constantine Lekapenos (Κωνσταντίνος Λακαπηνός) reign begins.Wiki: List of Roman emperorsSons of and co-regents with Romanos1
    924荊南 [Jingnan] dynasty begins.Wiki: Chinese monarchs
    7Apr924HREmperor Berengar1 reign the Unruoching dynasty and the First HRE Interregnum begins.Wiki: HRESeveral rulers were crowned King of the Romans (king of Germany) but not emperor, although they styled themselves thus, among whom were: Conrad1 and Henry the Fowler in the 10th century
    17Jul924King of the Anglo-Saxons Edward the Elder reign ends and Ælfweard lasts 16 days, and Æthelstan reign begins.Wiki: English monarchsÆlfweard is Disputed. Son of Edward the Elder. Æthelstan Son of Edward the Elder
    924Silla 경명왕 (景明王) [King Gyeongmyeong] reign ends and 경애왕 (景哀王) [King Gyeongae] reign begins.Wiki: Korean Monarchs

    950Toltec civilization rule in Central Mexico begins.SFGate - Olmecs to ToltecsThe capital, Tula (a.k.a. Tollan), in the Valley of Mexico, was home to 40k to 60k people.
    950Medieval Warm Period begins.(2022) YT: AA - CahokiaThis turned the American Bottom (floodplains near St Louis, MO) into a warmer and more humid swamp, where maize thrived. work began on Monks Mound.

    26May961HREmperor Otto2 the Red reign begins.Wiki: HREOtto2, son of Otto1. King of Italy, Germany
    2Feb962HREmperor Otto1 crowned by Pope John12 in Rome, Italy, beginning the Ottonian dynasty and ending the First HRE Interregnum.Wiki: HREMany historians consider the HRE to have started with this, and to be politically separate from the before the HRE Interregnum. It was officially an elective position, though at times It ran in families, notably the four generations of the Salian dynasty in the 11th century.
    15Mar963Roman emperor Romanos2 (Ῥωμανὸς ὁ Πορφυρογέννητος) reign ends, and Nikephoros2 Phokas (Νικηφόρος Φωκᾶς) reign begins 16 AugustWiki: List of Roman emperorsNikephoros2 was chosen by the army after Romanos2's possible poisoning. Acted as senior emperor during the regency of young emperors Basil2 and Constantine8.
    6Dec963Pope John12 papacy ends and Antipope Leo8 (LEO Octavus) (Italian) papacy begins.Wiki: List of PopesAppointed antipope by Emperor Otto in 963 in opposition to John12 and Benedict5. His pontificate after the deposition of Benedict5 is considered legitimate by the modern Catholic temple.
    963荊南 [Jingnan] dynasty ends.Wiki: Chinese monarchs
    26Feb964Antipope Leo8 papacy ends and Pope John12 (IOANNES Duodecimus) (Italian) papacy begins.Wiki: List of Popes
    14May964Pope John12 papacy ends and Pope Benedict5 (BENEDICTVS Quintus) (Italian) papacy begins 8 days later.Wiki: List of PopesElected by the people of Rome, in opposition to Leo8 who was appointed by Emperor Otto; he accepted his own deposition in 964 leaving Leo8 as the sole pope.
    23Jun964Pope Benedict5 papacy ends and Pope Leo8 (LEO Octavus) (Italian) papacy begins.Wiki: List of PopesHis pontificate from 963 to 964 is considered illegitimate by the 21st century's Catholic temple. An appointee of Emperor Otto1, his pontificate occurred during the period known as the Saeculum obscurum.
    1Mar965Pope Leo8 papacy ends and Pope John13 (IOANNES Tertius Decimus) (Italian) papacy begins 214 days later.Wiki: List of PopesChronicled after his uninstall as "the Good".

    969Japanese 冷泉天皇 [Emperor Reizei] reign ends and 円融天皇 [Emperor En'yū] reign begins.Wiki: Emperors of Japan

    1000Bitter oranges are brought to the Mediterranean.Harvest To Table - Orange TypesOriginated in India, they were named after the Sanskrit word "naranga" which means "fragrant". (Thus the Spanish word for the fruit, "naranja" as well. But the Latin name became "aurantium" and then "arancia in Italian. This fruit's pigmentation was a unique combination of red and yellow, and in English the color "orange" was named after the fruit.)
    1000Izamal king Ah Ulil reign occurs.Wiki: Maya rulers
    1000Song court keeps dogs from the pug breed.(2021) YT: BA - Every Dog BreedThey were so prized that soldiers guarded them. (Take that, Cú Chulainn!)
    1000Old Cahokia sees massive population growth from the huge amounts of maize grown on the Mississippi floodplains.(2022) YT: AA - CahokiaAn influx of people drove an increase in farmed land, which drove an increase in available food, driving an influx of people in a populating cycle. The population reached 2000 humans. work continued on Monks Mound.
    1000sEarly chalk on blackboard was in use in Indian schools as mentioned in Alberunis Indica Tarikh Al-Hind.Wiki: BlackboardThey used black tablets for the children in the schools, and wrote upon them along the long side, not the broadside, writing with a white material from the left to the right.
    1000sJapanese power subtly shifts from the emperor to the shogun.(2012) YT: OSP - Meiji RestorationThe emperor still held all the symbolic power, but the shogun had all the local daimyo (micropower leaders) who had all the samurai.
    1000sSteel was produced in Song China using two techniques.Wiki: SteelOne was a berganesque method that produced inferior, inhomogeneous steel, and the other was a precursor to the modern Bessemer process that used partial decarbonization via repeated forging under a cold blast.

    1050sOld Cahokia becomes New Cahokia.(2022) YT: AA - CahokiaIt's speculated this might be due to supernova SN1054 being interpreted as a cosmic sign to change their ways. Other options are exceeding their food storage, or a charismatic leader had a new proposal. Whatever the cause, the city was completely razed and rebuilt, in what's known as the Big Bang of Cahokia. After this, the Toltec Mound Site abandoned about this time, and the population would soon increase from 2k humans to 10k. work continued on Monks Mound. 5 major changes to the city:
    1. Instead of digging post holes, placing posts, and building walls off these, they would prefabricate walls, then dig trenches and drop the walls in, for faster wall building.
    2. Ramey Incised Pottery - using reeds, rocks, sticks, etc to create decorative patterns.
    3. (t)Chun-key game - Player rolls a sideways curling stone along the grass, and 2 other players throw javelins where they think it will stop. Gambling was common. Cahokia introduced a new type of Chun-key stone, with concave sides.
    4. Flintclay sculptures of Cahokian deities.
    5. SouthEastern Ceremonial Complex (SECC) - A new style of art was born that would spread across the land. Originally thought to be from the Southeast, but now known to be Mississippian.
    Nearby Aztalan changes from a normal settlement with effigy mounts to a Cahokia-style settlement, with mounds, plazas, houses with prefabricated walls that fit into trenches, and other artifacts.
    1054An unknown star goes supernova, creating the Crab Nebula.(2020) YT: FC - Betelgeuse
    1054The closest supernova to Earth, light finally reaches Earth from 6500 light years away.(2020) YT: LPA - BetelgeuseRecorded by Chinese scholars as a "brilliant guest star" that stayed bright for almost a full year, it was visible during the daytime, and could be read by at night.
    1054Mutual excommunications of Leo9 and Patriarch of Constantinople Michael1 Cerularius began the East-West Schism.Wiki: List of Popes
    1054Great Schism of 1054EWTN - Great Schism Pope Leo9 sent an emissary, Cardinal Humbert, from Rome to Constantinople. It is commonly accepted that the separation of Vatican City and Constantinople into two Christian temples was the result of centuries of conflict.

First cousin once removed of Edward the Confessor. Right of conquest.
    1066William the Conquerer came to the British Isles, starting the Norman Britain period.(2018) YT: IPOV - Britain's 2nd EmpireThe City of London was one of the few areas he failed to conquer.

    1067William the Conquerer struck a deal with the City of London.(2018) YT: IPOV - Britain's 2nd EmpireThis allowed the city to continue functioning, and is part of why even in the 21st century this area is unlike the rest of the UK - they are a private company, with private police and private courts - and have a separate mayor, the Lord Mayor, selected by medieval guilds - with his own parade every November. The Rememberancer is their representative in the House of Commons, to lobby for The City and also report back what Parliament is doing. "Over and over again we have seen that there is another power than that which has its seat at Westminster. The city of London, a convenient term for a collection of financial interests is able to assert itself against the government of the country. Those who control money can pursue a policy at home and abroad contrary to that which is being decided by the people." - Clement Attlee, UK Prime Minister in the 20th century. Some assert that there has never been a fully-comprehensive academic study of the political economics and economic impacts of the City of London.
    1Jan1068Roman emperor Andronikos Doukas (Ἀνδρόνικος Δούκας) and Romanos4 Diogenes (Ῥωμανὸς Διογένης) reigns begin.Wiki: List of Roman emperorsMarried to Constantine10's widow and senior emperor as guardian of her sons by Constantine10

    1086Emperor 李秉常 [Lǐ Bǐngcháng] reign ends and 李乾順 [Lǐ Qiánshùn] reign begins.Wiki: Chinese monarchs
    1086Duke William of Normandy writes the Doomsday Book.(2021) YT: MHTV - English Peasants

    This book records data about England, and maybe southern Scotland. It records a few slaves, but the vast majority of field workers were free peasants. Danes held the eastern half of England, and had slightly different rules - keeping no slaves and few Serfs, and the ancient tradition of taxing based on the number of horned beasts that were kept. (A herd of livestock would be a pre-bank account display of wealth.) It cataloged a huge amount of the country in great detail, but ignores some huge areas. There are 283k men listed, but clergy, women and chldren, and London are not counted - leading to an estimated English population of 2 million to 2.5 million. Of these people, 95% lived outside cities, split between servile Serfs and free peasants. Villein was another word for Serf.

    Peasants would report to a Manor, with a lord, who would hold 2-3 villages. Serfs worked 2-3 days a week for the lord, while free people paid rent. Serfs and lords had different rights to the lands, not unlike a landlord/renter relationship in the 21st century. One lord was fined 40 shillings (2 pounds Sterling, or about 2021 equivalent $7000 or 27.6 GC) for "thrashing" his Serf. A penny (1/240 pound Sterling, about 2021 equivalent $14.60 or .05 GC) per day was a common wage. Taxing involved using the lord's grain mill (which took a percentage), controlling where the Serf could live after marriage, and uninstall duty of a livestock animal - but usually not a direct financial requirement.

    The Normans were against human slavery, and Bishop Anslem said "It should be wrong to sell a man like a brute beast." They put a stop to the slave trade between Bristol, and Dublin (which had been set up by the Vikings as a slave-trading port). They preferred to make a person legally free - that way they have to feed themselves instead of needing you to feed them - except that they're not allowed to move off their land, and you can tax him. (This is very similar to the Mongol system of just taking tribute in words and crops each year, and leaving the local social, farming, and market institutions in place.)

    1087Roman emperor Constantine Doukas (Κωνσταντίνος Δούκας) reign ends.Wiki: List of Roman emperors
    9Sep1087Rex totius Britanniae [King of the Whole of Britain] William1 the Conqueror reign ends and William2 Rufus reign begins 17 days later.Wiki: English monarchsSon of William1. Granted the Kingdom of England over elder brother Robert Curthose.
    16Sep1087Pope Bl. Victor3 papacy ends and Pope Bl. Urban2 (VRBANVS Secundus) (Odon de Lagery O.S.B) (French) papacy begins 178 days later.Wiki: List of PopesPreached and started the First Crusade.

    2Aug1100Rex totius Britanniae [King of the Whole of Britain] William2 Rufus reign ends and Henry1 Beauclerc reign begins 3 days later.Wiki: English monarchsWilliam2 Uninstalled by arrow in New Forest.     1100Cocom king Hunac Ceel reign begins.Wiki: Maya rulersHunac Ceel, general who conquered the city and founded a new ruling family. 1100s
    8Sep1100Antipope Clement3 papacy ends and Theodoric (THEODORICVS) (Teodorico) (Lombard) papacy begins.Wiki: List of PopesIn opposition to Paschal2
    1100Cahokia's culture gap between upper and lower classes is widening.(2022) YT: AA - Cahokia

    This is about when the city redesign happened. After this, houses were constructed hastily and not quite aligned to the grid. Population about 15k. work continued on Monks Mound. The woodhenge was built for the first time - it would be rebuilt several times, ranging from 73 to 145 meters in diameter. It was west of Monks Mound, so observers standing in the woodhenge would see the sun rise/set through Monks Mound on the Equinoxes.

    The Emerald Site temple was constructed nearby, in the mountains at a natural spring. - it served as a site for lunar and hydrodynamic ritual uninstalling. A causeway was constructed to Cahokia.

    1100sCentral Eurasean Steppes become warmer and start growing more food.(2019) YT: FH - MongolsThis leads to the growth and success of China as a population center - like any complex devices, humans live close to our energy sources.
    1100sFinancial Trusts invented.(2018) YT: IPOV - Britain's 2nd EmpireTrusts play with the concept of legal ownership. Crusading knights (settlors) leaving for foreign lands would leave their lands or other assets in the hands of a steward (trustee). The trustee is usually a lawyer, and the settlor is legally separated from the assets, so they can't be taxed or frozen as part of their funds. The UK's overseas territories had no qualifications, licensing, nor registration or certification of trustees or trusts - the only people involved in creating the trust are the settlor and the trustee.
    1100sEnglish courts become increasingly interested in determing serfdom.(2021) YT: MHTV - English Peasants

    One of the determinations was "Terror ad furcum et flagellum" [Terror to the thief and the whip] - how do they pay rent: does their lord take their money, or does their lord force (whip) them to work the land? This was complex because most people paid rent in a mix of cash and labor.

    How could serfs gain freedom?

    • Quit rent - have someone else pay some money to the lord (since you legally can't own money)
    • Run away - if you reached a town and lived undetected for a year and a day, you'd be free. Towns wanted new residents, and competed with lords who would send people to bring them back. (City guards wouldn't help - are there no sherriffs?)
    • Become clergy - Temple rules exceeded legal rules, and required a different kind of service.
    • Military service - Legend says Henry5 freed the Serfs in his army, and other nobles might too.

    1128Black Book of Peterborough written.(2021) YT: MHTV - English Peasants

    It specifies labor for peasants:

    • Plow 4 acres for the spring sowing.
    • Work 3 days each week.
    • Must supply 60 hens and 640 eggs a year. (This would be about 1 hen and 21 eggs every 12 days. Hens produce 0.5 eggs a day so 3.5 hens would be dedicated to the egg tax year-round.)

    The Knights Templar had similar duities for peasants:

    • Must mow 4 days a week, until the meadows are clear, and the hay is carried in.
    • Carry loads to Gloucester - or wherever the Master wills. (About 20 mi or 32 km.)
    • Move the sheepfold [sheep pen] twice a year. (So they get new grass and toilet-space?)

    Over time, financial demands shifted from labor to money, due to money's fungible and non-perishable nature.

    7Apr1141Domina Anglorum (Lady of the English) Empress Matilda reign lasts for 208 days.Wiki: English monarchsDisputed claimant - Matilda was declared heir presumptive by her father, Henry1, after the uninstall of her brother on the White Ship, and acknowledged as such by the barons. Upon Henry1's uninstall, the throne was seized by Matilda's cousin, Stephen of Blois. During the ensuing anarchy, Matilda controlled England for a few months - the first woman to do so - but was never crowned and is rarely listed as a monarch of England. Married to:
    1. Henry5 of the Holy Roman Empire, married at Mainz on 6 Jan 1114, 0 children.
    2. Geoffrey5 of Anjou, married at Le Mans Cathedral on 22 May 1128, 3 sons.

    1150Cahokia's elite built a palisade [stake wall] around the central precinct.(2022) YT: AA - Cahokia

    2800 m long and 3-4 m tall, with bastions and L-shaped gates. It was enormously expensive, using 15k-20k logs. It was rebuilt 3 more times during the city's existence. It cut directly through neighborhoods, and separated the elite from the commonors. The satellite city at East St Louis was burned down about this time.

    Work on Monks Mound was just about complete - at 30 x 291 x 236 meters, it's the largest pyramid north of Mesoamerica. It had 4 terraces, with an elite Cahokian leader living in a house on the top one. The dirt was dug locally, and some nearby ponds are where it came from.

They raid the Merkits Mongol and easily get Borte back. Temujin ran his army as a meritocracy, which clashed with Jamukah's perference for traditional family-based ranks.

    24Sep1180Roman emperor Manuel1 Komnenos (Μανουὴλ Κομνηνός) reign ends and Alexios2 Komnenos (Ἀλέξιος Κομνηνός) reign begins.Wiki: List of Roman emperorsAlexios2 was son of Manuel1
    1180Japanese 高倉天皇 [Emperor Takakura] reign ends and 安徳天皇 [Emperor Antoku] reign begins.Wiki: Emperors of Japan
    1180Rabbi Maimodenes writes his 8 levels of Charity.MIT: AllanC - MaimonidesGeneralized, in order:
    1. Support a friend or colleague with financial aid, help them find a job, etc.
    2. Donate to a large charity, where you don't know who will benefit. Only do this if charities are trustable.
    3. Secretly donate to people you know, without their knowledge. Do this if charities are corrupt.
    4. Donate to people in a way that lets the recipient keep their anonymity and avoid the shame of begging.
    5. Donate directly to a beggar, before the beggar begs.
    6. Donate directly to a beggar, after the beggar begs.
    7. Donate insufficiently to a beggar, after the beggar begs, then give thoughts and prayers.
    8. Donate unwillingly. (Be stolen from?)
    30Aug1181Pope Alexander3 papacy ends and Pope Lucius3 (LUCIVS Tertius) (Ubaldo Allucignoli) (Italian) papacy begins 2 days later.Wiki: List of Popes
    Oct1183Roman emperor Alexios2 Komnenos (Ἀλέξιος Κομνηνός) reign ends and Andronikos1 Komnenos (Ἀνδρόνικος Κομνηνός) with John Komnenos (Ἰωάννης Κομνηνός) reign begins.Wiki: List of Roman emperorsAlexios2 was deposed and uninstalled by his nephew Andronikos1, also nephew of John2 (son of his brother Isaac). Appointed his son John as co-emperor that November.
    1183Japanese 後鳥羽天皇 [Emperor Go-Toba] reign begins.Wiki: Emperors of Japan
    12Sep1185Roman emperor Andronikos1 Komnenos (Ἀνδρόνικος Κομνηνός) with John Komnenos (Ἰωάννης Κομνηνός) reign ends and Isaac2 Angelos (Ἰσαάκιος Ἄγγελος) reign begins.Wiki: List of Roman emperorsAndronikos1 and his son John were overthrown and lynched in a popular rebellion.
    25Nov1185Pope Lucius3 papacy ends and Pope Urban3 (VRBANVS Tertius) (Uberto Crivelli) (Italian) papacy begins.Wiki: List of Popes
    1185安徳天皇 [Emperor Antoku] reign ends the Heian period and the Kamakura period begins.Wiki: Emperors of Japan
    1187Jamukah battles and wins against his blood brother, Temujin (Mongol).(2019) YT: FH - MongolsToghrul Khan and Jamukah band together to defend against Temujin's new and well-organized fighting force. Jamukah is titled "Gur Khan" or Universal Ruler, but went on to be defeated massively. Jamukah's own troops brought Jamukah to Temujin - Temujin had the troops put to uninstall, then offered Jamukah another chance - Jamukah turned it down and received an honorable uninstall.
    20Oct1187Pope Urban3 papacy ends and Pope Gregory8 (GREGORIVS Octavus) (Alberto de Morra Can.Reg) (Italian) papacy begins 1 day later.Wiki: List of PopesCanon Regular Premostratense. Proposed the Third Crusade.

    8Jan1198Pope Celestine3 papacy ends and Pope Innocent3 (INNOCENTIVS Tertius) (Lotario dei Conti di Segni) (Italian) papacy begins.Wiki: List of PopesConvened the Fourth Council of the Lateran, 1215. Initiated the Fourth Crusade but later distanced himself from it and threatened participants with excommunication when it became clear that the leadership abandoned a focus on conquest of the Holy Land and instead intended to sack Christian cities. Endorsed the Franciscan Order.

    1205Roman emperor Theodore1 Laskaris (Θεόδωρος Λάσκαρις) reign begins.Wiki: List of Roman emperorsHis brother Constantine Laskaris was elected emperor by the citizens of Constantinople on the day the city fell to the Crusaders; he later fled to Nicaea, where Theodore organized the Greek resistance to the Latins. Proclaimed emperor after Constantine's uninstall in 1205, Theodore was crowned only in 1208.

    1211Ghengis Khan completes rading the Western Shah to the south of Mongolia, makes the emperor a vassal, and turns sights on the Jin dynasty.(2019) YT: FH - MongolsThe Jin had long treated the Mongol as vassals, so when they returned, the Mongol went full Bugs Life on them. Ghengis spit on the ground and rode his horse away from negotiations, as a declaration of war. As war proceeded, messengers who were supposed to negotiate instead became traitors, leading to numerous swift victories. The Mongol quickly learned siege warfare and gunfare from their Jin prisoners.
    1211W. Liao Emperor 耶律直魯古 [Yēlǜ Zhílǔgǔ] reign ends and 屈出律 [Qūchūlǜ] reign begins, and W. Xia Emperor 李安全 [Lǐ Ānquán] reign ends and 李遵頊 [Lǐ Zūnxū] reign begins.Wiki: Chinese monarchs

Ghengis Khan invaded the Khwarazmian empire in a rage over this.

    1220Shah Ala Ad-Din Muhammad2 (Khwarazmian) uninstalls from illness while fleeing the Mongol micropowers.(2019) YT: FH - MongolsHis son rallies 30k troops, defeats a rookie Mongol general, and became famous by making the Mongol seem not invincible. Taking Khwarazmian had caused his empire to fall into civil wars. Ghengis Khan had 2 generals push on to the Caucasus mountains, while others quelled rebellions.

    1246Güyük Khan writes letter to Pope Innocent4(2019) YT: VOTP - GüyükIt was an invitation to serve at the court of the Khan. Word of the glory and horrors of the Khanate had spread as far west as the Vatican, and the ears of the then Pope, Innocent4. Franciscan friar John Of Plano Carpini was dispatched with a letter from the pope, calling on Güyük to act peacefully towards lands following Vatican City's religion and convert himself to Vatican City's religion.This was the great Khan's reply.

    18Aug1276Pope Adrian5 papacy ends and Pope John21 (IOANNES Vicesimus Primus) (Pedro Julião) (Portuguese) papacy begins 21 days later.Wiki: List of PopesDue to a confusion over the numbering of popes named John in the 13th century, the ordinal "20" was skipped. A.k.a. Petrus Hispanus and Pedro Hispano.
    1276Song Emperor Gong reign ends and 端宗 [Duanzong] reign begins.Wiki: Chinese monarchs
    20May1277Pope John21 papacy ends and Pope Nicholas3 (NICOLAVS (Tertius) (Giovanni Gaetano Orsini) (Italian) papacy begins 189 days later.Wiki: List of PopesPlanned the Sicilian Vespers.

    1279Emperor 宋帝昺 [Sòng Dì Bǐng] reign ends the 宋朝 (Song dynasty).Wiki: Chinese monarchs
    1294Kublai Khan reign ends and Temür Khan reign begins.Wiki: Chinese monarchsTimur and Temür are the same Mongolian word, but Temür avoids confusion with Timur the lame (Tamerlane).

    1290King of Portugal opens the first university in Portugal.(2016) YT: LF - PortugeseHe decided the language of instruction wouldn't be Latin, but "vulgar Latin", the local spoken version of Latin, which he called "Portugese". Galician hadn't yet diverged from Portugese, and they were one dialect.
    4Apr1292Pope Nicholas4 papacy ends and Second Papal Interregnum begins.Wiki: List of PopesTwo-year period without a valid pope elected. This was due to a deadlock among cardinals voting for the pope.
    1293Kingdom of Majapahit begins.(2019) YT: EH - Majapahit
    5Jul1294Second Papal Interregnum ends and Pope St Celestine5 (COELESTINVS Quintus) (Pietro Angelerio, O.S.B) (Italian) papacy begins.Wiki: List of PopesOne of the few popes who abdicated voluntarily. Founded the Celestines. Resigned from office and rumored to have been uninstalled in prison by Boniface8.
    13Dec1294Pope St Celestine5 papacy ends and Pope Boniface8 (BONIFATIVS Octavus) (Benedetto Caetani) (Italian) papacy begins 11 days later.Wiki: List of PopesFormalized the Jubilee in 1300. Issued Unam Sanctam [One Holy One] (1302) which proclaimed papal supremacy and pushing it to its historical extreme.

    1300Jews who lived under the Muslim caliphates of Al-Andalus were tolerated.Wiki: Expulsion Jews SpainThe good times of Spain of the three religions had coincided with a phase of territorial, demographic, and economic expansion, in which Jews and Christians did not compete in the labor market: both the former and the latter had contributed to the general prosperity and shared their benefits.
    1300Travels of Marco Polo published.(2019) YT: OSP - Marco Polo

    1300sKingdom of Srivijaya ends.(2019) YT: EH - Majapahit
    1300sThe period of relative tolerance of Spaniards towards the Jews ended, passing into a phase of increasing conflict.Wiki: Expulsion Jews Spain
    1300sDaisugi technique developed in Kitayama region, Japan.(2021) Imgur: KitayamaThis was the solution to a seedling shortage - instead of harvesting a tree, prune it like a giant bonsai, so it produces a 2nd layer of trees. Prune those to be straight trees, and harvest when ready.
    1300sTea ceremonies become popular in Japan.Wiki: DaisugiDaisugi logs were used in the construction of tea rooms and tokonoma alcoves (art appreciation pantries). The Kitayama region of Kyoto became especially known for its daisugi forests.
    1300sIbn Khaldun (Qaldun) wrote about how ancient empires formed around fertile river valleys.(2012) YT: CR - Pre-Islam Middle EastSuch as the Huang Ho [Yellow River], Indus, Tigrus & Euphrates, and Nile. He discussed how the rivers allowed for trade to happen more easily, so population centers formed there, grew into cities, then empires. Further, he wrote about a pattern to history:
    • Farmers build irrigation systems to build villages and towns.
    • A warrior takes these towns under his rule and form a micropower.
    • Conquest - Another nomadic micropower would come by and take over this micropower by force.
    • Consolidation - The nomadic rulers consolidate their power.
    • Expansion - The nomadic rulers expand the micropower.
    • Degeneration - Over time, the nomads assimilate to the local micropower culture.
    • Conquest - Another nomadic micropower would come by and take over this micropower by force.
    1300sMexica (me-hee-ca) micropower moves to Tenochtitlan(2018) YT: OSP - QuetzalcoatlAnother entry said they were dropped off by a foreign micropower leader.
    1300sSpaniel dog breed identified by English.(2021) YT: BA - Every Dog BreedSpaniels begin to show up in paintings and frescoes around Europe, such as Titian's Venus of Urbino (warning, nude art) a couple centuries later.
    1300sThe Kalinago micropower warred against the Maipurean-speaking Taíno micropower, to displace them from the Caribbean islands.Wiki: KalinagoThey were partially successful. The Taíno had settled the island chains earlier in history, migrating from the mainland. Kalinago later traded with the Eastern Taíno of the Caribbean Islands. Suninstalled boat builders and sailors, the Kalinago navally dominated the Caribbean.
    1301Comet may have been seen by Giotto di Bondone later determined to be Halley's Comet.Wiki: Halley's Comet

Benedict11 (BENEDICTVS Undecimus) (Niccolò Boccasini, O.P) (Italian) papacy begins 11 days later.Wiki: List of PopesMotto: Illustra faciem Tuam super servum Tuum (Shine Your Face upon Your servant) Member of the Dominican Order. Reverted Boniface8's Unam Sanctam [One Holy One].

Convened the Council of Vienne (1311-1312). Initiated the persecution of the Knights Templar with the bull Pastoralis Praeeminentiae [Pastoral Preeminence] under pressure from King Philip4 of France.

    7Aug1316Third Papal Interregnum ends and Pope John22 (IOANNES Vicesimus Secundus) (Jacques d'Euse/Duèse) (French) papacy begins.Wiki: List of PopesPope at Avignon. Controversial for his views on the Beatific Vision. Opposed the Franciscan understanding of the poverty of Christ and his apostles, famously leading William of Ockham to write against unlimited papal power
    1316Edward3 (England) is the cousin of the previous kings, but the French nobility reject him for another cousin, Philip2/6 (France)(2016) YT: Jabzy - 100yrs WarEdward3 accepted Philip2/6 as king of France because England's throne had held French territory since the Norman invasion. England had once held many French lands, but now only had Gascony

    1321Ayurbarwada Buyantu Khan reign ends and Gegeen Khan reign begins.Wiki: Chinese monarchs
    1323Gegeen Khan reign ends and Yesün Temür reign begins.Wiki: Chinese monarchs
    1324Musa Keita1 embarks on the most extravagant Hajj of all time.(2018) YT: EH - Mansa MusaHe wanted to put Mali on the map, and show of the epic funding of the country. (Even in the 21st century they're the Casterly Rock of Africa.) One account claims his micropower retinue included:
    • More than 60k people, of which 12k were servile
      • 500 heralds carrying gold staffs
      • His wife's personal 500 servile retinue
    • 600 camels
      • each with 300 lbs of gold dust.
      • (1oz = $1783.91 or 7 GC, 90 tons = 2021 equivalent $5.1 billion or 80k GD)
    • And they packed provisions for the entire trip, an army of pack animals.
    Musa gave handfuls of gold dust to beggars, built a mosque every Friday on the trip (every 40 miles or 65 km?), and spent months overpaying for everything he could. He spent so much that the value of gold wouldn't recover for over a decade. He caused a financial crisis by buying souvenirs. Legend of his spending lasted for centuries in Cairo and eventually got to Europe.
    1325Mali's armies take Timbuktu and Gow while Musa Keita1 was on Hajj.(2018) YT: EH - Mansa Musa
    1325Q'umarkaj king Ajkan reign ends and K'okaib' reign begins.Wiki: Maya rulers
    1326Musa Keita1 returns from Mecca.(2018) YT: EH - Mansa MusaThe return trip revealed that the original trip was as much an advertisement for talent & a display of financial fortitude, as it was a billboard celebrating Islam. He hired countless architects and engineers into his micropower, and brought them to Timbuktu, building numerous buildings when the micropower dispersed back into Mali, including the Djinguereber Mosque, which still stands in the 21st century. They built some stuff in Gow too. This caused a huge influx of culture and knowledge, along with trade, becoming the sub-Saharan Islamic center. (Mecca and Timbuktu are about the same latitude, but the Red Sea blocks a direct 2800 mi (4500 km) route. The shortest land route is about 3200 mi (5150 km) - across 542 days gives 5.9 mi/day (9.5 km/day), which is kinda amazing for this size of caravan. Assuming they left in Jan 1324 and returned Dec 1326, this gives 542 days to arrive, 10 days of Hajj and 1 to rest, and 542 more for the return trip.)
    1326Walter the Milimeter (England) writes about the first 1 mm (0.04 in or about 180 gauge) cannon.(2015) YT: PTA - Evol FirearmsOther writings discuss gun and shot as though they're common.

Member of the Order of Cistercians. Known for issuing the Apostolic constitution Benedictus Deus [Blessed be God] (1336). A careful pope who reformed monastic orders and opposed nepotism.

    12Sep1362Pope Innocent6 papacy ends and Pope Bl. Urban5 (VRBANVS Quintus) (Guillaume (de) Grimoard, O.S.B) (French) papacy begins 16 days later.Wiki: List of PopesPope at Avignon. Reformed areas of education and sent missionary movements across Europe and Asia. His pontificate witnessed the Alexandrian and Savoyard crusades.
    1362Sultan Orhan reign ends and Murad1 SULTÂN-I ÂZAM (the Most Exalted Sultan) HÜDAVENDİGÂR (the Devotee of God) ŞEHÎD (the Martyr) reign begins.Wiki: List of Ottoman sultansSon of Orhan and Nilüfer Hatun. Uninstalled on the battlefield at the Battle of Kosovo on June 15, 1389.
    1366Trastámarans occupied Briviesca.Wiki: Expulsion Jews SpainThe uninstall-desiring supporters of Enrique de Trastámara carried out another mass-uninstall of Jews while there.
    1366In Burgos, Jews who could not pay the large tribute imposed on them were enslaved and sold.Wiki: Expulsion Jews Spain
    1367In Valladolid, Jews were assaulted to the shout of "Long live King Henry!".Wiki: Expulsion Jews SpainThere were no uninstalls, but the synagogues were burned down.

    1370Casimir the Great (Poland) uninstalls, succeeded by Lewis (Hungary)(2017) YT: PI - History of PolandThe Jewish refugee micropower moved into Europe as traders, stopping in Poland as the first stop on the trade routes, but eventually spreading into every European country. Almost everywhere else, they were "uninstalled en masse", crusaded against, and expelled. Polish monarchs, in reaction to recently losing territory to the Teutonic Order in the north and HRE in the west, goto the local Counts of Pomerania and Silesia. They work to politically outmaneuver the HREmperors. This leads to a time of prosperity in Poland, which attracted the Jewish micropower back to Poland.
    1370A new law in England prevents non-landowners from owning hunting dogs.(2021) YT: BA - Every Dog Breed"It is ordained that no manner of layman which hath not lands to the value of forty shillings (2 pounds Sterling, about 2021 equivalent $1947 or 7.7 GC) a year shall from henseforth keep any greyhound or other dog to hunt, nor shall he use ferrets, nets, heys, harepipes nor cords, nor other engines for to take or destroy deer, hares nor conies, nor other gentlemen's game, under pain of twelve months' imprisonment."
    19Dec1370Pope Bl. Urban5 papacy ends and Pope Gregory11 (GREGORIVS Undecimus) (Pierre Roger de Beaufort) (French) papacy begins 11 days later.Wiki: List of PopesPope at Avignon; returns to Rome. The last French pope.

    1374Earliest painting of a spotted Dalmation dog.(2021) YT: BA - Every Dog BreedThey originated in the Dalmation region of Croatia. Originally popular with circuses for their high intelligence and distinct pigmentation, these dogs also worked as carriage dogs, running alongside a carriage to as honor guard its occupants (and display their asset level).

    1384Lewis (Hungary) was succeded by his 2nd daughter in Hungary and 3rd daughter Jadigwa (Ya-dig-va) in Poland.(2017) YT: PI - History of PolandThe first daughter uninstalled before inheriting, so everything shifted by one. Jadigwa (Poland) was loved by nobles and crowned king, not queen. Jadigwa (Poland) was engaged to both Wladyslaw (Vlad-is-lav) Habsburg (Lithuania), the Grand Duke and the Duke of Austria
    1386Jadigwa (Poland) chose the duke of Wladyslaw (Lithuania) over the duke of Austria.(2017) YT: PI - History of PolandTheir marriage formed the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth, the largest country in Europe. Poland's much larger population spread into Lithuania's much larger, less-densely populated lands, bringing their languages and cultures

    Jan1391The first attempted assault on the Jewish quarter was avoided by the municipal authorities.Wiki: Expulsion Jews Spain
    16Feb1391Roman emperor John5 Palaiologos (Ἰωάννης Παλαιολόγος)(third) reign) reign ends and Manuel2 Palaiologos (Μανουὴλ Παλαιολόγος) reign begins.Wiki: List of Roman emperorsSon of John5, Manuel2 was co-emperor since 1373.
    1391Massacres of 1391.Wiki: Expulsion Jews SpainBy this point, over half of Spain's Jews had converted to Catholicism as a result of the religious persecution and pogroms. In Seville, before the revolts, there were about 500 Jewish families. Anti-Jewish measures were intensified after this.
    Jun1391Hundreds of Jews were uninstalled, their houses ransacked, and the synagogues converted into temples.Wiki: Expulsion Jews SpainThe assaults, fires, looting, and massacres began in June, in Seville, where Ferrand Martinez, archdeacon of Écija, took advantage of the power vacuum created by the uninstall of the archbishop of Seville. Some Jews managed to escape; others, terrified, asked to be baptized.
    Aug1391Anti-Jewish violence reached the Crown of Aragon from Seville.Wiki: Expulsion Jews SpainThe great catastrophe for the Jews of the Iberian Peninsula took place with massacres in the juderías of Castile and of the Crown of Aragon. Many of the Jews who survived fled, many to the kingdoms of Navarre, Portugal and France, and North Africa.
    1Jun1392Charles6 (France) hears a prophecy from a leper in passing.(2019) YT: EC - Joan of Arc 1Startled by a Page dropping a lance, Charles6 starts hacking at his retinue, showing his mental illness. He would fip back and forth between lucidity and insanity, forgetting his family members and that he was king, sometimes running naked and screaming through the hallways. Meanwhile, 2 factions plotted.
    1392Emperor 後亀山天皇 [Emperor Go-Kameyama] reign ends the Northern Court, and 後小松天皇 [Emperor Go-Komatsu] reign begins.Wiki: Emperors of Japan
    1392Goryeo 왕요 (王瑤) [King Yo] Ends the Goryeo Kingdom, and 고황제 (高皇帝) [Emperor Go] begins the Joseon empire.Wiki: Korean MonarchsGoryeo was ruled by the Wang Dynasty. Joseon became the Korean Empire, some of the Joseon kings were posthumously raised to the rank of emperors.
    16Sep1394Antipope Clement7 papacy ends and Benedict13 (BENEDICTVS Tertius Decimus) (Pedro Martínez de Luna y Pérez de Gotor) (Spanish) papacy begins 12 days later.Wiki: List of PopesIn opposition to Boniface9 (1389-1404), Innocent7 (1404-06), Gregory12 (1406-15), Martin5 (1417-31) and Pisan Antipopes Alexander5 (1409-10) and John23 (1410-15)
    1398Joseon 고황제 (高皇帝) [Emperor Go] reign ends and Emperor 공정 (恭靖) [Gongjeong1] reign begins.Wiki: Korean MonarchsJoseon monarchs had temple names ending in jo or jong. Jo was given to the first kings/emperors of new lines within the dynasty, with the first king/emperor having the special name (Taejo), which means "great progenitor" (see also Goryeo ). Jong was given to all other kings/emperors.
    1398Sungkyunkwan was established as the Joseon Dynasty's highest educational institution.Wiki: SungkyunkwanIts name is 成 (sung) [to make], 均 (kyun) [harmonious society], 館 (kwan) [institute]. It focused on in-depth study of the old Chinese Classics, Confucian canon, and literature of the era, and how to apply the knowledge to governing the nation and understanding the nature of humanity. It also served as a shrine to the Confucian sages, and rituals were held there regularly to honor them and their teachings.

    1400sThe screw starts being used as a fastener in jousting armor and early firearms.(2020) YT: THG - ScrewdriverA screw was used in flint-lock to make the pyrite easy to replace, as it wore out often. Pyrite was used instead of flint by this point, apparently.
    1400sVoynich Manuscript written.(2015) YT: LEMMiNO - Unsolved Top10
    1400sFirst drawings of a soldier firing a gun with a hot iron.(2015) YT: PTA - Evol FirearmsOther drawings showed cannons and handguns side-by-side. The first gun artifacts come from this time as well - a long stick with a short tube, with one end plugged, and a hole. They were packed like muskets. Some drawings show a hoop-support to help aiming. The powder was soon moved to a pan chamber, and smoldering match cord was soon attached to a lever system (called a lock), pulled by a trigger.

    1403Roman emperor Andronikos5 Palaiologos (Ἀνδρόνικος Παλαιολόγος) & John7 Palaiologos (Ἰωάννης Παλαιολόγος) reigns beginWiki: List of Roman emperorsJohn7 was restored as co-emperor in 1403, then proclaimed his son Andronikos5 as co-emperor. Their imperial status was purely honorary.

    1406James1 (Scotland) sends 12k Scottish troops to France fight the English in the Hundred Years War.(2019) YT: OSP - ScotlandThis left James1 in a great position to consolidate the nation, however he was uninstalled as soon as he returned, and Scotland descended back into civil war. "The king can say whatever he wants in Edinburgh, but unless he personally marches out to InverNess to tell Clan Fraser to pay their taxes, I won't." (And many still didn't.)

    20Nov14072 factions in France make a truce.(2019) YT: EC - Joan of Arc 1One side, Armagnacs, led by Louis, duke of Orleans, rich and playboy and physically close with Isabeau (France). Other side was John the Fearless, duke of Burgundy, with large holdings in the English-influenced northern regions, so wanted an England-like society with pastures and cities. Both sides supported different popes too.

In opposition to Gregory12. Convened Council of Constance. Abdicated. Became dean of the College of Cardinals in 1417. Was considered a legitimate pope until 1958.

    1415Henry5 (England) invades France, but he's quickly bogged down and swept up by an Armagnac force.(2019) YT: EC - Joan of Arc 1It was a terrible storm. While the English were tired and diseased, the Armagnac were not, but wore themselves out just getting through the mud to the English. People who fell over drowned in the watery sucking mud. 6 French counts and 90 other Nobles uninstalled in 1 day. The French factions blamed the loss on each other, while the English advanced as the Burgundians put up no interference. (Why did the French have so many nobles? Lead up to their revolution.)
    1415More than half of the Jews of the crowns of Castile and Aragon had renounced Mosaic law and had been baptized, including many rabbis and important members of the community.Wiki: Expulsion Jews Spain
    1415Henry5 (England) crushes French in battle of Agincourt.(Reference Missing)He uninstalled half of French nobility, allowing Burgundians to gain power in France.
    30May1415Antipope John23 papacy ends and Fourth Interregnum begins.Wiki: List of Popes
    4Jul1415Pope Gregory12 papacy ends and Fourth Papal Interregnum begins.Wiki: List of PopesTwo-year period without a valid pope elected. The Council of Constance called on all three papal claimants to abdicate, but only Gregory12 (Roman) and John23 (Pisan) abdicated. The Council finally excommunicated Benedict13 (Avignon) and elected a new pope.
    11Nov1417Fourth Papal Interregnum ends and Pope Martin5 (MARTINVS Quintus) (Oddone Colonna, O.F.S) (Italian) papacy begins.Wiki: List of PopesHis election effectively ended the Western Schism (1378-1417). Convened the Council of Basel (1431). Initiated the Hussite Wars.

This leads the heir of Burgundy to ally with the king of England, and so did the French royal family, as their heir apparent was an uninstaller.
    24Dec1419Aldovia signs a peace treaty with Penglia, ending a brutal war between them.JN Ramble - Xmas Prince 3Christmas Prince 3 legend. Aldovia is along the eastern coast of the Adriatic Sea, reaching from Montenegro to Austria, while Penglia is approximately Romania. Another country, Belgravia, exists about where Hungary exists. Aldovians are pale Europeans while Penglians are Asian.

    20Feb1431Pope Martin5 papacy ends and Pope Eugene4 (EVGENIVS Quartus) (Gabriele Condulmer, O.S.A) (Italian) papacy begins 11 days later.Wiki: List of PopesMember of the Augustinian Order. Nephew of Gregory12. Transferred the Council of Basel to Ferrara. It was later transferred again, to Florence, because of the Bubonic plague. Issued the bull Creator Omnium [Creator of all], rescinding any recognition of Portugal's right to conquer the Canary Islands, as they were still pagan. He excommunicated anyone who enslaved newly converted Christians, the penalty to stand until the captives were restored to their liberty and possessions.

But most were Armagnac and supported Charles8 as Dauphin, but it was close to Burgundian territory and frequently raided.
    1432Jews in Spain get legal sanction (permission) from the Crown of Castille to practice their religionWiki: Expulsion Jews SpainAfter the critical period of 1391-1415, the pressure on Jews to recuperate their confiscated synagogues and books had decreased, and they were then able to avoid certain obligations such as carrying the red ribbon or attending friars' sermons. Thanks to agreements reached by the procurators (appointed Roman officials) of the aljamas (self-governing communities of Jews or of Moors living in Spain under Spanish rule during the middle ages), gathered in Valladolid (NW Spain), and were able to reconstruct the internal organization of the aljamas.

    1443장헌 (莊憲) [Jangheon] personally created the Hangul writing system.Wiki: HangulA popular saying about the alphabet is "A wise (person) can acquaint (them)self with (the alphabet) before the morning is over; even a (simple person) can learn (the alphabet) in the space of ten days." Before this, Koreans used Classical Chinese alongside their own ancient writing systems, including Idu script, Hyangchal, Gugyeol and Gakpil - a complicated system which caused high illiteracy.

    24Mar1455Pope Nicholas5 papacy ends and Pope Callixtus3 (CALLISTVS Tertius) (Alfonso de Borja) (Valencia) papacy begins 15 days later.Wiki: List of PopesThe first Valencian pope. Ordered the Feast of the Transfiguration to be celebrated on 6 August. Ordered the retrial of Joan of Arc, in which she was vindicated. Initiated the custom that bells be rung at midday to remind the faithful to pray for the crusaders. The tradition of the Angelus [angel] noon bell still exists in most Catholic temples to this day. Appointed two nephews as cardinals, one of whom became Pope Alexander6.

    26Jul1471Pope Paul2 papacy ends and Pope Sixtus4 (XYSTVS Quartus) (Francesco della Rovere, O.F.M) (Italian) papacy begins 14 days later.Wiki: List of PopesCommissioned the Sistine Chapel and created the Vatican Archives. Authorized the Spanish Inquisition targeting converted Jewish Christians in Spain at the request of the Catholic Monarchs of Spain. A patron of the arts, he brought together the group of artists who ushered the Early Renaissance into Rome with the first masterpieces of the city's new artistic age. Noted for his nepotism and involved in the Pazzi conspiracy.

    1488Hammer of the Witches written(2020) YT: RE - LiechtensteinThis leads to thousands of witch hunts on several continents.
    1490A letter sent by the Catholic Monarchs to the Council of Bilbao.Wiki: Expulsion Jews SpainThis letter stated that - under canon law (Vatican City's Policies and Procedures) - and the laws of the kingdoms, Jews were tolerated and allowed to live in the kingdoms as subjects and vassals. In Christian kingdoms, according to Henry Kamen, both Jews and Muslims were treated with contempt and the three communities lived separate existences. In Muslim kingdoms, on the other hand, Christians and Jews were required to pay a tax in order to profess their religion.
    1491Henry8 installs (England)(2015) YT: PTA - Evol Firearms
    2Jan1492The Catholic Monarchs conquered the Nasrid Kingdom of Granada.Wiki: Expulsion Jews SpainThe last Muslim king, Muhammad12 of Granada (Spanish: Boabdil), withdrew to Alpujarras, as almost 800 years of Muslim rule were ended by the Reconquista.
    1492Alhambra Decree begins the Jewish expulsion from Spain.Wiki: Expulsion Jews Spain

    As a result of the Alhambra decree and the prior persecution, and in order to eliminate their influence on Spain's large convert population and to ensure its members did not revert to Judaism, over 200k Jews converted to Catholicism and between 40k and 100k were expelled from Spain.

    The number of Jews in the Crown of Aragon was reduced to 1/4 its previous number. The famous Jewish community of Gerona, for example, was left with only 24 families. In the Crown of Castile, there were less than 80k.

    25Jul1492Pope Innocent8 papacy ends and Pope Alexander6 (ALEXANDER Sextus) (Roderic Llançol i de Borja) (Spanish-Valencian) papacy begins 17 days later.Wiki: List of PopesNephew of Callixtus3; father to Cesare and Lucrezia Borgia. Considered one of the most controversial of the Renaissance popes, partly because he acknowledged fathering several children by his mistresses. As a result, his Italianized Valencian surname, Borgia, became a byword for libertinism and nepotism, which are traditionally considered as characterizing his pontificate.
    Sep1492Columbus first voyage starts crossing the Atlantic.(2017) YT: LEMMiNO - Bermuda Triangle(This was his passion project, his life's work. Why didn't they go in, like, March or April? Why wait for September? Because the ocean is like a desert with its life underground. Spring is too cold and summer is too hot, but fall is just right.)
    1492Christopher Columbus (Italy) leaves Spain heading West.(2021) YT: GH - CircumnavigationHe was looking for a western route to the Indian subcontinent and their extremely valuable spices, to compete with Portugal's route south of Africa. He found the Americas.
    15Sep1492Columbus records:(2020) YT: VOTP - ColumbusAnd on this night, they saw a marvelous branch of fire fall from the sky.
    17Sep1492Columbus records:(2020) YT: VOTP - ColumbusThe pilots took the north, and found their compasses northwested a full point (11.25 degrees); and the sailors were fearful and depressed and did not say why.
    17Sep1492Columbus records seeing a strange light.(2017) YT: LEMMiNO - Bermuda TriangleHe described it as like a small wax candle that rose and lifted up, which to few seemed to be an indication of land. The Pinta had already found land, and a few hours later, a crewman on this ship (the Santa Maria? The Nina was recorded as being slower than the Pinta and "the Admiral".) saw land. While technically within the Bermuda Triangle.
    Oct1492Columbus first voyage completes crossing the Atlantic.(2017) YT: LEMMiNO - Bermuda Triangle
    1492Kalinago micropower members were misnamed Carib [brave warrior] by Christopher Columbus, leading to the island chain being called the Caribbean Islands.Wiki: Kalinago
    1493Columbus finds several islands, naming the first San Salvador [Our Savior], noting the natives call it "Guanahani".(2020) YT: VOTP - Columbus
    • He named the next Santa Maria, Isabella, Fernandina, Arena Island, and finally Johana (Cuba) and Hispaniola (Named it "Spain-ia" or "Hispana-YOLO").
    • He found no cities or houses, only a few villages and farms whose inhabitants fled as soon as they saw Columbus and crew - parents would abandon their children, and children their parents.
    • He thought Cuba was part of the continent at first, and after examining his records of traveling 322 miles (534 km) from west-to-east along it, believes it's larger than the British Isles. (He was correct about this measurement - The United Kingdom extends about 965 km (600 mi) N-S and about 485 km (300 mi) E-W.)
    • He thought Hispaniola (area 75.1k km2, 29k mi2, 7.5 MHectares, 18.6 MAcres) was larger than all of Spain (area 505k km2, 195k mi2, 50.5 MHectares, 124.8 MAcres). (He was incorrect about this one.)
    • He left some men behind on Haiti to found Town of the Nativity.
    • He found numerous new plants and birds, all flourishing in winter as though it were May.
    • He found Hispaniola breathtaking, with more rivers than he could believe.
    • Also it was like a nudist colony, and iron was foreign, but gold was plentiful - natives paid for leather straps with an equal weight of gold.
    • Plates were like jewelry.
    • Columbus forbade trading to prevent taking all their gold, but was hopeful to make them into Portugese subjects and/or Catholics.
    • The natives believed everything good came "from heaven", including Columbus - they shouted to each other "Come, come, see the men from heaven!"
    1493Inca king Túpac Inca Yupanqui (Tópa Inca) reign ends and king Huayná Cápac reign begins.VanDiverInca: Inca EmpireHe was the last Inca Emperor who ruled before the Arrival of the Spaniards.
    19Aug1493HREmperor Frederick3 the Peaceful reign ends.Wiki: HRE
    1493Pope Alexander6 issues the bull Inter caetera [Among other things], dividing the extra-European world between Spain and Portugal.Wiki: List of PopesDraw a line from pole to pole through the Azores. Everything on the European side was Portugal's. And everything on the other side was Spain's (or more specifically, personal property of Catholic Monarchs Ferdinand2 of Aragon and Isabella1 of Castile).
    1494Spain and Portugal split the undiscovered Earth along the Tordesillas Meridian.(2021) YT: GH - CircumnavigationThis was slightly west of the line drawn by Pope Alexander6 in the Inter caetera.

    1500The American Bottom region near St Louis begins to repopulate.(2022) YT: AA - Cahokia
    1500sGunsmiths introduce wheel-lock ignition, using flint like a lighter.(2015) YT: PTA - Evol FirearmsOrigins unclear, and while Leonardo da Vinci made many drawings, a Nuremberg clockmaker is more likely. This used a wind-up key to add tension to the steel wheel, which was released by a trigger, against flint. Guards were more stealthy without the burning match, but devices were expensive and hard to keep working. German gunsmiths, seeking new markets and bulk military orders, rework the design into the Snaphorn, where a flint arm fly forward and strike a steel pan, full of gunpowder.
    1500sHorses introduced into North America.130 (2019) YT: HP - Wounded KneeSioux and other micropowers were hunting bison on foot.
    1500sSpanish and Portuguese explorers bring both bitter and sweet oranges to the Americas.Harvest To Table - Orange Types
    1500sVatican City's priests went to Mexico with the first Spanish conquistadores.LATimes - Mexico Vatican tiesVatican City's religion was quickly taught to citizens of the conquered nations. Since then, Vatican City's priests sided politically with conservatives throughout Mexico’s colonial history, becoming the richest institution in the country and the biggest landowner.
    1500sBlackboards were used for music education and composition in Europe.Wiki: Blackboard
    1500sThe printing press invented.(2016) YT: LF - Portugese
    1500sBajorans begin exploring their home solar system.(2015) YT: Trekspertise - Borg HistoryStar Trek legend
    1500sMechanical clocks can accurately measure small quantities of time.Antiquitatem.com: Hour's dividersThis pushes the temporal concepts of "minutes" and "seconds" into popular culture.
    1500sGalician and Portugese languages diverge.(2016) YT: LF - PortugeseThe two languages remain highly intelligible to this day. This helped standardize European languages, including Portugese. Portugal had already started to colonize the world, bringing their language with them.
    1501Martin Luther studies law and hates it.(2015) YT: CC - Martin LutherOne day, he's struck by lightning, and he cries "Help me, Saint Anne, I'll become a monk!" He survived, and within 2 weeks he'd unenrolled from college, taken vows as a monk, and written his family to tell them.

    Vatican City's temples in Middle Ages:

    • Caretaker of human souls (eternal)
    • Parish priest was central to every aspect of life: baptizing, marrying, confessions, last rights, etc.
    • All social services: alms to the poor, orphanages, education.
    • Owned 1/3 of all land in Europe.
    • Claimed authority over all kings of Europe.
    18Aug1503Pope Alexander6 papacy ends and Pope Pius3 (PIVS Tertius) (Francesco Todeschini Piccolomini) (Italian) papacy begins 35 days later.Wiki: List of PopesNephew of Pius2. Founded the Piccolomini Library in the Siena Cathedral.
    18Oct1503Pope Pius3 papacy ends and Pope Julius2 (IVLIVS Secundus) (Giuliano della Rovere, O.F.M) (Italian) papacy begins 13 days later.Wiki: List of PopesNicknamed the 'Warrior Pope' or the 'Fearsome Pope'. Nephew of Sixtus4; convened the Fifth Council of the Lateran (1512). Took control of all the Papal States for the first time. Became Pope in the context of the Italian Wars, a period in which the major powers of Europe fought for primacy in the Italian peninsula. Established the Vatican Museums and initiated the rebuilding of the St Peter's Basilica. The same year he organized the famous Swiss Guards for his personal protection and commanded a successful campaign in Romagna against local lords. The interests of Julius2 lay also in the New World as he ratified the Treaty of Tordesillas, establishing the first bishoprics in the Americas and beginning the catholicization of Latin America. Julius2 was described by Machiavelli in his works as the ideal prince. Pope Julius2 allowed people seeking indulgences to donate money to the temple which would be used for the construction of Saint Peter's Basilica.
    15042nd Italian War ends.(2020) YT: FOL - French Docu
    1505Emperor Hóngzhì reign ends and Zhèngdé reign begins.Wiki: Chinese monarchs
    1505Martin Luther is sent to Rome on a diplomatic mission.(2015) YT: CC - Martin LutherInstead of admiring all of the art and architecture and history, he focused on the corruption: dirty streets with open prostitution, priests hurrying through ceremonies, and preists openly disobeying the doctrines they were just teaching in the ceremonies. Luther was obsessed with his own sinfulness, and kept confessing, so his confessor/teacher sent him to the University of Wittenberg. While teaching there, he found the writings of Paul the Apostle - who wrote that no matter how much someone did, no actions alone could guarantee the positive outcome in Vatican City's religion, and that merely wanting it badly enough was enough to guarantee it. In Latin, "sola fide" [only faith]. Johann Tetzel later visited Wittenberg to sell indulgences for 3 marks, or a year's wages. Martin Luther felt these should not be for sale.
    1506Joseon 연산군 (燕山君) [Yeonsangun] reign ends and 공희 (恭僖) [Gonghui] reign begins.Wiki: Korean Monarchs
    15083rd Italian War starts.(2020) YT: FOL - French Docu
    1508Pope Julius2 commissioned the Raphael Rooms and Michelangelo's paintings in the Sistine Chapel.Wiki: List of Popes
    4Feb1508HREmperor Maximilian1 crowned.Wiki: HREPope Julius2 allowed Maximilian1 to use the title of Emperor without coronation in Rome, though the title was qualified as Electus Romanorum Imperator (elected Emperor of the Romans). The Emperor was crowned in a special ceremony, traditionally performed by the Pope in Rome. Without that coronation, no king, despite exercising all powers, could call himself Emperor. Maximilian's successors adopted the same titulature, usually when they became the sole ruler of the Holy Roman Empire. Maximilian's first successor Charles5 was the last to be crowned Emperor by the Pope in Rome.
    21Apr1509Rex Anglie [King of the English] Henry7 reign ends and Henry8 reign begins 1 day later.Wiki: English monarchsMarried to
    1. Catherine of Aragon, Greenwich, 11 June 1509, 1 daughter
    2. Anne Boleyn, Westminster Palace, 25 January 1533, 1 daughter
    3. Jane Seymour, Whitehall Palace, 30 May 1536, 1 son
    4. 3 further marriages, no more children.
    Son of Henry7 and Elizabeth of York
    1509Henry8 marries Catherine of Aragon.(2022) YT: History - Henry8's Fave PieThey had a daughter who would become Mary1 (England).
    1511Magellan buys slave Henrique in Malacca as a translator.(2021) YT: GH - CircumnavigationHenrique's origins are unknown. He would be taken to Europe with Magellan.
    25Apr1512Sultan Bayezid2 reign ends and Selim1 YAVUZ (The Strong) Hadim'ul Haramain'ish-Sharifain (Servant of Meccah and Medina) reign begins.Wiki: List of Ottoman sultansConquered Mamluks in 1516-1517. First Ottoman Caliph; Son of Bayezid2 and Gülbahar Hatun.
    21Feb1513Pope Julius2 papacy ends and Pope Leo10 (LEO Decimus) (Giovanni di Lorenzo de' Medici) (Italian) papacy begins 16 days later.Wiki: List of PopesSon of Lorenzo the Magnificent. Closed the Fifth Council of the Lateran. Remembered for granting indulgences to those who donated to rebuild St Peter's Basilica. Extended the Spanish Inquisition into Portugal. Borrowed and spent money without circumspection and was a significant patron of the arts. Under his papacy, progress was made on the rebuilding of St Peter's Basilica and artists such as Raphael decorated the Vatican rooms. Leo also reorganised the Roman University, and promoted the study of literature, poetry and antiquities. The last pope to not have been in priestly orders at the time of his election to the papacy.

Portugal's king asks why, since he already controls the route around Africa, and doesn't agree.

    1517Martin Luther publishes his 95 Theses.(2015) YT: CC - Martin LutherThese were printed on a printing press, a new technology for the time.
    • Rituals didn't have power to save souls.
    • Pope and temple make errors all the time.
    • Denied temple and officers have any powers.
    • Priesthood is a social construct.
    • Christians don't need priests, but instead there's a priesthood of all believers.
    • Temple congregations should elect their priest, instead of being assigned one.
    • Skip some stuff...and the Pope is the Antichrist.
    1517Magellan (Spain), a veteran Portugese ship pilot, asks the Spanish king Charles5 to fund a trip to the Indian subcontinent by going south of the new American continents.(2021) YT: GH - CircumnavigationCharles is eager to get some of the spice trade riches. Portugal's king wants to prevent this at all costs, to protect his income stream, and puts out basically arrest warrants for Magellan and crews.

    20Sep1519Magellan leaves Sanlúcar, Spain with 239 crew split across 5 ships.(2021) YT: GH - CircumnavigationThis put 48 on each ship. Magellan brought his involuntary translator, Henrique de Malacca.
    8Nov1519Cortés (Spain) Meets Montezuma (Aztec)(2019) YT: VotP - Cortés MontezumaMontezuma tells their history - they were vassals of a foreign lord, who arrived on ships to establish a colony. (Was it Abukari2 from Mali?) But the lord didn't return for so long that his colony intermarried with the native micropowers, and had children, so they wouldn't recognize him as their ruler, nor leave with him. And they see a foreign lord as their true soverign. So they took Cortés as the representative of that soverign, and basically gave the city to him. (What motivated Montezuma to supplicate so hard?)

    Mar1520Magellan's expedition winters in a place along the Brasilian coast he names Puerto San Julian.(2021) YT: GH - Circumnavigation(It must have been rough, sailing out through winter only to arrive at the start of winter.) Within a month, the 5 ship captains mutinied, considering the expedition a failure and wanting to go back to Spain. Magellan violently suppreses the rebellion. (About 230 crew across 5 ships is 46 each.)
    May1520Magellan sends one of his 5 ships south to explore, but it sinks.(2021) YT: GH - Circumnavigation (The ship seems to have been lightly crewed, with maybe 20. About 210 crew across 4 remaining ships is 52 or 53 each.)
    Aug1520Magellan's expedition sets off again after the winter break.(2021) YT: GH - CircumnavigationThey find another bay and resupply there. (About 210 crew across 4 remaining ships is 47 each.)

    21Oct1520Magellan's expedition reaches a strait that he calls the strait of All Saints.(2021) YT: GH - CircumnavigationAll Saints Day happened while they were in the strait, likely when the very religious Magellan named it, and it would later be renamed after him. He saw lit fires on the land to the south of the strait, so he named it Tierra del Fuego [Land of Fire]. (About 210 crew across 4 remaining ships is 47 each.)
    Nov1520Magellan's expedition came to a fork in the strait at Dawson Island.(2021) YT: GH - CircumnavigationMagellan has 2 ships go left/west and 2 ships (including him) go east/right. After nightfall, Captain Estevao Gomes (one of the left/west ships) takes this opportunity to turn around and head back for Spain. Gomes accuses Magellan of treason, but gets jailed for this. The Magellan family members still in Spain are put under extra scrutiny until he returns. (About 188 crew across 3 remaining ships is 62.7 each.)
    28Nov1520Magellan's expedition has reunited with the other left/west heading ship, and all 3 exit the strait into a large sea.(2021) YT: GH - CircumnavigationThey quickly head deep into it, arcing north to head northwest. (About 188 crew across 3 remaining ships is 62.7 each.)
