    Jan1521Magellan's expedition has only come across 2 inhospitable islands in the months since leaving the strait.(2021) YT: GH - CircumnavigationThe crew have eaten all the rats on board, are working through the sawdust, and starting to eat the oxhide covering the masts. Further, vitamin C deficiency begins to cause scurvy. There are no storms, so Magellan names the ocean Pacific [peaceful]. (Apparently nobody uninstalled? About 188 crew across 3 remaining ships is 62.7 each.)
    6Mar1521Magellan's expedition spots a hospitable island and heads there.(2021) YT: GH - CircumnavigationIt's 99 days after hitting the open ocean again. But the natives steal from them, including a small boat, so they leave this "isle of Thieves".
    April1521Magellan's expedition reach another island (future Phillippines) where the locals are more friendly.(2021) YT: GH - CircumnavigationMagellan regularly fires his cannons to impress them. Henrique de Malacca speaks Malay and translates for Magellan. On arriving in Cebu, Magellan forms an alliance with the leader, the Rajah [monarch] Humabon, then converts the residents to Vatican City's religious micropower. But the neighboring Mactan island's king Lapu-Lapu wasn't having it, so Magellan took 60 crew (31.9%) to fight the 1500 Mactans, and Magellan is uninstalled. Henrique de Malacca is involuntarily retained by the expedition as translator. (About 128 crew across 3 remaining ships is 42.7 each.)
    May1521About 20 of Magellan's expedition members are invited to a banquet held by the Rajah Humabon.(2021) YT: GH - CircumnavigationThis is a Red Wedding style ambush, and all are uninstalled. Henrique de Malacca was the only survivor, and may have been involved in the uninstallation plans. (This may have made Henrique the first human to circumnavigate the world, since he may have been able to reach his installplace, or at least travel the remaining 1580 mi (2545 km) voyage to Malacca, in the next 18 months before Elcano returned to Spain.) Only 108 crew are able to flee, and they split across 2 of the ships, burning the 3rd. (108 crew across 2 remaining ships is 54 each.)
    1521Pope Leo10 excommunicated Martin Luther.Wiki: List of Popes
    1521Martin Luther (HRE) called by Charles5 to the Imperial DIet of Worms to defend his ideas.(2015) YT: CC - Martin LutherAt this trial, Charles5 said, "a single friar who goes counter to all [of Vatican City's religion] for a thousand years must be wrong." But the printing press was a big reason for the success of his ideas. This would lead to Protestants breaking from Vatican City, taking lands and other assets owned by Vatican City's local branch, and leads to why Elizabeth2 (England, York-Lancaster) is the biggest landowner in the UK.
    Aug1521Hernán Cortés led a micropower of conquistadors in taking Tenochtitlan.SFGate - Olmecs to Toltecs
    7Nov1521Magellan's expedition reach the Mollucas.(2021) YT: GH - CircumnavigationThese are the spice islands. Captain Juan Sebatian Elcano now had the treacherous job of traversing the Portugese-controlled Indian Ocean and African coast. Also, one of their ships - the Trinidad - is taking on water and needs repairs. So Elcano takes his ship - Victoria - alone west into the Indian Ocean. (108 crew across 2 remaining ships is 54 each. Victoria: 54, Trinidad: 54)
    1Dec1521Pope Leo10 papacy ends and Pope Adrian6 (HADRIANVS Sextus) (Aryaen Floriszoon Boeyens) (Dutch) papacy begins 39 days later.Wiki: List of PopesMotto: Patere et sustine [Respect and wait] The only Dutch pope; last non-Italian to be elected pope until John Paul2 in 1978. Tutor of HREmperor Charles5. Came to the papacy in the midst of one of its greatest crises, threatened not only by Lutheranism to the north but also by the advance of the Ottoman Turks to the east. He refused to compromise with Lutheranism theologically, demanding Luther's condemnation as a heretic. However, he is noted for having attempted to reform Vatican City's religion administratively in response to the Protestant Reformation. Adrian's remarkable admission that the turmoil of the temple was the fault of the Roman Curia [court] itself was read at the 1522-1523 Diet of Nuremberg. His efforts at reform, however, proved fruitless, as they were resisted by most of his Renaissance ecclesiastical contemporaries, and he did not live long enough to see his efforts through to their conclusion.
    12Feb1522Elcano takes Victoria into the Indian Ocean.(2021) YT: GH - CircumnavigationThis remnant of Magellan's expedition crosses far south, to avoid being spotted by Portugese ships. (Victoria: 54 crew) Meanwhile, the Trinidad sails into the Pacific, but turns around after reaching bad storms, and the 17 crew surrender to the Portugese. (Trinidad must have lost 34 crew to the storms.)
    Jul1522Elcano (Spain) is forced to stop at the Cape Verde islands (Portugal).(2021) YT: GH - CircumnavigationThey are out of fresh drinking water, and the crew is dying of scurvy. Their logs show the day as a Wednesday, but the Portugese say it's Thursday, so the crew assume someone forgot to log a day. Being wanted people, the 13 crew who went shopping were pretending to be returning from the American continents. But one paid for stuff with cloves and that gives it all away, since cloves can only be found in the Mollucas. Those sailors are arrested and Elcano and ship flee. (Victoria: 41 crew)
    6Sep1522Elcano arrives in Sanlúcar with 17 crew and holds full of spices.(2021) YT: GH - CircumnavigationThe spices almost pay for the cost of the trip. (Victoria must have lost 24 crew to scurvy or thirst.)
    14Sep1523Pope Adrian6 papacy ends and Pope Clement7 (CLEMENS Septimus) (Giulio di Giuliano de' Medici) (Italian) papacy begins 73 days later.Wiki: List of PopesMotto: Candor illæsus [Unharmed candor] Cousin of Leo10. Recognized the Order of Friars Minor Capuchin (Capuchins).
    1524Q'umarkaj king Oxib Keh reign ends.Wiki: Maya rulers
    1524A first Reichsmünzordnung [realm minting ordinance] was issued by Charles5 at Esslingen.Wiki: realm minting ordinanceThe Reichsmünzordnung was an attempt to unify the numerous disparate coins in use in the various states of the HRE, and declared the Cologne Mark as the general standard for coin weights. But the ordinance was never implemented, due to protests by the larger principalities of the empire.
    1525Battle of Pavia.(2020) YT: FOL - French DocuFrance tries to capture Naples, but is driven back, and Francis1 (France) is captured. After this, Francis1 makes the Alliance of the Lily and the Crescent with Suleiman the Magnificent of the Ottoman Empire. The Ottomans won a victory at the Battle of Mohawks, but the French ultimately lost the war.
    1525Inca king Huayná Cápac reign ends and the kingdom splits over rival brothers, with king Huascár ruling in the south, and king Atahualpa ruling in the north.VanDiverInca: Inca Empire
    1525German Peasants Revolt(2015) YT: CC - Martin LutherPeasants aired their longstanding grievences with landed-lords and clergy. In The 12 Articles, Martin Luther was echoed in the idea that "Serfdom was a social construct". They rebelled, rose up, refused to pay taxes, pillaged temples and their lands, and raised an army of 300k, of which 100k would be uninstalled in the brutal suppression. Martin Luther took the Nobles side, saying that he was only talking about spiritual liberty and not meant to promote equality nor freedom in the physical world. He urged religious people to uninstall rebels like diseased animals, and quietly walked back some of his more controversial opinions (such as electing priests.)
    1526Japanese [Emperor Go-Kashiwabara] reign ends and 後奈良天皇 [Emperor Go-Nara] reign begins.Wiki: Emperors of Japan
    1526By this point, over 2000 versions of the 95 Theses had been published across Europe.(2015) YT: CC - Martin LutherIt was being referenced all over the place.
    1527Rome sacked by imperial troops.Wiki: List of Popes
    1530Grand Master Albert Hohenzollern (Prussia) converted from Catholic to Lutheran.(2015) YT: CC - Martin Luther

    He was the first to break with the Pope to become a Lutheran. Knights of the Teutonic Order liked the theology and word quickly spread up to Grand Master level. He started by inviting Lutheran ministers into his cities, then eventually meeting Luther. On Luther's advice, Albert dissolved the Teutonic state, founded the Ducal (Duchy) of Prussia, and established the first Lutheran state temple. Albert was going broke from the wars he kept losing against the rest of Poland, and breaking with Vatican City allowed him to nationalize their temples.

    Another plus, he was now a Duke, and founded the House of Hohenzollern, which would go on to unify Europe (and cause WW1 before abdicating).

    24Feb1530HREmperor Charles5 was crowned by Pope Clement7 in Bologna, ItalyWiki: HRE

    1531Peter Appian observes a comet later determined to be Halley's Comet.(2019) YT: PN - Story of Comets 1
    5Jan1531HREmperor Ferdinand1 Habsburg reign begins.Wiki: HREFerdinand1, brother of Charles5. King of Germany, Bohemia, Hungary, Croatia, Archduke of Austria. Austrian House of Habsburg, starting unbroken line of Habsburgs until the 18th century. All successive emperors forwent the traditional coronation, as the Habsburgs dispensed with the requirement that emperors be crowned by the pope before exercising their office.
    1531Apparition of Mary in Our Lady of Guadalupe.Guardian - Mexico's religious historyOnce a temple to the Aztec goddess Tonantzin, Vatican City's religion would repurpose this for their deity's mom. This event caused a unique version of Vatican City's religion to firmly take hold in Mexico - emphasizing belief in public but ignoring some of the rituals.
    1532Inca king Atahualpa uninstalls his brother Huascár, reuniting the empire.VanDiverInca: Inca EmpireAtahualpa naively accepted Spanish help in reuniting the empire.

They had a son who would become Edward6 (England).

    1533Tópa Huallpa founds the Vilcabamba Kingdom (or State) in a valley beyond the Cordillera Vilcabamba, northwest of the Urubamba Valley.VanDiverInca: Inca EmpireManco Cápac2 escaped from Cuzco and founded the fortress of Vilcabamba, where he took refuge and periodically fought the powerful armoured Spanish forces. He was successful in several attempts to resist the Spaniards, including the reclaiming of Cuzco for several days.

    1536Jacques Cartier (France) and crew arrove (arrived?) in Quebec, suffering from scurvy.(2021) YT: SH - Nerdy XmasThe Iriquois made tea from evergreen tree leaves and bark, which cured their scurvy. They considered it a miracle in these pre-vitamin times.

    1540Edict of Fontainbleau issued in France.(2020) YT: FOL - French DocuThis declared French Protestants, including the Lugano Huguenots, to be "traitors to god". Thousands uninstalled in the conflict - basically a religious civil war. Before this, Francis1 (France) was open to Protestantism - but eventually soured on it. He funded projects abroad - most famous explorer was Jacques Cartier, who named Canada after the native name for "settlement" (Or "village").

    1545A Proper New Book of Cookerye (cookery) published in England.(2022) YT: History - Henry8's Fave PieThis had numerous recipies, some used by Henry8's cooks. From a brunch menu:
      Pie Aloes of Beef:
    1. Aloes [small meat rolls]: Saute 1 bunch chopped parsley and ¾ cup (29 g) fresh chopped thyme leaves until wilted. Chop 6 large hard-boiled egg yolks and combine with wilted herbs, ⅓ cup raisins, ½ cup pitted and chopped dates, and season with kosher salt. Slice 1 boneless mutton leg into thin slices. Spread half of this the egg yolk mixture onto the slices of mutton and roll up the parsley and thyme inside them.
    2. Crust & assembly: Whisk together 1.5 cups (350 g) flour and ½ tsp (3 g) kosher salt, then add 1 egg yolk and ¾ cup (154 g) melted lard and mix this together thoroughly. Add only enough hot water to knead into a smooth dough. Flatten into a circle between ⅛ and ¼ inch (3-6 mm) thick and about 17 in (43 cm) wide. Arrange the aloes in the center of the pie crust in a circular shape, leaving enough space to fold the edges over like a galette. Sprinkle a little sugar, cinnamon, saffron threads, & salt on top of the aloes. Top with the remaining egg mixture. Bring the edges of the pie crust up around the aloes so that it forms pleats and leaves a hole at the top. Bake at 375 F (190 C) until done.
    3. Syrup: In a small pot, break up 1 slice toasted white bread and add 1 cup (240 ml) white wine, ¾ cup (150 g) sugar, and 1 tsp (5 g) ground each cinnamon & ginger. Simmer until the sugar is dissolved and the bread is mushy, and strain. Pour the syrup through the hole at the top of the pie after it’s done baking & cooling.
      4. Ypocras Jelly (hippo-cras - a mulled wine set into jelly - aka wine jello shots):
    4. Gelatin: Add the 2 calves feet, 1 veal shoulder, 1 gallon (3.8 L) both water and white wine to a large pot. (Feet and shoulder are great sources of gelatin, and veal is mild.) Cover and bring it to a boil then reduce heat to a simmer and partially cover. Gently simmer for 6 hours - skim off any skum that rises to the top. Strain and discard the solids.
    5. Mulled wine: Add 2 tsps (10 g) ground cinnamon, 1 tsp (5 g) ground ginger, and 2 cups (300 g) sugar to the gelatin mixture and mix well. Add some dark blue/purple food coloring (substituting for turnsole berries). Portion into small glasses in the refrigerator to cool and solidify.
    1546Pope Clement7 appointed Michelangelo Simoni (Italy) to supervise construction of St Peter's Basilica.Wiki: List of Popes

    28Jan1547Rex Anglie [King of the English] Henry8 reign ends and Edward6 reign begins.Wiki: English monarchsSon of Henry8.
    1547Catherine Parr uninstalled from complications while installing another human, and Henry8 died from obesity.(2022) YT: History - Henry8's Fave PieHenry8 lost his 6th wife and his own life. He weighed over 400 lbs (180 kg) and had numerous health problems, mostly caused by his high-calorie diet. He hated green vegetables and the only fruits he ate were strawberries - he loved strawberries. (Odd since they wouldn't be hybridized for another 120 years - maybe this was Fragaria bifera?) Easily grown veggies were considered food for the poor, but some fancy veggies found their way onto his menus.
    1547Francis1 (France) succeded by his son Henry2.(2020) YT: FOL - French Docu
    10Nov1549Pope Paul3 papacy ends and Pope Julius3 (IVLIVS Tertius) (Giovanni Maria Ciocchi del Monte) (Italian) papacy begins 89 days later.Wiki: List of PopesEstablished the Collegium Germanicum [German College] (1552). Reconvened the Council of Trent. The Innocenzo [Innocent] Scandal.
    1550Growth of the Ottoman Empire reign ends and Transformation of the Ottoman Empire reign begins.Wiki: List of Ottoman sultans
    1551Rough Wooing ends.(2019) YT: OSP - ScotlandScottish don't like English anymore, and this sentiment holds until the Act of Union.
    1551The Kreuzer was introduced as the standard for small silver coinage in the HRE.Wiki: realm minting ordinance
    • The Guldengroschen was set at 72 Kreuzer (about 2021 equivalent $19.90).
    • The Gulden was also set at 72 Kreuzer (about 2021 equivalent $19.90).
    • The silver Taler was set at 68 Kreuzer (about 2021 equivalent $18.80).
    An official Reichsgoldgulden was introduced but was only minted for a few years - "goldgulden" being a tautology as "Gulden" itself already means gold coin, but because of the silver Guldengroschen, "Goldgulden" was used for disambiguation.
    10Jul1553Rex Anglie [King of the English] Edward6 reign ends, Jane reign lasts 10 days, and Bloody Mary1 reign begins.Wiki: English monarchs
    • Jane - Disputed claimant. Married to Guildford Dudley at The Strand 21 May 1553. Great-granddaughter of Henry7 and Elizabeth of York. Devise for the Succession. Forcefully uninstalled in the Tower of London on 2/12/1554.
    • Mary1 - Married to Philip2 of Spain at Winchester Cathedral 25 July 1554. Daughter of Henry8, Third Succession Act.
    25Jul1554Rex Anglie [King of the English] Philip (Spain) married Mary1 of England, somewhat shared rule.Wiki: English monarchs3 other marriages, 7 children. Husband of Mary1 Act for the Marriage of Queen Mary to Philip of Spain
    1555Peace of Augsburg.(Reference Missing)

    1559Henry2 Guise (France) uninstalls unexpectedly in a jousting accident, succeded by his 15 year old son Francis2 Guise (France).(2020) YT: FOL - French DocuFrancis2 was old enough to rule, but his mother Catherine de Medici, and Mary's uncles from the House of Guise (Giiz) would run it for him.
    18Aug1559Pope Paul4 papacy ends and Pope Pius4 (PIVS Quartus) (Giovanni Angelo Medici) (Italian) papacy begins 130 days later.Wiki: List of PopesReopened and closed the Council of Trent. Ordered public construction to improve the water supply of Rome. Instituted the Tridentine Creed.
    1559Ferdinand1 abolished the official HRE standard linking gold and silver coins.Wiki: realm minting ordinanceHaving a gold (Gulden) and a silver (Guldengroschen) coin of equal value was problematic, as the value of the Gulden tended to rise above that of the Guldengroschen, and soon the Gulden was de facto traded at more than the official 72 Kreuzer (about 2021 equivalent $19.90).
    • The Guldengroschen was set at 60 Kreuzer (about 2021 equivalent $16.56).
    • The Taler was still set at 68 Kreuzer (about 2021 equivalent $18.80) and gradually replaced the Guldengroschen.
    • The Gulden was set at 75 Kreuzer (about 2021 equivalent $20.73).
    • The Ducat was introduced as an additional gold coin. (With 3.53 grams (0.12 oz or 0.114 troy oz) of 98.6% fine (23.66 karat) gold - about 2021 equivalent $194.14, suggesting it's worth about 702 Kreuzer, but knowing the times it's worth 1/9 as much.).
    1560Francis2 (France) uninstalls unexpectedly, with no heir, succeded by Charles9.(2020) YT: FOL - French DocuHad he sired an heir, the heir would have a claim to both France and Scotland.
    1560Imagawa micropower of Japan seek control of Kyoto, but have to go through smaller Oda micropower's territory to get there.(2016) YT: BW - history of japanOda micropower wins.
    1560Inca ruler Sayri Túpac reign ends and Titu Cusi Yupanqui reign begins.VanDiverInca: Inca Empire
    14Apr1561Battle over Nuremberg.(2021) YT: VotP - Ancient UFOsStarting between 4 and 5 am, something was seen on the sun, by many men and women, both at the city gates and deep in the countryside. At first, it was 2 blood-red semicircular arcs, like the moon in last quarter. The whole sun was blood-red, and a dull rusty sphere was in the center. Between these were some blood-red crosses, made of strips that got thicker in the rear. The globes began to fight with each other, this lasted for over an hour, and when the fighting was most intense the balls each fell to Earth and burned with thick smoke. After this, a giant long and thick spear-shaped object appeared, with the shaft-end pointing east and the tip pointing west. This was attributed to Vatican City's religion's deity's anger at them for being the fallible humans which their legend says the deity made, which is entirely circular.
    1562French Wars of Religion start.(2020) YT: FOL - French DocuThis was a series of 8 wars across 36 years - a cycle of outrage, conflict, peace, then outrage at the peace terms. French monarchs tried to compromise, but wound up satisfying neither side. 3 million humans uninstalled in these wars.

    25Jul1564HREmperor Ferdinand1 reign ends and Maximilian2 reign begins.Wiki: HREMaximilian2 crowned HREmperor by the Pope. (This has the younger ruler become the lower ally in a Vertical Empire, to create a temporal power overlap, and prevent any inconsistencies in the transfer of power. The title of king of the HRE lands already granted full control, and the additional title of HREmperor was icing on that cake. And the elder leader would run off with the icing, wearing it like a crown, leaving the younger leader to find new icing for the cake.)
    9Dec1565Pope Pius4 papacy ends and Pope St Pius5 (PIVS Quintus) (Antonio Ghislieri, O.P) (Italian) papacy begins 29 days later.Wiki: List of PopesMotto: Utinam dirigantur viæ meæ ad custodiendas [I wish to be directed in my ways to guard] Member of the Dominican Order.     1566The Reichstaler [realmdollar] was introduced to the Diet as the official coin of the HRE.Wiki: realm minting ordinanceIt remained in use throughout the HRE until the early 18th century. It was 29.23 grams (1.03 oz, 0.9397 troy oz) of 88.9% silver (2021 equivalent $18.80 or 0.074 GC). It was fixed at the same 68 Kreuzer as the previous Taler. (This suggests 1 Kreuzer is about 2021 equivalent $0.28)

    1572Margaret, sister of Charles9, married Henry (heir to Navarre).(2020) YT: FOL - French DocuThis was outrageous because France was so very Catholic, while Henry (Navarre) was Protestant. A leader of the "traitors to god" was at the wedding, and Catherine de Medici ordered his uninstalling, which failed. But French Catholics soon found and uninstalled him, as he lay wounded in his bed. This led to a purge of Protestants in the city - the Bartholomew's Day Massacre, in which 15k humans were uninstalled.

    1582Pope Gregory13 reformed the calendar.Wiki: List of Popes(While the Juilan calendar upgraded the Roman calendar from a pseudo-lunar calendar into a full solar calendar, the Gregorian calendar fine-tuned the leap years, to more accurately approximate Earth's orbit.)

Conv) (Italian) papacy begins 14 days later.Wiki: List of PopesMember of the Conventual Franciscan Order. Known for fixing and completing building works to major basilicas in Rome.     1586Simon Stevin (Flemish) (Flanders/Dutch?) mathematician and engineer concieves The Epitaph of Stevinus thought experiment.(2013) YT: udiprod - StevinusThis started with a chain on a triangle (of wood or something). If the chain were not balanced on the triangle, then it would roll off to one side. Now, attach the chain ends so it's a loop - this will create a perpetual motion machine, which cannot be.

    1589A process similar to the cementation process, for case hardening armor and files, was described in a book published in Naples.Wiki: Steel
    late 1500sThe standard formula for military-grade gunpowder was saltpeter, sulfur, and charcoal dust in the ratio 6:1:1.John Brown - PetermenAt this time, the only source of potassium nitrate was from rotting organic matter, especially rotting meat and urine. The saltpeter supplier would send out teams of collectors who would locate promising places to dig (abandoned privies and dungheaps) by tasting the soil before digging it out and carting it off to be boiled, strained and evaporated to produce saltpeter of the required purity. It is said that throughout Europe no privy, stable, or dovecote was safe from saltpeter collectors or "petermen".
    1590Toyotomi Hideyoshi completes conquering Honshu and Hokkaido islands, completing the Japanese empire at the time.(2016) YT: BW - history of japanHe then confiscated swords, outlawed owning swords or guns, solidified the caste system, and instituted taxation. Then he announced plans to invade China by invading Korea first.
    27Aug1590Pope Sixtus5 papacy ends and Pope Urban7 (VRBANVS Septimus) (Giovanni Battista Castagna) (Italian) papacy begins 19 days later.Wiki: List of PopesSupported by the Spanish. Shortest-papacying pope; uninstalled before coronation. Set the first known worldwide smoking ban, banning smoking in and near all temples.
    27Sep1590Pope Urban7 papacy ends and Pope Gregory14 (GREGORIVS Quartus Decimus) (Niccolò Sfondrati) (Italian) papacy begins 69 days later.Wiki: List of PopesModified the constitution Effraenatam [Noticing] of Sixtus5 so that the penalty for abortion did not apply until the fetus became animated (1591). Made gambling on papal elections punishable by excommunication.
    1590John Wolfe (England) publishes 'A booke of Engines and traps to take Polcats, Buzardes, Rattes, Mice, and all other kinds of vermin and beasts...'(2019) YT: SW - Paddle MoustrapA mousetrap is described with a wire over a bucket, with a spinning set of paddles in the middle of the trap.
    • The wire is cut or bent to hold onto the bucket.
    • Wood in the shape of a center tube, with 4 large paddles extending from the center tube.
    • The wooden paddle device spins freely on the wire.
    • Bait on the paddle tips.
    • Once between the paddles, the target's mass imbalances the paddle section, and it spins to drop the target into the bucket.
    16Oct1591Pope Gregory14 papacy ends and Pope Innocent9 (INNOCENTIVS Nonus) (Giovanni Antonio Facchinetti) (Italian) papacy begins 13 days later.Wiki: List of PopesSupported the cause of King Philip2 of Spain and the Catholic League against King Henry4 of France in the French Wars of Religion. Prohibited the alienation of temple property.
    30Dec1591Pope Innocent9 papacy ends and Pope Clement8 (CLEMENS Octavus) (Ippolito Aldobrandini) (Italian) papacy begins 31 days later.Wiki: List of PopesInitiated an alliance of European Christian powers to partake in the war with the Ottoman Empire known as The Long War (1595). Convened the Congregatio de Auxiliis [Congregation of Aides] which addressed doctrinal disputes between the Dominicans and Jesuits regarding free will and divine grace.

    1598Toyotomi Hideyoshi passes on without invading Korea.(2016) YT: BW - history of japanHe instructed his council of 5 elders to have his son become emperor, when the son grew up. But Tokugawa Ieyasu, one of the elders, takes power instead.
    1598French Wars of Religion end.(2020) YT: FOL - French Docu
    1600Battle of Sekigahara [seki-ga-hara] between Tokugawa Ieyasu and Ishida Mitsunari, over Tokugawa's control of the country.(2016) YT: BW - history of japan
    1600sFrench gunsmiths refine Snaphorn into flint-lock by joining cover and flint cock to the same spring, and hiding everything behind the lock plate.(2015) YT: PTA - Evol FirearmsFrench gunsmiths also invent the Cartouche - tear it open and pour a bit of powder into the frisson pan and close it, then pour the rest into the barrel, put the baggy in as padding, add bullet. Then aim and fire. Flint would last 50 shots, and battles often came down to whose flint and powder were better. But there was still a long delay between trigger and actual fire. The unexpected flash in the frisson pan would both cause the shooter to flinch, and visually alert the target. Loading through the "breech" or back end of the barrel became common, instead of "muzzle" loading through the front of the barrel like in muskets.
    1600sThe best crucible steel came from oregrounds iron of a region north of Stockholm, Sweden.Wiki: SteelThis was the best source of iron for melting in crucibles, which had the advantage of fully melting all of the iron, which let the ingredients mix fully, while impurities floated to the top or sank to the bottom. Before crucible steel, the iron and other ingredients were mixed while in a semi-molten slush-like state.
    1600sEuropeans begin producing steel with a process starting with the smelting of iron ore into pig iron in a blast furnace.Wiki: SteelOriginally employing charcoal, modern methods use coke fuel, which has proven more economical.
    1600Some city near Mexico City (Tenochtitlan?) uses lighter-colored stones as a centerline.(2020) YT: THG - Lane Markings
    1600Metro Bishop Dionysius the Philosopher (Thessaly) led a short-term revolt.Wiki: Ottoman Greece
    1600sCodex Regius first referenced, with information about Norse culture and traditions.(2016) YT: OSP - Poetic EddaA number of short stories, it's one of the few sources of information about the ancient Norse land and micropowers. Some pages have gone missing since this time.

Galileo and others would quickly make their own and improve them, with Galileo's having 20x magnification from a 3.8 cm (1.5 in) aperture.

    27Mar1625Rex Anglie [King of the English] James1 reign ends and Charles1 reign begins.Wiki: English monarchs
    1626Charles1 (England) ordered the collection of urine.John Brown - PetermenHe ordered "his loving subjects (to) carefully and constantly keep and preserve in some convenient vessels or receptacles fit for the purpose, all the urine of man during the whole year, and all the stale of beasts which they can save and gather together whilst their beasts are in their stables and stalls, and that they be careful to use the best means of gathering together and preserving the urine and stale, without mixture of water or other thing put therein. Which our commandment and royal pleasure, being easy to observe, and so necessary for the public service of us and our people, that if any person do be remiss thereof we shall esteem all such persons contemptuous and ill affected both to our person and estate, and are resolved to proceed to the punishment of that offender with what severity we may."
    1626Charles (England) abruptly dissolves the Parliament of 1626 before it had granted any subsidies, causing himself to be desperately short of money.BCW Project - Forced LoansHe kept hearing about everyone else's victories and his own failures, and started planning. To fund his war plans, he "pawned" the crown jewels, invented taxes on customs that Parliament hadn't yet said he couldn't, and requested mandatory loans of his wealthier subjects. Nobles and gentry across the kingdom became the loan collectors. The deeply unpopular loans raised more than £250k (2021 equivalent $87.4 million or 1.38k GD) within a year. 76 famous gentlemen refused and were imprisoned, but not charged with crimes, out of fear that the judges might rule against Charles. This imprisonment was not unheard of but unprecedented. (Did Charles dissolve Parliament before they could stop him from doing things?)
    1627Ming emperor Tiānqǐ reign ends and 皇太極 [Hong Taiji] reign begins the Chóngzhēn period.Wiki: Chinese monarchs
    16275 British gentlemen, imprisoned for refusing to loan money to Charles (England), applied for writs of habeus corpus (to have the body).BCW Project - Forced LoansThis called into question the legality of their imprisonment. Judges found in favour of Charles and the five were returned to prison, but the case became a focus of opposition to the King's arbitrary use of his powers. Roger Maynwaring and Robert Sibthorpe (England) preached sermons justifying Charles' actions, by virtue of his Divine Right, and Charles ordered these to be published. George Abbot (Archbishop of Canterbury) was reluctant to license them, but was superseded by William Laud (England) and a commission of bishops.
    1628Prince Khurram, 5th son of Emperor Jahangir (India) becomes emperor of India at Agra.History.com: RomanticsHis father had given him the title of Shah Jahan, or "King of the World".

He built the Taj Mahal. (Was it named after her - is "Taj" a shortened version of "Mumtaz"?) "Set across the Jamuna River from the royal palace in Agra, the white marble fade of the Taj Mahal reflects differing hues of light throughout the day, glowing pink at sunrise and pearly white in the moonlight. At its center, surrounded by delicate screens filtering light, lies the cenotaph, or coffin, containing the remains of the Shah’s beloved queen.

    4Jan1643Isaac Newton (England) installs.(2021) YT: SH - Nerdy XmasEngland was still using the Julian calendar, so this was late December. Yet many in the scientific community would remind each other of Newton's installday instead of Jesus (Nazareth)'s disputed installday, even though the Gregorian calendar shifted both off of the 25th of December. Newton was born on January 4th in the Gregorian calendar, and only had to face this inconsistency when he went to the European continent, as the UK kept the Julian calendar until long after his uninstall.

    1645Maunder Minimum Begins.NASA: The Inconstant SunSun has no sunspots for about 70 years. Thames river in London freezes. Glaciers advance in the Alps.
    1645Maunder Minimum Begins.Space: Sun in hibernationSunspots stop forming for the next 70 years. This 70-year solar lull was later noted by astronomer Gustav Spörer (Germany), which then later inspired the husband and wife team Edward and Annie Maunder (UK-Ireland).
    1645Maunder Minimum Begins.Imgur: Plagues and Solar MinimumsThis was the height of the Little Ice Age.

    1646Ming emperor 朱聿鍵 [Zhū Yùjiàn] reign ends and 朱聿𨮁 [Zhū Yùyuè] and 朱由榔 [Zhū Yóuláng] reigns begins.Wiki: Chinese monarchsDoes Ming currently have 5 leaders?
    26Mar1646English Parliament issues An Ordinance enabling Saltpeter-men to make Gun-Powder.British History - Saltpeter

    "This Ordinance of Parliament to continue for three yeers, from the six and twentieth day of March, 1646." (thus)

    How:
    • Authority for specified individuals to dig for Saltpeter in likely places.
    • Penalties for not allowing digging were going in front of one of many legal authorities, and being judged.
    • Saltpeter-men had quotas to fill, and had to work from 30 minutes after sunrise, until 60 minutes before sunset.
      • But pigeon houses had different hours: 9am-3pm. (Why?)
    • So they could come by and disrupt your morning routine to dig a big hole in your outhouse, then fill it in.
    • They could take your cart and use it to carry the bottles and buckets of what they dig up, but they had to pay you 8 pence (2021 equivalent $5.85 or 0.023 GC) per 1 mile (0.6 km).
      • This is about 10.4x the US IRS 2021 mileage deduction of $0.56/mile.
    • They could take your bottles and jugs, and return them without paying you. (Did they have to clean them out?)
    • They were exempt from taxes and tolls.
    Why:
    • Gunpowder was expensive because the King starts a lot of wars, and they'd used up their national stash.
    • Having this stuff on hand means repelling potential invaders, and keeping the country running.
      • Without more, they couldn't supply all of their navies, forts, and armies.
    • Foreign saltpeter sucks.
      • Other countries had banned selling saltpeter to them. (Because they don't want to be shot with their own saltpeter?)
    • Gunpowder will be way cheaper.

    6Jan1649Charles1 (England, Scotland, Ireland) appears before English High Court of Justice, after being accused of tyranny, treason, and uninstalling others.(2020) YT: HC - Trial Charles1Oliver Cromwell watched, turning "white as a wall" when Charles1 showed up. Cromwell knew the King would ask "under what Authority and Commission do you try me?" And their authority came from the House of Commons, which had - without support of the House of Lords (and probably illegally) - declared its own supremacy, superceding the King, which was thin at best. Eventually someone - Mr Marten - broke the silence: "In the name of the Commons and Parliament assembled, and all the good people of England."

    1650sGermans begin developing the Great Dane.(2021) YT: BA - Every Dog BreedBefore guns became useful, larger game like boar or bears would be held in place by dogs until humans could arrive to uninstall it. So a huge dog was needed to handle these huge creatures. They were created by importing and selectively breeding the largest dogs they could from the British isles - probably Irish Wolfhounds and English Mastiffs.

But the admirals believed in the medicinal value of the lime juice in a pint of rum and water. (Much like the medicinal value of the quinine in a gin and tonic. Other references said up to half of the crew could be lost to scurvy during long voyages, so instead of losing half your crew to disease, you'd lose them below decks and eventually deliver them to their loved ones in port.)

    1664Isaac Newton kept a ciphered list of minor transgressions he had comitted against Vatican City's religious practices.(2021) YT: SH - Nerdy XmasNewton was a prolific scientist, astrologer, and follower of Vatican City's micropower. He searched their Bible for numerological patterns (inventing Bible Codes). Newton was in his early 20s here, and the list included eating an apple at their temple, making pies on Sunday (the holy weekday which was reserved for laziness), stealing plums from his mother, and using someone else's bath towel. (Was he unable to find one of their priests to confess to? But first he'd have to teach them to read the cipher.)
    1665Giovanni Cassini sees the Great Red Storm on Jupiter.(2020) YT: PS - Red SpotHe was also called Gian Domenico or Jean-Dominique.
    1665Japan sees great peace and prosperity from being not in civil war, and has a massive population boom - almost double, from about 17 million to about 30 million.(2016) YT: BW - history of japanThis led to an explosion of civilization on the islands - businesses, schools, roads, literacy, books, haiku poetry, kabuki plays, ukiyo entertainment, bunraku puppets, and "Dutch Studies" of everything else.
    1666Isaac Newton pushed a bodkin sewing needle between his eyeball and skull.(2021) YT: SH - Nerdy XmasHe wrote: "I took a bodkin and I put it between my eye and the bone, as near to the backside of my eye as I could. And pressing my eye with the end of it, there appeared several white, dark, and colored circles." Later that year, he would stare at the sun, having taken great care to dilate his pupils in a dark room beforehand. He couldn't look at bright objects over a week afterward.
    22May1667Pope Alexander7 papacy ends and Pope Clement9 (CLEMENS Nonus) (Giulio Rospigliosi) (Italian) papacy begins 29 days later.Wiki: List of PopesMotto: Aliis non sibi Clemens [Clement to everyone but himself]. Mediated in the peace of Aachen (1668).
    1668Issac Newton made a telescope with mirrors instead of lenses.(2022) YT: SM - Biggest TelescopesThis solved the Chromatic aberration issue that plagued earlier telescopes, and had a side-effect of making the telescope smaller. It was also simpler than other telescopes, with a spherical primary mirror and flat secondary, which were very easy to buy.

    1673Robert Hooke finds the correct mirrors for the Gregory telescope, and constructs one.(2022) YT: SM - Biggest TelescopesHe then made one with an 18 cm (7 in) aperture, but it performed poorly. At the same time, there was another made by Cassegrain, with a parabolic primary and convex ellipsoid secondary, which was very similar. Issac Newton wasn't a fan of this design, with the secondary mirror blocking so much light - only 19% of the light got through his telescope - and the metallurgy for good mirrors was far behind the technology for lenses. (Silvered glass mirrors hadn't been invented yet.)

    5Jul1686Philosophiae Naturalis Principia Mathematica published by Issac Newton at Edward Halley's press(2019) YT: PN - Story of Comets 1Unifies mathematics, covers topics from planetary motions to double-entry bookkeeping. Showed that comet tails lead away from the sun, so could not be refracted sunlight, and were probably comet head cloud from heated matter. Formalizes many ideas, from the inverse square law, to the limits in calculus.

    1695Halley and Newton revise comet data for Principia 2nd edition, including the notion of periodic comets.(2019) YT: PN - Story of Comets 1Halley creates a table to precisely identify comet locations, and combs historical records to try and identify patterns. He realizes the comet he'd seen in 1682 had been seen numerous times in history.
    1695Ships Snowdrop and Constant sink on the Eddystone Reef.(2018) YT: Zepherus - EddystoneThis causes Henry Winstanley (inventor, painter, engraver, and owner of both ships) to design and build the 1st Eddystone Lighthouse, the first lighthouse to face the open sea.
    1696Isaac Newton wrote to John Locke about staring at the sun.(2021) YT: SH - Nerdy XmasHe wrote: "In a few hours' time I had brought my eyes to such a pass that I could look upon no bright object with either eye but I saw the sun before me, so that I could neither write nor read ... I began in three or four days to have some use of my eyes again & by forbearing a few days longer to look upon bright objects recovered them pretty well."
    16981st Eddystone Lighthouse completed(2018) YT: Zepherus - Eddystone24 meters (78 feet) tall (shorter than the 28 meter (92 foot) waves)
    1699France gains control of Louisiana PurchaseWiki: Louisiana Purchase
    16992nd Eddystone Lighthouse completed(2018) YT: Zepherus - Eddystone36.5 meters (119 ft) tall, with a gallery
    26Jan1700An earthquake occurred around 9:00 PM in Cascadia.NOAA: 1700 Cascadia Tsunami

    (05:00 January 27 UTC) Its tsunami would cross the Pacific Ocean and reach Japan in about 9 hours.

    The trees all uninstalled in the winter of 1699 - 1700 when the coasts of northern California, Oregon, and Washington suddenly dropped 1- 2 m (3.3 - 6.6 ft.), flooding them with seawater. By comparing the tree rings of uninstalled trees with those still living they could tell when the last of these great earthquakes struck the region. That much motion over such a large area requires a very large earthquake to explain it - perhaps as large as 9.2 magnitude, comparable to the Great Alaska Earthquake of 1964. Such an earthquake would have ruptured the earth along the entire length of the 1000 km (~600 mi) long fault of the Cascadia Subduction Zone and severe shaking could have lasted for 5 minutes or longer.

    Jan1700The last known megathrust earthquake in the northwest USA occurred along the Cascadia Subduction Zone (CSZ).PNSN: Cascadia Subduction ZoneSeparating the Juan de Fuca and North America tectonic plates is this "megathrust" dipping fault, stretching 1,000 km (621.3 mi) from Northern Vancouver Island to Cape Mendocino California. Mantle is cooled into new Juan de Fuca plate offshore along the Juan de Fuca ridge, pushing the Juan de Fuca plate north-northeast beneath the continental North American plate. The CSZ may be unique among the world's subduction zones in that it produces very few (if any) earthquakes unambiguously on the plate interface. The fault's frictional properties change with depth:
    • Immediately below the locked part is a strip (the "Transition Zone") that slides in "slow slip events" that slip a few cm every dozen months or so. This transfers the plate boundary stresses from the Transition Zone to the locked part of the fault.
    • Below the transition zone geodetic evidence suggests that the fault slides continuously and silently at long term plate slip rate.
    • From its surface trace offshore to a depth of possibly 5 km, all remote from land, observations are few and it remains unknown whether the fault is stuck or slipping silently.
    • At depths shallower than 30 km or so, the CSZ is locked by friction while strain slowly builds up as the subduction forces act, until the fault's frictional strength is exceeded and the rocks slip past each other along the fault in a "megathrust" earthquake.
    Great Subduction Zones like the CSZ are the only source zones that can produce earthquakes greater than M8.5 - the CSZ has produced M9.0 or greater earthquakes - but it's not known if these zones can produce smaller than M8 earthquakes.
    27Jan1700A tsunami struck the coasts of the Japanese archipelago just before midnight.NOAA: 1700 Cascadia TsunamiNo one in Japan felt the earthquake that must have caused it, so there was no warning of this "orphan tsunami". (Was this the tsunami that occurred in James Clavell's Shogun?)
    1700Germany & Swizerland adopt Gregorian CalendarWiki: Gregorain calendar
    1700Transformation of the Ottoman Empire ends and Stagnation and reform of the Ottoman Empire begins.Wiki: List of Ottoman sultans
    27Sep1700Pope Innocent12 papacy ends and Pope Clement11 (CLEMENS Undecimus) (Giovanni Francesco Albani) (Italian) papacy begins 57 days later.Wiki: List of PopesThe Chinese Rites controversy. Patronized the first archaeological excavations in the Roman catacombs and made the feast of the Immaculate Conception universal.
    1700The English end their intermittent warring against the Kalinago micropower.Wiki: Kalinago
    1700sThe Lakota Sioux micropower move permanently into the Great Plains.(2019) YT: HP - Wounded KneeThe habit of following bison around only happened after horses were reintroduced into North America by Europeans. (Horses evolved in the Americas, and some crossed the land bridge to Eurasia, but the American branch went extinct thousands of years before this point.)
    1700sDaniel Bernoulli investigated the forces present in a moving fluid.NASA: Bernoulli's Equation Bernoulli's Equation states that Total Pressure is equal to the Static Pressure plus the Dynamic Pressure - which is one half of the density times the velocity squared. To restate, Pt = Ps + Pd, where Pd = (DV2)/2. Or the full equation, Pt = Ps + (DV2)/2. Thus dynamic pressure is like a constant. The liquid must satisfy these constraints: No viscosity, steady, incompressible, low velocity, no heat addition, little height change (negligible gravitational gradient).
    1700sReflecting telescopes become more popular than refracting telescopes.(2022) YT: SM - Biggest TelescopesJohn Hadley had solved most of the issues with the mirrors, and from this point all of the largest telescopes would be reflecting.
    1701Frederick1 of Prussia commissions Amber Room in Charlottesburg Castle in Berlin(2017) YT: Zepherus - Amber Room
    8Mar1702Queen Anne's reign began over the Kingdom of England, the Kingdom of Scotland, and the Kingdom of Ireland.Wiki; British MonarchsAnne Stuart and George1 were second cousins as both were great-grandchildren of James1 and James6.

    1703Mr C (England?) writes the Royal Society of London about square and oblong shapes seen in his simple microscope.(2019) YT: JttM - DiatomsOne of the earliest descriptions of diatoms, microsocopic photosynthetic unicellular algae, which can collectively be seen from space. Bulk quantities (lbs or kgs) of their tiny glass frustules [cell shells] have uses from beer filtering to ant control.
    1705Halley publishes A Synopsis of the History of Comets(2019) YT: PN - Story of Comets 1He charts numerous times in history where this same comet shows up every 76 years or so - varying slightly based on the gravity of Jupiter and Saturn, and predicts it will return in 1758. (This history page wasn't inspired by this historical event, but rather finding it felt like an indicator of being on the correct course.)

    1707Act of Union joins England and Scotland into the United Kingdom (UK) of England and Scotland.(2019) YT: OSP - ScotlandScottish parliament adjourns for 292 years.

    1709Japanese 東山天皇 [Emperor Higashiyama] reign ends and 中御門天皇 [Emperor Nakamikado] reign begins.Wiki: Emperors of Japan
    1710Robert Harley gets himself appointed Chancellor of Exchecquor.(2015) YT: EH - South Sea 1

    Discovers UK is massively in debt - has 5000 pounds Sterling (2021 equivalent $1.13 million or 17.8 GD) of assets, and 9000 (2021 equivalent $2.036 million or 32 GD) of debts. Before his investigation, it was known that UK was in debt, but nobody knew how deeply. UK was at war with every foreign lender, at war with Spain (blocking trade), taxation was politically impossible, and the Bank of England were controlled by the Whigs - Harley's political (Torey) enemy.

    Harley partnered with James Blunt of the Hollow Sword Blade Company to form the South Seas Company. Their plan was to exchange ownership shares for Army Debentures, a promissory note the army would issue when they couldn't pay. They would charge 6% interest, which was lower than the army was paying individuals, and use the profits to buy land in Ireland. In the lead-up, they bought all the debentures they could to increase demand.

    They got the 200k pounds (2021 equivalent $45.13 million or 710 GD) to buy land in Ireland, and 20k (2021 equivalent $4.51 million or 71 GD) to loan to the government. They also got exclusive rights from the UK government to operate in the South Seas (aka all ports in Central and South America). They advertised this heavily, even hiring the author of Gulliver's Travels to advertise, giving buyers confidence.

    House of Lords members don't need election - until recently, any "Peer of the Realm" could be made a lord - so Harley jailed Whig party members Sir Robert Wapole, and John Churchill Duke of Marlborough, in the Tower of London. Then they got the Queen of England to add 12 new Peers, and now Parliament also wanted to end the war with Spain. But they left the war early, and so didn't get loot drops at the end, such as access to the ports. They ended up with slave trade, and 1 ship per year per port. This revealed the South Sea Company to merely be a bank.

    Harley gets the UK lottery's administration rights (run the thing) given to Blunt, who modified the lottery so every ticket would pay at least 10% of its price, across the next decade. Tickets sold quickly and turned present debt into long-term debt.

He got the king's son, George2, as the ceremonial Governor of the company. Also got George1 to invest personally. They also forgave 2 years of interest, to placate Wapole and Churchill, in exchange for more stock. They had 10 million pounds Sterling (2021 equivalent $2.853 billion or 44.9k GD) at this point. (Other entries say Anne uninstalls, not Elizabeth1.)

Then, during a UK Lottery debt payment, Jacobites tried to overthrow George1 - after this the South Sea Company ran favorable submarine articles, which drove up their share price from 100 pounds (2021 equivalent $27,840 or 110 GC) to 114 (2021 equivalent $31,739 or 125 GC), giving massive profit.
    1717Sir Isaac Newton, as master of the UK Mint, set the gold price at £3 17s 10p (2021 equivalent $1,118.53 or 4.4 GC) per troy ounce.NMA - Historic Gold Prices
    1719UK has a lot of debt, so a group of humans form essentially a private bank called the South Sea Company, which would exchange government debt for stock in the company.(2019) YT: OSP - Blue's History 1Stock quickly rose in price, and the Company basically bribed all of Parliament. The company was valued at more than there were Pounds Sterling in circulation, and was worth 1/5 of the entire empire GDP. South Sea company didn't have any rights in South America, where they were supposed to operate, but humans kept investing because they liked the idea.
    1719Ferdinand von Hohenhems loses Countship of Vaduz to his brother.(2020) YT: RE - LiechtensteinThe brother is sued for Ferdinand's witch hunts, and has to sell Vaduz to the wealthy Leichtenstein family (Austria). Their connections kept the land free while Napoleon and the HRE cut up Europe into Swiss, Austrian, and German states. In the 21st century, it would be home to Swizerland's more illicit bank accounts.
    1719UK had racked up 31 million pounds (2021 equivalent $9.28 billion or 146k GD) of unconsolidated debt.(2016) YT: EH - South Sea CoTaking this on would make the South Sea Company the largest financial institution in the world. They bribed members of UK Parliament on the order of 4000 pounds (2021 equivalent $1.211 million or 19 GD). By March, the share price was 330 pounds (2021 equivalent $98,767 or 1.56 GD), but in April it slipped to 310 pounds. So they offered a layaway system, which means everyone leveraged and reinvested, pushing the price higher. They used some of the profits to loan up to 3000 pounds (9 shares worth) to buyers, which raised share prices over 600 pounds. The UK government was afraid that South Sea might monopolize the pound, leaving no money for commerce. By June, Blunt was knighted, company valued at 300 million pounds, and would be owed 60 million pounds - more than the total amount of money in the UK economy at the time. (2021 equivalent $93.58 trillion or 1.47 billion GD)

They got their name from the huge hostels they lived in, and treated their land like a giant hostel.     Nov1745Ewald Georg von Kleist (Germany) invents the capacitor.How Stuff works - CapacitorsHe didn't keep detailed notes or records.
    1746Andreas Sigismund Marggraf isolates elemental Zinc.Wiki: Zinc
    1746Pieter van Musschenbroek (Netherlands) invents the Leyden Jar.How Stuff works - Capacitors

    This is typically credited as the first capacitor, despite an earlier invention, due to more thorough notes and records. Named after the University of Leiden, where early experiments took place. Capacitors are electrical components that store electrical potential as electron abundance and deficiency through capacitance, where at least two conducting plates are separated by an insulator but joined by magnetic fields. Legend says the first was basically a beer can dielectric, with distilled water as an insulator, and a nail in a cork for the other dielectric. Voltaic Cells were used to charge them, and a grounded discharge wand to discharge them. Capacitor dimensions:

    • Dielectric Strength is the maximum voltage that can be handled.
    • Capacitance defines how many Farads (F) (aka amp-seconds, or more likely pico-farads (pF) or micro-farads (uF)) of electrical energy a capacitor can store - and numerous factors can reduce capacitance.
    • Temperature: A capacitor with a temperature coefficient of -0.3pF/°C holds 33% fewer Farads at 60°C than that at 25°C.
    1747Japanese 桜町天皇 [Emperor Sakuramachi] reign ends and 桃園天皇 [Emperor Momozono] reign begins.Wiki: Emperors of Japan

    1750Chemist Joseph Black (Scotland) was hired by a distillery to determine the best combination of fuels to make whisk(e)y.(2019) YT: PN - Story of Comets 2While studying this, Black heated water from freezing to boiling, and observed a break in continuous temperature rise when the material changed phase from solid to liquid, and again liquid to gas.
    1750Laplace used Joseph Black's observation of temperature rise pausing during phase change to suggest this is why comets don't get blasted away - it takes some energy to cause the exterior layer to change phases.(2019) YT: PN - Story of Comets 2
    1750sStrawberries created through hybridization in Brittany, France.(2018) YT: AP - Fruit GeographyThey're hybrids of the North American fragaria virginiana & Chilean fragaria chloensis berries.

    1754French and Indian war begins.(2017) YT: FH - 7-years war
    13Dec1754Sultan Mahmud1 reign ends and Osman3 SOFU (The Devout) reign begins.Wiki: List of Ottoman sultansSon of Mustafa2 and Şehsuvar Sultan.
    1755Immanuel Kant proposes the solar system formed from a condensing ball of gas, which flattened as it spun, and the planets and sun formed from this.(2019) YT: PN - Story of Comets 2While his contemporaries believed comets to be rocks from other solar systems, Kant believed comets to be from the same solar system formation process, but further out than planets. He believed comets must be made of a material light enough to be pushed by light itself. Additionally he speculated that the cause of a comet's tail is the same as the cause of the aurora borealis (which is also true). Though Kant was a legend in his time, his publisher for his solar system writings went bankrupt, so they went ignored for long enough to be overshadowed by his philosophical works.
    1755Magnesium discovered.(Reference Missing)
    Feb1755Solar Cycle 1 starts.Wiki: List of solar cycles
    1755Wolf's Solar sunspot Cycle 1 starts.ScienceMag: Violent Sun
    1755Wolff begins watching sunspots.Space: Sun in hibernationThis starts Sunspot Cycle 1. This "Wolff number" remains in use in the 21st century, according to the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA). Many other astronomers at the time either independently observed this cycle or were inspired by the results of others. Wolf struggled to piece together solar cycles before this time because of the lack of sunspots, but it didn’t mean they weren't trying. Many distinguished astronomers of the age, such as Giovanni Cassini, continued to make observations.

    1759Russia and Austria push to take Prussia, but...didn't.(2017) YT: FH - 7-years warLouis (France) was too indecisive and didn't win either war. GB takes more of Quebec from France. Ferdinand4 (Spain) uninstalls and Charles3 replaces, joins 7-year war. "Bourbon Spain" and "Bourbon France" join the war, while actual Spain targets weakened Portugal. But invading Portugal left soldiers hungry and without morale. Spain's colonies pressure Portugal's colonies in South America.
    1759Adam Smith (Scotland) publishes Theory of Moral Sentiments.(2017) YT: FH - 7-years war

    Smith viewed humans as social beings, and his life's work was developing a systematic understanding of how humans operate in society. This system is grounded in sympathy - a combination of empathy with the judgment and evaluation of others. Before this, people thought good things and bad things of all sizes happened because a deity made them happen. He gave the model that we're each independent players who react to what others do to us, not deity-controlled NPCs, and that society's morals should be based off this. And that we're all motivated by self-interest, where positive judgments in the sympathy give pleasure, and thus are in our self-interest.

    To counter the criticism that selfish desires can harm others, Smith develops a Spectator within each person, who observes the person's behavior and others. That Spectator is who makes the judgments, against both ourselves and others. A crucial distinction Smith makes is between Justice (both social norms and actual laws) and Beneficence (being nice to people, holding doors, etc) - with beneficence but no justice, it's an untenably unjust society, while justice without beneficence is a livable-but-unpleasant society. This makes justice the most important moral foundation of society, and thus governments should enforce rules but not interfere with beneficence, as this might cause chilling effects.

    Starting with humans as social beings, we strive for sympathy, tempered by the Spectator to be as impartial as possible. And we build social norms and laws around this impartiality, which was his vision for a free society of responsible people.

    Beware the (Person) of System, he warned, who sees people as pieces on a chessboard - for they arrive with a vison in hand for a Perfect Order to Society. But people have their own laws of motion and aren't pieces on a chessboard. (Too often, this person's motivation is simple totalitarianism, where everyone else does what the person says or are punished.)

    1760Industrial Revolution begins.Wiki: Industrial Revolution
    1760France and Mughals fight GB together in India, but GB takes many forts.(Reference Missing)

    1763Britain had annexed St Lucia, Tobago, Dominica and St Vincent islands.Wiki: KalinagoAfricans who were marooned from shipwrecked slave ships, as well as some who escaped from plantations, intermarried with the Kalinago to form a new Afro-Indigenous culture: The 'Black Caribs' of St Vincent. They were later known as Carifuna. The Black Carib communities that remained in St Vincent and Dominica retained a degree of autonomy well into the 19th century.

    1766Johann Daniel Tituts finds a planetary distance formula.(2017) YT: PN - Planet X 1For Planet n (orbit AU of n) = (4+(3*2^n-2))/10. A gap is needed between Uranus and Pluto.
    PlanetNumberEquationSemimajor Axis in AUs
    Mercury1(4+(3*0))/10 = .4 AU.39
    Venus2(4+(3*2^0))/10 = .7 AU.72
    Earth3(4+(3*2^1))/10 = 1.0 AU1
    Mars4(4+(3*2^2))/10 = 1.6 AU1.52
    Ceres5(4+(3*2^3))/10 = 2.8 AU2.77
    Jupiter6(4+(3*2^4))/10 = 5.2 AU5.2
    Saturn7(4+(3*2^5))/10 = 10.0 AU9.58
    Uranus8(4+(3*2^6))/10 = 19.6 AU19.22
    Neptune9(N/A)30.07
    Pluto10(4+(3*2^7))/10 = 38.8 AU39.48
    Uranus showed up exactly where predicted, solidifying it as a planet. This forced many to ask what was in the gap between Mars and Jupiter. (Also this was likely part of why Pluto was originally a planet.)

Lexle said Jupiter pulled it in. They used the fact that this comet had no impact on the duration of daytime meant it had (relative to Earth) miniscule mass.

    1776George Washington writes to his estate manager about landscaping plans.(2019) NYT: Great American LawnHe and Thomas Jefferson are big fans of European landscape architecture, and he wants big flowering shrubs and groves of trees, alongside huge lawns. In this pre-motorized age, lawns could only be trimmed with small sicles and blades, so maintaining a golf course would take dozens of (usually unpaid and involuntary) groundskeepers working full-time. This extravagance was a huge indicator of class stratification.

After his uninstall, Herschel would buy the telescope for 30 pounds Sterling (2021 equivalent $3,626 or 14.3 GC).

He was allowed to keep the money he made from selling kitchen scraps like bone, feather, ash, fat, etc - and bought a nice outfit of fine clothes, which he would wear daily and walk around the neighborhood.

    1792Buttonwood Agreement creates the New York Stock Exchange.HowStuffWorks - Stock Mkt Fractions"The Buttonwood Agreement was signed by 24 of our emerging country's most prominent bankers, brokers and merchants, all with the intent to trade stocks and securities through a common clearing house." - they used Spain as a model, mostly because the US Dollar's value was based on the Spanish Real. The Spanish Real broke apart into Pieces of Eight, based on counting with fingers but not thumbs - which was mathematically inconvenient to convert to decimal (based on counting *with* thumbs) due to the state of the technology of the age.

    1796Ming emperor 弘曆 [Hónglì] reign ends and 顒琰 [Yóngyǎn] reign begins.Wiki: Chinese monarchsThe Qianlong emperor officially retired, taking the title Emperor Emeritus (太上皇帝). This was an act of filial piety to ensure that he would not reign longer than his illustrious grandfather, the Kangxi emperor. However, he remained the ultimate authority until his uninstall in 1799, at which point his son, the Jiaqing emperor, began to exercise the power that had been his in name only from 1796.

    1798Giacomo Casanovan uninstalls.History.com: Romantics
    1798Establishment of the Helvetic RepublicCurrencies Fandom - Swiss FrancThe Helvetic Republic issued coins denominated in 1 rappen, ½ batzen, 1 batzen in billon, 10 batzen, 20 batzen, and 40 batzen in silver, and 16 franken and 32 franken in gold. (Franken is the plural form of franc.) These coins were minted in Basel, Bern, and Solothurn. This Helveltic franc was an equivalent to 6¾ grams of silver (2021 equivalent $5.85 or 0.23 GC), or 1½ French francs, and was based on the Berne thaler, being subdivided into 10 batzen or 100 rappen. Before this, about 75 places were producing coins - including 25 cantons and half-cantons, 16 cities, and abbeys - resulting in about 860 different coins in circulation.
    1798Napoleon entered Egypt.(2017) YT: LF - Arabic LanguageThis started a period of greater contact between the Arab and Western worlds. Western concepts required some updates to the language.
    29Aug1799Pope Pius6 papacy ends and Fifth Papal Interregnum begins.Wiki: List of PopesSix-month period without a valid pope elected. This was due to unique logistical problems (the old pope uninstalled as a prisoner and the conclave was in Venice) and a deadlock among cardinals voting.
    1799Allesandro Volta (Italy) invents the Voltaic Cell.ETHW: Volta's Battery

    This was literally a "wet pile" of alternating copper and zinc discs, with each pair of metals separated by flannel soaked in weak acid. The acid chemically oxidizes individual +2 zinc atoms, with each leaving behind 2 electrons in the zinc metal (anode). The zinc atom supplants two hydrogen atoms in the acidic molecules, pushing all of the hydrogen atoms forward until 2 reach the copper plate, where they reduce 2 electrons from the copper (cathode) and fuse into a dihydrogen molecule. Electrons flow freely from the zinc plate to the next copper plate through their direct contact.

    Volta used this to demonstrate electrolysis, and the concept of an electric circuit. Scientific curiosity grew greatly because of this new device's ability to generate electricity on demand. Before this, electricity was believed to be "animal electricity" generated by living beings. (This may be due to static shocks making frog legs jump, as the electricity activates the electrochemical cascade in neurons - usually the electrical potential made chemically by neurotransmitters at the synapse, but here an electrical potential.)

    4Sep1799Herschel uses a 40 ft (12.2 m) telescope with 240x magnification to view the Fuzzy Nebula in Messier's catalog.(2022) YT: SM - Biggest TelescopesHe could see these as distinct stars and clusters. He writes: "The scattered stars were brought to a good, well determined focus, from which it appears that the central condensed light is owning to a multitude of stars that appeared at various distances behind and near each other. I could actually see and distingusih the stars even in the central mass. The Rev Mr Vince, Plumain Professor of Astronomy at Camridge, saw it in the same telscope as described.

    1800Gotha Observatory Director Baron France Sauer Van Sac, assembled a Uranus planetary task force.(2017) YT: PN - Planet X 1 Members included Herschel, (UK) Astronomer Royal Nevil Maskelyne, and prolific star cataloger Charles Messier. They were called the Himmelblitzide [Heaven's Police] and each given a section of sky to watch for this missing planet.

    1800sJapan resembles medieval Europe.(2012) YT: OSP - Meiji RestorationThe country is unified but not centralized. The 300 daimyo set their own tax rates and only accepted payment in goods (food? Bug's Life again?). The commoners worked hard and endured famines so samurai could do kendo and write poetry.

    1800sClementine oranges are observed as they naturally hybridize.(2018) YT: AP - Fruit GeographyThis was observed happening in an orphanage garden in Misserghin, Algeria, which was led by Mr Marie-Clement Rodiers (France), which is where we get the name.
    1800sMany people were poisoned by the arsenic in their wallpaper.(2016) YT: PV - ArsenicSheila's Green, a bright green common pigment for the time, is made from of a mixture of arsenic, sodium, and copper. There was a common fear of drafts and cold air causing deadly illness in this pre-germ theory era, leading to extremely well sealed houses, which caused a huge mold problem. And the mold could consume the pigment and emit gases containing the arsenic.
    1800sRichard Carrington and Spörer both discovered sunspots appearing at different latitudes during different points in the solar cycle, starting at mid-latitudes and migrating towards the equator at the end.Space: Sun in hibernationPlotted against time, this leads to a distinctive "butterfly" diagram.
    1800sAn estimated 2 million sailors had been uninstalled by scurvy since the 1600s.(2021) YT: SH - Nerdy XmasOn long voyages, it was common to lose half of the crew. This disease is caused by a lack of vitamin C, which was sometimes addressed using pine tree needle tea, which is high in vitamin C. (Citrus fruits were a known and forgotten cure, despite being rationed as part of grog on UK ships throughout this time.)
    1800sHorse-drawn buses reappear.What Things Weigh: Bus

    1801Theodosia Burr Alston (daughter of Vice President Aaron Burr) and her husband Joseph Alston were the first recorded couple to honeymoon at Niagara Falls.Wiki: Niagara Falls
    1801Thomas Young performs the Double-Slit experiment.(2017) YT: PDE - Double-SlitLight from a light source traveling through one small (few mm) slit in a card gives the expected circular glow on the wall behind the card, as each photon takes random straight lines through the slit and to the back wall. But two slits gives a moire pattern, as each photon takes both paths, and the circular glows interfere with each other.
    1801Napoleon creates a medal in Allesandro Volta's honor.ETHW: Volta's BatteryThe world honored Volta by naming the unit of electric potential (Volts) after him.

    1802Inventor Richard Trevithick (England) invents the high-pressure tram engine.(2021) YT - MP: UP GTELBasically the first locomotive, he boasted that this could haul 10 tons (9 metric tons) of iron, 5 wagons, and 70 workers. It took 4 hours to go 9 miles (14.5 km), for a speed of 2.25 mph (3.62 km/h) or a slow walk. Nevertheless, this was revolutionary for the time, and quickly led to others copying and improving on the design. (This was a steam engine small enough to have wheels attached and fit on rails. Previous designs used much larger stationary engines and long ropes.)
    1803War of 3rd coalition, Napoleon wins on land, UK wins at sea.(2017) YT: FH - Peninsular War
    22Feb1803Fishermen on the Hitachi prefecture shoreline see a woman in an utsuro-bune [hollow boat].(2021) YT: VotP - Ancient UFOsThey towed the boat in, finding it was 3 m (9.8 ft) tall and 5 m (16.4 ft) wide. It reminded them of a huge incense burner. The upper part was made of red-coated rosewood with transparent windows, while the lower was covered in brazen plates. Inside was covered in text of an unknown language. Also inside were 2 bedsheets, 1 bottle with 3.5 L (0.92 gal) water, some cake, and kneaded (toughened) meat. Lastly there was a short beautiful woman of height 1.5 m (4.9 ft), with red hair and eyebrows, pale pink skin, and white hair extensions. Her clothes were smooth unknown fabrics. She didn't understand the fishermen, and they didn't understand her. She was polite but odd, clutching a quadrilateral box with sides of about 0.5 m (1.6 ft - this would have been 1/3 of her height) which she wouldn't let anyone touch. Recently, another woman with a similar box had washed up nearby, and also a board with a head pinned to it. So an elderly villager made up a legend that starts by disparaging her character and ends with her exiled to float in this boat with the head of a lover. Based on this new legend, they gathered the woman back into the ship and set her adrift again.

Add to this that private banks had just invented the bank note, and there were about 8k different forms of currency in circulation, vastly complicting the monetary system.

He would become a US Congressperson later in life.

    1814Treaty of GhentIndian Country Today - WordsDuring talks leading to the Treaty, American and British treaty commissioners engaged in a heated and lengthy political debate over the shape of the continent. British commissioners wanted to compress the numerous pre-Columbian micropowers and nations into a single country between the United States and Canada - as a political buffer - but the USA's commissioners were very much opposed. During the discussions, British commissioners maximized the numerous pre-Columbian micropowers and nations as "Indian nations", while the American commissioners described them with the minimizing term "Indian tribes".

When her 4th (and only surviving) child was just 2 years old, Perce uninstalled in a storm at sea.

    1818Captain Artemus Wheeler (Massachusets) patents 7-shot pistol.(2015) YT: PTA - Evol Firearms!t was a carbine/musket with a hand-turned cylinder and 7 barrels. It used a flint-lock to fire. His colleague, Elisha Collier, moved to England and patented a repeating firearm, where one spring rotated chambers, and another pushed this against the non-rotating barrel, to seal hot gases. The pepperbox pistol combined self-rotating with auto cocking and the percussion cap to fully automate firing into pulling the trigger.

    1820Dalton Minimum Ends.Imgur: Plagues and Solar Minimums
    1820Missouri Compromise declares that new US States north of the 36'30 Parallel North cannot legalize human slavery.(2022) YT: WG - Bleeding KansasThis established a northern border for Texas, which was the only US State west of the Mississippi at that point. It also put a freeze on new states, as there was a balance of power between the pro-slavery South and anti-slavery North. Southern senators wouldn't approve new Northern states to change that balance of power, but other than the land begrudgingly reserved for the displaced Native micropowers (that would become Oklahoma), Texas took up basically all the land below that Parallel North and within the Louisiana Purchase, so there was no space for new pro-slavery US States.
    1820sEngineer John Loudon McAdam (Scotland) develops Macadam road construction.Wiki: MacadamSame-sized layers of small angular crushed stones are placed in shallow channels and compacted thoroughly. A binding layer of stone dust may be added after the stones to keep dust and stones together and help water run off. (The method simplified the state-of-the-art for road building, which used 3 layers of smaller and smaller crushed stones).

    1822Reverend Alexander John Forsyth invents percussion ignition of firearms.(2015) YT: PTA - Evol Firearms He patented a rotating "scent-bottle" gun lock, which allows more reliable ignition, and has some success. Others loved the design, and improved on this with a sliding magazine, pills of powder, and powder within paper disks (cap guns). These would be struck with a pin. The ignition cap had the gunpowder sealed within copper, where the cap covered the vent and the hammer struck it.

Adding toluene will separate it better since bromine is non-polar.

The surface carburetor was a simple fuel vaporizer (a bong using gasoline instead of water, where the engine provides the suction and thus intakes the hydrocarbons, in this case preignition).

    1830Conic Sections Rebellion at Yale shows how the use of blackboards changed education and testing methods.Wiki: Blackboard(Numerous geometric shapes, from circles to ellipses to arcs can be described by taking a cross-sectional slice of a cone at a particular angle, so these can be used in engineering fields from industrial to civil to orbital. Students were being forced to solve mathematical problems during interviews, on these new blackboards, making interviews stressful and leading to this rebellion. 21st century IT workers could learn from this, as it's a very similar situation.)

    Feb1832Alexis De Tocqueville completes his trip through USA(2016) YT: TSOL - TocquevilleHe visited New England, travelled down the coast to The South, and traveled back up through Tennesee and Kentucky, along with the Great Lakes to Green Bay and Quebec in Canada. (The USA at the time held just 24 states, and barely crossed the Mississippi River.)
    11May1832The London Conference of 1832 occurs.Wiki: Ottoman GreeceAn international conference was held between the three "Great Powers" (UK, France, Russia) which had contributed mightily to Greek independence from the Ottoman empire. They decided Greece should be fully independent with a stable government, not merely autonomous, and that Bavarian prince Otto should be their king. Succession was established, to Otto's descendants then younger brothers - and that there would be no personal union between Otto's family members and the ruling family members of Bavaria, UK, France, or Russia - something also supported by Queen Victoria (UK). Greeks were disappointed at the restricted borders of their new country - from Arta to Volos, and only Euboia and the Cyclades among the islands - but felt powerless and were unable to fully express this sentiment at the London Conference. The London Conference's decisions were ratified in the Treaty of Constantinople later that year.
    23May1832Governor Αυγουστίνος ΚαποδίστρIας (Augustinos Kapodistrias) term ends the Hellenic State, and ΒασIλεὺς τῆς Ἑλλάδος (King of Greece) Ὄθων (Otto) Wittelsbach reign begins the House of Wittelsbach and Kingdom of Greece 4 days later.Wiki: Greek Head of StateFollowing the resignation of Augustinos Kapodistrias, a series of collective governing councils were established, but their authority was often only nominal.
    1832Chloral hydrate discovered by Justus von Liebig (chemist) at the University of Giessen.Wiki: Chloral HydrateA chlorination halogenation reaction was performed on ethanol.
