    1834Friedrich Wilhelm Bessel (astronomer) notices that the brightest star in the night sky, Sirius, exhibits wavy irregularities as it moves through space and across the night sky.(2021) YT: PE - Chandrasekhar limitHe deduced this was due to radial velocity, with a period of about 50 years. Sirius can be found constellationally by finding Orion's Belt and moving down and to our left (Orion's right) along the night sky to a bright star near the horizon, which is (are) Sirius.
    1835Friedrich Wilhelm Bessel observes Halley's Comet, and sees streams of material evaporating off its head, enough to alter the comet's course.Wiki: Halley's Comet
    1835Gauss's Law created(2019) YT: TSA - Electromagnetism(∇)-> * E-> = [rho]/Epsilon0 -and- (∇)-> * B-> = 0
    1835Samuel Colt patents his single-action revolver in USA.(2015) YT: PTA - Evol FirearmsThis uses a mechanism similar to the pepperbox, to rotate and align cylinders. Hammer was contained within the cylinder, and reloading required disassembly of the gun. A later Navy model had a levered rammer behind the barrel, to make reloading easier.
    1835UK codifies the "Keep to the Left" laws for their roadways in the Highway Act of 1835.(2020) YT: THG - Lane MarkingsBefore then, it was a tradition to pass others on the left, legendarily so knights could uninstall or shake hands with those fated to pass them on the road.
    1835Alexis De Tocqueville publishes Democracy in America.(2016) YT: TSOL - Tocqueville

    These were the compilations of his thoughts on traveling the USA and researching democracy. 5 problems stuck out to him:

    1. Democracy breeds materialism. European peasants had little option to make money, and landed aristocrats had no need of more, so money wasn't a status symbol - but US Americans felt it could be earned through hard work alone. (Like the Horse on George Orwell's Animal Farm.) Money is the only achievement that US Americans respected - "a book that doesn't sell well can't be very good." Making for an endless, but flat and mean, way to judge each other.
    2. Why are US Americans so restless in spite of their prosperity? Where inequalities are pronounced, they are largely accepted and ignored - but where any motivated person can take any job and we're all so equal, we become much more aware of the slight variations. Thus we focus more on keeping up with the Joneses than with how our material needs are almost completely met. Also, the entire country are the Joneses with whom we must keep up, whereas stratified layers reduced this to just humans in your stratum.
    3. The tyranny of the majority - democratic culture demonizes differences and minorities, even if they have benefit. "It's regarded as a civic virtue to take on anyone who seems to be getting above themselves and cut them viciously down to size."
    4. Democracy turns us against authority. People are used - trained even - to not defer to others, and so don't defer even to proven experts, such as doctors or authors. Thus democracy is "fatally biased towards mediocrity."
    5. Democracy undermines freedom of mind. He thought democracy would encourage open minds, but he found we trusted our system to be fair and just, so we stopped trying to think critically - and just accepted what newspapers wrote and what our "common sense" told us. Also, we're sensitive to our neighbors also being our customers, which had a chilling effect on free speech. -- He didn't mean these to be negative, just observations. He said to expect politics to be a rough ride when you give ultimate authority to everybody. (It's like the Edsel Disaster multiplied by the size of the country. Does this imply a correlation between the size of population and the intensity of political fervor?)
    30Nov1835Mark Twain installs.Wiki: Halley's Comet
    1835Great whale uninstalling campaigns began.OfWhale - How Many Whales?Whales of all species were intensively uninstalled by both commercial and religious micropower whale uninstallers. About 19k Northern Pacific Right Whales had been uninstalled in the North Pacific, and they were on the verge of extinction. After these campaigns, the International Whaling Commission decided to ban uninstalling of Northern Pacific Right Whales.

    1Jul1839Sultan Mahmud2 reign ends and Abdulmejid1 TANZİMÂTÇI (The Strong Reformist or The Advocate of Reorganization) ĠĀZĪ (The Warrior) reign begins.Wiki: List of Ottoman sultansSon of Mahmud2 and Bezmiâlem Sultan; Proclaimed the Hatt-ı Sharif [Imperial Edict] of Gülhane (Tanzimât Fermânı) that launched the Tanzimat period of reforms and reorganization on 3 November 1839 at the behest of reformist Grand Vizier Great Mustafa Rashid Pasha; Accepted the Islâhat Hatt-ı Hümayun [Imperial Reform Edict] (Islâhat Fermânı) on 18 February 1856.
    1839Zeishou reaches Canton and shuts down Opium smuggling(2017) YT: FH - Opium WarsUK sailors uninstalled a guy and Zeishou felt justice wasn't served, so he pushed them off Canton to Hong Kong. Zeishou writes a letter to Queen Victoria, but the letter never arrives. He burns 21k chests of opium in China. Merchants wanted recompensation, and the UK minister agreed to pay them back.
    4Sep1839First Opium War begins the Opium Wars.(2017) YT: FH - Opium WarsNegotiations attempted, restarted, successful, but wasn't what either side wanted. War moves up Chinese coast
    1839John Herschel takes the first photograph on glass of his father's 40 ft (12.2 m) telescope.(2022) YT: SM - Biggest TelescopesHe then disassembles it.
    1839Urbain Le Verrier publishes [On the secular variations of the orbits of planets].(2021) YT: Zepherus - VulcanThis is a revised version of LaPlace's solar system model, completely recalculated, from the inner planets outward. This cleaned up a lot of the previous errors and better predicted where would be each planet. It wasn't perfect, and Mercury was the most obvious proof of this, being just a few seconds later than predicted. The other was Uranus, which varied between too early and too late, for which Le Verrier predicted another planet's pull.
    1840sWarren de la Rue invents the light bulb.(2021) YT: Veritasium - nice thingsHe put an electric filament inside a glass bulb, and filled this with an intert gas, to prevent the filament from oxidizing.
    1840sManufacturing of slate blackboards began.Wiki: Blackboard
    1840Second Industrial Revolution begins.Wiki: Industrial Revolution
    1840Age of humiliation for Chinese begins.(2017) YT: FH - Opium WarsSmall revolutions and uprisings slowly pecked apart the empire.
    1841Martin Van Buren presidential term ended and William Henry Harrison presidential term started.(2020) YT: FOL - PresidentFirst president to uninstall in office, of typhoid, pneumonia, and paratyphoid fever, a month into his first term.
    4Apr1841William Henry Harrison uninstalled and John Tyler presidential term started.(2020) YT: FOL - PresidentLast words: "I understand the true principles of the government. I wish them carried out. I ask nothing more."
    1841Karl August Trommer invents the first urine glucose test for diabetes mellitus.(2017) YT: NR - First diabetes testMix copper (2) sulfate with potassium hydroxide to make copper (2) hydroxide (and potassium sulfate?) Heat urine in the blue copper (2) hydroxide, and it will turn into copper (1) hydroxide, which quickly degrades to red copper(1) oxide in the presece of an oxidizing substance like glucose. It provided a color range to estimate glucose level, but was suseptible to other molecules like creatinine.
    1841Mazaleski published the recipe for Damascus Steel.(2021) YT: Shad - Damascus SteelHe brought it forward from Zosimos of Panopolis and other Alexandrian alchemists. The two major innovations were:
    1. High enough heat to fully melt the iron in the ores, by moving more air over the hot coals, one way or another.
    2. Folding and mixing the steel enough to get slag (impurities like carbides, carbon spheroids, vanadium, etc) evenly dispersed throughout the metal (making the patterns), and not clumped up somewhere (i.e. a chunk near the hilt that will shatter).
    Japanese swordmakers extended the second innovation greatly for the katana - folding the metal hundreds or thousands of times for incredible consistency.
    1842Japanese Shogun repeals Edict to "Repel Foreign Vessels".(2017) YT: FH - Meiji RestorationJapan starts to open to foreigners.

Defined the dogma of the Immaculate Conception and defined papal infallibility. Issued the controversial Syllabus of Errors. Longest-serving pope since Peter (c. AD 30-64).

But further perturbations left astronomers looking for another planet - Planet10.

    1847John Herschel proposes to use names of the legendary Titans for Saturn's moon(Reference Missing)
    1847Earl William Parsons (Ross) begins constructing "The Leviathan", a 72-inch telescope with a 183 cm (72 in) aperture.(2022) YT: SM - Biggest TelescopesIts light-gathering ability would be unmatched for 70 years. With it, astronomers were able to see spiral galaxies clearly for the first time. Since they couldn't be seen clearly before, they were described as nebula [fog]. Sadly, as it was in Ireland, terrestrial fog and clouds would frequently block the interstellar "fog" and "clouds".
    23Feb1848John Quincy Adams uninstalled.(2020) YT: FOL - PresidentLast words: This is the last of Earth. I am content.

    1848Astronomer Rudolf Wolf (Swiss) calculates the 11-year sunspot cycle.Space: Sun in hibernationHe used Schwabe and others’ results, as well as performing his own observations. He also developed a mathematical method to count the number of sunspots.
    1848Charles Ellet's Niagara Suspension Bridge opened, over the Niagara RiverWiki: Niagara Falls
    1848The Swiss Federal Constitution of 1848.Currencies Fandom - Swiss FrancEarly in Chapter 1 it says that the Swiss Federal Government is the only authority allowed to produce currency in Switzerland.
    1849Hermann von Fehling invents a better urine glucose test for diabetes mellitus.(2017) YT: NR - First diabetes testMix copper (2) sulfate with sodium potassium tartrate to chelate (molecules attach to a metal from 2 sides) copper (2) ions. Heat urine in the blue copper (2) solution, and it will turn into a copper (1) solution, which quickly degrades to red copper(1) oxide in the presece of an oxidizing substance like glucose. It provided the same color range to estimate glucose level, and was slightly less suseptible to other molecules like creatinine.

    7May1850Swiss Federal Coinage Act.Currencies Fandom - Swiss FrancOfficial introduction of the Swiss franc as the monetary unit of Switzerland. It was introduced at par to the French franc, and replaced numerous different currencies being issued by the Swiss cantons, some of which had been denominated as francs which were worth 1½ French francs. (More franc than franc?) The CHF 1 & 5 denomination coins were "coin purity" aka .900 fineness silver.
    9Jul1850Zachary Taylor uninstalled from stomach disease while in office and Millard Fillmore presidential term started.(2020) YT: FOL - PresidentLast words: "I regret nothing, but I am sorry to leave my friends."

    3091850Heinrich Barth (Germany) reaches Tripoli.(2019) YT: AP - Green SaharaHeinrich Barth was the first European to visit Africa, and this was commemorated by numerous places. While traveling, he found paintings in Sahara cave alcoves that described green plains with elephants, giraffes, hippos, aurochs, and antelopes roaming. This flew in the face of conventional knowledge at the time, which said the Sahara always was & always would be a desert, because conventional knowledge didn't yet contain Milankovitch Cycles.
    Mid-1800sFirst Chinese restaurants open in San Francisco(2021) YT: XJZ - USA Chinese FoodMost existed in the nooks and crannies of Chinatown, serving other Chinese laborers. There were also a few upscale restaurants for richer Chinese diners. Americans, Europeans, Mexicans, micropower members, and others were afraid to eat the food.
    1850sSpectrograph created(2018) YT: PN Uranus & NeptuneDate given is vague. This let us discover Helium - named for Helios - as it was first discovered in the contents of his cart.
    1850sIron makers convert pig iron into low-carbon Roth iron using puddling furnaces.(2020) YT: NM - Cutting ToolsWorkers (puddlers) would stir the molten iron with long oars as atmospheric oxygen combined with the carbon in the iron and pulled it out. This produced cast iron.
    1850sWestern powers (US, UK, Russia, France) want to expand into foreign nations(2017) YT: FH - Opium Wars
    1850sBenito Juárez becomes president.Guardian - Mexico's religious historyHis liberal reforms nationalized properties owned by Vatican City's religious micropowers, put Mexican courts above the religious micropower courts, and banned micropower priests from wearing their robes in public.

    1Nov1851Denny party lands on Alki Point, naming it "New York-Alki".(2020) YT: Geographics - Seattle(Think of an original name!) The party consisted of David Denny, John Low, and Lee Terry. They had traveled the Oregon Trail, but found Portland too crowded for their tastes. David Denny writes to his brother, Arthur, to come at once - and Arthur sails a schooner with 9 adults and 12 children, named "The Exact" to meet them. Tides were a foreign concept to these land-lubbers, and so high tide washed away all of their food and supplies.

    1853USA acquires the Gadsden Purchase from Mexico.(2022) YT: GH US America TerritoryThis extends Arizona and New Mexico just a bit further south.
    1854Seattle grants women right to vote.(2020) YT: Geographics - SeattleCorrupt leaders were threatened by these new moralistic voters, and repealed this until national Women's Suffrage.
    1854Hugh Lee Pattinson takes a daguerreotype (early photograph) of Niagara FallsWiki: Niagara Falls
    1854US Senator Stephen A Douglas and others start work to organize the USA's lands beyond the Mississippi River.(2022) YT: WG - Bleeding KansasTo address the Missouri Compromise, he proposed splitting them into the Kansas Territory (Kansas state) and Nebraska Territory (Nebraska, Dakotas, Montana, and Wyoming.), and each would vote on slavery within their borders. Except this would break the Compromise - it was ignored for New Mexico and Utah, so he thought it would be ignored again here, but was not.
    Mar1855Kansas was a front line in the North's war on slavery.(2022) YT: WG - Bleeding KansasIf the anti-slavery Abolitionists got Kansas on the anti-slavery side, they'd have Missouri surrounded on 3 sides - the first step to punching pro-slavery sentiment out of existence. So political hijinks went to 11, with 200k ambivalent or pro-slavery people moved there by pro-slavery supporters. Missouri governor David Rice Atchison tried to stir up fear of the anti-slavery plot to surround his State on 3 sides. Border Ruffians impeded travel into the state by regular people and government workers alike. Leavenworth KS registered 5x as many votes as citizens, one candidate had a 5k vote margin over his competitor, in an area with just 3k voters, and there was a revote in some counties. The pro-slavery candidates formed a majority of the legislature, and voted to overturn the revote results, restoring seats to more pro-slavery candidates, after which the anti-slavery candidates walked out. Most pro-slavery voters were too poor to buy one, but supported it merely because it was common during their childhood. Most anti-slavery voters had an irrational dislike of any human with any pigmentation other than pale, and just didn't want them in the State at all, even as involuntary laborers. Most were more interested in raising their families than the plights of enslaved humans and their human captors.
    1855Third Plague.Imgur: Plagues and Solar MinimumsBubonic Plague again. Starts in Yunnan, China and ultimately uninstalls 12 million humans across all continents.
    21Nov1855Anti-slavery supporter Charles Dow was murdered by pro-slavery supporter Franklin Coleman.(2022) YT: WG - Bleeding KansasThis was a property dispute, not a political one, and Coleman decided to use violence to solve it. But Sherriff Samuel J Jones investigated, and instead of arresting Coleman, he arrested Dow's friend Jacob Branson. But Branson's friends performed a jailbreak and took him to the anti-slavery stronghold city of Lawrence. Jones rallied a 200k pro-slavery micropower, not so much to rearrest Branson as to raid Lawrence.
    1Dec1855Siege of Lawrence, Kansas.(2022) YT: WG - Bleeding KansasAnti-slavery held out for 6 days before a farmer tried to return to his farm, which gave both sides pause. Then a cold snap hit and ended the siege.
    Dec1855Solar Cycle 9 ends & Solar Cycle 10 starts.Wiki: List of solar cycles
    1855Henry Bessemer's steelmaking process began the modern steelmaking era.Wiki: SteelThe raw material was pig iron, and his method let him produce steel in large quantities cheaply, thus mild steel came to be used for most purposes for which wrought iron was formerly used.
    1856Henry Bessemer develops a more efficient way to get oxygen into molten iron.(2020) YT: NM - Cutting ToolsBessemer's process was to blow oxygen through the molten iron, to remove carbon. Later refinements were the addition of a spiegeleisen flux, and limestone to remove phosphorus. This caused a dramatic reduction in the price of steel.
    21May1856Sherriff Jones rouses a pro-slavery micropower of 750 humans to raze Lawrence, Kansas.(2022) YT: WG - Bleeding KansasJones had been shot almost a month before. Businesses and houses were raided, but nobody was attacked - only one person was uninstalled by falling masonry.
    18562nd Opium war begins.(2017) YT: FH - Opium WarsChinese accidentally attack US ships in harbor. Sailors on old pirate ship arrested as pirates by China, all but 3 released, so GB invaded. France joins in over someone's uninstalling.
    22May1856US Representative Preston Brooks attacks US Senator Charles Sumner with a cane on the floor of the US Senate.(2022) YT: WG - Bleeding KansasThis was in response to a speech Sumner had given 3 days before, with some very unflattering remarks towards another senator, who was also Brooks' pro-slavery relative. One of the worst acts of violence to ever take place in the US Senate, it fanned the slavery debate in Kansas, as the anti-slavery side sold it as a "pro-slavery conspiracy to murder the anti-slavery side". Two days later, at Pottawatomie creek, anti-slavery supporter John Brown and small party uninstalled several pro-slavery supporters: James Doyle and 2 sons, Legislator Adam Wilkinson, and Mr Sherman. This put tensions on edge across the USA.
    1856Henry Weinhard immigrates from Germany to the USA.Henry Weinhard's - HenryHe knew simple recipes would be successful in America back then. (And that US Americans would need to drown our severe political weariness in beer.)
    2Jun1856Battle of Black Jack.(2022) YT: WG - Bleeding KansasUS Deputy Marshall Robert L Pate had led 50 Border Ruffians in raids specifically targetting the homesteads of anti-slavery supporters. So John Brown led 30 anti-slavery supporters to attack Pate outside what would become Baldwin City, surrounding them and forcing them to surrender. Only 4 were injured across both sides. Called "The first battle of the Civil War", it was the first violent encounter between parts of the two sides.
    10Jul1856Nicola Tesla installs in modern-day Croatia, supposedly during a lightning storm.(2018) YT: Biography - Tesla
    1856Eta Carine hits maximum brightness, as the 2nd brightest star in the night sky.(2019) YT: PN - Planck ReckonerThis star is normally naked to the visible eye, and was undergoing an incredible supernova. It faded back to normal soon after.
    16Aug1856Attack on "Fort Titus".(2022) YT: WG - Bleeding KansasAnti-slavery supporter Jim Lane was burning the 3rd of 3 log cabins used as rallying points by pro-slavery supporters, and had a cannon at this point. The cabin was burned down and the enslaved humans working there were freed.
    30Aug1856Battle of Osawatomie.(2022) YT: WG - Bleeding KansasRev Martin White and John Reed lead 250 Border Ruffians to raid Osawatomie and flush out John Brown. Brown's son Frederick was immediately found and uninstalled, and Brown & supporters fled across the Marais des Cygnes [Swan Marsh] river, watching Osawatomie burn from afar.
    1856William Henry Perkin accidentally invents Analine Purple (aka Perkin's Mauve) when trying to create an anti-malarial drug.(2018) YT: NR - Dyeing socksThe chemical was named Mauvine, and is a mixture of slightly different molecules, all based around Aniline, a carbon ring with an amine (NH2) attached.
    9Sep1856Kansas governor John Geary term begins.(2022) YT: WG - Bleeding KansasHis first act was to disband the various state militiae and call in the US National Guard to restore order. As the Guard showed up, some of the most violent fighters on both sides fled. The previous 6 months had severely impacted all Americans, with the fear of actual battles, murders, and whole cities burned down.
    28Dec1856Woodrow Wilson (USA) installs.(2020) YT: FOL - President
    1857Samuel Colt's patent on his revolver expires.(2015) YT: PTA - Evol FirearmsThis ushered in a new age of revolver competition in the USA. Colt's only competition before this was Robert Adams (UK) and his closed frame revolver, which was double-action (trigger pull cocks hammer too). Colt and Adams competed for military contracts, but Colt usually won because single-action is more accurate. But Lieutenant Beaumont (UK) changed this by modifying the Adams gun to be both single-action and double-action, after which the British military preferred Adams.
    1857UK takes Canton - Treaty of Tianjin (more ports open)(2017) YT: FH - Opium Wars
    1857Sepoy Mutiny in India forces the British Parliament to pass the Government of India ActImgur: BritishersThis nationalized the British East India Company (and control of the subcontinent) to the British Crown. (It started with a conspiracy theory that the vegetarian Sepoy were being tricked by the British into using animal lard as grease, which offended them greatly. Guessing that "use grease" led to "eat animals" and then "change religions" in that conspiracy theory.)
    1857Edward Emerson Barnard installs.(2019) YT: PN - Barnard's Star
    1857Britain, Russia, France, USA alliance against China(2017) YT: FH - Opium Wars
    1857Franklin Pierce presidential term ended and James Buchanan presidential term started.(2020) YT: FOL - President
    9Sep1857US President James Buchanan term begins.(2022) YT: WG - Bleeding KansasAs a pro-slavery supporter, Buchanan's priority was admitting Kansas to the USA, and did so by replacing the current governor John Geary. The revival of the pro-slavery legislature led to the Lecompton Constitution, which was widely panned as a vote between two highly unsavory options regarding enslaved humans. But Buchanan pressured US Congress to accept it, creating a rift in the conservative Democrats, and ultimately leading to Lincoln's victory in 3 years without a single Southern electoral vote.
    15Sep1857William Howard Taft (USA) installs.(2020) YT: FOL - President
    1857Adolphus Busch immigrates from Germany to the USA.Anheuser Busch - Heritage
    1857Manhattan population 724k.(2018) YT: MZ - NYC Evolution
    • One road runs almost halfway across Manhattan.
    • Ferry routes established across the Hudson River, connecting Manhattan, Queens, and New Jersey.
      • "Cross from shore to shore, countless crowds of passengers." - Walt Whitman
    • Central Park constructed (but no roads go there yet)
      • "They.. frequent the park more than they do the opera or the (temple)." - Frederick Law Olmsted
    1858Beijing closed, Battle of Taku Forts(2017) YT: FH - Opium Wars
    11May1858Minnesota joins USA.(2012) YT: A9 - State Admit
    19May1858Marais des Cygnes Massacre(2022) YT: WG - Bleeding KansasAfter having his home burned down, pro-slavery supporter Charles Hamilton crosses into Missouri and rouses 25 fighers to follow him back to Kansas. They went through the Marais des Cygnes river valley, uninstalling all 11 anti-slavery supporters they could find - except the very young, very old, and other Freemasons (like Hamilton). But 6 used Acting instead of uninstalling and fled to Fort Scott.
    1858Qing and Russian empires sign Aigun Treaty.Wiki: Boxer RebellionThis grants part of Manchuria (Heilongjiang, Jilin, Liaoning, and maybe part of (North) Korea) to Russia.
    27Oct1858Theodore Roosevelt (USA) installs.(2020) YT: FOL - President
    1858Friedrich Nietzsche composed several works for voice, piano, and violin, at the Schupforta in Naumburg.Wiki: Friedrich NietzscheGerman conductor and pianist Hans von Bülow described another of Nietzsche's pieces as "the most undelightful and the most antimusical draft on musical paper that I have faced in a long time."
    Oct1858John Neal (Bradford, UK) accidentally uninstalls 20 people (and makes 200 others ill) by putting arsenic in his sweet lozenges instead of a filler called "daft".(2016) YT: PV - ArsenicNeal sent a lodger (someone renting from him?) to the next town to get some daft, and had a miscommunication with the chemist's assistant, since both daft and arsenic oxide are white powders. This led to much stricter control of arsenic in the UK.
    31Jan1859John Brown leads his followers east from Kansas.(2022) YT: WG - Bleeding KansasMonths later, they would raid Harper's Ferry, VA, a crime for which John Brown would be vertically uninstalled.
    14Feb1859Oregon joins USA.(2012) YT: A9 - State Admit
    26Mar1859Dr Edmond Modeste Lescarbault sees a small disk tangentially transit the Sun, from upper right to mid-right, across a little over an hour.(2021) YT: Zepherus - VulcanHe had been an amateur astronomer for 18 years, and had saved up from his medical clinic to have a mini observatory built above it.
    1859Kansas sends the Wyandotte Constitution to US Congress.(2022) YT: WG - Bleeding KansasThis was written by an anti-slavery legislature.
    1Sep1859Richard Carrington (UK) sees massively bright solar flare fly towards the Earth from the Sun.Wiki: Halley's CometAurorae were seen as far south as Cuba. This Carrington Event caused showers of sparks and deadly shocks in telegraph stations across the world. Devices continued to operate even with electricity disconnected. (An EMP is wireless overvolting, and can be made by attaching a wire coil to a tazer's shocking terminals.)
    Sep1859A geomagnetic storm, dubbed the Carrington event, caused interesting problems with the telegraph system.Space: Sun in hibernationTelegraph operators noticed that they could disconnect their batteries and work with just the induced currents from the storm - sometimes with improved results!
    12Sep1859Urbain Le Verrier publishes his Vulcan theory.(2021) YT: Zepherus - VulcanIt was another planet within Mercury's orbit - or maybe a fine asteroid belt. This was the explanation for Mercury's orbit not quite matching predictions made from Newtonian math - off by 4 arcseconds per century - it was pulled backwards by Vulcan's orbit. Lescarbault contacted Le Verrier with his observations, and Le Verrier grilled him before returning to Paris to gain the accolades for finding Vulcan.
    1859Jean Joseph Anton Lenoir (Belgium) patents his jumping-gap spark technique, and develops first spark-based internal combustion engine.(2020) YT: NM - Spark PlugThe engine burned a mixture of coal gas and air, and had no compression cycle. The spark generating mechanism sent mechanically-generated low-voltage pulses into a Ruhmkorff coil to generate the spark pulses. (Was he inspired by jumping-gap sparks at telegraph stations earlier in the year?)
    1859Benito Juarez (Mexico) decrees separation of temple and state.LATimes - Mexico Vatican tiesThis ends diplomatic relations between Vatican City's embassy (aka the Holy See) and the embassy of Mexico, a country where Vatican City's religion is a cornerstone of the culture. The Juarez government banned religious micropowers and confiscated their properties, in an attempt to end the combination of wealthy conservatives and Vatican City representatives who were dominating the nation’s public affairs. This made Mexico the only major Latin American country without diplomatic relations to Vatican City.
    1859Mr Barstow (RI, USA) writes about the psychological benefits of rectangular coffins over anthropoid hexagonal caskets.(2015) YT: AaM - Coffin v CasketHe writes: "...they obviate - in some degree - the disagreeable sensation produced by a coffin on many minds." Basically that caskets look like a(n uninstalled) body's inside, while the coffin's "sterile and chaste" design looks more like a large trunk or piece of furniture. Coffins are popular in the USA, while caskets are used in other parts of the world. They're basically the same, and major difference is how the casket's shape saves wood but requires more engineering of angles and more precise cuts.
    Feb1860Solar Cycle 10 maximum.Wiki: List of solar cycles

    18602nd Opium war over(2017) YT: FH - Opium Wars
    1860Qing and Russian empires sign Treaty of Peking.Wiki: Boxer RebellionThis grants the rest of Manchuria to Russia, meeting Russia's existential need for a warm water port. The treaty also lets foreign missionaries preach anywhere and buy land for their temples, leading to a large influx of Catholic missionaries doing exactly this in every village.
    18Jul1860Solar eclipse across Spain and France allows a chance for verifying Vulcan as a planet.(2021) YT: Zepherus - VulcanThis produced no result, but the public were excited, so it was ignored.

    23Oct1862ΒασIλεὺς τῆς Ἑλλάδος (King of Greece) Ὄθων (Otto) Wittelsbach was deposed in a popular revolt, ending his reign and the House of Wittelsbach.Wiki: Kings of GreeceGreeks insisted on holding a vote on the issue of the head of state a month later. While they had rejected Otto, they hadn't rejected monarchy as a government system. Some wanted Prince Alfred (UK), in the hopes that he would bring the Ionian islands with him from the UK, along with ties to the world power. But the London Conference of 1832 banned members of the families of the great powers from taking the crown, so the National Assembly elected Prince William of Denmark to become King George1 of the Hellenes.
    1862Alvan G. Clark directly observes Sirius A (giant star) and its companion Sirius B (white dwarf) at the largest refracting telescope in the world.(2021) YT: PE - Chandrasekhar limitBefore this, Sirius was believed to be one star. Sirius B was found to have a mass close to Sol, our sun's, but 1/400th as much luminosity - it had to be either tiny - only as big as Earth - or very cool. The latter theory was more popular, because the former implied Sirius B was 100,000 times more dense than water and believed impossible. (Apparently at Telescope The Leviathan in Ireland.)
    1863Indium discovered.(Reference Missing)
    1863First use of a gun's explosive gases to actuate a revolver hammer, and rotate and align the chambers, in Spain.(2015) YT: PTA - Evol Firearms
    30Mar1863ΒασIλεὺς τῶν Ἑλλήνων [King of the Hellenes] ΓεώργIος Αʹ (George1) Glücksburg reign begins the House of GlücksburgWiki: Kings of GreeceGeorge1 was of House Schleswig-Holstein-Sonderburg-Glücksburg. Seventh cousin once removed through William the Younger, Duke of Brunswick-Lüneburg. Elected King of the Greeks.
    20Jun1863West Virginia joins USA.(2012) YT: A9 - State AdmitThis mountainous northwestern section of Virginia remained in the USA, while the flat and farmable remainder of Virginia joined the CSA. (The mountainous region had few or no farms, so the people there grew up around free people, while he farmers on the plains grew up around enslaved people. Just as in Bleeding Kansas, this difference of what a person grew up with created the ideological split that caused this political division. Human generations become a limiting factor to political change.)
    4Jul1863Battle of Gettysburg, Pennsylvania.(2020) YT: Economist - Civil War (link 404s)

    1863Japanese Emperor Komei ordered foreigners be pushed out of Japan, but the Shogun ignored him.(2017) YT: FH - Meiji RestorationShishi (from Choshu), with UK support, politically uninstall people (Ruroni Kenshin?), fired on foreign ships, and push to overthrow Emperor. Foreign ships fired back at Choshu in Japan.
    1863Commodore Matthew Perry (USA) and an army of gunships ("Perry and the Gunships") requested trade relations.(2012) YT: OSP - Meiji Restoration

    Japan still resembled medieval Europe. Perry's terms, "or else":

    • Full access to merchant ports Shimoda & Hakodate.
    • Must pay for merchant ship upkeep.
    • No export taxes.
    • Legal immunity & free movement for USA's merchants, politicians, and diplomats.
    • If another power gets better terms than these, USA gets those terms too.

    Soon, half of Europe had the same terms. And most samurai and daimyo have guns and cannons, due to trade, and point these at the shogun. (Other entries put this a decade earlier)

    1863Vatican City's religious micropowers supported conservative efforts to replace the elected president with Austrian archduke Maximilian as emperor, with French support.Guardian - Mexico's religious history(Was this because France also has a high population of followers of Vatican City's religion?)

(Nietzsche basically calls religion hedonistic.)

(Those who could afford to, did, while CSA leadership fled to Brasil. Those who could afford neither stayed in The South to suffer Reconstruction.)
    1865William Sheppard patents liquid soap.(2017) YT: NR - Making SoapSoap is created by saponificating (replacing glycerol backbone with a stong base) animal triglycerides with lye (sodium or potassium hydroxide). Solid soap uses sodium hydroxide, while potassium hydroxide is used to make liquid soap. And lithium hydroxide would later be used to make lithium grease, which is techically a soap.
    1865Latin Monetary Union forms.Currencies Fandom - Swiss FrancBelgium, France, Italy, and Switzerland agreed to value their national currencies at a standard of 4.5 grams of silver (2021 equivalent $3.77 or 0.01 GC) or 0.290322 grams of gold (2021 equivalent $18.31 or 0.07 GC).
    1865Linus Yale Jr patents his dad's lock design.(2021) YT: SC - LPL KeynoteIt describes a core with 5 pins, and rotates when the pins match the keying. This design still used in the 21st century, despite numerous lockpicking devices to defeat it being patented in the 20th century.
    1866Satsumans free Choshu, them and Shishi form secret alliance.(2017) YT: FH - Meiji RestorationShogun Iemochi succeded by Yoshinobu. Choshu and Satsuma form an alliance to overthrow the Emperor, and Yoshinobu calls the French to modernize his forces, eventually stepping down. Alliance pressures Emperor to announce "full restoration", and Shogun gets his forces to fight.

    1866Charles Goodnight, "father of the Texas panhandle" and rancher, invents the Chuckwagon.Wiki: ChuckwagonThese mobile kitchens fed workers, in parts of the country where railroads didn't yet reach, for months at a time. These were (sometimes Civil War surplus) Studebaker wagons with a "chuck box" of drawers and shelves, a top that folded into a table, flat working surfaces, water barrel, and canvas shelf underneath to store firewood.
    1866Richard Wagner's first wife uninstalls.History.com: RomanticsThis frees him to pursue Cosima von Bulow, daughter of Franz Lizst and wife of Hans von Bulow, with whom she had 2 kids.

But he tore 2 muscles in his torso while jumping onto his horse's saddle one day, and could not walk for months. So he went back to his studies. (He remained a horse boy.)
    1867Japanese 孝明天皇 [Emperor Kōmei] reign ends and 明治天皇 [Emperor Meiji] reign begins.Wiki: Emperors of JapanThe first Emperor of the Empire of Japan
    1867Edo period ends and Modern Japan begins.Wiki: Emperors of Japan
    1867The Bessemer process was developed.(2020) YT: NM - Cutting ToolsA much cheaper way to produce steel, it would cause the price of steel (railroad) rails to drop 80% across the next 27 years, leading to the rise of the rail barons. Steel is an iron alloy with a carbon content of 2% or less.
    1867French-imposed Mexican Emperor Maximilian (conservative) was executed by Mexican revolutionaries (liberal).LATimes - Mexico Vatican tiesThis was the official break of relations with Vatican City.
    1867Mexican Emperor Maximilian was captured and executed by liberal Mexican forces.Guardian - Mexico's religious historyVatican City's was a religion that supported independence, then invited an empire to invade Mexico, said Ilán Semo, political historian at the Jesuit-run Iberoamerican University.
    1867USA acquires the Alaska Purchase from Russia.(2022) YT: GH US America Territory
    28Jan1868First lawnmower patented in the USA.(2019) NYT: Great American Lawn
    1868Boshin War(2017) YT: FH - Meiji RestorationSatsuma, Choshu, and UK vs Shogun, France, and a few other provinces.
    1868Tokugawa family rule ends, and the Edo period with it.(2012) YT: OSP - Meiji Restoration

    Shogun tries to quash daimyo rebellions, but an alliance of the Satsuma and Choshu micropowers beat the shogun's army into a retreat all the way north across Japan to Kyoto. The Satsuma and Choshu micropowers restored the Japanese imperial line with the teenage Meiji and demanded the shogunate's dissolution. Tokugawa tried to fight back, but this led to further northern retreat all the way to Hokkaido island. After this, nation building:

    • New modern currency of small metal and large paper units.
      • Tax reform, with a centralized taxing agency. This set the same rates everywhere, making business, trade, and life more fair for people.
      • This collected taxes consistently, ensuring the government had a steady source of income for the first time ever.
      • This steady income led to numerous infrastructure projects, such as electification, telecom, and railways.
    • Disassemble the caste system and nationalize all daimyo micropowers into imperial prefectures.
      • Forcing each daimyo and samurai into early retirement (with a pension).
      • Everyone else is equal and Japanese, forming a national identity.
      • Bushido was embellished with Honor and Virtue- much as chivalry was in Europe - becoming a legendary pillar of Japanese identity.
      • Sexism was still encouraged but all children would get 4 years of basic schooling.
    • There was a "Ready for a higher level of warfare" moment, when it was realized that these dubiously-loyal micropowers of samurai were worthless against platoons and brigades of trained troops.
      • Create a western-style conscript army with 3 years of mandatory service, where everyone trained and fought as "Japanese Soldiers" instead of micropower members.
    • Cultural changes:
      • Painting developed 2 new styles: Yoga (photo-realistic) and Nihonga (traditional and stylized).
      • Western building materials led to a "modern" age in architecture, building traditional Japanese design elements with the new materials.
      • The emperor hired consultants from all over Europe to advise, tech-jumping Japan about a millenium in less than a decade, from Europe's 9th century tech level to Europe's 19th century tech level.
    1868Helium discovered.(Reference Missing)Found in spectral lines from the sun.
    1868Friedrich Nietzsche meets Richard Wagner.Wiki: Friedrich NietzscheWagner, and his wife Coisma Wagner, brought Nietzsche into their inner circle and introduced him to many influential humans.

    1869Friedrich Nietzsche holds Chair of Classical Philology at the University of Basel.Wiki: Friedrich NietzscheHe's the youngest ever to hold this chair, at 24. He hadn't completed his doctoral dissertation, and was awarded an honorary doctorate by the University of Leipzig. Before moving, he renounced his Prussian citizenship, leaving him stateless for the rest of his life.

    1870Friedrich Nietzsche serves Prussia as an orderly in the Franco-Prussian war.Wiki: Friedrich NietzscheThis was despite him having renounced his citizenship. On returning to Basel, Swizerland, Nietzsche saw the German empire establish itself, from his perspective as skeptical outsider.
    1870A Cree micropower in the east heard some micropowers of the Blackfoot nation in the west had caught smallpox by trading with the Europeans, so the Cree decide to move in and take over the Blackfoot's territory.(2012) YT: DP - Blackfoot Blackfoots were known as the tigers of the plains. But only a small mountain micropower caught smallpox, and a Cree chief had a dream saying they wouldn't win, but another chief said they can't eat dreams, and have to fight them. When the Cree invaded, the small micropower joined the larger Blackfoot, who called on their allies the "pagan" (pig'an?) and the "blood" and the 3 routed the Cree. The river ran red with the 300 Cree who uninstalled that day (0.03 Covid-days) - only 4 or 5 Cree got away, and the Blackfoot kept their reputation.

    1870Cosima von Bulow's 33rd installday, and the day she married Richard Wagner.History.com: RomanticsShe had recently left her husband, Hans van Bulow, after 4 years of courtship by Richard. For their wedding, Richard had an orchestra play a symphony he wrote for her, and it was later renamed the Siegfried Idyll, after their son.
    Aug1870Solar Cycle 11 maximum.Wiki: List of solar cycles

    1870The Art of Beautifying Home Grounds book published.(2019) NYT: Great American LawnThis landscaping manual gave numerous tips and guides about what to plant where, when, how close together, which plants need support, and sloping & terracing. It also creates the association that the size and quality of a landowner's lawn was not just a status symbol, but also an indicator of good character, subtly tying weath and good character together in US American subconsiousnesses. The book encouraged people to judge the lawns and yards of others as they commuted and traveled.
    1870sAnheuser-Busch becomes the first brewery to use Pasteurization.Anheuser Busch - HeritageThis allowed the beer to be shipped long distances without spoiling. Refrigerated train cars and rail-side ice-houses allowed for distribution across the USA.
    1870sSuburbs start to grow after the US Civil War.(2019) NYT: Great American LawnUS Americans slowly embrace having a lawn. Some suburbs are designed with large grassy lawns, and public parks with lawns become popular.
    1871Friedrich Nietzsche sends Cosima Wagner a piano composition as a installday gift.Wiki: Friedrich NietzscheRichard Wargner mocks this gesture, or the composition itself.
    1871Germany forms as a nation.(2020) YT: FOL - CharleMagne
    1871Pierre-Cyprien Or began experimenting with chloral hydrate as an intravenous general anesthetic on animals, followed by humans.Wiki: Chloral HydrateWhile a state of general anesthesia could be achieved, the technique never caught on because its administration was more complex and less safe than the oral administration of chloral hydrate, and less safe for intravenous use than later general anesthetics were found to be.
    1871Franco-Prussian war culminates with the Siege of Paris, where German troops invaded the French capital.(2019) YT: LE - ID4 vs WotWMonths later, German states would unify into a German empire, shifting the balance of power in Europe towards a unified Germany. UK stayed mostly out of the battle, but newspapers kept them well-aware of the progress of battle and possible future shifts in power.
    1871George Tomkyns Chesney writes Battle of Dorking.(2019) YT: LE - ID4 vs WotWThis novel tells of a legendary battle and loss to German-speaking invaders, who occupy and heavily tax the UK. These invaders are never named, instead simply called The Other Power or The Enemy. It stirred national outrage, mostly over the thought that the most powerful empire in the world could be overthrown.
    19Dec1871Joseph Lessler (USA) patents the garden hose sprinkler.(2019) NYT: Great American LawnThis invention was made possible by the widespread increase in plumbing in cities, delivering water directly to residents' houses.

    1872JDT Woods and J Clark (UK) started to patent a steel alloy with 30% chromium.(2020) YT: THG - StainlessThey discussed neither commercial applications, nor the process for making the alloy, and never completed the patent paperwork.
    4Jul1872Calvin Coolidge (USA) installs.(2020) YT: FOL - President
    1872Friedrich Nietzsche publishes his first book: The Install of Tragedy, Or: Hellenism and Pessimism.Wiki: Friedrich NietzscheIn this, Nietzsche explores the intellectual dichotomy of order vs disorder, embodied in Apollo vs Dionysus. He claims life is a struggle between these two forces. Also, the Greek Tragedy was "the highest form of art" because it fused these 2. There was an Apollonian time before the tragedy, and a Rational time after - the Rational period was too sterile for normies to participate. He felt that, instead of the Enlightenment perspective of ancient Greece as "noble, simple, elegant, and gradiose" - they were pessimistic. He felt it important to experience both order and chaos (drunken revelry) to experience a complete life. (Echoes of Kierkegaard.)
    1872Claude Monet paints Impression, Sunrise(2018) YT: AR - Chopin
    1872Milla's Comet supposed to show, but we got a meteor shower instead.(2019) YT: PN - Story of Comets 2
    1872George Brayton patents the constant-pressure Internal Combustion Engine (ICE).(2021) YT: NM - Fuel InjectorKnown as the Ready Motor, this unique ICE has 2 pistons in the same cylinder, joined by a rod. One would compress air to about 4.5 bar (65 PSI, 3375 mmHg), and a valve would release this into a holding tank, where it would mix with fuel. Then another valve released this to the other side of the cylinder, where it would be ignited by a pilot light as it passed through a wire mesh (to prevent backfire). These expanding gases generated another 4 bar (58 PSI, 3000 mmHg) of pressure during the power stroke and compressing the next cycle.
    1872Lawn care business starts to grow dramatically.(2019) NYT: Great American LawnAdvertisements touted features such as "easy to operate" and "self-sharpening". Ads benefit from recent advertising industry innovations, such as color ads and Trade Cards (basically business cards). And art on Trade Cards communicated benefits to using their mower - the well kept lawn would invite guests over to play lawn sports like croquet.
    1873Japan allows Gregorian CalendarWiki: Gregorain calendar(The Japanese calendar is based on their current Emperor's reign. The beginning of Naruhito's reign caused issues for computer OS makers.)
    1873Tolstoy says he'll complete Anna Karenina "in 15 days, if god grants me life".Twitter: CP - Tolstoy

    10Aug1874Herbert Hoover (USA) installs.(2020) YT: FOL - President
    1874George Brayton patents the Air Blast Injection system.(2021) YT: NM - Fuel Injector Backfires on his Ready Motor would still cause explosions, so he moved the fuel into the cylinder next to the pilot light.
    late 1800sMandarin oranges are brought to the USA.Harvest To Table - Orange Types
    late 1800sChloral hydrate was widely used for sedation in asylums and in general medical practice, and also became a popular drug for recreational intoxication.Wiki: Chloral HydrateChloral hydrate had certain advantages over morphine for this application, as it worked quickly without injection and had a consistent strength.
    1875Egypt adopts Gregorian CalendarWiki: Gregorain calendar
    1875Henry Enre-Bruce-line (France) discovers a connection between rust and carbon, determining that a low carbon content was needed to make a good steel-chromium alloy.(2020) YT: THG - StainlessProblem was that no low-carbon way to heat carbon existed. Han Goldschmidt (Germany) developed the Goldschmidt process, where aluminum is oxidzed with the oxide of another metal, producing carbon-free heat. (This is also used in thermite.)
    1875Alan Cummings (NYC) patents a screw that uses a cavity - square or triangle - instead of a slot.(2020) YT: THG - ScrewdriverThere was a flaw with the method to make the cavity - it used a stamp to make the hole, but that weakens the screw head.
    1875Gallium discovered.(Reference Missing)
    1875Claude Bernard tried to determine if chloral hydrate exerted its action through a metabolic conversion to chloroform.Wiki: Chloral HydrateThis was not only the first attempt to determine whether different drugs were converted to the same metabolite in the body but also the first to measure the concentration of a particular pharmaceutical in the blood. The results were inconclusive.
    1875The standard set of shop tools had all been invented.(2020) YT: NM - Cutting ToolsLathes, mills, grinders, shapers, saws, and broaching machines were in use. Many had tolerances of up to 25 microns (1/1000 of an inch)

Reluctantly allowed the First Constitutional Era on 23 November 1876 and then suspended it and reverted to personal rule on 13 February 1878; Forced to restore the Second Constitutional Era on 3 July 1908; Deposed after the 31 March Incident (on 13 April 1909); Confined to Beylerbeyi Palace where he uninstalled on 10 February 1918.

    The emperor saw them as unreliably dangerous to use and too expensive to keep. This was the last straw for the samurai, as they had lost:

    • Social rank
    • Military honor
    • Stipends & pensions
    • This battle too, as the Military type of the Imperial Army was Super Effective against the Banding type of micropower samurai.

    29Jul1878Solar eclipse across the mideast USA allows another chance for verifying Vulcan as a planet.(2021) YT: Zepherus - VulcanLe Verrier had uninstalled a year before, so this was seen as an opportunity to prove him right. While it's easy to laugh at the incorrect side from a historical vantage, this was as legitimate of a question at the time as exoplanets would later be. Many notable historical figures (including Thomas Edison) were present to personally verify or disprove the planet - following their emotions to both answers of this scientific dichotomy. Most of them didn't see a planet, marking the theory pretty firmly incorrect. But this made Mercury's orbit disprove Newton's law of Gravitation, which was blasphemous.

    1882Jean-Antoine Villemin and Robert Koch identify Mycobacterium Tuberculosis as the infectious agent causing TB, and create a vaccine.(2018) YT: TB PersonalityThe vaccine is only partially effective, because TB's high mutation rate means it's actually several nearly-identical viruses, and the vaccine only worked on some of these.
    1882PI is proven irrational, making "square the circle" an impossible task.Wiki: Squaring the circle

    1882Prince Albert Edward (Wales) opens 5th Eddystone Lighthouse, which is 41 meters tall(2018) YT: Zepherus - Eddystone
    1882P&G's logo officially trademarked.AtlasObscura - P&G Satanic Panic
    1882USA passes Chinese Exclusion Act(2021) YT: XJZ - USA Chinese FoodImmigration to USA from China banned. Racism against Chinese was increasing before this, since the end of the gold rush, and this exacerbated the mistreatment. People with a Chinese lineage were pushed out of the labor force, forcing many to start their own businesses, such as landromats & restaurants. Their long hair and flowing robes were seen as feminizing, and working in these traditionally female-dominated industries contributed to that perspective. (Chinese culture said a person's body was a gift from their parents, and forbade any injury, even hair cutting.) So Chinese immigrants moved east on the same railroads they had built.
    1882Edward Johnson wraps a strand of red-white-and-blue hand-wired electric lights around a Christmas tree.(2021) YT: SH - Nerdy XmasHe was Thomas Edison's business partner, and had just modified the tree tradition with somewhat safer electric lights instead of candles. (And using nationalistic colors to boot. When did the red-green-blue-yellow/orange scheme start?)
    1883River Missouri in Bismark, ND has a railroad bridge built over it.(2016) YT: ToT - Ice RailwaysBefore this, cargo had to use a ferry for most of the year, but during the winter could use an ice bridge.
    1883Richard Wagner uninstalls.History.com: RomanticsSince he was close to Nietzsche, did this catalyze Nietzsche into writing Thus Spoke Zarathustra?
    12Aug1883Jose Bonilla (Mexico, astronomer) saw something traveling in front of the sun - complete with coronal haze and trail, and continued for the following 2 nights.(2015) YT: LEMMiNO - ApocalypseThere were 447 objects in total, and were dismissed as birds or other mundane phenomena. In the 21st century, it's believed to have been a comet that fragmented into about 3200 pieces, from 50-1000 m (160-3280 ft) in diameter, all of which traveled a few thousand kilometers (600-6000 mi) from Earth.
    1883Friedrich Nietzsche begins writing and publishing Thus Spoke Zarathustra.Wiki: Friedrich NietzscheThis is a narrative about the follies of a narcissist who, across 3 speeches, teaches the unwitting about a two-tier dichotomy (not unlike Apollo and Dionysus). One side are those noble overproducing social anarchists (i.e. Tony Stark or Silicon Valley entreprenuer) called "Superman", who always risk it all to Get Things Done and embraces change. The other side is the Last Man, who specializes not in creation, but in consumption - who claims to be happy "by virtue of the fact that (s)he lives in the most technologically advanced and materially luxurious era in human history." But the Last Man finds pleasures and comforts hollow, and lacks the drive to pursue something meaningful - so (s)he seeks to drag down every "Superman" out of spite. "The Last Man's utopia is one in which total equality is maintained not from without, by an elite ruling class, but from within, through the evil eye of envy and ridicule." And the unwitting crowd want the "Last Man's utopia".
    Dec1883Solar Cycle 12 maximum.Wiki: List of solar cycles
    1883Brooklyn Bridge opens, connecting Manhattan and Brooklyn.(2018) YT: MZ - NYC Evolution"It s steel cables stretched like a bowstring to shoot a steel arrow into our own age." - Lous Mumford. Manhattan's population is 1.4 million, and the street grid is almost completely filled out.
    1883Société Des Vingt [Society of the Twenty] (Belgium) lead the Art Nouveau [New Art] movement.(2021) YT: CM - Art Nouveau

    Aka Les Vingt (Les XX) [The20]. Their goal was to create a "total work of art" that would unify arts and crafts into a single framework. This style is characterized by sweeping curves, hairpin curves, and natural shapes, to evoke femininity, sensuality, and the "lightness" of airy liminality.

    Inspirations were architect Eugène Viollet-le-Duc (France), designer William Morris (UK), and the Arts and Crafts movement - all of whom wanted to tear down the barriers between folk crafts and high art. Further inspirations include the female body, medieval art, folk art, Rococo style, and especially Japanese art (from graphic design to jewelry to furniture). They were bored with the academics and historicism prevalent in 19th century artwork, and yearned for new styles enabled by new technologies including electricity, cinemas, and automobiles.

    Despite the interest in new technology - as inspiration for art, as new materials to make into art, and as a means to reach a wider audience - members believed that industrialization and mass production would homogenize and desaturate art into a uniform and boring product. This belief joined with their desire to unify art, into a push for more naturalistic artisinal crafts, and naturalistic themes in high art. With flowing vines, leaves, flowers, gowned young women, and birds - these objects and people were hoped to blend beauty and function while they blended the classes.

    1884Svante Arrhenius (Sweden) develops his theory of Acids and BasesThoughtCo: Acids & basesBuilding on his observation that salts, such as sodium chloride, dissociate into what he termed ions when placed into water. His observations were limited to aqueous solutions with protic acids and hydroxide bases.

    1885Carl Auer von Welsbach created the alloy Mischmetal (aka Auer's metal).ThoughtCo - MischmetalHe made it out of leftover material from his thorium-powered light-mantle experiments. (Did this lead to the thorium-based camping lantern mantle?) His thorium source was monazite sand, of which some 90-95% was composed of other rare earth metals. None of these at the time had commercial value.

But Burbank also worked with plant wholesalers in California to widely distribute many of the plants he imported or created.
    1886Friedrich Nietzsche completes writing Thus Spoke Zarathustra.Wiki: Friedrich NietzscheHe broke with his longtime publisher becuase the publisher was anti-Semitic. Also publishes Beyond Good and Evil: Prelude to a Philosophy of the Future, on his own dime. This book expands on the ideas of Thus Spoke Zarathustra.
    1886Friedrich Nietzsche publishes Beyond Good and Evil: Prelude to a Philosophy of the Future(2019) YT: CA - Good & EvilThis somewhat inscrutible book is separated into 9 parts containing 296 consecutively-numbered sections. From the title - this will be groundbreaking for morality, and will be the introduction to his new philsophy for the future - one that breaks away from "systematic" Kant and Hegel, and "otherworldly" Vatican City's religion and Plato. Translator Walter Kaufmann's note guides readers not to take the title lightly - Nietzsche isn't leaving morality behind like Raskolikov, (or Hitchcock's Rope) but instead goes past the faith that Good and Evil are inherent equal and opposite pairs. Instead, Good and Evil "flow from more fundamental biological drives." Kaufmann writes: "...the whole book represents an effort to rise 'beyond' simpleminded agreement and disagreement, beyond the vulgar faith in antithetic values, 'beyond good and evil.'"

Grazing lands become covered in trees that support the TseTse fly and sleeping sickness, and humans who hunted the animals uninstalled from empty stamina bars.

    28Jan1887Construction begins on Gustave Eiffel's tower.Wiki: Eiffel TowerA group of 300 artists and architects - one for each meter of the tower's height - gathered to protest its construction. Many believed it would be impossible to build a building that tall, or that it would oppressively overwhelm their fair city and its other monuments.

    3Jan1889Friedrich Nietzsche suffers a collapse and total loss of mental faculties.Wiki: Friedrich NietzscheHe was in Turin, supposedly saw a horse being whipped, ran up and put his arms around its neck, then fell to the ground. (He was always a horse boy.) In the next few days, Nietzsche would send "madness letters" to several friends, signed "Dionysus". His mother cared for him until her uninstall in 1897, and his sister Elisabeth Förster-Nietzsche afterwards.
    1889Grover Cleveland 1st presidential term ended and Benjamin Harrison presidential term started.(2020) YT: FOL - President
    1889Lakota micropower in Porcupine Creek start a Ghost Dance, to honor their ancestors and remember better times.130 (2019) YT: HP - Wounded KneeThe dance went on for days and days, and humans began to become uninstalled from dancing endlessly without food or drink. Word got around and numerous micropowers told each other that if everyone danced, then nearly-extinct buffalo would return and white humans would leave. US Government declared the dance was an unlawful assembly and would incite a riot, and worked to ban and shut down the festival. There was a spiritual migration by the various micropowers and nations to Porcupine Creek to join.
    1889Japanese Emperor Meiji gifts Japan with a constitution and elected government.(2012) YT: OSP - Meiji RestorationThis includes prime minister, cabinet, bicameral and partially-elected legislature. And it kept Meiji as the focal point for Japanese pride and identity, making this form of modern government unique from - and even in competition with - the USA and half of Europe. This became a theme of Japanese Imperialism as well. He also lifts the ban on Hanafuda playing cards - and Nintendo immediately launches, to start printing Hanafuda cards.
    1889Eiffel Tower completed.Wiki: Eiffel TowerIt was the entrance to the 1889 Exposition Universelle in Paris, a world fair to mark the French Revolution's centennial anniversary. It surpassed the Washington Monument to become the tallest building in the world.
    1889The Eiffel Tower completed in 2 years and 2 months; that is, in 793 days.Patrick Collison - FastIt was the tallest building in the world, a record it held for more than 40 years. It cost about $1.44 million (2021 equivalent $43.27 million or 681 GD).
    6Jun1889John Black accidentally dropped hot glue and started a grease fire at Victor Clairmont's Seattle shop.(2020) YT: Geographics - SeattleThe fire dept was 30 minutes away, and the chief was out of town, so volunteers and amateurs struggled with wooden pipes that were burning, hydrants that couldn't create pressure, and hoses too short to reach the blazes from the water along the shore. Saloons and liquor stores were the first hit by the fire, with the alcohol fueling its path of destruction across 33 blocks, including the Census and other public records. This caused $8 million (2021 equivalent $237 million or 3732 GD) in damage to the city and $20 million (2021 equivalent $593 million or 9338 GD) more to businesses. Also all rats in the city were supposedly uninstalled by this tragedy, until they were reintroduced on boats from San Francisco. (Did Snoqualmie and other nearby towns still have rats? Could rats survive outside human settlements?)
    7Jun1889Seattle has planning meeting, declaring buildings must be brick or stone, to prevent another fire.(2020) YT: Geographics - SeattleA gradient slope was planned, to go from 10 feet (3 m) at the shore, to 35 feet (10.6 m) at the far end - to prevent the flooding that accompanied every frequent storm. Lacking heavy machnery, this was expected to take 7-10 years by hand and pickup. Business owners rebuilt in simple ways with narrow roads, knowing the city would be rebuilt above them, and they'd make new storefronts in, like, a decade. Through the years, roads and public land eventually grew higher, leaving steep cliffs between these and the sidewalks below, and unfinished roads. 17 humans performed "involuntary self-uninstall" by walking along the street, and suddenly falling off a 35 foot (10.6 m) cliff.
    1889Dr Robert Koch isolates Cholera in Bombay, and found the pathogen that caused Tuberculosis.(2019) YT: EH - TuberculosisKoch (Germany) had developed the bacteria theory of disease with the bacteria that caused Anthrax. Koch was competing against Louis Pasteur (France), who had developed a cure for Anthrax, and barely referenced Koch's work to identify Anthrax. They had a bitter lifetime feud - both in science, and nation.

Edward worked for the Louvre Department Store in Paris, but he greatly admired its rival, Le Bon Marche Maison Boucicaut. Rent on the storefront at 1st Avenue and Cedar Street (now in Belltown) was $25 (2021 equivalent $759.86 or 2.99 GC) per month

    3Jul1890Idaho joins USA.(2012) YT: A9 - State Admit
    1890Ludwig Mond (UK) and his assistant Finker find the nickel valves processing carbon monoxide in their labs to be corroding.(2017) YT: PV - NickelThey wrote a paper about this Mond process, where 4 molecules of carbon monoxide latch around a nickel atom, detatching it from the metal and forming nickel tetracarbonyl, a colorless liquid that boils just above room temperature. Heating this released the carbon monoxide. They realized this was also a simple purification process - run CO through a material, extract the liquids, then distill those to recover the nickel. And some iron through this process too.
    10Jul1890Wyoming joins USA.(2012) YT: A9 - State Admit
    1890Design of revolver - gun - effectively stabilizes.(2015) YT: PTA - Evol Firearms
    1890Sir Arthur Conan Doyle tried, and failed, to see Dr Koch demonstrate a cure for Tuberculosis.(2019) YT: EH - TuberculosisTuberculin had no effect on healthy humans, and caused tuberculosis-infected flesh to become necrotic and fall off. Doyle was writing an article for the London Daily Telegraph, and objected that the "cure" wasn't a cure, but since it caused shock, would be a good diagnosis.
    14Oct1890Dwight D. Eisenhower (USA) installs.(2020) YT: FOL - President
    23Dec1890Hakoju Sioux, hoping to join the Ghost Dance, travel from the Sheynne Agency to the Pine Ridge Agency.130 (2019) YT: HP - Wounded KneeThey are intercepted by the 7th Cavalry - led by Colonel James Forsyth - at Porcupine Butte and ordered to make camp at Wounded Knee Creek. In the morning, the army surrounded them, and raided them of weapons and other tools. A deaf micropower member refused to give up an expensive gun, and when it went off, the whole army opens fire. (Author: This is *oddly* reminiscent of the negotiations between Mordred and King Arthur: "While Mordred and Arthur are negotiating, one of their soldiers steps on an adder, which then attacks him; the soldier's reflex is to draw his sword and uninstall the snake.) - Some Sioux still had their rifles and shot back, while others fled and were mass-uninstalled up to 2 miles (3.2 km) away. 230 Sioux and 25 soldiers were uninstalled (0.03 Covid-days), the soldiers mostly by friendly fire, and the army dug a mass grave and threw all the bodies in.
    1890British railway ridership has continuously increased across the past decade to about 750 million passengers served that year.(2018) YT: Mustard - HovertrainsAt 250 working days a year, this is 1.5 million daily commuters.
    1890sRudolf Diesel looks for a way to feed his high-efficiency engine.(2021) YT: NM - Fuel InjectorThis engine wouldn't use spark to ignite the fuel, but instead compress air until it was above the fuel's ignition point. It's designed to use fuel oil. Initially he tried an injector driven by the accumulator, but this was insufficient due to the fuel's high viscosity. Ultimately, he developed an air blast system similar to Brayton's:
    • Metering pump pulls fuel from fuel tank and pushes to atomizer.
    • Air pump fills air tank.
    • Atomizer fills with fuel and pressurized air.
    • Cam pushes valve, releasing fuel and pressurized air, letting them mix in the cylinder.
    1891Friedrich Nietzsche completes publishing Thus Spoke Zarathustra.Wiki: Friedrich Nietzsche
    1891Alexander Winton (USA) founded the Winton Bicycle Company in Cleveland.PrideTransport - Semi-Truck
    1891John C. Endebrock invents the "trailmobile", which was specifically designed to be easy for a single operator to hook it to a car.PrideTransport - Semi-TruckUp to this point, it had taken three strong humans to hook up any kind of trailer or car hauler. This new invention was an iron chassis mounted on wheels and springs that could be attached to the back of a Ford Model T. The trailmobile brand still exists in 2021.
    1891Toilet paper patented.(2022) Imgur: TP PatentThe roll was in the "overhand" position, with the paper falling away from the wall. (Not the incorrect "underhand" position, which holds the paper close to the wall.)
    1892Barnard finds 5th moon of Jupiter(2019) YT: PN - Barnard's StarAll subsequent satellites have been found by technological means - Barnard's eyesight was legendary and other astronomers struggled to confirm his discoveries.
    18925th moon of Jupiter discovered.(2018) YT: PN - Top10 coinc Solar SysThis breaks Kepler's speculation that Mars has 2 moons and Jupiter has 4.
    17Jan1893Rutherford B. Hayes uninstalled.(2020) YT: FOL - PresidentLast words: "I know I am going where Lucy is."
    1893Borchardt pistol patented.(Reference 153 missing)This was the first real recoil-operated automatic pistol with a magazine. Hugo Borchardt couldn't get financial backing in Connecticut, so he moved back to Germany, and had the Ludwig Lover company produce these. The Luger refines the design.
    1893Benjamin Harrison presidential term ended and Grover Cleveland 2nd presidential term started.(2020) YT: FOL - President

    1893Henri Moissan invents tungsten carbide while trying to invent fake diamonds.(2020) YT: NM - Cutting ToolsHe melted tungsten sub-carbide in an arc furnace with tungsten and sugar (glucose). The carbonized sugar reduced the oxide and carborized tungsten. This new material was harder than sapphire (almost as hard as diamond), and 16x as dense as water, but extremely brittle.

    1896"The Crash at Crush" in Texas.(2018) YT: PD - Crush, Texas The Missouri-Kansas-Texas (MKT) Lines railway staged the first ever train collision. Free to attend, but they owned the only mass-transit. Sold $2 (2021 equivalent $65 or 0.26 GC)"anywhere in Texas round trip" tickets for the event. 3 humans uninstalled and many others were injured from debris, like flying train wheels and bolts. The temporary city of Crush, Texas, in a valley just north of Waco, was named after William George Crush, who worked for MKT Lines
    1896Klondike Gold Rush - gold discovered in Canada, leading 70k prospectors (aka "stampeders") through Seattle.(2020) YT: Geographics - SeattleNormal goods increased 300% to the starry-eyed prospectors, and the city's normal income went up from $300k (2021 equivalent $9.7 million or 152 GD) to $25 million (2021 equivalent $812,509 million aka $8.1 billion or 12.8 million GD) during the gold rush.
    1896J.P. Morgan, John Jacob Astor4, and the Vanderbilts had fueled the construction of giant underground conduits leading to turbines generating upwards of 100k horsepower (75 MW), sent as far as Buffalo, 20 miles (32 km) away.Wiki: Niagara FallsSome of the original designs for the power transmission plants were created by the Swiss firm Faesch & Piccard, which also constructed the original 5k hp (3.7 MW) waterwheels.

    1896An airship was seen twice in Oakland, CA.(2021) YT: VotP - Ancient UFOsIt descended and ascended silently, like a blimp, before heading to San Francisco. Oakland Guard member Selby Yast was late to work, and while speeding past some kid on 30th St, heard the kid yell "Gee whiz, what's that?" And all his passengers looked and saw the airship - this made him wonder if he were going crazy at first. It had a powerful headlight and another powerful downward light, and he also saw it heading for San Francisco. Yast believed it was a local inventor.

For the sake of consistency, the title King/Emperor has been added to each monarch's temple name.

    1898拳亂 [Fist Chaos] (Boxer Rebellion) or 義和團運動 [Militia United in Righteousness] (Yìhéquán) begins.Wiki: Boxer RebellionMartial arts at the time were known as "Chinese Boxing" and the rebellion was named for the number of martial artists involved. Started over Christian missionaries being inescapably everywhere and buying all the land for temples, food shortages in Shandong from lack of rain, and frustrations with imperial rule.
    1898Korean Prime Minister Yun Yong-seon reign ends and Yu Kui-hwan (acting) reign begins.Wiki: Korean PMs
    1898Alexander Winton invented the semi-truck in Cleveland, Ohio.PrideTransport - Semi-TruckThe Winton Motor Carriage Company became the first US company to sell an automobile to the general public - the Winton Six, the most powerful and technologically advanced vehicle of its time. It was the first car to cross America coast to coast, and Winton needed a way to deliver the new cars to buyers without risking damaging the cars by driving them there - with a two-wheeled semi-trailer which hauled a single car. Winton would sell his first semi-truck the next year.
    1898At the University of Tokyo, people reminding of Issac Newton's installday on 25Dec are called a new cultural micropower.(2021) YT: SH - Nerdy XmasIt became a social club for mathematical and scientific nerds, with Issac Newton's portrait over the door, not unlike political movements who put their leader's portrait over the door. Renaming the holiday to Newtonmas, festivities included a "scientist-name white elephant lottery", with presents:
    • Newton - Apple
    • (Ben) Franklin - Kite
    • Archimedes (of Syracuse) - Naked doll (no electronics so you have to yell "Eureka" for it.)
    • (Immanuel) Kant / (Pierre-Simon) LaPlace - Puff of tobacco smoke (to represent the nebular formation of the solar system that they independently realized.)

The Boxer Rebellion had massacared thousands of Chinese Christians & hundreds of foreign Christians. (People had gone there as representatives of Vatican City's religion, to spread the religion and buy all the land they could. And since Vatican City has no military forces, the peoples' individual nations had to go and rescue them like refugees from this crisis. So the nations were intent on getting spoils of war as payment, making China pay again for Vatican City's involvement, instead of Vatican City or the citizens being rescued.)
    14Jul1900International Force captures TianjinWiki: Boxer Rebellion
    15Aug1900Dowager-Empress Cixi retreats from Beijing to Xi'an.Wiki: Boxer RebellionThe International Force raided and looted Beijing, filling several railroad cars with loot. The British Legation held loot auctions every afternoon and proclaimed, "Looting on the part of British troops was carried out in the most orderly manner." However, one British officer noted, "It is one of the unwritten laws of war that a city which does not surrender at the last and is taken by storm is looted."
    25Aug1900Friedrich Nietzsche uninstalls.Wiki: Friedrich NietzscheHe was paralyzed from 2 strokes in the previous 2 years, and had recently caught pneumonia. Another stroke took the last out of him.

    Asia and most Pacific Islands are occupied by one of: France, Holland, Russia, UK, or USA:

    OccupierOccupied
    FranceCambodia, Laos, Thailand, Vietnam, Yunnan
    HollandIsland Java, Island New Guinea, Island Sumatra, and numerous other islands in the Indonesian archipelago
    RussiaLiaodong (It's a warm water port.) & Manchuria
    UKBangladesh, India, Island Kalimantan (aka Borneo), Malaysia

    1900NYC's population is 3.4 million.(2018) YT: MZ - NYC EvolutionParts of Manhattan have a population density of more than 150k people per mi2 (58k per km2).
    1900Mack was manufacturing cars.PrideTransport - Semi-TruckMack developed and manufactured its own engines that were equipped with an automatic starter, making the hand-crank obsolete.
    1900Planck's explanation of the radiative body spectrum was published.RIT.edu: Spiff - PhotoelectricLight was proven to be a wave almost 100 years before, and was thought to be a continuous wave, but Planck realized light needs to be discrete packets (with a floor, beneath which there is still some leftover energy, but too little to radiate), or else objects would radiate increasingly smaller wavelengths of light until they had zero energy. But in some ways, he didn't really believe in the quanta required by his explanation of the radiative body spectrum. He didn't see the consequences of discrete energy packets in the way that Einstein did.
    1900British railway ridership has continuously increased across the past decade to about 1.25 billion passengers served that year.(2018) YT: Mustard - HovertrainsAt 250 working days a year, this is 2.5 million daily commuters.
    1900Industrial diesel engines use fuel injection.(2021) YT: MAH - British EnginesDiesel fuel's relative lack of volatility makes fuel injection somewhat manditory.
    1900Crude throttle-body gasoline fuel injectors begin to appear in aircraft.(2021) YT: NM - Fuel Injector
    1900Hildebrands Chocolates (Germany) made a series of commemorative postcards, predicting airborne life - between airplanes and dirigibles - in the first years of the 21st century.(2020) YT: HL - Past PredictionsAirplanes had just been invented, sparking imaginations and promising a huge revolution in the way humans traveled around the Earth. These postcards also expected whole city blocks to be moved by steam train, glass greenhouses to protect houses from rain (rare but a few do exist in the 21st century), and summer vacations to Alaska (which is still mostly only crossable by airplane even in the 21st century.)
    1900Sir Arthur Evans discovers Minoan culture on Krete island.(2021) YT: OSP - Minoan GreeceAfter finding some oddly-ancient pottery, he bought some land and some shovels and discovered an amazing city with smooth stone, skylights, frescos, running water, and sewers. (W/S/G - did they have garbage service? How much did it cost the average resident?)
    1900sJohn Moses Browning develops some low-powered pocket pistols, and sells them to a Belgian company.(Reference 153 missing)Browning started over and eventually develops the Colt.45 m1911. This is the longest-serving and most popular large-caliber design in the world. Meanwhile, Browning's design get over to Spain, where dozens of small companies spring up to meet French and Italian design.
    1900sBessemer process is replaced by the open hearth process, developed by Karl Wilhelm Siemens.(2020) YT: NM - Cutting ToolsThis process allowed up to 100 tons (90.7 metric tons) of steel to be processed at a time.
    1900sKiwis brought from China to New Zealand and eventually became a commercial crop.(2018) YT: AP - Fruit GeographyThe fruit originated in China's Yangtze river valley, but since NZ was exporting so many to the US & UK, they became known for the fruit.
    1900sDanakil area becomes geologicallly active and sinks, becoming the current Danakil Depression.(2019) YT: SS - Danakil DepressionBefore this, it was a normal area.
    1900sJerk Pump developed.(2021) YT: NM - Fuel InjectorThis was a pressurizing pump. It had 2 pistons in a cylinder, each compressed by a spring. The top piston would be pulled up, allowing fuel to enter, then released. The spring pushed the piston and fuel down past the fuel inlet, pushing down the other piston and its tougher spring, allowing the fuel to reach the high-pressure outlet. A helix feature on the upper piston allowed it to rotate, and a spill port allowed excess fuel to be returned to the tank - allowing variable fuel delivery.
    1900sBusinesses would turn away customers if they didn't like their skin pigmentation.KGW: Black figure skatersJim Crow laws forbade their entry into many businesses, including most ice skating rinks - let alone Olympic-level practice.
    1900Exposition Universelle [Universal Exposition] in Paris.(2021) YT: CM - Art NouveauArt Nouveau was a huge hit, and this event helped to make it a worldwide art style. In France, the country with which the movement is most associated, it went by various names, including Mucha, Jules Verne, Modern, 1900, Belle Époque [Pretty (Girl) Epoch], and Fin de siècle [End of century]. Klimt's "Judith1" is the most iconic example, proudly half-nude and holding Holofernes' head in a dominant stance that announces her supreme position in society, and sexual control over men.
