    7Sep1901Qing Imperial court signs the Boxer Protocol.Wiki: Boxer RebellionThis was a peace treaty with the 8-nation International Force. 10 high-ranking officials in the Qing empire were ordered to be uninstalled for mass-uninstalling foreigners, and the Qing Empire was fined 450 million taels of fine silver (18,514 tons @ 1.2 oz/tael) by 1940, at 4% interest - approximately 1 tael per Qing empire citizen. In total, 668,661,220 taels were paid from 1901 to 1939. (2021 equivalent $77.37 billion or 1.2 million GD)

    1902Benito Mussolini immigrates from Italy to Swizerland.(2018) YT: OS - WW2 [p1]This was to avoid military service. He falls into Socialism and starts writing for socialist newspapers, advocating a violent overthrow of Europe's monarchies. This gets him arrested and deported back to Italy. On release he does it all again, including being arrested and deported. On second release he's forced to serve in Italy's military, (and be a schoolteacher), then returns to Socialism in Italy.
    1902Leon Levavasseur patents his Antoinette 8V aircraft engine.(2021) YT: NM - Fuel InjectorThis was the first V8 engine, and also used one of the first forms of gasoline fuel injection. This had a fuel pump fill reservoirs foreach cylinder, each having a capillary tube at the bottom. Similar to diesel air blast injection, fuel would be pulled into the cylinder by the intake air moving past the capillary tube.

Combatted Modernism; issued the oath against it. Advocated the Gregorian Chant and reformed the Roman Breviary."

    1903Carl Auer von Welsbach had optimized the fusion electrolysis procedure to produce a void-free cerium alloy with approximately 30 percent iron.ThoughtCo - MischmetalThe iron addition added significant hardness to the cerium, which is a pyrophoric rare earth. He had created Auermetall, now known as ferrocerium, which is the basic material used for flints in fire starters and lighters. From this, he realized that various rare earths could be separated from a given ore with electrolytic processes in a chlorine bath, and this started the rare earth industry.

    1905Einstein published a paper (in the very same issue as his famous paper on relativity) which used Planck's idea of quanta to explain the photoelectric effect's quirks.RIT.edu: Spiff - PhotoelectricHe wrote: "In accordance with the assumption to be considered here, the energy of a light ray spreading out from a point source is not continuously distributed over an increasing space, but consists of a finite number of energy quanta which are localized at points in space, which move without dividing, and which can only be produced and absorbed as complete units." These quanta would eventually be named "photons".

    1907Boris Rosing used a CRT to create geometric shapes.(2018) YT: TC - Farnsworth
    1907Stanley Benedict invents a better urine glucose test for diabetes mellitus.(2017) YT: NR - First diabetes testMix sodium carbonate, sodium citrate, and copper (2) sulfate in water to create a solution. Heat urine in the blue copper (2) solution, and it will turn into a copper (1) solution, which quickly degrades to red copper(1) oxide in the presece of an oxidizing substance like glucose. It provided the same color range to estimate glucose level, and was much less suseptible to other molecules like creatinine.
    1907Seattle sets 15,457 rat traps in the Seattle Underground, and officially condemns the space as dangerous and unsanitary.(2020) YT: Geographics - SeattleCitizens were instructed to stay above ground and forget the lower space. But literal undeground markets, opium dens, speakeasies, and casinos opened there.

I wanted to tear off my shirt and throw it down but then the sky closed, a strong thump sounded, and I was thrown a few meters."

    1908Ford releases Model T for $825 (2021 equivalent $24,966 or 98 GC)(2020) YT: THG - Lane Markings
    1908Ford Motor Company begins production of the Model T.(2020) YT: PS - Models A vs TIt was available in 4 colors: red, green, blue, or grey. All Model Ts had the same I4 Flathead 2.9L (177 cu in) engine, making 20 HP (14.9 kW), coupled to a 2-speed transmission to push the 1500 lb (680 kg) car. It sold for about $850 (2021 equivalent $25,035 or 98.6 GC). The fuel tank was under the front seat, so going up a steep hill would cause the gravity feed to starve the engine, and going up in reverse was a solution. The base model only had transmission-brakes (not unlike hybrid regenerative braking), but "Rocky Mountain brakes" were an available option.
    1908Hermann Minkowski develops the Spacetime Interval(2012) YT: VS - RelativityThis extends the Pythagorean Theorem to 4 dimensions.
    1908Ming emperor 載湉 [Zǎitián] reign ends and 溥儀 [Pǔyí (also known as Henry)] reign begins.Wiki: Chinese monarchsXundi ("The Abdicated Emperor") is the common name by which mainland China and Taiwan's history books refer to Puyi.
    1908Fiedler's flamethrower is assigned to the Pioneer Experimental Company (Imperial German Army, Guards Corps, 1st Guards Division) for testing.(2021) YT: Ahoy - FlamethrowerTwo models were sent: The "Gross Flammenwerfer" aka "Grof" was a stationary tank connected to a handheld nozzle by a hose. And the "Klein Flammenwerfer" aka "Kleif" had a backpack-tank connected to a similar nozzle by a hose.
    1909Theodore Roosevelt presidential term ended and William Howard Taft presidential term started.(2020) YT: FOL - President
    1909William Taft is the 2nd US President to own a car.(2015) YT: RC - MalibuBut he was too fat to drive it.
    27Apr1909Sultan Abdul Hamid2 reign ends and Mehmed5 REŞÂD (Rashād)(The True Path Follower) reign begins.Wiki: List of Ottoman sultansSon of Abdulmejid1 and Gülcemal Kadın; Reigned as a figurehead of Mehmed Talat, İsmail Enver, and Ahmed Cemal Pashas until his uninstall.

    Sep1909Luther Burbank visits Seattle to speak at the Alaska Yukon Pacific Exposition (AYPE), the city’s first world’s fair.MyNorthwest: Himalayan Blackberry He spoke to a large crowd, and was lauded as a hero for the work he had done to create and/or promote so many new species of plants.
    20Apr1910Halley's Comet observed to come within 0.15 AU (13,943,370 mi).Wiki: Halley's CometComet was a bad omen for China's existing government, as it was the eve of the Xinhai Revolution.
    21Apr1910Mark Twain uninstalled.Wiki: Halley's Comet
    1910Of the USA - forest land has reduced by 269 million acres (108.8 million hectares), to 754 million acres (305 million hectares, 34% of the total land area) since 1630.Imgur: Volcano chicken
    19105 cars per 1000 humans in the USA.(2020) YT: THG - Lane Markings
    1910NYC hits max population density.(2018) YT: MZ - NYC Evolution
    6May1910British King Edward7 reign ends and George5 (George Frederick Ernest Albert) reign begins.Wiki; British MonarchsHouse Saxe-Coburg and Gotha (1865-1917), Windsor (1917-1936). Married Mary of Teck on 6 July 1893, had 6 children
    1910Crucible Steel company invents High Speed Steel.(2020) YT: NM - Cutting ToolsThis was specifically to address the limitations of carbon steel. Previous steels could soften at temperatures as low as 150 Celcius (302 Fahrenheit). These had 0.5 to 1% carbon, and were alloyed with tungsten, molybdenum, chromium, vanadium, and cobalt.
    1910Italy invades Libya.(2018) YT: OS - WW2 [p1]Benito Mussolini rioted over this, and got arrested. But he was getting popular in Socialist circles.
    1910Mexican Revolution begins.LATimes - Mexico Vatican tiesVatican City sides with conservatives and loses politically. They had also sided with Maximilian, who was executed by revolutionaries.
    1910The Mexican revolutionGuardian - Mexico's religious historyThis brought about more conflict for Vatican City's religion: the country’s new leaders feared the religion would hold back progress. They imposed even stricter anti-clerical laws, such as a prohibition on preaching politics from the pulpit.
    1910Joseon PM 효황제 (孝皇帝) [Emperor Hyo] turns the Joseon Dynasty into the Korean Empire, Park Je-sun 3rd Term ends and Lee Wan-yong 3rd Term begins.Wiki: Korean PMs
    1910British railway ridership has continuously increased across the past decade to about 1.4 billion passengers served that year.(2018) YT: Mustard - HovertrainsAt 250 working days a year, this is 2.8 million daily commuters.
    1910Airplanes used the "wick carburetor".(2021) YT: MAH - British EnginesThis was literally just a rope dangling out of a bucket of gasoline and into the air intake pipe for the engine.
    1910Peter Bowman (Denmark) patents the Pintle valve.(2021) YT: NM - Fuel InjectorThis pin sits in the middle of the spray nozzle's output to provide a circular surface (angled pinhead) that's great at atomizing liquids and consistently throtting output. (This is how many hand-held garden hose sprayers work too.) The vast majority of fuel injectors are pintle-based. About this same time, fuel injection systems started using pressures around 200-340 bar (2900-4931 PSI, 150k-255k mmHg), and eventually going over 2000 bar (29007 PSI, 1.5 million mmHg).
    1910French prints depict predictions of refined airborne life in the early 21st century.(2020) YT: HL - Past PredictionsSome treated airplanes like we treat cars, with proto-drive through establishments serving pilots - predefining "in-flight refueling". Others showed mechanical barbers and proto-audio books. Fashion remains firmly Victorian, with concealing dresses and top hats.
    6Feb1911Ronald Reagan (USA) installs.(2020) YT: FOL - President
    1911Ernest Rutherford discovers the basic structure of an atom - negative electrons surrounding a positively-charged center.(2016) YT: Fermilab - Strong Nuclear
    1911Hafnium discovered.(Reference Missing)
    1911Niagara Falls had remarkably heavy icing up during winter.Wiki: Niagara Falls
    1911Bob Berman sets a world record at Daytona Beach, by going 141 mph (227 km/h).(Reference Missing)
    1911NYC uses painted lines to mark crosswalks.(2020) YT: THG - Lane Markings
    14Jun1911RMS Olympic makes her maiden voyage.(2013) YT: FJT4 - Titanic SunkShipbuilders Harland and Wolff in Belfast built the ship, and built all White Star Line ships. Within a week, it would crash into the tugboat O'El Hallenbeck in NYC.
    1911Pete Monarchs and W Borches (Germany) describe anti-corrosion properties of chromium-steel alloy, noting the resistance increases when the chromium ratio is above 10.5%.(2020) YT: THG - StainlessThey patented the formula.
    20Sep1911RMS Olympic crashes a second time, into the HMS Hawk in the Brambles channel in Southampton water.(2013) YT: FJT4 - Titanic Sunk

    The Olympic's wake pulled in the Hawk, making a several meter (dozen foot) tall triangular hole. The Admirals found The Olympic at fault, despite evidence to the contrary, but this meant the insurance company would not pay for repairs. Thousands of rivets popped and dozens of steel hull plates were damaged across 4 decks, the crankshaft needed replacing, and she listed badly to port (left).

    Shipbuilders Harland and Wolff in Belfast performed the repairs - replacing 1/3 of the steel hull plating on the starboard (right) side took 7 weeks. The Titanic's propeller 401 was put on the Olympic instead.

    1911Edward Hines gets the first lane lines painted on a road, on River Road in Wayne County in Michigan.(2020) YT: THG - Lane MarkingsFrom Michigan DOT, but disputed. Hines was a road safety innovator, and started the Good Roads Organization to improve public roads in Michigan.
    10Oct1911The Xinhai Revolution started.Wiki: Chinese monarchs

    The last Chinese emperor, Puyi, abdicated officially, and the Qing dynasty was overthrown with his abdication on that day.

    However, that same day the Chinese Republic granted the 清帝退位優待條件 (Articles of Favourable Treatment of the Emperor of the Great Qing after his Abdication) which allowed Puyi to retain his imperial title, and stated that he should be treated by the government of the Republic of China with the protocol attached to a foreign monarch until 12 Feb the next year.

    1911Amunsen Expedition crosses the Ross Ice Shelf and reaches South Pole, Antarctica.(2021) YT: Mustard - Antarctic Snow CruiserPrivately funded. They returned successfully.
    1911Qing empire ends with Wu-Tang uprising(2017) YT: FH - Opium Wars
    1912People generally believed what authority figures told them.(2013) YT: FJT4 - Titanic SunkThe careers of Investigative Journalism and Freelance Photography hadn't been invented yet. Photography was still in its infancy. There was no Social Security or other social safety nets. Employers could fire whole families if they didn't like what one employee had done, or if they were talking about "suspicious things" or trying to organize a labor union.
    6Jan1912New Mexico joins USA.(2012) YT: A9 - State Admit
    1912Much of the water coming over American Falls at Niagara Falls froze, though a trickle still ran and the falls ran at the other two sites.Wiki: Niagara Falls
    12Feb1912Ming emperor 溥儀 [Pǔyí (also known as Henry)] reign ends the 清朝 [Qing dynasty]Wiki: Chinese monarchs
    14Feb1912Arizona joins USA.(2012) YT: A9 - State Admit
    24Feb1912RMS Olympic runs over a sunken ship while departing New York harbor.(2013) YT: FJT4 - Titanic SunkThis broke off the starboard (right) propeller. The Olympic limped into Southampton UK 4 days later.
    2March1912RMS Olympic back in Belfast drydock.(2013) YT: FJT4 - Titanic SunkIt's believed that the Olympic and Titanic had their nameplates and other items (menus, etc) swapped at this point, to commit insurance fraud. The propeller repair should have taken just 2 hours, but wound up taking 5 days.
    1912Phenobarbital replaced chloral hydrate as a synthetic drug to treat insomnia.Wiki: Chloral Hydrate
    7Mar1912RMS Olympic (formerly Titanic) departs Belfast.(2013) YT: FJT4 - Titanic SunkThe Olympic was frequently docked next to its twin sister, the Titanic. One of the few major differences were that Olympic had 2 more C-deck portholes than Titanic. (9:56) Yet oddly, those 2 portholes seem to transfer ships by this departure.
    1912Brandenberger completes inventing cellophane, and also a machine to produce it.Wiki: CellophaneThe name is a portmanteau of cellulose and "diaphane" (French for transparent). The process takes viscose (cellulose treated with carbon disulfide and lye) and removes the sulfur while adding glycerine for flexibility. It's waterproof, but not moisture proof, as water vapor can still transit the barrier.
    1912UK has a coal strike.(2013) YT: FJT4 - Titanic SunkAs coal was steam ship fuel, this was basically a fuel shortage, and Southampton was full of ships and laborers. Yet Titanic (formerly Olympic) couldn't find coal workers, and all but 2 of those who sailed from Belfast wouldn't sign up again.Further, Titanic first class wasn't being booked, so White Star First Class customers could only get second class. The ship left half-full (half-empty, half as many paying customers) when customers were lining up for any free ship.
    1912Wilfrid Michael Voynich buys manuscript with writing from an unknown language and containing unusual drawings.(2015) YT: LEMMiNO - Unsolved Top10
    5Apr1912RMS Californian (a Layland Liner) departs for the north Atlantic.(2013) YT: FJT4 - Titanic SunkOddly during a coal strike, this passenger ship was full of coal and wool sweaters but empty of passengers.
    1912Whitman's Sampler begins shipping candy wrapped in cellophane.Wiki: Cellophane
    10Apr1912RMS Titanic (formerly Olympic) departs for NYC.(2013) YT: FJT4 - Titanic SunkScience teacher Lawrence Beasley, in 2nd class seating, was one of many passengers who noted a slight list to port (left). The former Olympic had a list to port (left) from a previous collision, which the new Titanic would not have. JP Morgan and over 50 of his close friends cancelled their passage just before departure. Morgan also took several bronze statues off the Titanic. There was a fire smoldering in Coal Bunker 10 on departure, but instead of putting this out they topped it off. Its existence was hidden from inspectors.
    12Apr1912A reporter finds JP Morgan at a French resort, despite calling in sick for the Titanic departure.(2013) YT: FJT4 - Titanic SunkHe was apparently in vigorous health, with a mistress.
    14Apr1912RMS Californian waits in the middle of the north Atlantic ice field.(2013) YT: FJT4 - Titanic SunkThey sent several messages to the Titanic (formerly Olympic), telling them their location. Then the radio operator went to bed, missing the Titanic's distress calls. The Titanic's telegraph workers were so busy that they missed the Californian's last message.
    15Apr1912RMS Titanic sinks in the north Atlantic at 2:20 AMImgur: 4/15 in historyThis was 2h40m after hitting the iceberg.
    15Apr1912RMS Titanic (formerly Olympic) sinks in the north Atlantic.(2013) YT: FJT4 - Titanic SunkNaval common sense of the day said to plow full speed through an ice field, as they considered their steel ships fairly impenetrable, and the belief that anything large enough to damage one would be seen 6 to 10 miles away, while ships had 3/4 of a mile turning radius. This was the first modern ship sank by an iceberg.
    • 11:38 PM - Titanic sights iceberg. First Officer orders a port (right) turn and engines full astern, to broadside the iceberg - this increased ship damage in exchange for a gentler collision for passengers. The shudder felt by passengers was likely from the engines, and the iceberg's damaging impact was apparently not noticeable.
    • 11:40 PM - Titanic hits the iceberg. Officers were calm, like they were running a drill. Survivor Edith Russel said a ship officer told her "Don't worry, the Californian will pick everybody up, if you don't come back for breakfast."
    • 11:45 PM - The fourth officer determines their position - but the location is 12 miles further west than their actual location, and The Californian couldn't see the Titanic through Earth's curvature.
    • 11:50 PM - Captain Smith has the Titanic go half-speed for about 5 minutes, expecting the ship they see on the horizon to save them. It's not clear if this was the Samson, a seal uninstalling vessel, or another nearby ship.
    • 12:05 AM - The Titanic shoots its first red-white-and-blue rocket. The captain of the Samson saw these but didn't check on the ship because they were on shady business - they shot their own plain-white rockets to call back their boats from illegally uninstalling seals on the icebergs. The Californian's crew could see plain-white rockets, not the red-white-and-blue rockets they were expecting.
    • 12:15 AM - The Titanic sends its first radio emergency signal. The Californian's crew don't receive this because the telegraph operator is sleeping.
    • 12:20 AM - Titanic officers start becoming agitated.
    • 12:25 AM - Officers start pumps and prepping lifeboats.
    • 12:45 AM - First lifeboat launched. Lifeboats were only being half-filled.
    • 1:00 AM - Captain Smith realized the Californian wasn't going to rescue them, so they started filling lifeboats all the way.
    • 2:20 AM - Titanic sinks, pulling numerous swimmers down into the cold below. 1500 people uninstalled (0.18 Covid-days).
    • 5:25 AM - The Californian's radio operator wakes up, and they attempt to join rescue efforts, but find The Carpathia already there.

    Surving crew members were herded into a railway shed and kept for about 24 hours, before being required to sign an early NDA. This was accompanied by a threat of 20 years of prison if they said anything.

    The UK Board of Trade (BoT) were Plaintiff and Defendent in this case, and also Judge and Jury. The BoT's corrupt inspectors rushed the Titanic's approval through, despite bulkheads being too short and having too few lifeboats. The BoT appointed 1st Viscount (Lord) Mersey John Bigham (UK) to lead their inquiry. Lord Mersey had his son arrange the venue, and they got the Scottish Drill Hall in London, whose acoustics were so bad that the audience couldn't hear the trial. Lawyer (solicitor?) Harold Sanderson, for shipyard Harland and Wolfe, repeatedly called the sunken ship Olympic.

    At the trials, officers and crew were evasive and sometimes gave contradictory or confusing answers. They claimed they had been in the below-freezing water for more than an hour, which wasn't possible. But the trials were hastily arranged and failed to ask the right questions. Nobody asked the simple question of "If icebergs could normally be seen at 5 or 6 miles distance, why did the Titanic hit one?" The press were more interested in the drama of an officer's escape, and Lord Mersey ignored evidence he didn't like. The Californian's captain tried for the rest of his life to get the case reopened and his name cleared.

    The justification given for a national coverup of the insurance scandal was the brewing WW1 - JP Morgan (USA)'s ownership the White Star Line (UK) involved letting the UK use the ships as naval reserve during wartime. But if the White Star Line went bankrupt, JP Morgan would be the primary creditor, and he would not have to let the UK use the ships (now his personal property) during WW1. So the White Star Line became Too Big To Fail as a military asset.

    20Apr1912Lloyd's of London pays White Star Line for the Titanic (formerly Olympic) sinking.(2013) YT: FJT4 - Titanic SunkThe payout was $12.5 million (2021 equivalent $349 million or 5499 GD), on the $10 million (2021 equivalent $279 million or 4399 GD) ship. The damaged Olympic would have been much less insurable.

    8Aug1913Brearley patents stainless steel.(2020) YT: THG - StainlessElwood Hayes was also patenting stainless steel, so they joined forces and started the American Stainless Steel Company.
    1913Francois Feynes (Belgium) develops the rotary distribution pump.(2021) YT: NM - Fuel InjectorA rotor would make a hydraulic connection with distributor ports to feed different cylinders. This allowed one plunger to feed all cylinders, ensuring more consistent fuel delivery, and making the whole thing smaller and simpler.
    1913Fisher Autobody opens a factory in Walkerville, Ontario, to make parts for the Ford Model T, using about 700 screws per car.(2020) YT: THG - ScrewdriverThis saved $2.60 (2021 equivalent $71.70 or 0.28 GC) per car - significant when the sale price was $390 (2021 equivalent $10,755 or 42 GC) and produced in the millions.
    1913Henry Ford develops the Moving Assembly Line, cutting down the time to produce a car from 12 hours to 1.5.(2020) YT: THG - Lane MarkingsThe major innovation is bringing the car to the humans, not the humans to the car.
    1Dec1913Ford Motor Company adopts the assembly line.(2020) YT: PS - Models A vs TThis reduced the time to produce a car from 12 hours to 1.5 hours. In other terms, it increased the number of cars produced per 12h of work from 1 to 8.
    1913Vickers Ltd (UK) develops Common Rail (fuel) Injection.(2021) YT: NM - Fuel InjectorA pump feeds an accumulator/header, where pressure is maintained by a relief valve, and also supplying each cylinder's injector valve. Fuel metering was performed through timing individual valve opening durations.
    1914American Great Binge ends.Wiki: The Great Binge

    1914Benito Mussolini invents Faschismo as a way to help Socialism spread and replace Classism.(2018) YT: OS - WW2 [p1]He rioted over Italy's involvement in WW1, and got arrested. But he quickly rethought this, seeing it as the push needed to start a Socialst revolution in every European country. The other Socialists didn't like his new ways, so he said "screw them" and "We need a new system not built on class divisions separating us, but nationalism uniting us. We'll conquer the Mediterranean, just like the old Roman empire. I'll call it Faschismo." (Rhymes with Machismo, or "being a macho, macho man", to show intersections.) Also, Hitler (Germany) was a young soldier fighting in the trenches during the war.
    20Aug1914Pope St Pius10 papacy ends and Pope Benedict15 (BENEDICTVS Quintus Decimus) (Giacomo Paolo Giovanni Battista Della Chiesa) (Italian) papacy begins 14 days later.Wiki: List of PopesMotto: In te, Domine, speravi: non confundar in aeternum. [In you, Lord, have I hoped: let me not be confounded into eternity.] Credited for intervening for peace during WW1. Issued the 1917 Code of Canon Law; supported the missionaries in Maximum illud [The greatest thing]. Remembered by Benedict16 as a "prophet of peace".
    1914Japan wants Qingdao peninsula and many Pacific Ocean islands, all held by Germany, who was just declared war upon by Japan's ally, UK(2016) YT: BW - history of japanBecause Germany was going through UK's other ally Belgium to get to France. Germany wanted to attack France because France was Russia's ally-Germany and Russia shared a huge land border. Why did they not attack Russia directly? Weather is a huge reason. Russia was invading Germany's ally, Austria-Hungary. Austria-Hungary was invading Serbia because a Serb uninstalled their head of state. Serbia's not big enough to be a "real country" - they were an "Arch-Dutchy".
    1914US occupation of Port of Veracruz in Mexico.Reuters: Mexico Cartels
    1914The UK Mint again changes their price for gold.NMA - Historic Gold PricesThe price of gold remained remarkably stable for long periods of time. (What was it changed to?)
    1914Blacksmith and business owner August Charles Fruehauf Detroit was asked to help transport a very expensive boat to the lake.PrideTransport - Semi-TruckFruehauf created a carriage that would attach to a Ford Model T and haul the boat. He officially called his invention a semi-trailer [half-trailer]. HIs boat carrying semi-trailer was a huge hit and, being a smart businessperson, he immediately started to manufacture his semi-trailer for other purposes, such as hauling lumber.
    1914Lord Mersey (UK) appointed chairman of inquiry into Lusitania sinking.(2013) YT: FJT4 - Titanic SunkLike the Titanic, this was another British Government coverup.
    Dec1914Flamethrowers first used in warfare.(2021) YT: Ahoy - FlamethrowerIn the Argonne Forest of France. The Kleif was fragile and underpowered, but the German army saw their value, and created a unit led by Bernhard Reddemann, who played a key role in the weapon's development. They would see significant deployment, carrying out 653 attacks (82% successful) including the 2nd battle of Ypres and the Battle of Verdun.
    18Jul1914Roosevelt takes a day off from politics to mow his lawn.(2019) NYT: Great American LawnThe NYT reported on this. Must have been a slow news day. Working in the yard was sold as a relaxing pastime, and this belief was bought by many.

    1914Ford Motor Company find that black paint dries the fastest, and replace the previous 4 paint colors with all black.(2020) YT: PS - Models A vs TThe assembly line moved so fast that finished cars had hand prints and streaks. Green, light brown, and maroon would be readded in 1926. The next year, these would sell for $490 (2021 equivalent $13,146 or 51.76 GC).
    1915Armenian (Karabakh) genocide by Ottoman empire(Reference Missing)
    1915Albert Einstein releases General Relativity(2018) YT: PBS ST - Hawking Radiation
    1915Albert Einstein publishes General Relativity.(2021) YT: Zepherus - VulcanOne of the predictions explains Mercury's unexplained orbital precession, as orbits are straight lines in curved spacetime, not a curved line in flat spacetime. The other two predicted gravitaitonal lensing and the redshift of light from a spinning object, like a star.
    1915Chinese restaurant owners were among the first allowed to hold visas.(2021) YT: XJZ - USA Chinese FoodChinese restaurants had won over the hearts and bellies of Americans and led to a softening of racial dislike.
    1915Walter S. Adams took a spectrogram of Sirius B af the Mount Wilson telescope.(2021) YT: PE - Chandrasekhar limitSirius B gave an identical color spectrum as Sirius A - and since color equals temperature for such massive radiative objects, they must be the same temperature. This disproved the "cold" theory about why Sirius B was so dim, and forced astronomers to reconsider the "unbelievably dense" theory.
    1915Luther Burbank published a 12-volume series about his work.MyNorthwest: Himalayan BlackberryIn volume six, he wrote almost lovingly of the Himalayan blackberry he had unleashed on North America 30 years earlier. "It is a plant of extraordinary vigor. [A s]ingle cane may grow more than 25 feet (7.6 m) -sometimes even 50 feet (15.2 m) - in a season," Burbank wrote. "And in point of fruit production, the Himalaya far surpasses any other berry plant ever grown. Reports tell of a single bush bearing 200 pounds (90.7 kg) of berries in the season."
    22Dec1915Chinese Emperor 袁世凱 [Yuan Shikai] reign begins the 中華帝國 [Empire of China] dynastyWiki: Chinese monarchsA short-lived attempt by statesman and general, but his rule was universally accepted as inauthentic. After 83 days, his reign ended.
    1916Barnard sees Barnard's Star racing across the sky.(2019) YT: PN - Barnard's Star
    22Mar1916Chinese Emperor 袁世凱 [Yuan Shikai] reign ends the 中華帝國 [Empire of China] dynastyWiki: Chinese monarchs

    1916Zoologist Lancelot Borradaile (UK) creates the phrase "carcinization" [become crab-like] to describe the convergent evolution of crustaceans towards the crab body plan.(2020) YT: PBSE - Why Crabs?Evolution starts with a lobser-shaped animal, and the pleon [tail] shrinks as the body expands, moving from a tubelike body plan to a more spherical body plan - which allows more useful interior space for the same amount of expensive armored exterior - and is more balanced for easier running, swimming, and burrowing. (What about jumping?) This process increased during the Mesozoic era and especially during the Cretaceous Period.
    1916US Amendment to mandate a public vote on all wars, with a "Yes" vote also volunteering the voter for military service, failed.(2022) Imgur: Failed Amend
    1917Dr Judah McCaroll gets run off the road near Indio, CA, in her Ford Model T, and has the idea for a highway centerline.(2020) YT: THG - Lane Markings"My Model T Ford and I found ourselves face-to-face with a truck on a paved highway. It didn't take me long to decide between the sandy berth to the right, and the 10-ton (9 metric ton) truck to the left. And that's when I had my idea of painting a white line down the center of the nation's highways." And she painted a local lane line when the Chamber of Commerce wouldn't.
    1917Kenneth Ingalls Sawyer painted a white center line along a dangerous curve in Michigan.(2020) YT: THG - Lane Markings
    Apr1917Deputy Sherriff Peter Rexford in Oregon had the idea for a center line while riding a bus on a dark and rainy night.(2020) YT: THG - Lane MarkingsThe county refused to pay for the project, so Chief Deputy Martin Pratt paid for the paint along Columbia River Highway, between Crown Point and Multnomah Falls.
    1917Ernest Rutherford discovers the proton.(2016) YT: Fermilab - Strong NuclearLacking any force to explain why like-charged particles would remain together within a nucleus, the Strong Force was developed.

    1920sLight bulb life times reach 2000 to 2500 hours.(2021) YT: Veritasium - nice things(At 8 hours per workday, this lasts about 250-312.5 days or between 1-1.25 working years.) This is the longest that bulbs lasted. After this, light bulb life decreases.
    1920sMilutin Milankovic (Serbia, geophysicist astronomer) notices Milankovic Cycles.Wiki: Milankovitch cyclesHe hypothesized that the Earth's climatic patterns were strongly influenced by "orbital forcing" - variations in orbit eccentricity, axial tilt, and precession across thousands of years - resulted in cycles of variation in the solar radiation reaching the Earth. That is, Earth's orbit has sometimes been much more eccentric than it currently is - and based on Newton's inverse square rule, being 2x further away gives you 1 / (2 ^ 2) = 25% as much solar radiation. Solar output and distance are by far the primary drivers of Earth's temperature.
    1920sAlfonso13 (Spain) has bad war against Morocco.(2017) YT: FH - Spanish Civil War
    1920sLawyer Herbert Rowse Armstrong (Hay-on-Wye, UK), poisoned his wife with arsenic.(2016) YT: PV - ArsenicThe lawyer's business rival got sick after having tea with him, where Armstrong had brushed the rival's scone and contaminated it with arsenic. Based on this they reinstalled his wife out of the ground, and found she was full of arsenic. When they went to arrest him, they found a small baggie of arsenic in his pocket.
    1920sLos Angeles Phuenomic Plague.Imgur: gIY2hKH (link 404s)
    1920sMilutin Milankovitch (Serbia) calculated that Ice Ages occur approximately every 41,000 years.NASA - Milankovich CyclesHe hypothesized the long-term, collective effects of changes in Earth’s position relative to the Sun are a strong driver of Earth’s long-term climate, and are responsible for triggering the beginning and end of glaciation periods. (At maximum distance, it might partially offset anthropogenic CO2 accumulation.)
    1920sRadio broadcasting was just being established.EDi - Muzak
    1920sFuel Injection was seen as only necessary for engines that use fuel oil, and carburetion was seen as sufficient for engines powered by more volatile fuels.(2021) YT: NM - Fuel InjectorEverything changed when the aircraft nation attacked. Airplane fuel injection operated at much lower pressures - 30-40 bar (435-580 PSI, 22.5k-30.0k mmHg) - with much more consistent air/fuel mixing, and the elimination of backfires. Injectors made engines largely immune to issues caused by an airplane's frequently-changing operating environment.

Further, the steering wheel and other equipment had been smashed with a sledgehammer. At the time, the US State Dept reported "every suspicion of foul play."     1922US Army Major General George O. Squier patented a system for the transmission and distribution of background music from phonograph records over electrical lines to workplaces.EDi - MuzakSquier was intrigued by the made-up word Kodak being used as a trademark and so took the "mus" sound from music and added the "ak" from Kodak to create his word Muzak. At the time, phonograph records only lasted for one song or tune. As the equipment required to amplify the music was also relatively expensive, Squier's distribution system allowed costs to be shared amongst many subscribers.

    1Sep1923Japanese islands rocked by 4 minute long 8.0 magnitude earthquake.(2021) YT: MH - Honda PointThis caused fire tornadoes and uninstalled over 100k humans (12.0 Covid-days).     9Sep1923Honda Point CA naval training disaster.(2021) YT: MH - Honda Point

    These were 14 Clemson class destroyers, and were finally being allowed "off their leashes". This would be a power trial, and they would sail at 20 knots from San Diego to San Francisco.

    Destroyer Squadron (DesRon 11):

    • Flagship: USS Delphy DD261 (Captain Edward H Watson)
    • DesDiv 33: USS SP Lee DD310, USS Young DD312, USS Woodbury DD309, USS Nicholas DD311.
    • DesDiv 31: USS Farragut DD300, USS Fuller DD297, USS Percival DD298, USS Summers DD301, USS Chauncy DD296.
    • DesDiv 32: USS Kennedy DD306, USS Paul Hamilton DD307, USS Stoddart DD302, USS Thompson DD305.

    Ships were navigating with dead reckoning, but were also experimenting with the new radio direction finding (RDF) technology. This system used a number of shore-based stations in tandem with ships to provide a single Line of Bearing (LOB). It had some flaws, but was valuable in poor visibility.

    Visibility was worsening as the ships steamed south. Dead reckoning and experience told the navigators they were further south, but RDF told them they were further north and near the coast. Watson decided the new technology was in error and that they were too close to San Miguel (one of the Santa Barbara channel islands) and the SS Cuba, which had ran aground there. SOP had ships in columns, with 250 yards (228.6 m) from foremast to foremast, which mandated they overdrive their braking capabilities. Traveling at 11 yards/sec (10.0 m/s, 22.5 mph, 36.2 km/h, 19.5 knots) means they covered this gap in 22.7 seconds.

    • 2100 - Watson orders ships turn to port (left) at 095 degrees, turning due east and closing on shore.
    • 2105 - USS Young crashes a submerged reef, spins starboard (left, north), and gets stuck on the reef.
    • USS Delphy glides on gravel before crashing. Most captains had realized the Delphy was aground.
    • USS SP Lee sees Delphy crash, and the captain turned port (right, south) in a panic, but only found more coastline and went aground.
    • USS Nicholas also goes to port (right, south) and makes her propeller touch bottom before going aground.
    • USS Woodbury was behind the USS Young and made evasive maneuvers to starboard (left, north) and came aground on a rock that was named after it.
    • USS Farragut saw what was going on, and ordered full reverse, which badly damaged the boilers and generators.
    • USS Fuller didn't see it and crashed into USS Farragut.
    • USS Summers also hit its propellers on the bottom but managed to get away.
    • USS Chauncy gets too close to USS Young to get survivors, and Young's propellers cut through Chauncy's hull, damaging Chauncy's engines.

    Railroad section leader John Gurvis finds the boats from the nearby rail line, and tells them they weren't on the channel islands, but much more north on Honda Point (aka the Devil's Jaw). They hadn't overshot their turn, but vastly undershot it, partially due to unfelt currents pushing the fleet closer to shore. These ships reported their speed from propeller turns, and speed is an important component for dead reckoning math. Each wave pushed propellers up and sometimes out of the water, so they were really going much slower than was reported on ship instruments. By the time the sailors had climbed the cliff to see where they were, John Gurvis had gone inside and called for rescue on his landline telephone. Watson was startled by the sound of a railroad train, as he thought he was on an island, and only then did he realize just how far off course he'd led the squadron.

    1923Greece switches from Julian to Gregorian calendar.(2021) YT: SH - Nerdy XmasExcept for the Monastic Republic of Mt Athos, which used the Julian calendar far into the 21st century.     25Mar1924ΒασIλεὺς τῶν Ἑλλήνων [King of the Hellenes] ΓεώργIος Βʹ (George2) Glücksburg reign ends House of Glücksburg and the Kingdom of Greece, and Admiral Παύλος ΚουντουρIώτης (Pavlos Kountouriotis) term begins the Second Hellenic Republic.Wiki: Greek Head of StateGreeks voted to go back to a parliamentary republic, ousting George2, due to Greece's loss to Türkiye in the Asia Minor Campaign. The economy was in ruins following a decade of warfare and was unable to support the 1.5 million refugees from the population exchange with Türkiye. Greek society was stronlgy divided between the pro-Republic Venizelists, and the People's Party monarchists who refused to even acknowledge the Republic. The split in society extended to cultural and social issues such the use of Greek language and architectural styles. Adding chaos to this situation were military leaders who kept attempting coups, some successful.

    1924Arthur Eddington proposes that if Sirius B really is so unbelievably dense, then Einstein's new Relativity said light from Sirius B would be measurably redshifted by climbing out of the gravitaitonal well.(2021) YT: PE - Chandrasekhar limitEddington was a leading and well-known astronomer of his time. He said this would be 6 parts per thousand (0.6%), which is 30x the same redshift as from solar photons, making it easier to measure. He contacted Walter Adams at the Mount Wilson telescope and asked him to measure the redshift.

    24Dec1924Phoebus Cartel formed in Geneva, Swizerland.(2021) YT: Veritasium - nice thingsExecutives from light bulb manufacturers Philips, GE International, Tokyo Electric, OSRAM Germany, and UKs AEI among others, were involved. They standardized the light bulb plug, so all brands were interchangeable. They agreed to limit bulb lifespan to ~1000 hours, and set up a testing facility to ensure compliance. They fined themselves (2021 equivalent $624.67 or 2.46 GC) per 1000 bulbs sold that lasted 3000+h. (At 8 hours per workday, this was a goal of about 125 days (0.5 working years) and fine at about 375 days (1.5 working years.))

    1925Rhenium (Re#75) discovered, named after Rhine.(2012) YT: PV - Rhenium
    1925Uhlenbeck and Goudsmit postulated the existence of a new intrinsic property of particles that behaved like an angular momentum, to explain intrinsic magnetism.Chem LibreText - Uhlenbeck

    Uhlenbeck and Goudsmit proposed a new quantum parameter that would be similar to angular momentum, and thus generate the magnetic moment seen in particles. This intrinsic angular momentum was later inaccurately termed "spin" by Wolfgang Pauli, despite it having nothing to do with the classical concept of spinning around an axis - beyond generating an electric field around a particle in the same way that a spinning bar magnet generates an electric field in a copper coil. (Were it actually spinning, it would have to spin many times the speed of light to create this level of magnetic charge. This phenomenon will be referred to as Polarity for macroscopic clarity.) Polarity allows two like particles to "stack", thus explaining why electrons "orbit" in pairs. Dirac later showed that this phenomenon naturally arises with the Dirac equation, a relativistic generalization of quantum theory from the Schrödinger equation:

    [Ms] = ( ([g][μ][B])/[hbar] )[S]

    where

    • [Ms] = magnetic moment of the particle
    • [g] = constant introduced to produce the best fit with experiment.
    • [μ] is vacuum permeability = 1.257 x 10 -6 henry/ meter
    • [B] is the magnetic force?.
    • [hbar] = Reduced Planck constant.
    • [S] = Polarity operator.
    • [ċ] is a derivative (of time?), possibly of the speed of light in a vacuum. (This is suggested by the Newton-dot notation.)

    The data fits well with this equation when [g]=2, which means that the polarity gyromagnetic ratio, ([g][μ][B]/[hbar]) is twice as large as the orbital gyromagnetic ratio [μ][B]/[hbar]. The interaction with a magnetic field is proportional to [Ms]=[ċ][B], which is the basis of the NMR technique.

    1925Walter Adams publishes his conclusions on the redshift of Sirius B, supporting the unbelievably dense theory.(2021) YT: PE - Chandrasekhar limitArthur Eddington remarked that "Professor Adams has (uninstalled) two birds with one stone: he has carried out a new test of Einstein's General Theory of Relativity, and he has confirmed our suspicion that matter over 200,000 times denser than platinum is not only possible, but is actually present in our universe." This presented a new puzzle, as a material with this high of density and the compressibility of a perfect gas can happen only at temperatures high enough to completely ionize all atoms in the core, to form an aggregate of matter very different from found on Earth. An ionized gas is made of "naked" atoms - denuded of their electrons - and being millions of times smaller than normal atoms allows them to be unbelievably densely packed. Astrophysical models of the time paradoxically showed a valley, where a star would need to *gain* energy in order to cool down.
    1925Büchi installs turbochargers giant marine v10 Diesel engines.(2020) YT: d4a - Turbo HistoryThe German Ministry of Transport used these on 2 large German passenger ships: Hansestadt Danzig and Preussen. The design was licensed to other manufacturers, after which it started showing up in planes, trains, and automobiles, along with stationary engines.
    1926Japanese 大正天皇 [Emperor Taishō] reign ends and 昭和天皇 [Emperor Shōwa] reign begins.Wiki: Emperors of Japan
    1926Kenjiro Takayanagi demonstrates a television system in Japan.(2018) YT: TC - FarnsworthThis still used a mechanical camera with a Nipcow [Nipcov] disk.
    6Apr1926President Admiral Pavlos Kountouriotis (Παύλος ΚουντουρIώτης) and Lt. General Theodoros Pangalos (Θεόδωρος Πάγκαλος) terms BeginWiki: Greek Head of StateMilitary
    26May1926Mark 14 torpedo and Mark-6 exploder's first and only destructive test performed by the US Navy before WW2.(2020) YT: Drach - Mark 14 TorpedoSubmarine hulk L-8 was sunk for this demonstration, off Newport, Rhode Island. This was a new detonator inspired by magnetic mines, which are unusually destructive due to exploding underneath a ship's hull, instead of to the side or nearby. This is based on the deflection of the Earth's magnetic field by a large metal object, like an armored naval vessel. Since Earth's magnetic field varies a great deal across the planet, torpedoes would only be effective in similar areas as they were calibrated, and in other areas the torpedo would bonk off the hull (common for German torpedoes) or explode too soon (common for British torpedoes).
    1926Edwin Schrodinger publishes his equations describing subatomic particles as wavefunctions(2017) YT: PBS ST - Anti-Matter
    24Aug1926President Lt. General Theodoros Pangalos (Θεόδωρος Πάγκαλος) term ends and Admiral Pavlos Kountouriotis (Παύλος ΚουντουρIώτης) term ends.Wiki: Greek Head of StatePangalos was deposed, Kountouriotis resigned 2 days later.
    1926Pope Pius11 wrote an encyclical that priests were put in the same category as "criminals and the insane".Guardian - Mexico's religious historyThis was in response to the 1910 banning of religous priests from preaching politics from their pulpits.
    1926G. N. Lewis coined the word 'photon'.RIT.edu: Spiff - PhotoelectricThe photoelectric phenomenon described by Einstein that we percieve as light went unnamed for 21 years.
    1927Pan American Airlines starts as a mail carrier, founded by 2 US soldiers.(2018) YT: BSF - Pan AmFirst flight was from Key West, Florida to Havana, Cuba.
    1927First trip to 1908 Siberian explosion site found all trees flattened for 2000 km2 (772.2 mi2) - approx 80 million trees in total.(2015) YT: LEMMiNO - ApocalypseIt's thought to be a small asteroid or comet (about 200m or 650ft) diameter exploded a few kilometers (miles) above the site. Had this happened over NYC, it would have removed all of Manhattan.
    1927Donald Hall and Charles Lindbergh (both USA) designed and built The Spirit of St.Louis in 60 days.Patrick Collison - FastTo determine the amount of fuel the plane would need, Lindbergh and Hall drove to the San Diego Public Library at 820 E St. Using a globe and a piece of string, Lindbergh estimated the distance from New York to Paris. It came out to 3,600 statute miles (5793 km), which Hall calculated would require 400 gallons (1,514 liters) of gas. This means it got about 12 MPG (3.82 km/L)
    1927Quartz oscillator invented, as more accurate timekeeping mechanism than Huygens' pendulum clock(2018) YT: PN - Titan
    Jan1927American Association of State Highway Officials published a Manual and Specification for the Manufacture and Erection of US Standard Road Markers and Signs.(2020) YT: THG - Lane MarkingsThis only addressed signs, but not road markings.
    Jan1927Philo Farnsworth (USA) submits a patent for his television system.(2018) YT: TC - FarnsworthFarnsworth's camera uses caesium oxide (which releases electrons when hit with photons) to create an "electron image" of the image, then scan this electron image with a CRT - the electrons would normally be absorbed by the caesium oxide, but would be reflected where it was energized (and emitting electrons) onto a detector.
    12Apr1927The name of the UK was amended to the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland.Wiki; British Monarchs
    10May1927Murray Raney patents Raney Nickel, a mixture of nickel and aluminium.(2017) YT: PV - NickelThese metals mix when heated, but separate when cooled (different cooling temps/rates?) for little chunks of nickel in the aluminum. This is kept as a slurry with water, to prevent spontaneous ignition. Adding sodium hydroxide pellets dissolved in water dissolves the aluminum (also possible with soda cans), leaving the superfine nickel, water, and aluminum hydroxide.
    26May1927Ford Motor Company ends production of the Model T, in favor of the Model A.(2020) YT: PS - Models A vs TAlmost 15 million Model Ts produced since production began in 1908 - this averages to almost 750k per year. They were selling for $390 (2021 equivalent $6,073 or 23.9 GC) by this point. Ford Motor Company was floundering by this point, with the waning popularity of the Model T, so Clara Ford threatened to leave Henry Ford in order to get him to end the aged Model T. He worked with Edsel Ford to redesign their cars.
    1927Latin Monetary Union ends.Currencies Fandom - Swiss FrancThe Swiss franc CHF continued to be valued at 4.5 grams of silver (2021 equivalent $3.77 or 0.01 GC) or 0.290322 grams of gold (2021 equivalent $18.31 or 0.07 GC).
    7Sep1927Farnsworth transmits first television system image.(2018) YT: TC - FarnsworthIt was only a line, and not a full-screen image, but was a great proof-of-concept.
    1927Fritz Lang directs Metropolis, which predicts massive cities with mega-skyscrapers, expansive highways, and beautiful robots in a jazz-age art-deco aesthetic.(2020) YT: HL - Past PredictionsIt was influenced by 1920s NYC, which expanded almost explosively.
    1927Great Mississippi Flood.(2022) YT: ITS - Hurricane KatrinaNew Orleans was protected from flooding by using dynamite to detonate the levee upstream, sacrificing poorer St Bernard and Plaquemines parishes [religious districts]. Residents were never paid for their losses.

    1928Arnold Sommerfeld (Germany) visits India.(2021) YT: PE - Chandrasekhar limitSubrahmanyan Chandrasekhar (India), as an undergraduate, would hear about the newly-invented quantum mechanics from Sommerfeld. (Did Sommerfeld give a lecture that Chandrasekhar attended? Or were they formally introduced?) After this, Chandrasekhar started reading everything he could about quantum mechanics, especially Fowler's paper on dense matter, and started thinking about white dwarfs. Eventually Chandrasekhar realized Fowler omitted quantum mechanics from his analysis of degenerate stars, and that the electrons inside would eventually reach the speed of light.
    1928Law student Pedro Flores (Phillippines) in the USA, begins hand-making yo-yos and selling them to neighborhood kids.ThomasNet - Yo-YoCalled "bandalores" in the Phillippines, Flores used the Tagalog word "yo" [come] instead to sell them. He quickly found investors and sold 300k within a year, then sold the company to Donald Duncan. Duncan would grow the toy into one of the most popular in the USA.

    24May1930Planet X (ecks) found, named Pluto.(2015) YT: LEMMiNO - Space Top10 [p6]But this body was too small - both in mass and volume - that it couldn't account for Uranus' orbital irreguarities.
    1930National Conference on Street and Highway Safety published a manual on street traffic signals and markings.(2020) YT: THG - Lane MarkingsThe manual suggested lane lines in many situations, such as curves of radius less than 600 ft (182m), or hill crests with insufficient view. Center lines were also recommended on streets with heavy traffic in both directions, or wide enough to have more than one lane each way. Lines were to be at least 4 inches (10 cm) wide and white or yellow on bituminous pavement, and black or white on concrete. Use of black paint decreased during WW2, since it couldn't be seen at night during blackout. (Black paint on concrete can be hard to discern in full sunlight.) Lines could be dashed to save paint, but should be evenly dashed.
    1930Chalkboards invented.Wiki: BlackboardGreen porcelain enamel surface was first used on slate blackboards, and as this type of board became popular, the word chalkboard appeared.
    Jul1930Transcontinental Air Transport and Western Air Express merge to form Transcontinental & Western Air (T&WA), to better compete for larger USPS airmail contracts.(2019) YT: BSF - TWAThey established routes across the USA to transport passengers and mail. They would split after a couple years, but Transcontinental kept the T&WA name.
    1930Harry J Anslinger becomes Commissioner of the US Federal Bureau of Narcotics.Imgur: now you knowAnslinger ran a campaign against marijuana, using racist claims to support outlawing marijuana. Anslinger's racist quotes also include a hatred of jazz & swing, revealing his scientific ignorance by conflating the performance of some types of music with certain skin pigmentations. He frequently used these to imply that he was better in some way than musicians and laborers.

    1930P&G's logo created, with a man in the moon looking out on 13 stars.AtlasObscura - P&G Satanic Panic(It was) first developed by wharf hands to mark STAR candle crate boxes, a spokesperson from P&G, Tressie Rose, explained in an email. "We then decided to formalize it, created the graphic, 13 stars for the 13 original US colonies."

Roosevelt. This was during the Great Depression, and was allowed as part of the National Industrial Recovery Act.

    1930sBrowning refines his 1911 into the Browning High-Power Pistol.(Reference 153 missing)
    1930sErnest Lawrence (USA) invents the Cyclotron.(2021) YT: Thoisoi2 - TechnetiumThis was one of the first particle accelerators. Some of the parts were made from molybdenum, and after a few experiments, it was noticed that some of those were radioactive. Further analysis revealed the new chemical element. Its name is Greek for "artificial".
    1930sDutch Elm Disease started wiping out elm trees in the United States.KREM - Botanical SexismIt was a decades-long process.
    1930sOne torpedo manufacturer in the USA remains in business.(2020) YT: Drach - Mark 14 TorpedoIn WW1, The US Navy could only get enough torpedoes for a few engagements. So they beefed up torpedo production, especially since the Clemson battleship destroyers and Omaha cruisers were going to use many. But that fleet was sent to reserves and scrapped by the Washington Naval Treaty, along with general funding. This lone manufacturer had slimmed down their staff, so when the US Navy suddenly increased their orders this decade, the manufacturer struggled to keep up while they expanded. Just more than 6 torpedoes were produced each week, between submarine torpedoes, (battleship) destroyer torpedoes, aerial torpedoes, and PT Cruiser torpedoes. This lack of supply makes the US Navy concerned about "wasting" any to testing.
    1930sMuzak became immensely popular when studies were released showing that playing it in offices and factories would improve productivity.EDi - Muzak
    1930sHimalayan blackberry were growing practically everywhere around the PNW USA, without any assistance, and maybe getting in the way of other desirable plants.MyNorthwest: Himalayan Blackberry
    1930sUSAF launches USS Akron and USS Macon.(2019) YT: Mustard - 747 CarrierThese blimps were the size of battleships, crewed by 60 and having 8 machine guns. They had internal hangars that stored 5 "parasite fighter" planes. But both were destroyed in weather-related incidents within 3 years.
    1930sAtlas Imperial Diesel company (CA, USA) announces an electromechanical fuel injector.(2021) YT: NM - Fuel InjectorThis was an upgrade from previous all-mechanical injectors. This allowed injection timing to be fully decoupled from engine timing. Separately, Unit Injectors become common, especially in marine use.
    1930sRoy Ovid Hall (US Commerce Dept economist), wants to include criminal payments in balance of payments statistics.(2018) YT: IPOV - Britain's 2nd EmpireThe logic in WADC was apparently to invoke Vatican City's religion and deny the reality that criminal activity wasn't being completely stopped by legislation and law enforcement. Instead of being called "criminal inflow and outflow", it's called "errors and omissions".
    1930sTetrachloroethylene replaces gasoline for dry cleaning.(2009) YT: MDC - Dry Cleaning w/Gasoline

    A nonflammable, synthetic solvent, also called percholoroethylene or perc. It's also used as brake parts cleaner.

    There are many stories about the origin of drycleaning, all centering on a surprise discovery when a petroleum-type fluid was accidentally spilled on a greasy fabric. In the early days, garment scourers and dryers found several fluids that could be used as drycleaning solvents, including camphene, benzene, kerosene, and gasoline. These fluids are all dangerously flammable, so drycleaning was a hazardous business until safer solvents were developed. Tetrachloroethylene would still be used in the 21st century in many drycleaning plants.

    1930sEconomics failed to give India a good model.(Reference Missing)The only choices they saw were hardcore American capitalism (which would take too long to ramp up) or hardcore USSR communism (which would take too long to convince everyone). They would wind up navigating a course between the two, making mistakes from which other nations would learn when forging their own path between the two extremes.
    1930sDiesel-electric locomotives common in USA.(2021) YT - MP: UP GTELMany had amazing art-deco styling and paint jobs. Union Pacific were unsatisfied with the low output of diesel-electric locomotives, and experimented with steam turbines, but this tech didn't work out. Fun fact: US rail track standard is about 4.5 ft (1.3 m).

    1930sFigure skater Mabel Fairbanks (USA) taught herself how to skate on small frozen ponds in New York City.KGW: Black figure skatersShe was denied entrance to skate at many of the city’s coveted rinks because of her skin pigmentation, according to the Ice Theatre of New York. She produced her own figure skating shows in Harlem, and eventually moved to California.

    1931Sanford Essig accidentally leaves an iconoscope's mica plate in the oven too long, greatly increasing its sharpness.(2018) YT: TC - FarnsworthThe iconoscope greatly increased the output of the original detector by using a mica plate, which emitted many more electrons.
    1931Pope Pius11 inaugurated Vatican Radio.Wiki: List of Popes
    1931Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar mathematically explains white dwarf stars.(2021) YT: PE - Chandrasekhar limitFor his work, Chandrasekhar would eventually win a Nobel Prize, but was immediately roasted by the leading astronomer of the time, Arthur Eddington. "There should be a law of Nature to prevent a star from behaving in this absurd way," said Eddington. And this was very discouraging for Chandrasekhar, as he said: "I felt that astronomers without exception thought I was wrong. They considered me as a sort of Don Quixote trying to (uninstall) Eddington. As you can imagine, it was a very discouraging experience for me, to find myself in a controversy with the leading figure of Astronomy, and to have my work completely and totally discredited by the astronomical community. I had to make up my mind as to what to do: should I go on fighting or change my field of interest and go into something new?" Chandrasekhar worked in other fields and did not return to white dwarfs for more than 25 years.
    1931Japan invades the Manchuria region.(2016) YT: BW - history of japanThis was a continuation of the invasion into the Korean peninsula. (They didn't see the goal posts and kept charging into the stands.)

Niceto Alcala-Zamora's 2nd Republic takes over.(2017) YT: FH - Spanish Civil WarNiceto promises a step into the 20th century - trade unions, land reform, secularization, women's liberation, and autonomy for Catalonia and Basque. This alienates the conservatives yet changes came slowly.
    1931Switzerland's CHF 5 coin was reduced in size from 25 grams (2021 equivalent $17.188 or 0.07 GC) to 15 grams (2021 equivalent $10.313 or 0.04 GC).Currencies Fandom - Swiss FrancThis was to save precious metals during WW2. (The CHF 5 coin represented the value of 22.5 grams of silver (2021 equivalent $18.85 or 0.07 GC))
    1931US Gov't has surplus of $0 billion (2021 equivalent $0 billion or 0 GD), increase by 0.6% of $1 billion (2021 equivalent $18.19 billion or 286.46k GD) blamed on Dust Bowl.TheBalance - US Deficit, GDP, Events
    25Jan1932US NACA releases a report showing fuel injection gives ~10-15% power gain over carburetion with valve overlap, and ~20% power gain over carburetion without valve overlap.(2021) YT: MAH - British EnginesOne of the benefits with fuel injection is "valve overlap" - allowing both valves to be open at once lets cool intake air pass over the hot exhaust valves, cooling them off a bit. Hot valves reduce how much you can compress a fuel without it predetonating, and increases chance of backfire. This process also pulls out the last bit of exhaust from the previous ignition, so the next ignition has more clean air and thus is more powerful. With carburetion, air and fuel are already mixed, so this wastes a small amount of fuel. But with fuel injection, you can time the injection to just after the exhaust valves have closed, wasting none of the fuel - which can be more volatile and compressed more because of the cooler exhaust valves, both giving more energy. This led the Ricardo company (UK airplane makers) to start experimenting with fuel injection.
    1932Neutron discovered(2018) YT: Veritasium - Neutrons
    20May1932Amelia Earhart becomes the first woman to fly cross the Atlantic Ocean, solo, from Newfoundland to Ireland in 15 hours.(2018) YT: BFM - Amelia EarhartShe was the 2nd person to ever travel this route. Her plane suffered fuel leaks, weak cracks, and icy windshield.

(Maybe he couldn't market it? Or maybe he already had an agreement?) Phillips refined the design, and planned to license production.

    1932Ford Flathead was very popular.(2021) YT: AG - GM Engines
    Dec1932Polish Cipher Bureau cracks the NSGerman military's Enigma code.Wiki: Enigma machineIt's a set of 5 reciprocal ciphers (Front plate, wheels A, B, C, and 4thwheel plus rolling reflector, neither of which could spin from keystrokes), with 5 different sets of reciprocal letter pairs, and all but the 5th (hub) run twice - running just once turns the other 4 reciprocal ciphers into an additional set, for a total of 8 or 9 replacements foreach letter. The 3 wheels would be swapped each day from a box of up to 8 wheels. They would rotate like a dial counter:
    • Wheel A would move once foreach 1 keystroke.
    • Wheel B would move once foreach rotation of Wheel A, or every 26 keystrokes.
    • Wheel C would move once foreach rotation of Wheel B, or every 676 keystrokes.
    1932US Gov't has deficit of $3 billion (2021 equivalent $60.56 billion or 953.7k GD), increase by 4.5% of $3 billion (2021 equivalent $60.56 billion or 953.7k GD) blamed on Hoover tax hike.TheBalance - US Deficit, GDP, Events

    1933The electoral victory of the People's Party, and two failed Venizelist coups, paved the way to the restoration of George2.Wiki: Greek Head of State
    1933German President Hindenburg names a popular German as chancellor.(2018) YT: OS - WW2 [p1]

    As chancellor, Hitler believed he was Germany's new savior, and went full meglomania. He shared a lot of Mussolini's brutal ideas - totalitarian military violence, political and physical discrimination - but more importantly, had the same enemies: UK, France, and Russia.

    Japan asked to join their club. Japan held isolationism for over 200 years, until the USA forcibly entered their ports and legitimized it with a shotgun trade deal. Japan, who have no natural resources (oil, rubber, copper, etc), were subject to a bunch of unequal treaties, busting their economy. So they invaded China to get a sphere of influence over Korea, and take their resources. But the UK, France, Germany, and Russia stopped them, because they were setting up spheres of influence across a weakend China.

    So Japan warred against Russia and won, annexing Korea. Next, they took Germany's islands in the Pacific during WW1. Then, a bomb blew up a train in Manchuria, giving Japan an excuse to invade Russia's occupation of the area. This might have been a Japanese plot.

    Germany's chancellor hated the Treaty of Versailles, and disregarded its terms. The Luftwaffe [airforce] were airborne, military conscription was introduced, and military funding greatly increased. Then German troops re-entered the demilitarized Rhineland.

    All of this was completely ignored by the other treaty members, meaning they had basically disregarded the treaty's terms also.

This led to uprisings across the nation, as people started arming themselves in the belief that Niceto's 2nd Republic has failed and can't protect them anymore.
    16Jul1934BMW-Va engine found to have 10%-17% greater power on fuel injection, with the same fuel consumption, than with a carburetor.(2021) YT: MAH - British EnginesThis power gain was attributed to greater airflow and less air intake resistance, simply by not having a carburetor in the pipe. The next year, the German Umo 210G airplane would have fuel injection.

    1935Combining tungsten carbide with a cobalt binder made a superior drill.(2020) YT: NM - Cutting ToolsThis was good for soft metals and nonmetals, but steel eroded it too quickly. So other carbides were added to allow high-speed steel manufacturing.
    10Oct1935President Αλέξανδρος Ζαΐμης (Alexandros Zaimis) term ends in a coup, and Lt. General ΓεώργIος Κονδύλης (Georgios Kondylis) reign lasts for 46 days.Wiki: Greek Head of StateAbolished the republic and declared himself regent. A former pro-Venizelos (democracy) military officer, Prime Minister Κονδύλης (Kondylis) became the most powerful political figure in Greece. He compelled Panagis Tsaldaris to resign as Prime Minister and took over the government, suspending many constitutional provisions in the process. Kondylis, who had now joined the Conservatives (monarchists), decided to hold a vote in order to re-establish the monarchy, despite the fact that he used to be a supporter of the anti-monarchist wing of Greek politics.

    1936Edward8 (UK) proposes to Wallis Simpson.History.com: RomanticsThis huge scandal pushed the UK Prime Minister Stanley Baldwin to threaten to resign. Edward8 abdicated the throne and married Wallis, instead of choosing between Wallis and Baldwin. "I have found it impossible to carry the heavy burden of responsibility and to discharge my duties as King as I would wish to do without the help and support of the woman I love." They lived in exile in France, under the titles Duke and Duchess of Winsor, becoming a fixture of "cafe culture".
    11Dec1936British King Edward8 abdicates and George6 (Albert Frederick Arthur George) reign begins.Wiki; British MonarchsGeorge5 abdicated to marry Wallis Simpson on 3 June 1937, had no children. George6 married Elizabeth Bowes-Lyon on 26 April 1923, had 2 daughters. House Windsor.
    1936Mathematician Alan Turing (UK) writes a paper describing the Universal Computing Machine.(2020) YT: TCfCH - ColossusOne implementation of this idea was called the Bombe, and had 36 Enigma cores, allowing incredibly fast code-testing. By the end of WW2, there were over 200 of these across the UK and another 120 on US Navy ships. Each one was 7 ft long, 6 ft tall, 2 ft deep, (2.1 x 1.8 x 0.6 m) and weighs about 1 ton (0.9 metric tons). Enigma worked by replacing each letter in a message with the corresponding letter in a completely separate alphabet, from over 16.9k randomized alphabets.
    1936US Amendment to mandate a public vote on all wars failed.(2022) Imgur: Failed AmendThis was similar to the 1916 amendment, but without the mandatory military service for those who vote "Yes".

    7Apr1937Government-sponsored UK airplane makers end experiments with fuel injection.(2021) YT: MAH - British EnginesDr AW Morley (UK) at the Royal Aircraft Establishment (RAE) wrote "[t]hese experiments fail to show that injection has any advantage over carburetion for engines with large valve overlaps." This was possibly because he irrationally disliked carburetion. (There's no evidence of him being a spy, nor any evidence of this being a sabotage attempt - just human irrationality.) This was "put at the disposal of the industry", which basically stalled UK fuel injection before WW2.

They planned to land at Howland island to refuel, a 20 hour flight - and carried 24 hours of fuel, but never arrived. Headwinds were fierce. The US Coast Guard ship Itasca had radio contact, and thought the plane was very close, but neither could find each other.

    Oct1937Fritz Zwicky writes "On the Masses of Nebulae and of Clusters of Nebulae".(2022) YT: SM - Biggest Telescopes(In this, he describes the unusally-consistent redshift of galaxies, which implies an unusually-consistent orbital rate. Compared to the outer planets in our solar system, the outer stars in galaxies are going way too fast - as though they're being dragged along by something we can't see, mathematically inventing Dark Matter.)

The US Navy's torpedo backlog moves from hundreds to thousands of items on backorder. Navy admirals politically maneuvered to reopen their torpedo factory, producing an additional 3 torpedoes per day, despite projections for 50 per day. The US Navy jealously guards their precious torpedoes, and don't want to test any because they have so few.

Which was given like a pie crust promise.

Eliminated the Italian majority of cardinals. Credited with intervening for peace during WW2; controversial for his reactions to the Holocaust.

    1939USA Torpedo production funding increased and 24/7 production starts.(2020) YT: Drach - Mark 14 TorpedoDespite this, no more than 25 torpedoes per day were produced. The US Navy began contracting other factories, including Pontiac, American Can Company, and a combine harvester manufacturer.
    Jun1939UK RAE report finds carbureted airplanes get different amounts of fuel depending on their flight angle.(2021) YT: MAH - British EnginesWhen raising port (tilting right), fuel flow would fall off about 0.25% per degree - down to 92% of the requested fuel at 40 degree tilt - but when raising starboard, it would increase at about half that rate, to about 104% fuel at 40 degree left tilt. (This is because the float system in the carburetor is on one side of the engine, so very affected by gravity. Model T cars may have the same issue going up steep hills.)
    1939Francium discovered.(Reference Missing)
    1939Kathleen Woodiwiss installs.History.com: RomanticsUnsatisfied with women's literature options as an adult, Kathleen would invent "bodice rippers".
    1Sep1939German troops entered Poland, and Britain & France declare war on Germany, starting WW2.(2018) YT: OS - WW2 [p1]

    Germany had made an alliance with Russia, to mutually invade Poland, and otherwise generally not be aggressors. Poles fought hard, but were no match for this double-teaming.

    Then came the "Phony War", a period of little aggression:

    France's Saar Offensive was easily repelled. They were still living in their WW1 victory: using horses, sending messages by motorcycle instead of radio, orders were vague, and troops were rarely inspected. They built the Maginot line along the German border, but not along the Belgian border nor to the channel. And they wouldn't launch artillery strikes for fear of Germany shooting back.

    The UK's attempts were equally futile. Hoping for a diplomatic solution, the RAF flew dropped propaganda fliers instead of bombs. One air marshall said it was "likely did nothing but provide the continent with toilet paper for the duration the war." The UK only sent 200k troops to France, who had mobilized millions of troops.

    Both the UK and France wanted to avoid a repeat of messy home fighting in WW1, so they looked to Norway. Sweden and Norway were both neutral, but iron ore from Sweden was traveling through Norway to Germany. So the Allied duo asked Sweden and Norway to stop, but were refused.

    The Winter War - Russia invades Finland. So the Allied duo asked Sweden and Norway to allow their troops to pass, and take the iron, but were again refused. So the Allied duo mined Norway's shipping lanes, to force these shipments into international waters, where they could be intercepted. And they attacked a German tanker, the Altmark.

    German leadership saw what the Allied duo were up to, and invaded Norway by invading Denmark, to secure the iron ore supply lines. Allied troops took the ports, but Germans took the airfields, and used air superiority to outmatch the Allies.

    After this Chamberlain resigned, and Winston Churchill took his place.

    German leadership's WW2 plan was similar to their WW1 plan: Attack France, knock out the UK in the process, then turn on Russia. And their armies were given all the prep time in the world.

    Allies tried to put troops in Belgium, but were refused, so Germany invaded easily. After this, Allies invaded the German invasion, and it looked like a repeat of WW1. But Germany had a trick: Blitzkrieg, sending thousands of refugees westward into Allied troops.

    France had considered the hilly and forested Ardennes as naturally impenetrable, and lightly defended. But Germany smashed 50 Wermacht divisions through, encircling Allied troops, decimating the French and forcing the UK to leave the continent through Dunkirk. After this, Paris and the rest of France fell easily.

    The UK were expected to fall easily after this and sue for peace, but did not. So Germany tried Mind Games, but they were not very effective. Italy declared war, to remind the UK that they were alone (a new Continenal system?) A French puppet state was left in operation, to make it seem like France and her people were happily living under German rule. Further, all 3 had colonies in Africa, and Germany were hoping their new French holdings would be ignored by UK forces - but Churchill upended that by having ships sail to Mers-el-Kebir, Algeria, and wreck boats.

    Next was air superiority over the English Channel. RAF fought bravely but were overrun by superior numbers.The Luftwaffe attacked UK ports, then RAF bases, wrecking UK air defense. Churchill ordered a small bombing run over Berlin as a response - it wasn't militarily impactful but made German leadership furious. Bombing runs directly on London were ordered, and British kids were sent to the countryside to remain safe. Air raid trips became daily occurrences for those who stayed, but they took it in stride - smiling, knitting, lounging.

    By focusing on London, Luftwaffe gave RAF bases time to recover. This led to the RAF defeating Luftwaffe forces in a final raid over London, where many Luftwaffe planes were shot down. UK had retaken air superioity over the English Channel, postponing a German invasion, but not preventing further bombing.

    193920 companies had licensed the Phillips screw.(2020) YT: THG - Screwdriver
    24Oct1939Antarctic Snow Cruiser rolls out of the assembly plant.(2021) YT: Mustard - Antarctic Snow CruiserIt was rush-built in just 6 months of crunch time, barely leaving time for a 994 mi (1600 km) shakedown drive from Chicago to Boston. Designed by Chicago's Armour Instiute of Technology, this "unstoppable machine" got stuck in heavy rains, then stuck in mud a few days later. Designed to travel at 30 mph (48 km/h), the trip should have taken just 33.1 hours of driving, but each electric motor could produce only 75 HP (56 kW), for a total of 300 HP pushing this 37 ton land boat. They arrived on the 19th day of their 8 day trip.
    1939Peterbilt began selling semi-trailers.PrideTransport - Semi-TruckT.A. Peterman found the standard method of transporting logs - river or horse teams - too inefficient, so he refurbished surplus army trucks and equipped them with trailers specifically to haul logs.
    15Nov1939US Navy Rear Admiral Richard Byrd leads the US Antarctic Service Expedition.(2021) YT: Mustard - Antarctic Snow CruiserAntarctica was expected to have vast resources hidden beneath its frosty exterior, and there was a major land-grab to try to claim various parts of the continent. The first part of legitimizing a land grab is obtaining a geographic survey from expedition teams. The expedition's goal was to establish the West Base on the Ross Ice Shelf, the East Base on the Larsen Ice Shelf peninsula, and explore Marie Byrd Land and other lands between. To meet this goal, they brought:
    • 125x humans
    • 84x sled dogs
    • 3x aircraft
    • 2x light tractors
    • 2x US Army tanks
    • 1x Antarctic Snow Cruiser

    1940sRCA develops the Orthicon Tube, which used deflector plates to slow electrons down to almost zero speed - meaning most electrons didn't have the momentum to return to the detector.(2018) YT: TC - FarnsworthThis uses the initial electron to blast electrons out of an intermediate plate, which when scanned by an electron gun would absorb its electrons instead of reflecting like the rest of the plate. (This means a television camera is an electron scanning telescope.)
