    1940NYC population 7.45 million.(2018) YT: MZ - NYC EvolutionSubways consist of 4,400 cars carrying 1.9 billion annual riders across 830 miles (1337 km) of track connecting all 500 stations. (At 250 working days a year, that's 3.8 million daily riders or 51% of the population, at 850 per car.).
    Jun1940The Paramount case first went to trial in federal court in New York.History - Paramount CaseThis called off after two weeks when the government and studio attorneys worked out a compromise deal in which the studios would retain their movie theaters but limit block booking. Dissatisfaction with this so-called consent decree led to the formation of the Society of Independent Motion Picture Producers (SIMPP) by some of the leading independent movie producers of the day, including Charlie Chaplin, Walt Disney, Samuel Goldwyn, David O. Selznick, Mary Pickford and Orson Welles.
    24Jun1940Beatrice Schilling (UK) publishes an analysis of issues caused by carburetion in Merlin engines (used on Spitfire fighter planes).(2021) YT: MAH - British Engines
    1. Unbalance of altitude needle. (Testing indicated that engine performance under 6g of acceleration (131.4 MPH/s or 211.5 km/hs-1) was equivalent to flying about 500 feet (152 m) higher in the air.)
    2. Level of fuel in float chamber. (Increased G forces make the float lighter/heavier at different times, flooding or starving the engine. This is linear, so 6 G acceleration (131.6 miles per hour per second) made the float 6x heavier and only gave 1/6 the requested fuel.)
    3. Level of diffuser delivery tube. (This fuel feed tube works based on being slightly higher than the fuel in the fuel chamber, which isn't always true for an airplane.)
    4. Effect on unvaporized fuel particles. (Unvaporized fuel might be large enough to be pulled against the airflow, especially around some of the right angles between supercharger and inlet valves. This would make the mixture leaner and starve the engine slightly.)
    5. Frothing in carburetor fuel chamber. (The float inlet would spray into the fuel chamber and form an emulsion with the air. This didn't get into the delivery tube so wasn't a huge problem.)
    Schilling spent most of the war working on a pressurized carburetor, despite being known for a regulation "orifice" for existing carburetors. The Hobson company would post-war make a direct injection system for the Bristol Taurus. The Bristol company noted these benefits:
    1. Increase in detonation limited power.
    2. Reduction of cylinder head temperatures, permitting weaker mixure strengths to be used for take-off and climb.
    3. Increased power output for a given boost pressure.
    4. Elmination of backfires and fires in the blower.
    1940Bendix (USA) pressure carburetor solves many of the problems with carburetors on airplanes.(2021) YT: MAH - British EnginesIt's not quite a carburetor anymore, so much as a hybrid between a carburetor and a throttle body fuel injector. By this point, the RAF had recovered enough crashed German planes to have fully functional fuel injected engines to test - and note the amazingly-low fuel consumption.

    Jan1941Japan's first "subcarrier", named I-400, is launched.(2021) YT: COA - Japan's Sub-Carrier Japan's navy was the 3rd largest in the world, but was still numerically smaller than the USA's, meaning it depended on quick victories. This led to designs such as the Yamato-class super-battleships, and even more far-fetched designs. Admiral Yamamoto (Japan, Commander of Japanese Combined Fleet) had proposed these I-400 class "Sentoku" (special) submarines. There were plans for 18. After the first was completed, work on the second "I-401", third "I-402", and fourth "I-403" began. These were meant to reach the USA, so the vessels were huge: Table popup.

    Huge tubular internal hangar 102 ft (31 m) long by 11 ft (3.5 m) in diameter, and an 85 ft (26m) steam catapult that took up the entire forward deck of the ship. The "subcarrier" was armed with:

    • 3x M6A1 dive bombers (Took 7 minutes to equip & launch), armed with either:
      • a torpedo.
      • up to 1800 pounds (850 kg) of bombs.
    • 8x torpedo tubes
    • 1x 140 mm (5.5 inch) deck gun
    • 4x 25 mm (0.98 in aka 98 caliber) anti-aircraft autocannons

    A small rudder, and right-leaning superstructure meant it was a hassle to drive and would constantly pull to the right. Quarters were cramped, and had no A/C nor flushing toilets. The hull was coated in a special mixture of rubber, asphalt, and cement that absorbed and deflected sonar, rendering the ship invisible to pings.

(This would have forced Hitler to also abdicate and put Hohenzollern's descendant in control of Germany's future. His immense patriotism wasn't as strong as his desire to remain in political authority, showing its corrupting influence.)
    1941Leningrad's curators were concerned for the Amber Room, among other artifacts.(2017) YT: Zepherus - Amber RoomThey covered the Amber Room since it was too fragile to move. However, the Germans found it anyway
    22Jun1941Germany launches Operation Barbarossa.(2017) YT: Zepherus - Amber Room(Invade Russia like HREmperor Friedrich1 Barbarossa [Redbeard] would have, whose life had become a common German cultural reference, where they saw themselves as the spiritual successor to the HREmpire.)
    14Aug1941Germany completes moving the Amber Room back to Konigsberg Castle in Prussia(2017) YT: Zepherus - Amber Room
    31Aug1941Bletchley Park codebreakers receive a partial duplicate of a previous German transmission.(2020) YT: TCfCH - ColossusThe UK codebreaking industry at Bletchley Park recently began hearing a new type of signal - a much faster transmission of random letters from the 5-bit ITA (International Telegraph Alphabet). It's heard along a sparse long-distance network with 12 endpoints and 4 spokes, one of which was Berlin - so it's a new high-speed channel to get information directly into Berlin. The message was over 4000 characters long, and the first 19 characters match.
    10Sep1941Cambridge mathematician John Tiltman (UK) had decrypted these two new German messages, added them together, and got 4000 characters of keystream.(2020) YT: TCfCH - ColossusHe determined that Enigma used a Vernham cipher, where a message is converted to binary (such as the 5-bit ITA), then XOR'ed against a key. The fancy bit with XOR is that XORing against the same key will decrypt the transmission, and a downside is that adding the two together makes the key disappear. Tiltman guessed the first 12 characters were setup instructions, leaving 7 identical characters - which were encrypted with the same key.
    11Sep1941Construction started on The Pentagon.Patrick Collison - FastLed by Brehon Somervell.
    9Oct1941Franklin D. Roosevelt approves an atomic program that would become the Manhattan Project.(2021) Imgur - On this day
    1941Japan declares war on USA, which USA accepts.(2016) YT: BW - history of japanThen Germany also declares war on USA, so USA joins war in Europe.
    1941Japan bombs Pearl Harbor, Hawaii.(2012) YT: OSP - Meiji Restoration
    7Dec1941Japan bombs Pearl Harbor, Hawaii.History - Mexico WW2Japan's surprise attack on Pearl Harbor brought the war to the Western Hemisphere for the first time.
    9Dec1941Mexico cut diplomatic ties with Japan.History - Mexico WW2
    9Dec1941Cambridge mathematician William Tutte (UK) performed countless modulations of the keystream, from which he determined how the new German encryption machine worked.(2020) YT: TCfCH - Colossus3 sets of wheels:
    • 5 Chi wheels: These move forward as one set with each keystroke. Repeats every 22 million steps.
    • 2 Mu wheels: These move forward at a stagger pace, about every other keystroke.
    • 5 Psi wheels: These move forward as one set with the Mu wheels. Repeats every 322 million steps.
    The encryption would XOR the message against the Chi stream, and XOR that against the Psi stream. Decryption was completely reversible: take the encrypted message, XOR that against the Psi stream, and XOR that against the Chi stream. The two streams combined created 1019 combinations. The Mu wheel stagger likely felt like a bright move by the designers, but was actually a fatal flaw, as it allowed codebreakers to add a letter to the next letter and see a pattern. (They should have gone 2 forward 50% of the time instead of 0 forward.) The German language's natural letter duplication, coupled with mechanical typography duplication, caused 20% of a message to naturally include repeated characters, which combined with the 50% duplication of Psi gave 55% zeroes, or 5% too many to be random. In other words, it allowed fast testing that reduced the number of combinations to 109, which could be done by humans in weeks.
    11Dec1941Mexico cut diplomatic ties with Germany and Italy.History - Mexico WW2
    1941US Navy uses untested Mark 14 torpedoes in combat against Japanese naval vessels.(2020) YT: Drach - Mark 14 TorpedoThe Mark 14 had only been tested with dummy warheads before, which were the wrong weight. These torpedoes sank too easily, often went under enemy ships, and either exploded too early, or crashed through the enemy hull without exploding. But too many simply disappeared. The US Navy's Bureau of Ordinance denied any issues, and refused to expend any for testing. Field modifications got the torpedo to at least hit ships instead of going under them, and the Bureau of Ordinance threatened to reprimand sailors for this.
    1941Various companies supplied gasoline direct injection technologies to their parent world power during WW2:(2021) YT: NM - Fuel Injector

    6Jan1942President Manuel vila Camacho issued a formal declaration of war against the Axis Powers.History - Mexico WW2

    1942Torpex invented.(2020) YT: Drach - Mark 14 TorpedoThis is an explosive specifically designed for torpedoes. It had about 50% more explosive power than the previous TNT warhead.
    1942USA and Mexican governments agreed to recruit more than 300k Mexicans into the Bracero program.History - Mexico WW2To work low-paying agricultural jobs in the United States, many of which had been left empty as US Americans went off to war or took on more highly suninstalled positions in armaments factories.
    1942The Alaska Highway.Patrick Collison - Fast1,700 miles (2736 km) of military roadway were built over the course of 234 days, connecting eastern British Columbia with Fairbanks, Alaska. (This is about 7.26 miles or 11.7 km per day.)
    1942Promethium discovered.(Reference Missing)
    May1942German U-boats sank two Mexican oil tankers in the Gulf of Mexico.(Reference 303 Missing)Germany refused to apologize or compensate Mexico, and Mexico declared war the next month.
    Jun1942Rear Admiral Lockwood (US Navy) begins testing the Mark 14 torpedo.(2020) YT: Drach - Mark 14 TorpedoHe had taken over one of the most active parts of the Pacific theater, and his forces had used 12 months of ordinance in 6 months, most of it futilely. Torpedo nets showed the torpedo aimed to hit 10 feet (3 meters) under the surface for a submarine, actually hit the net at 25 feet (7.6 meters) under the surface, where only heavy battleships would be hit. The average difference between setting and reality was 11 feet (3.35 meters). Word of this got to (a supposedly notorious) Admiral King, who consulted the Bureau of Ordinance, after which they admitted the issues were known and testing was flawed. The Bureau of Ordinance had used very light dummy warheads, so the torpedoes would float after testing and be easy to collect. This meant they had to calibrate the torpedoes to aim much lower than with the heavier live warheads. The warhead was increased after this, and the depth sensors were installed in an area that would give false readings, causing the torpedo to go even lower. The depth sensor was a tricky one, since it was installed where the torpedo's shape causes a vortex as it moves through the water, which isn't detectable in a currentless bathtub. Now, torpedoes consistently either explode too early, or do not explode. Some did still damage their targets, but not into sinking.
    1942Ames company invents a better urine glucose test for diabetes mellitus.(2017) YT: NR - First diabetes testThis is the Stanley Benedict test, in pill and test strip form. Put your strip or pill into a cup, and it will generate its own heat and change color.
    1Jul1942Capitol Records issues its first records.Wiki: Musicians' Strike
    1942Vatican City's temple has become a pillar of Mexican culture.LATimes - Mexico Vatican ties
    1Aug1942American Federation of Musicians president James C Petrillo began a strike against the major American record companies because of disagreements over royalty payments.Wiki: Musicians' StrikeUnion musicians wouldn't make commercial recordings for any commercial record company, only live radio programs and shows. This led to the decline of unionized big bands and the rise of individual vocalists.
    1942Vatican Bank Founded.World Finance: Vatican BankIts main purpose was to ‘provide for the safekeeping and administration of movable and immovable property transferred or entrusted to it by physical or juridical persons and intended for works of religion or charity.’
    1942Sugar Ray Robinson is named Fighter of the Year.(2019) YT: JHEB - The Fire[1]
    1942US Gov't has deficit of $21 billion (2021 equivalent $356.3 billion or 5.61 million GD), increase by 12.3% of $23 billion (2021 equivalent $390.28 billion or 6.15 million GD) blamed on Battle of Midway.TheBalance - US Deficit, GDP, Events
    Early 1940sHunt for Humpback whales declined.OfWhale - How Many Whales?Commercial and religious micropower whale uninstallers cease extensively uninstalling gray whales.
    7Jan1943Nicola Tesla uninstalls in a hotel room in New York City.(2018) YT: Biography - Tesla
    Jan1943Casablanca Conference between UK & US.ColorsNY - Tehran, Yalta, Potsdam
    15Jan1943Construction completed on The Pentagon.Patrick Collison - FastThis was 491 days after construction began.
    Apr1943Admiral Yamamoto (Japan) was shot down.(2021) YT: COA - Japan's Sub-CarrierHis flight plan had been decoded by US intelligence.
    Jun1943US Navy Submarine crews begin disabling the Mark 14 torpedo's magnetic detonators.(2020) YT: Drach - Mark 14 TorpedoThis is against the Bureau of Ordinance's orders. Submarine crews regularly have to correct the Bureau's engineers. This way, the torpedo would at least hit the ship, and maybe make a big hole in the side - enough big holes and the ship sinks. Also, there was a contact detonator that sometimes went off.
    13Jun1943Tom Riddle (Wizarding UK) opens the Chamber of Secrets.(2020) YT: ETR - Hagrid's AdventureHarry Potter legend. He uninstalls Myrtle Warren (Wizarding UK) in the process. Aka Voldemort.
    Jun1943Cambridge mathematician Maxwell Newman (UK) develops a machine that can perform the Tutte stream comparison using a computer punch tape foreach of the two key streams.(2020) YT: TCfCH - ColossusIt was named Heath Robinson after a UK cartoonist who drew impossible devices. The two tape lengths had to be coprime, and the paper tapes broke often. It could compare them at 2k characters per second, completing a run in about 15 minutes (1.8 million characters). 15 minutes was much better than the weeks a human would take. It could only do the Chi stream, not the Psi stream, but it did this very well.
    30Oct1943Declaration of the Four Nations signed at the Moscow Conference by UK, US, USSR, China.Wiki: 4 Nation DeclarationThis established the G4 who would influence the post-war period by creating an international organization to succeed the League of Nations.
    Nov1943Tehran Conference between UK, US, USSR.ColorsNY - Tehran, Yalta, PotsdamFDR and Churchill ask Stalin to join the Allies against Germany, who had pushed into Russia more than 2 years before. Stalin wanted political control over eastern Europe, support for the Yugoslav Partisans, and a westward shift of the border between Poland and the USSR. All agreed to support Iran’s government, and that Türkiye should also join the Allies in the next couple months. Stalin also asked FDR and Churchill to eventually start a 2nd front against Germany, after giving the USSR a few months to get ready - FDR and Churchill were more than willing to delay, hoping to let the forces of NSGermany and USSR reduce each others numbers. (Stalin and USSR are very much a devil you know situation for USA and other Allies.)
    Dec1943US Navy issues orders to disable the Mark 14 torpedo's magnetic detonators.(2020) YT: Drach - Mark 14 TorpedoThe USS Tinosa shot 15 torpedoes at a small 19k ton (17.2k metric ton) Japanese whale uninstalling ship, of which 13 hit, and none detonated. (Japanese whale uninstallers would be bringing whale oil home as fuel for their war efforts.) Drop testing after this showed that angle hits were much more likely to trick the faulty contact detonators into firing, than direct hits. Ships were ordered to ignore their training and fire torpedoes at an angle, which gave a slight improvement in detonations. Further testing and deconstruction revealed the contact detonator's fire pin was 90 degrees from the direction of travel - if it were in the plane of travel, the impact would help it fire, but this way impact helped it jam. Often the torpedo's collision would smash its contact detonator before it could fire. Angled impacts gave slightly longer and slower impact, damaging the fragile detonator less and putting the line of travel closer to the firing pin's line of movement. This design flaw was in the previous generation, which traveled much slower, but the Bureau of Ordinance believed the same solution - a stronger spring - would continue to work with the faster torpedo. There was an additional issue common to all torpedoes, where a gyroscope might flip, causing the torpedo to flip and chase the ship which fired it - this caused at least 2 Allied ship losses during WW2.
    1943US Gov't has deficit of $55 billion (2021 equivalent $879.33 billion or 13.85 million GD), increase by 26.9% of $64 billion (2021 equivalent $1.023 trillion or 16.11 million GD) blamed on Defense tripled.TheBalance - US Deficit, GDP, Events
    Jan1944Work begins on the fifth of Japan's "subcarriers", named I-404.(2021) YT: COA - Japan's Sub-CarrierThis and the remaining 13 of the I-400 fleet would be canceled. But 2 "mini-I400s" were built: The I-13 and the I-14 were the same concept but shrunken to fit just 2 aircraft.
    Jan1944Thomas Flowers brings a massive decryption machine on a flatbed truck to Bletchley Park.(2020) YT: TCfCH - Colossus

    It was named Colossus due to its massive size, at 7 ft long, 16 ft tall, 2 ft deep, (2.1 x 4.8 x 0.6 m). It had 1500 valves [vacuum tubes] (a transistor predecessor), and processed 5k characters a second. This required running the tape at 30 mph (48 km/h), aka 40 ft/sec (12.2 m/s). The machine could read at 10k characters per second, but this required spinning the tape at 53 MPH, which destroyed te tape. The machine used the mechanical sprocket-holes as a timing signal, so the machine would synchronize itself to the tape, instead of needing to be synched manually.

    The later Mark2 would have 2400 valves and processed 25k characters a second. Immediately destroyed after WW2, it was the most complex computing machine developed at the time. This device shortened WW2 by 2 years, and installed the electronc computing industry.

    Feb1944Solar Cycle 17 ends & Solar Cycle 18 starts.Wiki: List of solar cycles
    30Mar1944Botanist Cecil Solly (USA) writes about WW2 Victory Gardens.MyNorthwest: Himalayan BlackberryOne of the most pointed pieces of evidence that gardeners are planning to grow and increase supply of vegetables and fruit is the number of letters asking how to get rid of blackberries. Apparently something in Cecil's tone changed regarding the blackberry, reflecting changing public perception of it, despite government estimates that there would be about 43 perent less fruit available.
    Jun1944Mark 14 torpedo issues largely solved.(2020) YT: Drach - Mark 14 TorpedoOnce the torpedo was made to float at the correct depth, and the detonator issue was solved, it was a highly useful weapon. A torpedo is basically a warhead mounted to a scuba tank, which has a lawnmower engine behind it, fuel tank, transmission, and a small propeller fan behind that. (In the 21st century, they're basically "water drones".)
    22Jun1944Roosevelt signed the Servicemen’s Readjustment Act.Military - Black GI Bill DenialThis law granted sweeping benefits for veterans, including: college tuition, low-cost home loans, and unemployment insurance. US Representative John Rankin (Mississippi), the chair of the House Veterans Committee, insisted that the program be administered by individual US States instead of the Federal government - this allowed banks and realtors to continue turning away customers based on physical attributes - while having the Federal government administer [run] all of it meant discriminatory practices would be somewhat prevented and much easier to monitor & call out. Rankin added a provision to kick veterans out of the program if any other work was available to them, even work that provided less than subsistence wages. He attempted to gut another provision that entitled all veterans to $20 a week of unemployment compensation for a year. An irrational obsession with human pigmentation was one of Rankin's defining personality characteristics. Another House Representative had asked Rankin to vote "Yes" for him, but Rankin was so concerned that people with more melanin might benefit that he lied & hid, and the American Legion had to find him and make him cast the vote.
    Jul1944Squadron 201, better known as the Aztec Eagles, left from Mexico for intensive training in the United States.History - Mexico WW2These were Mexico's best, brightest, and bravest fighters.
    1944The Bretton Woods Agreement tied the US Dollar's value to gold's value.TheBalance - Paul VolckerThis helped to establish the dollar as the global currency.
    Jul1944Bretton Woods Conference between 730 delegates from all 44 Allied nations.Wiki - Bretton Woods ConfThis established:
    1. IBRD (International Bank for Reconstruction and Development, later part of the World Bank group)
    2. IMF (International Monetary Fund)
    3. The Final Act:
      • Exchange rates were all pegged to gold. (Governments were only supposed to alter exchange rates to correct a "fundamental disequilibrium.")
      • Currencies were convertible (into other currencies, aka had an exchange rate set) for trade-related and other current account transactions. Western Europe wouldn't get this done until 1958.
      • To address unfavorable exchange rates being locked in, governments could adjust them by up to 10% from the starting rate (aka par value). Raising/lowering beyond that 10% allowed the IMF to deny the country its resources if they didn't like the rate.
      • IMF membership was a requirement for IBRD membership, so all member countries were required to buy into to the IMF's capital, in exchange for voting rights tiered at certain quotas - buy more, vote more.
    1944Americium created.(Reference Missing)
    5Aug1944USS Mount Hood reaches Norfolk Navy Yards in Virginia.(2021) YT: MH - USS Mt Hood4k ton (3629 metric tons) ammo of all kinds, from bullets to rockets to aerial depth charges to 250 lb (113 kg) bombs and 14" (36 cm) battleship shells. Holds were full. A modified type C2 freighter, she was built as an ammo-handling ship. 13,910 tons (12619 metric tons), plus max 7710 tons (6995 metric tons) fully loaded. 459 ft (140 m) long, 63 ft (19.2 m) beam - 16 knots (18.4 mph or 29.6 km/h) max speed, crew 267 sailors.
    1944Curium created.(Reference Missing)
    28Sep1944Dumbarton Oaks Conference - ROChinese Half.Wiki: Dumbarton OaksWashington Conversations on International Peace and Security Organization. The general purpose and role of the UN in the Earth's human governance were formed here. ROChina and the USSR were unwilling to sit at the same table, so ROChina got to meet with the US & UK first.
    7Oct1944Dumbarton Oaks Conference - USSR Half.Wiki: Dumbarton OaksWashington Conversations on International Peace and Security Organization. The general purpose and role of the UN in the Earth's human governance were formed here.
    1944Mack had produced 2,601 semi or full trailers since 1929.PrideTransport - Semi-TruckThis was about 173 per year for those 15 years, or about 0.75 trucks per workday. Mack was also responsible for many truck innovations that are still in use in the 21st century - including power brakes, and the very first hook-and-ladder fire truck.
    10Nov1944USS Mount Hood disintegrates in an enormous explosion while docked at Seeadler [sea eagle] Harbor.(2021) YT: MH - USS Mt Hood

    It was being recklessly overused as a floating ammo storage shed at Manus Island, Paupa New Gunea, and still had 3k ton (2722 metric tons) or 75% of her ammo load from Virginia. Sailor David Greenroose (USA) (16 yo) was serving on the ship, and had counted 400 ships in the harbor on busy days, as it served as a staging area for the US invasion of Japan. Greenroose recalled that while the ship flew the "E" ammunition flag, it was illegally parked: US Navy regulations said an ammunition ship had to be anchored several thousand feet from other ships, not docked next to them.

    Storage practices were lax, with explosives stored next to detonators, incendiaries stored in a wood and tar paper hut, and several damaged rockets whose propellant was badly leaking onto a storeroom floor. Proper explosive handling techniques weren't taught and safety notices weren't posted. Non-smoking areas around the ship weren't enforced.

    The 3 kiloton (12.552 TJ) blast lowered the 35 ft (10.7 m) harbor by another 50 ft (15.25 m) across a 200 ft x 1000 ft (61 m x 305 m) area, in which was found the largest piece of ship, just 10 ft x 16 ft (3 m x 4.8 m). All organic matter was vaporized entirely in the blast. The harbor was somewhat empty, with only 82 listed uninstalled and another 98 injured from this ship, and just over 1k total injured from all ships. On a busy day, up to 20k could have been uninstalled by the explosion (2.4 Covid-days), Greenroose said. The 350 sailors whose remains were entirely vaporized in the blast were recorded as Missing In Action (MIA) instead of uninstalled, as there were no remains. Instead of blaming the uninstalled, Admiral Nimitz excused the technical errors and lack of procedure following on the "keen desire to meet necessary military commitments" and that war would always invole certain operational hazards.

    11Nov1944American Federation of Musicians strike against the major American record companies ends.Wiki: Musicians' StrikeRCA Victor and Columbia finally capitulated, agreeing to substantially similar terms as the other recording companies - some recording companies did not have an extensive backlog of recordings, and they settled with the union early, more than a year before this.
    31Dec1944Greek King ΓεώργIος Β΄ (George2) reign ends and Archbishop Δαμασκηνός (Damaskinos) of Athens reign begins.Wiki: Greek Head of StateNamed regent after the Liberation of Greece, until the conclusion of a vote on the monarchy
    1944Foo Fighters.(2022) YT: UFOJ - Flying SaucersSmall bright orbs were often seen alongside fighter pilots. CIA files note that, had the term UFO been popular at this point, these bright orbs would have been publicly known as UFOs instead of saucer-shaped craft.
    1944US Gov't has deficit of $48 billion (2021 equivalent $754.33 billion or 11.88 million GD), increase by 21.2% of $64 billion (2021 equivalent $1.005 trillion or 15.83 million GD) blamed on Bretton Woods.TheBalance - US Deficit, GDP, Events

    22Apr1945San Francisco Conference between 50 nations (formation of UN).ColorsNY - Tehran, Yalta, Potsdam
    30Apr1945The Aztec Eagles (including 33 pilots and more than 270 support personnel) arrived in Manila Bay in the Philippines.History - Mexico WW2Over the next few months, they flew 795 combat sorties and logged almost 2k hours of flying time, including conducting bombing missions over Luzon and Formosa and providing support for US pilots.
    1945As NSGermany declined, troops guarded assets like famous artworks against the Allies.(2017) YT: Zepherus - Amber RoomThis included the Amber Room.
    8May1945WW2 Allied Victory in Europe (VE).Wiki - VE DayThis was the formal acceptance by the Allies of WW2 of Germany's unconditional surrender of its armed forces
    Jul1945Potsdam Conference between US, UK, USSR.ColorsNY - Tehran, Yalta, PotsdamThere was dispute about how to handle post-war Germany. But Churchill had lost reelection earlier this year, and Roosevelt uninstalled, so the tone was different.
    • Stalin (USSR) wanted to divide it back into numerous other states, and weaken those through heavy reparations. (Like a true sadist, looking to maximize punishment and pain.)
    • Clemenceau (France is somehow involved) knows that's how this war started (WW1 forced heavy reparations out of Germany, forcing an austerity that Hitler blamed on racism), and doesn't want a repeat.
    • Truman wants a strong Germany, so they can be a trade partner, and spread Capitalism through trade - he believes Communism spreads in poor and weakened countries, which he wants to prevent.
    In the end they went with a modified version of the USSR separation plan into 4 parts - USSR, UK, USA, and France. Stalin got his weakened state with heavy repartations. USA, UK, and France made a union of theirs, and made it into the Capitalist trade powerhouse that Truman and Clemenceau wanted. There was a population drain from the USSR state (which included a divided Berlin) to the other 3, so the USSR built a wall (and staffed it with armed soldiers for decades) to stop this.
    1945Nuclear bombs first used in human warfare.(2016) YT: BW - history of japan
    1945Japanese imperialism ends.(2012) YT: OSP - Meiji Restoration
    6Aug1945Nuclear bomb used over Hiroshima, Japan.Wiki - Atomic bombingsThis uninstalled 20k soldiers and between 70k and 126k civilian humans (between 10.9 and 15.2 Covid-days), and injured many times more. ("Little Boy" was a Uranium bomb that exploded with the energy of 15 kilotons of TNT (63 TJ) at 600 m (1968 ft). It required merely conventional explosives to detonate, driving a uranium plug into its uranium cap (with a little polonium to get things going), surrounded by neutron-reflecting tungsten carbide. Before this, it would have required several trucks or a barge of TNT to destroy a city, - or 5x USS Mt Hoods - but now it was possible to do so with one bomb.)
    9Aug1945Nuclear bomb used over Nagasaki, Japan.Wiki - Atomic bombingsThis uninstalled 150 soldiers and between 39k and 80k civilian humans (between 4.7 and 9.7 Covid-days), and injured many times more. ("Fat Man" was a Plutonium bomb, which exploded with the energy of of 21 kilotons TNT (87.8 TJ) at 503 m (1650 ft) above Nagasaki City. Significant numbers of radionuclides were created, including 137Cs and 239,240Pu, polluting the city for decades.)
    9Aug1945WW2 Allied Victory in Japan (VJ).Wiki - VJ DayThis was Japan's formal unconditional surrender of its armed forces. This is the VJ date recognized in the UK.
    17Aug1945Four Japanese "subcarriers" were dispached to strike the US fleet at Ulithi Atoll.(2021) YT: COA - Japan's Sub-CarrierI-400 and I-401 were part of Operation Arashi (storm), which would have launched all 6 of their Seirans in kamikaze attacks at US forces. Two more were sent to Singapore.
    Sep1945Japanese Unit 731 develops fleas infected with plague pathogens.(2021) YT: COA - Japan's Sub-CarrierOperation "Cherry Blossom At Night" would have had these dropped from submarine-launched bombers over US soil. These plans weren't completed, and plans instead were made for a conventional attack on the Panama Canal, but these were also canceled in favor of defending the Japanese archipelago. Ultimately, all weapons on board, including the planes, were ordered destroyed upon Japan's conceding the war.
    2Sep1945WW2 Allied Victory in Japan (VJ) documents signed.Wiki - VJ Day This is the VJ date recognized in the USA.
    2Sep1945Korea partitioned along the 38th parallel.Wiki: KoreaThe United Nations developed plans for a trusteeship administration, the USSR administering the peninsula north of the 38th parallel and the United States administering the south. The politics of the Cold War resulted in the 1948 establishment of two separate governments, North Korea and South Korea. The north under USSR occupation and the south under US occupation supported by other allied states. Consequently, North Korea, a USSR-style socialist republic was established in the north and South Korea; a Western-style regime, was established in the South.
    1945Akiba and shiba dog breeds threatened by canine distemper.(2021) YT: BA - Every Dog BreedThis canine disease saw a rise among the post-WW2 famine. (Japan struggled to feed its citizens after the war. The legend of conveyor sushi starts with Japanese chefs who had too few ingredients to make menus - they might have enough for one serving of a dish, but not 20 - and instead put whatever meals they could scrape together onto little paper boats on a little pond. Customers could look at the meals floating around and grab one if it sounded good, then pay after.)
    Fall1945The efforts by independent movie producers helped get the government's studio antitrust case back into court.History - Paramount CaseAfter a New York District Court handed down a guilty ruling (the terms of which nonetheless failed to satisfy the government and the independent producers), both sides submitted appeals that would eventually take the case all the way to the US Supreme Court.
    26Nov1945Charlie Parker recorded "the greatest Jazz session ever".Wiki: Charlie ParkerRecording as Charlie Parker's Reboppers, Parker enlisted Dizzy Gillespie and Miles Davis on trumpet, Curley Russell on bass and Max Roach on drums. The tracks recorded during this session include Ko-Ko, Billie's Bounce, and Now's the Time. This was the height of Bebop, with much of its formulation going unrecorded during the Musicians' Strike.
    5Dec1945Squadron of 5 planes departs a Naval Air Station in Ft Lauderdale, Florida, on a routine navigaion training exercise over the Bahamas, led by flight instructor Charles Taylor.(2017) YT: LEMMiNO - Bermuda Triangle
    • At about 2 hours after takeoff, on the way back, the pilot of the leading plane became disoriented, as both of his compasses were malfunctioning. (Were they malfunctioning in the same way?)
    • At about 4 hours after takeoff, the planes had traveled about 200km (125 mi), and Patrick AFB launched flying boat ST-49 to intercept them, but the flying boat inexplicably disappeared after a routine transmission.
    • At about 5 hours after takeoff, at 19:04 Eastern, a final transmission was intercepted - one plane (FT-3) trying to contact another (FT-28) in the group, but getting no response.
    • Communications intercepted arguing between the 5 pilots around the 2-hour mark, about directions and bearings, but lost the signal as the it faded out across a few minutes.
    • Taylor was an experienced training pilot from a Naval Air Station in Miami, which trained over the Florida Keys - and stationed in the Keys before that- but he had never flown over the Bahamas, and got disoriented as he flew over the similar-looking archipelago.
    • He took control of the squadron, and denied his compasses, 5 training pilots, and aircraft tower in believing that he was over the Keys, leading them northeast (out to the open ocean) to find land, instead of west.
    • Taylor initially used the wrong call sign - MT-28 (Miami Torpedo bomber 28) instead of the correct FT-28 (Ft Lauderdale number 28) further supporting the theory of his confusion.
    • As for ST-49, 23 minutes after it took off, a ship nearby saw a plane catch fire, then crash into the ocean and explode - the flames went up 30 feet, and when the ship got there, they found no survivors.
    • The plane used by ST-49 had "gone aground" the day before - few details to explain that, but could have caused mechanical failure such as an engine explosion.

    1947India becomes independent from Great Britain.Imgur: Britishers
    1Apr1947ΒασIλεὺς τῶν Ἑλλήνων [King of the Hellenes] George2 (ΓεώργIος Βʹ) reign ends and Paul Glücksburg (Παῦλος) reign begins.Wiki: Kings of GreeceThird son of Constantine1, Brother of George2
    May1947Solar Cycle 18 maximum.Wiki: List of solar cycles
    1947A crowd hurled rocks at WW2 veterans as they moved into a Chicago housing development.Military - Black GI Bill Denial

    Thousands of veterans were attacked in the years following WW2, and some were singled out and suddenly vertically uninstalled, due to their skin pigmentation.

    From the start, some veterans had trouble securing the GI Bill’s benefits. Some could not access benefits because they had not been given an honorable discharge—and a correlation of dishonorable discharge and increasing skin pigmentation, as though there were an irrational obsession with punishing people for producing high amounts of melanin.

    The GI Bill created a massive influx of students, and institutions reacted to this glut in different ways. Southern colleges simply refused to matriculate any students who generated too much melanin, while Northern universities focused on low-melanin students. 95% of high-melanin veterans were shunted off to mostly-unaccredited Black colleges where they would compete for the few availabilities with students fresh from high school. The VA addressed this educational inequality by encouraging veterans to apply for vocational training instead of university admission, and arbitrarily denied educational benefits to some students. Vocational training programs were impacted by the same segregational policies as the rest of the education system, further limiting the learning opportunities for these individuals. Black veterans and civil rights groups protested their treatment, calling for protections like Black involvement in the VA and non-discriminatory loans, but the racial disparities in the implementation of the GI Bill had already been set into motion.

    Of the more than 3,200 VA-guaranteed home loans across 13 Mississippi cities, banks turned away an estimated 318 customers purely due to their skin pigmentation. This afinancial nonsense wasn't limited to the South, notes historian Ira Katznelson, as in New York and northern New Jersey, banks again turned away an estimated 6,600 customers purely based on pigmentation. This forced these veterans to remain in cities that received less and less investment from businesses and banks. This was possible because the Veteran's Administration (VA) didn't have the funds to provide these loans, and so acted as cosigner on local bank loans. This allowed local banks to coordinate Redlining—a decades-old practice of marking maps by skin pigmentation or ancestry, to characterize the risks of lending money and providing insurance, thereby reducing the available housing supply to that group. Lenders banned customers from poorer neighborhoods, ensuring that they couldn't receive this goernment assistance. And new suburbs often came with overtly racist covenants that denied entry to people based on their pigmentation.

    New businesses sprouted around these suburbs, and they hired and served mostly local people. This local suninstalled labor allowed workers to collect large amounts of assets - and due to Redlining, almost all of these local workers and customers had pale or pink pigmentation. Long-term asset collection was largely blocked for people with darker pigmentation.

    Some veterans seeking the education they had been guaranteed were at a considerable disadvantage - generational discrimination prevented their parents from having the incomes to properly fund public schools, meaning additional college prep was often needed to reach the level of education provided by well-funded public high schools. And there was a lot of social and cultural pressure to forego public education and enter the workforce as a courier of illegal goods.

    Southern postmasters were even accused of refusing to deliver the forms veterans needed to fill out to receive their benefits.

    "Though Congress granted all soldiers the same benefits theoretically," writes historian Hilary Herbold, "the segregationist principles of almost every institution of higher learning effectively disbarred a huge proportion of Black veterans from earning a college degree."

    July1947An unidentified object crashed into a farm in Roswell, New Mexico.(2019) YT: GG - Area 51General William "Butch" Blanchard stated that the US Military had recovered the remains of a UFO, of extraterrestrial origin. The US Army immediately retracted the statement, saying it was a balloon. In these days, they liked to "make it so secret that even the cover story is classified." The "shell conspiracy" here:
    • The UFO crashed (possibly shot down by EMPs from nuclear weapon "testing" at the nearby White Sands testing facilities) which was classified with the cover story:
    • It was a "Project Mogul nuclear listening balloon", which was also classified with the cover story:
    • It was a weather balloon to gather high-altitude atmospheric data.
    1947Roswell crash, and Project Sign starts.(2022) YT: UFOJ - Flying SaucersThis was the dawn of the "flying saucer" era, when the term UFO came to mean saucer-shaped craft specifically, and not other UAPs. (The additional implication that these were piloted by a specific type of extraterrestrial, and that reporting the sighting of any UAP meant that you wholeheartedly believed in all of those implications specifically and without reservation. Hollywood and other media thoroughly perpetuated this concept to the point that seeing something unknown in the sky could get you fired, evicted, and arrested for trying to start a mass panic. And now that you're an unemployed and homeless criminal, nobody will listen to you, and you get arrested again for vagrancy.)
    1947US Gov't sues Phillips and some manufacturers over screw market price fixing and suppressing competition.(2020) YT: THG - ScrewdriverPhillips settled the next year, with reduced ability to apply the patents.

    1947British railway ridership sees a drop to about 1 billion passengers served that year.(2018) YT: Mustard - HovertrainsAt 250 working days a year, this is 2 million daily commuters.

Times were still hard, but being one of two airlines allowed to fly to Europe helped a lot.

    Late 1940sUSAF develops punch cards to automate manufacturing of complex airplane parts.(2020) YT: NM - Cutting ToolsThis early CNC project was spearheaded by MIT's servomechanism laboratory.
    30Jan1948Airplane Star Tiger approaches Bermuda from the east, but fails to arrive.(2017) YT: LEMMiNO - Bermuda TriangleThe pilot and crew were experienced, but had bad weather and were blown off course an hour before the last transmission, and they were never seen again.
    1948National Conference on Street and Highway Safety published a new manual, which specifies using dashed lane lines for passing lanes.(2020) YT: THG - Lane Markings
    3May1948The US Supreme Court issues a decision in US v Paramount Pictures, et al against Paramount et al.History - Paramount Case The trial had been at the Court since February. At the time, the seven studios controlled almost all the country’s movie theaters, either through ownership of their own theater chains or through a process known as "block booking," in which independent theater owners signed contracts with the studios that required them to show a given number (or "block") of films. The government’s case accused the studios of violating the Sherman Antitrust Act in their total control over movie distribution and exhibition, and demanded that the studios end block booking, and get rid of either their distribution arms or theaters. By the terms of the verdict, the studios were made to sign consent decrees that would end the practice of block booking by requiring that all films be sold on an individual basis. They were also required to divest themselves of their own theater chains. With this decision, independent producers could finally begin to compete with the major studios for audiences and actors, marking the beginning of the end for the Hollywood studio system.
    24Jun1948The USSR initiated a blockade of Berlin.Patrick Collison - Fast
    24Jul1948RO(S)Korea President Syngman Rhee reign begins.Wiki: Korea
    9Sep1948DPR(N)Korea Supreme Leader Kim Il-sung reign begins.Wiki: Korea
    1948The anomaly of chloral hydrate being polar yet a potent hypnotic was solved when Claude Bernards experiment was repeated.Wiki: Chloral HydrateWhile chloral hydrate was expected to convert to chloroform, it was found to convert to a different metabolite - the more lipophilic molecule 2,2,2-Trichloroethanol. Prior to this, it had not been demonstrated that general anesthetics could undergo chemical changes to exert their action in the body.
    1948GE builds a Gas Turbine ELectric (GTEL) locomotive, the GE 101, for Union Pacific.(2021) YT - MP: UP GTELThe major downside of gas turbines is the overwhelming fuel use, but this was supposed to be made up for by generating the output of several diesel-electric locomotives. Here, it was also offset by using very cheap Bunker C fuel, despite its several downsides. UP would accept the train into their ranks the next summer as UP 50, but never actually took ownership. The fuel was soon changed to more expensive #6 heavy fuel oil, which burns cleaner, causes less wear, and doesn't turn into a sludge when cold. The extra fuel cost was offset by greatly increasing the air taken into the engine with adjustable vents.
    1948US Amendment to allow citizens to segregate themselves failed.(2022) Imgur: Failed AmendThis is what the Right to Associate (or not associate) in the First Amendment means.

    17Jan1949Airplane Star Ariel departs Bermuda for Kingston, Jamaica - but it failed to arrive, despite the pilot making a routine transmission an hour into the flight.(2017) YT: LEMMiNO - Bermuda TriangleThis was a sister plane to Star Tiger - and had a heater under the first officer's seat. If hot hydraulic gasses got onto the heater, it could have caused an explosion.
    1949Vadim Kolpakov discovers an enormous crater in Siberia.(2015) YT: LEMMiNO - Unsolved Top10Now called the Patomskiy Crater, it's as large as a 25-story building. It looks vaguely like a volcano - a massive pile of rock and dirt, with an edge ring, inner moat (of a sort), and center hill as high as the edge ring. Volcanoes haven't been active in the area for at least a few million years, yet this was formed only about 300 years ago.

    1949Harry S. Truman reelected.(2019) YT: JHEB - The Fire[1]Newspapers were so sure that Thomas E Dewey (USA) would win that they pre-printed editions saying so beforehand, but Truman won anyway. He got a lot done, not unlike Caesar:
    • The use of nuclear weapons against Japan (uninstalls 200k civilians and injures many more).
    • The Berlin Airlift (airdrop supplies into isolated West Berlin).
    • Starting NATO.
    • Starting the Cold War (a time of vague and unspoken hostilities between the USA and Russia/USSR).
    • Incepting anti-Communist messaging into USA's foreign policy.
    • Antagonizing Russia to make the Cold War worse.
    • Increased Minimum Wage in the USA.
    • Started Social Security Reforms.
    Cultural events this year:
    • Doris Day (USA) starred in My Dream is Yours and It's A Great Feeling. Singer and actress, she was a cute woman.
    • Communist Party of China wins their brutal civil war, and establishes The People's Republic of China. They became another target for Truman's antagonizing.
    • Johnnie Ray (USA) was a partially-deaf musician. (His controversial bad-boy image was popular in the innocent times.)
    • South Pacific addressed racism, sex, and gender roles, making it controversial for the times.
    • Walter Winchell (inventor of the gossip column) and Drew Pearson expose a conspiracy (where the Secretary of Defense James Forrestal (USA) would continue the job in Dewey's cabinet after a Dewey victory. Truman fired him for this, and he left the job extremely stressed, and had a highly-narcotic psychiatric treatment, after which he was found uninstalled on a roof 14 stories below the floor where he was staying. There is speculation that this overwhelming stress was from the MIB-esque double whammy of having extraterrestrial life confirmed, and not being able to discuss this with friends and family due to having to cover it up from the world.)
    • Joe DiMaggio (USA) becomes the first MLB player to sign a $100k (2021 equivalent $1.168 billion or 18.4k GD) employment contract. Even in 2021, he still holds the record for a 56-game hitting streak.
    • USSR develops a nuclear weapon.
    1949Cadillac got a V-8 engine.(2021) YT: AG - GM Engines
    1949Hale 200 in (5.1 m) telescope in Palomar, CA completed.(2022) YT: SM - Biggest TelescopesIt was started before WW2, but was deprioritized. Originally a fused quartz mirror was planned, but instead they used Corning's new Pyrex borosilicate glass. A honeycomb shape halved the mirror's weight from 36 tons (32.7 metric tons) to 18 tons (16.3 metric tons). It's still in use in the 21st century, imaging exoplanets directly.
    1949WW2 veteran Eugene Burnett wanted to buy a tract house near Levittown, New York using a GI Bill-guaranteed mortgage, for his family to live in.Military - Black GI Bill DenialThe suburb was pigmentation-restricted, and wouldn't allow humans with Eugene's pigmentation to buy a house there. "It was as though it wasn’t real," Burnett’s wife, Bernice, recalled. "Look at this house! Can you imagine having this? And then for them to tell me because of the color of my skin that I can’t be part of it?" While the GI Bill’s language did not specifically exclude African-American veterans from its benefits, it was structured in a way that ultimately shut doors for the 1.2 million Black veterans who had bravely served their country during WW2, in segregated ranks.
    1949US Gov't has surplus of $1 billion (2021 equivalent $11.62 billion or 182.99k GD), decrease by -0.2% of $0 billion (2021 equivalent $0 billion or 0 GD) blamed on Recession.TheBalance - US Deficit, GDP, Events

    1950Transcontinental becomes Trans World Airlines (TWA).(2019) YT: BSF - TWAAs shareholder, Howard Hughes gained great influence and sometimes even prevented growth - an example later this decade was when Boeing released the 707, the first jet airliner. PanAm ordered 20, but Hughes prevented TWA from ordering any until he made a huge order for 70 total various planes for TWA - which he planned to have his tool company pay for - but his tool company was also on hard times and he didn't know. So TWA coudln't buy any Boeing 707s until they got a Wall Street bailout several years later.

    1950Article published in several of USA's newspapers covers 5 separate incidents between Miami and Bermuda, since 1900 - in which 1 boat, 9 planes, and 135 civilians & crew vanished.(2017) YT: LEMMiNO - Bermuda TriangleIt was sold as a mystery as no causes were given.
    25Nov1950South Korea has pushed North Korea nearly to the Yalu River and off the Korean Peninsula.(2019) YT: JHEB - The Fire[1]
    1950Californium created.(Reference Missing)
    9Nov1950A meeting at the UK Ministry of War would originate both the FV4005 and the FV215 Tank Destroyer tanks.(2021) YT: COA - FV4005These weapons were based on the FV200 hull, and the FV4005 would carry a 183 mm (7.2 inch) gun, with the goal of piercing a 152 mm (6 inch) armored plate, sloped at 60 degrees, from 2000 yards (1.13 mi or 1.82 km). This was improbable with the 120 mm (4.72 in) Centurion gun currently in use. The projectile for the 183 mm (7.2 inch) gun was 160 lbs (72.6 kg) and the propellant charge was another 73 lbs (33.1 kg), so a loading system put the bullet in place to be pushed in by the operator. Other tanks had full autoloaders, unlike this partial loader. The final design was called FV4005 Stage 2 and only 2 were produced, with a large and boxy turret that was only armored against artillery fragments and not intended for the front lines. Just 12 rounds of ammo could fit inside, adding 2800 lbs (1270 kg) and it was planned to have frequent supply refills. Tank Destroyer tanks, and their unrealistically-oversized cannons, were replaced by larger missiles, mostly air-to-surface.
    1950Cultural events this year:(2019) YT: JHEB - The Fire[1]
    • Senator Joseph McCarthy (USA) "hunts" Communists by calling them names and convincing others to ban them from their businesses. This moral panic became known as "McCarthyism", and was used by Richard Nixon to successfully convict Alger Hiss of spying. Nixon then became a senator.
    • Studebaker car company was outcompeted by Ford and begins to decline.
    • Television became popular. It used an enormous amount of energy and early ones might emit dangerous levels of X-ray radiation from the electron-phosphorus collisions in the cathode ray tube, but this was the only way to get any video in the home. (Affluent people would find their porches filled with random strangers, staring in through the windows to see this fascinating new technology. Farnsworth developed the basics decades before - why did mass production take so long?)
    • North Korea splits off during the Korean War, finding support from China and the USSR.
    • South Korea splits off during the Korean War, finding support from USA and the UN.
    • Marilyn Monroe rises in popularity, transitioning from small roles to one of the USA's biggest stars.

    1950sAnaconda Copper Mine changed from vein mining to strip mining.(2019) YT: TS - Toxic Pit10k miles (16k km) of mineshafts and tunnels had been dug under Butte. This turned the mine into Berkeley Pit - 1 mile (1.6 km) wide and deep enough to fit the 21st Century's One Trade Center. Whole neighborhoods have been moved to mine under them.
    1950sA backlash began when Muzak was accused of brainwashing and it was even challenged in court.EDi - Muzak
    1950sPredictions of future conveniences include a picture-phone, where a user can see a product for sale, and order now.(2020) YT: HL - Past PredictionsIt also predicted that food would be formed from flavored sawdust, which could also be worn. (We'd need to regrow our appendices and reseed them with cellulose-eating bacteria first. But then we could also get calories from grasses and tree leaves.) Nuclear power was expected to provide 100% of society's power needs, and that streetlamps would be replaced by hovering uranium-powered "mini-suns".
    1950sMechanic Jean-Louis Domecq (France) invents the Jieldé ((z)jee'ell-dae) lamp.(2020) YT: LADBR - French LampHe was fed up with the wires hanging off his lamp, and made one without any visible wires. Instead of hollow joints for the wires to pass through, each joint has a pair of circular contact strips in them - one about 3 cm (1.18 in) in diameter, and the other about half of that. The name comes from its inventor's initials: JLD.
    1950sAutomakers try to add turbochargers to cars, but they don't take off.(2020) YT: d4a - Turbo History
    1950sCahokia Mound 34 excavated.(2022) YT: AA - CahokiaIt was like a time capsule - a variety of SECC artifacts were found, which had originated across the Mississippi.
    1950sInline-8 engines from the 1920s begin to wear out.(2021) YT: VR - Straight-8Low octane gasoline and low engine efficiency led to low engine wear. But they were replaced several years earlier in Europe, due to higher fuel prices after WW2.

    27Jul1951The Korean peninsula is split on a diagonal line which crosses the 38th Parallel North.(2019) YT: JHEB - The Fire[1]After 13 months of war and 2.5 million uninstalls, the peninsula was again evenly divided, but across a smaller and more natural dividing line. (Having less border to defend allows each power to exist in a lower energy mode (fewer troops defending less border), allowing both populations to access more modes of existence, and is thus entropically favored.)
    1951European bison are reintroduced to Europe.Imgur: Reintroduction(2020)By the 21st century, herds would roam from Switzerland to Russia to Kyrgyzstan to the Western Caucasus mountains.
    1951Cultural events this year:(2019) YT: JHEB - The Fire[1]
    • Traitor Rosenbergs (USA) tried and executed of espionage for sharing plans for nuclear weapons with the USSR. (They believed it was unfair for one side to have such overwhelming military dominance, and wanted the USA to have some kind of opposition on the World Stage. Khrushchev actually said that the USSR couldn't have done it without them.)
    • USA builds the H-Bomb (hydrogen bomb). This nuclear weapon is so large that it needs a normal nuclear weapon to start it. (The first fission explosion generates a neutron(n=1), which fissiles lithium(n=3) into helium(n=2) and tritium (hydrogen(n=2)). The tritium finds deuterium (hydrogen(n=1)) next to it, and they fuse into a helium(n=3) atom. The 3rd neutron escapes at 14.1 MeV, pushing the helium(n=2) atom at 3.5 MeV, for a total of 17.6 MeV. Boltzmann's constant turns these very fast velocities into a very high temperature. Unlike the fission bombs dropped over Japan, this is a fusion bomb.)
    • Sugar Ray Robinson (USA) is named Fighter of the Year (again).
    • Roy Campanella, catcher for the Brooklyn Dodgers, was named the National League's Most Valuable Player.
    • 판문점 Panmunjeom [State Change Place] hosts peace talks between North and South Koreas.
    • Marlon Brando (USA) was an attractive actor and was nominated for an Academy Award for A Streetcar Named Desire.
    • The King and I opens to critical acclaim. (It follows the romantic relationship between unemployed British schoolteacher Anna, and the king of Siam.)
    • The Catcher in the Rye published. (A coming-of-age story that follows Holden Caulfield, a disillusioned teenager frustrated by "phonies.") The book was controversial (for being found in the belongings of numerous criminal uninstallers) and eventually banned.
    • Mickey Mantle begins his baseball career.
    1951Chrysler launched the Hemi.(2021) YT: AG - GM Engines(The hemispherical combustion chamber created a more-even combustion.)
    1951US Gov't has surplus of $6 billion (2021 equivalent $63.83 billion or 1.01 million GD), decrease by -1.7% of $2 billion (2021 equivalent $21.28 billion or 335.12k GD) blamed on Expansion.TheBalance - US Deficit, GDP, Events
    Jan1952Union Pacific (UP) received the first 7k HP (5.2 MW) Big Boy GTEL locomotive to operate across the Rocky Mountains between Utah and Wyoming.(2021) YT - MP: UP GTELUP bought 10 of these over the next 20 months, for $500k (2021 equvalent $5.2 million or 81.9 GD) each. Most diesels were only capable of 1.5k HP (1.1 MW). Steam locomitives had much more power, but were heavier and prone to catastrophic boiler explosions. GTELs were immense, between 275 and 425 tons (250 and 386 metric tons) depending on generation, and delivered 138k Lb/ft (187.1k Nm) of torque and had a speed limit of 65 mph (105k m/h) but could go faster. They were 80 ft (25 m) long, 15.3 ft (4.7 m) tall, and 10.6 ft (3.2 m) wide, for a total volume of 12974.4 ft3 (97.1k Gal, 367k L). Common payloads were 7k ton (6.4k metric ton), and used an early hybrid transmission, with the diesel engines powering generators that powered electric traction motors. These were slightly different from the original UP 50, with a cab at only one end, which increased fuel capacity to 7.2k Gal (27.3k L).
    6Feb1952British King George6 reign ends and Queen Elizabeth2 Windsor (Elizabeth Alexandra Mary) reign begins.Wiki; British MonarchsMarried Philip Mountbatten on 20 November 1947, had 4 children
    1952Penicillin V (vee), suitable for oral use, developed.(2019) YT: RCSB PDB - Penicillin
    1952A paranormal stories magazine describes a triangle between Miami, and the islands of Bermuda and Puerto Rico.(2017) YT: LEMMiNO - Bermuda TriangleThe shape of triangle was arbitrary, and the author makes no attempt to justify the shape.
    1952The Linz-Donawitz process of basic oxygen steelmaking (BOS), and other oxygen steel making methods renders obsolete the Bessemer and similar steel production processes.Wiki: SteelPumping oxygen into the furnace pumps out impurities like nitrogen, preventing slag, and making the same quantity of steel in one-twelfth the time.

Hillenkoetter writes to Eisenhower about the recovery of 2 crashed extraterrestrial craft.(2019) YT: GG - Area 51One was from July 1947, where the remains of 4 uninstalled extraterrestrials were also recovered. According to this letter, Truman had created a Top Secret organization, known as Majestic 12, to study these remains. (Was he writing to the President-Elect? Had Eisenhower been briefed on this confidential matter yet?)
    1952Bosch introduce an automotive version of their gasoline direct injection system.(2021) YT: NM - Fuel InjectorThis would be fitted to several racecars, including the race version of the Mercedes-Benz 300SL, and the W196 Grand Prix [Grand Prize] car. Mercedes' wins would show the extra power of fuel injection, but the system was expensive and the high fuel pressures made it troublesome for daily drivers. A solution was throttle-body, or intake manifold, injection.
    1952Cultural events this year:(2019) YT: JHEB - The Fire[1]
    • Dwight D Eisenhower elected president.
    • Jonas Salk (Yonas Salk) develops the Polio vaccine and gets worldwide distribution. There were 60k cases this year, and caseloads were almost doubling every year. Within a decade, there would be less than 1k cases, which continues into the 21st century.
    • Elizabeth Windsor (UK) succeds her father King George.
    • Rocky Marciano becomes the world heavyweight boxing champion.
    • Liberace, an extravagantly costumed pianist, was becoming popular and got a TV show.

    1953Harry S. Truman presidential term ended and Dwight D. Eisenhower presidential term started.(2020) YT: FOL - President
    1953Cultural events this year:(2019) YT: JHEB - The Fire[1]
    • USSR PM Joseph Stalin (Georgia) reign ends with his uninstall and Georgy Malenkov (Russia) reign begins. The crowds to see Stalin's remains were so massive that 100 people were uninstalled from trampling. There was technically no leader of their Communist party, but Stalin's name was listed first in the roster, and Malenkov's second, so it was like a "first among equals" arrangement to identify the Thought Leader. (It's odd how conservative and patriarchical is this highly liberal and leaderless organization.)
    • Gamal Abdel Nasser (Egypt) led the Egyptian Liberation rally, ousted the monarchy, wrested control from the previous PM, and helped form a democratic government. He's one of the most influential Arab politicians.
    • Musician Sergey Prokofiev (Russia) uninstalled of a cerebral hemorrhage. He was a prolific composer, pianist, and conductor.
    • Winthrop Rockefeller and his wife Barbara Sears had a messy public divorce. He was the grandon of oil tycoon John D Rockefeller. Meanwhile, Winthrop's brother Nelson Rockefeller was becoming a special assistant to the US President for Foreign Affairs.
    • Disney's animated feature Peter Pan, based on J.M. Barrie’s play of the same name, premieres.
    • Roy Campanella was named the National League's Most Valuable Player again.
    • World splits into 3:
      • Communist Bloc: Armenia, Azerbaijan, Belarus, Bulgaria, China, Czechoslovakia, East Germany, Estonia, Ethiopia, Georgia, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Latvia, Lithuania, Moldova, Mongolia, North Korea, Poland, Romania, Russia, Somalia, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan, Ukraine, Uzbekistan, Vietnam, Yemen.
      • Capitalist Bloc to counter: Angola, Australia, Belgium, Canada, Denmark, France, French Guiana, Germany, Greece, Iseland, Iran, Italy, Japan, Mozambique, Namibia, Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Oman, Papua New Guinea, Phillippines, South Africa, South Korea, Spain, Suriname, Taiwan, Thailand, Türkiye, UAE, UK, USA, West Germany, Western Sahara, Zimbabwe.
      • Not playing: Afghanistan, Albania, Argentina, Austria, Belize, Bolivia, Brasil, Cambodia, Central African Federation, Chile, Colombia, Costa Rica, Ecuador, Egypt, El Salvador, Federal People's Republic of Yugoslavia, Finland, Guatemala, Honduras, India, Indonesia, Liberia, Libya, Mexico, Morocco, Myanmar, Nicaragua, Pakistan, Panama, Paraguay, Peru, Saudi Arabia, Sweden, Swizerland, Uruguay, Venesuela. Also colonial Africa.

    • Share non-military nuclear tech, training, and materials with other nations.
    • Promote advancements in industry, medicine, and agriculture.
    • Ensure world nuclear market is dominated by the USA.

He got them to call City Hall, and he continued writing articles.
