    30Sep1954USS Nautilus entered service.Patrick Collison - Fast
    1954Cicada Brood11 latest emergenceWiki: CicadasCycle 17 yrs. Connecticut, Massachusetts, Rhode Island. Last seen in this year in Ashford, Connecticut along the Fenton River
    1954Cultural events this year:(2019) YT: JHEB - The Fire[1]
    • Roy Cohn (USA) quits Joseph McCarthy's staff. Cohn later advised Donald Trump to never apologize, fearing that apologies would signal a lack of stubbornness and insufficiently coarse personality, Trump relates in The Art of the Deal.
    • Military coup against Argentinan president Juan Perón, former Army colonel, uninstalls at least 320 civilians but fails to oust Perón. Then another coup 3 months later is successful. The musical Evita was based on the life of Eva Perón, his wife.
    • Brown v. Board of Education declared segregated public schooling unconstitutional.
    • Arturo Toscanini, one of the great virtuoso conductors of the first half of the 20th century, performed for the last time. While conducting, he had a 14 second lapse in concentration, and quit. He uninstalled a couple years later.
    • Polyethylene terephthalate (PET, PETE) is a new high-strength polymer material, and is marketed as Dacron in the USA.
    • French-held Điện Biên Phủ [Established Frontier Prefecture] falls, and the Việt Minh [Vietnamese intelligence] victory essentially ended the First Indochina War, leading to a (temporary) split between (Communist and China-supported) North Vietnam, and (Democratic and US-supported) South Vietnam.
    • Rock Around the Clock becomes an anthem for restless teenagers after appearing in Blackboard Jungle.
    • Elvis Presley (USA) was a truck driver who released a single.
    1954Scania stops making inline 8 cylinder turbo diesels for railroad use.(2021) YT: VR - Straight-8These may still be used in marine applications in the 21st century.
    1954US Gov't has deficit of $1 billion (2021 equivalent $10.28 billion or 161.89k GD), increase by 0.3% of $5 billion (2021 equivalent $51.41 billion or 809.61k GD) blamed on Recession, Eisenhower budgets.TheBalance - US Deficit, GDP, Events
    Jan1955USS Nautilus was the first US submarine launched on nuclear-steam power.(2021) YT: HIS - AIP Subs(The name was a reference to the ship in "20k Leagues Beneath The Sea" (69k mi or 111k km), in which the vessel had a very similar powerplant and drive system.)
    1955The US Bureau of Ships produced a booklet of futuristic surface combatants.Defense Media - Nucear PowerThe ancestor of the current Naval Sea Systems Command (NAVSEA) - the booklet went down to the level of frigates (then called destroyer escorts), all of them nuclear-steam. The nuclear power organization within the bureau developed a range of reactor designs, ranging from cruiser to (battleship) destroyer to carrier class.
    15Apr1955McDonald's restaurant opens their first franchised restaurant.Imgur: 4/15 in history
    18Apr1955Albert Einstein (Germany/USA) uninstalls.(2019) YT: JHEB - The Fire[1]Arguably the most known physicist, and often credited with the discoveries of others, he revolutionized our understanding of how space and time change as very fast things and very massive things travel through them. He was working to reconcile these with our understanding of how space and time change as very small things travel through them during his uninstallation.
    1955Boeing develop first USA-made jet-powered aircraft.(2018) YT: BSF - Pan AmPanAm buys 20.
    1955The phrase NC (Numerical Control) was developed to describe computer-controlled machine operation.(2020) YT: NM - Cutting Tools
    1955Mendelevium created.(Reference Missing)
    1955Average car owner kept their car for 2 years.(2021) YT: Veritasium - nice things
    1955GM is the most valuable company in the world, selling half of the vehicles purchased in the USA.(2021) YT: Veritasium - nice things
    1955Marty McFly and Doc Brown arrive from 1985 and try not to disrupt future events.(2020) YT: HL - Past PredictionsBack to the Future legend. Marty metions reruns, which hadn't been invented yet. The time machine was a customized DeLorean car, "for style", and also because the stainless steel exterior had no paint to interfere with the time travel device. This movie would inspire a great many time travel tropes.
    1955Cultural events this year:(2019) YT: JHEB - The Fire[1]
    • Roy Campanella was named the National League's Most Valuable Player a third time, bringing Jackie Robinson and the Brooklyn Dodgers victory against the Yankees in the World Series.
    • James Dean (USA) starred in Rebel Without a Cause, and had Giant (and East of Eden) filmed when he uninstalled in a car crash. (He thought the other driver, Donald Turnupseed, could see him coming at like 65 MPH, but the sun blinded Turnupseed as he turned his 1954 Custom Coupe (curb weight ~3600-4400 lbs or 1630-2000 kg) left into Dean's tiny 1955 Porsche Spyder (curb weight 1460 lbs or 660 kg).) After this, Dean had Academy Award nominations for both movies.
    • Davy Crockett: King of the Wild Frontier premiered as a 5-part miniseries, beginning the trope/semiotic of outdoorsy kids wearing racoon-skin hats. Despite its popularity, the show wouldn't be aired again until the 1960s.
    • A Broadway adaptation of J.M. Barrie’s Peter Pan was released, being the first Broadway production to be broadcast on TV, and in color too.
    • Elvis Presley's single tops the record charts, and he gets a record deal, then the record album also tops the charts.
    • Disneyland opens in Anaheim, California.
    1955UP would supplement their GTEL locomotives' 7.2k gal (27.3k L) fuel capacity with 24k gal (91k L) fuel tenders.(2021) YT - MP: UP GTELThe modern equivalent of a coal car, these greatly increased range on long coastal routes. More engine vents were added to increase airflow. One was retrofitted for propane, which burned cleaner and left less gunk in the turbines, but was more expensive and harder than diesel to transport. A double-locomotive with a tender between was tested and found to make over 10k HP (7.5 MW), but the second engine choked on the exhaust of the first in tunnels. So they used a GTEL and diesel-electric teamup instead, which "only" generates 6.5k HP (4.8 MW) and didn't have the same issue in tunnels. Soon, all GTELs were teamed with a diesel-electric.
    1955GM releases their first V-8 engine in 25 years, the small-block 265 (in3 or 4.3 L).(2021) YT: AG - GM EnginesIt debuted in the 1955 Corvette, weighing 40 lbs less than the inline V-6 that it replaced, and 100 pounds less than other V-8s.
    1955US Gov't has deficit of $3 billion (2021 equivalent $30.96 billion or 487.56k GD), increase by 0.7% of $3 billion (2021 equivalent $30.96 billion or 487.56k GD) blamed on Expansion.TheBalance - US Deficit, GDP, Events
    Mid-1950sArea 51 established at a facility previously used to train WW2 bomber pilots.(2019) YT: GG - Area 51
    Mid-1950sUSAF perfects aerial refueling.(2019) YT: Mustard - 747 CarrierUSAF cancels numerous flying hangar designs as aerial refueling is much safer than landing a flying craft within another flying craft. The problem was that bombers had huge fuel tanks and could fly several times further than their fighter escorts.
    1956Gerard Kuiper detects water in the polar caps of Mars.(2019) YT: PN - Top 10 Astro DiscThis is significant because water keeps being "discovered".
    1956Invention of reciprocating screw.Formlabs: ThermoformingPlastic injection molding became fully realized with this invention added to the process.
    1956Sir Francis Crick (UK) establishes the "central dogma" of biology.(2010) YT: iBiology - RNA SplicingDNA is transcribed into RNA which is translated into the language of proteins. A central tenent is that one gene encodes one protein, and this is largely true in bacteria.
    29Sep1956Miriam Sawyer writes article "Parents Misunderstood By Teens" starting the "uphill both ways" story.Quora - Uphill Both Ways"To hear the old folks tell it they had nothing but hard times," one teenager said. "They walked three miles to and from school, uphill both ways."
    1956Noah Kramer publishes "History Begins at Sumer: Thirty-Nine "Firsts" in Recorded History"Antiquitatem.com: Hour's dividersOne of the "firsts" is the use of "seconds".
    1956F11F Tiger shoots itself down by flying faster than its bullets.373VIyv (link 404s)
    1956Cultural events this year:(2019) YT: JHEB - The Fire[1]
    • Elvis Presley's first movie deal.
    • Brigitte Bardot (France) stars in 4 movies as a (sometimes underage) seductive temptress, solidifying her international fame. (After her retirement Bardot published her racist and sexist writings and was fined.)
    • Hungarian Revolution against USSR rule was centered around the capital of Budapest, with USSR secret police shooting into the crowds of protesters, while soldiers ripped off their red stars and joined the protesters.
    • Rosa Parks (USA)'s arrest - after refusing to give up her seat to a passenger with different skin pigmentation on a city bus - triggered the Montgomery bus boycott, a 381-day mass protest. In response, the US Supreme Court declared Montgomery’s segregated public transit to be unconstitutional, beginning the Civil Rights Movement.
    • USSR PM Georgy Malenkov (Russia) reign ends and Nikita Khrushchev reign begins. He pursued policies of de-Stalinization and "peaceful coexistence" with the capitalist West.
    • Grace Kelly (USA), Hollywood star and muse to Sir Alfred Hitchcock (UK\USA), abandoned her acting career to marry Prince Rainier3 (Monaco).
    • Mickey Mantle was named the National League's Most Valuable Player, and this was his 5th year as an American all-star.
    • Peyton Place, one of the first soap operas to successfully air in prime time, introduced American viewers to a small New England town secretly populated by scandal. It touched on themes of sex, social inequality, and class privilege.
    • Gamal Abdel Nasser nationalizes the Suez Canal Company, after months of tension with Britain and France. Both countries (and Israel) attack, then withdraw, marking a humiliating end to both Britain and France's time as the only World Powers. Their failure gave their other African holdings and colonies the confidence to fight back.
    1956President Nasser (Egypt) nationalized the Suez canal.(2018) YT: IPOV - Britain's 2nd Empire

    UK and France issue a 12 hour ultimatum to give it back - after which, UK fighter planes fly over and attack 5 Egyptian cities, including Cairo. But Eisenhower (USA) refused to join in on hostilities, instead deferring to the UN General Assembly.

    This marked a humiliating end of the UK's role as one of the World Powers, and there was a run on the UK Pound, devaluing it. To stop the devaluation, Bank of England (BoE) banned lending to foreign borrowers - this prevented much investment business, and those idle bank investors met with the BoE. There was an unwritten agreement that transactions conducted between 2 foreign residents in a foreign currency weren't under the BoE's jurisdiction - it was "elsewhere". This created a "sterling zone" within the UK, and "non sterling zone" for financial trading, which developed into the London Eurodollar market. This "non-sterling zone" being in the imaginary land of "elsewhere" means activites weren't taxed by the UK, or anyone.

    Jul1956The original GI Bill ended.Military - Black GI Bill DenialNearly 8 million WW2 veterans had received education or training, and 4.3 million home loans worth $33 billion (2021 equivalent $129.51 billion) had been handed out, across the program's 12 years. Allowing local banks to control the loans made it one of the most effective instruments for concentrating incomes and assets among one skin pigmentation group, to the deprivation of the other.
    1956US Gov't has surplus of $4 billion (2021 equivalent $40.67 billion or 640.47k GD), decrease by -0.9% of $2 billion (2021 equivalent $20.34 billion or 320.31k GD) blamed on Expansion.TheBalance - US Deficit, GDP, Events
    1957Ames company invents a better urine glucose test for diabetes mellitus.(2017) YT: NR - First diabetes testAmes is now part of Bayer. Based on enzymes glucose oxidase and peroxidase, along with a chromagen. Glucose oxidase oxidizes glucose into gluconic acid and hydrogen peroxide. Peroxidase uses the hydrogen peroxide to oxidize the chromagen into a color. It detected only glucose, not creatinine.
    1957First chemical synthesis of Penicillin V completed(2019) YT: RCSB PDB - PenicillinUnlike previous penicillin molecules, this one can survivie in the stomach acid, and thus can be delivered in a pill instead of a shot.
    4Oct1957Sputnik launched.(2015) YT: LEMMiNO - Space Top10 [p6]
    1957Laika (dog) launched into space.(2015) YT: LEMMiNO - Space Top10 [p6]Numerous other animals had been launched by the time of this PR stunt - Fruit flies, monkey, mice, hamsters, turtles, rabbits, cats, frogs, goldfish, other insects, etc. This research has been crucial for our understanding of the impacts of space travel on humans, and also other animals. See 2008 study on cockroaches.
    1957James Blish coins term "Gas Giants" to describe outer 4 planets.(2018) YT: PN Uranus & Neptune
    1957Cultural events this year:(2019) YT: JHEB - The Fire[2]
    • 9 students enrolled at Little Rock Central High School, in Arkansas, but were blocked by notorious racist Arkansas governor Orval Faubus, because he irrationally disliked their skin pigmentation. Eisenhower had to order army escorts for the students, to ensure a safe learning environment for them.
    • Boris Pasternak publishes Dr Zhivgo in the USA, after it was banned in the USSR. (An epic tale of the effects of the Russian Revolution in 1917 and its aftermath on a bourgeois family.) He had to smuggle it out. To further insult the KGB over this failure to contain one book and author, the CIA published Russian translations.
    • Mickey Mantle was named the National League's Most Valuable Player again, and this was his 6th year as an American all-star.
    • Jack Kerouac published On the Road, a road-trip novel and "the Bible of the original hipsters" according to Britannica editor Jeff Wallenfeldt. But success would ruin Kerouac.
    • The USSR launched the first artificial satellite, Sputnik 1. It measured about 60cm (23.6 in) across and shocked many US Americans, who assumed the USA was the most technologically advanced nation in all ways. This began the Space Race.
    • Zhou Enlai (Chou Enlai) served as the first-ever premier of the People’s Republic of China, and kept busy improving diplomaic ties, evading assassination attempts, and preparing for his role in China's Great Leap Forward.
    • The Bridge on the River Kwai was a British-American WW2 film following the lives of men imprisoned in a Japanese POW camp. Boulle, whose novel was adapted, was credited for the film and awarded an Oscar for best screenplay - even though it had actually been writers Michael Wilson and Carl Foreman who adapted it - but both were on McCarthy's Hollywood blacklist for alleged communist ties, so Boulle received the film’s honors alone.
    1957General Motors Rochester Ramjet developed for the Corvette.(2021) YT: NM - Fuel InjectorA purely mechanical fuel injector, it used throttle vaccum to adjust fuel delivery. Fuel was pumped from the fuel tank to a reservoir and pressurized to 13.7 bar (199 PSI, 10.2k mmHg), then fed to injectors. This lower pressure system was much simpler to manufacture. It also allowed some neat features, like cold-start enrichment (step on the pedal a couple times before turning the key), and overrun fuel cutoff (deliver no fuel while engine RPMs are too high). This system was acclaimed for achieving one HP/in3.
    1957GM releases the 283 (in3 or 4.6 L) engine.(2021) YT: AG - GM EnginesThe Rochester Ramjet fuel-injected 283 was the pinnacle of the line and reached 283 HP, or 1 HP per in3. Also, they discontinued their 265 (in3 or 4.3 L) engine.
    1957US Gov't has surplus of $3 billion (2021 equivalent $29.53 billion or 465.04k GD), decrease by -0.7% of $2 billion (2021 equivalent $19.69 billion or 310.08k GD) blamed on Recession.TheBalance - US Deficit, GDP, Events
    Late-1950sBosch develops an indirect mechanical gasoline fuel injection system.(2021) YT: NM - Fuel InjectorThis used a unique camshaft to vary fuel delivery duration, based on a lobe in the cam that adjusted based on engine operating conditions. It also incorporated ambient air temperature and pressure into its design, giving 18% more power and 80% better fuel economy over the twin carburetor model, on the Mercedes-Benz 220SE. This would go into all Mercedes-Benz cars and become adapted into numerous other cars in the following decade.
    1958Boeing delivers first USA-made jet-powered aircraft to PanAm and other airlines.(2018) YT: BSF - Pan AmPanAm flies inagural flight of plane.
    Mar1958Solar Cycle 19 maximum.Wiki: List of solar cycles
    1958Nobelium created.(Reference Missing)
    1958?US Interstate Highway System(Reference Missing)
    1958US Bureau of Public Roads adopts a white line to divide lanes.(2020) YT: THG - Lane Markings
    9Oct1958Pope Ven. Pius12 papacy ends and Pope St John23 (IOANNES Vicesimus Tertius) (Angelo Giuseppe Roncalli) (Italian) papacy begins 19 days later.Wiki: List of PopesMotto: Obedientia et Pax [Obedience and peace] Opened the Second Vatican Council; called "Good Pope John". Issued the encyclical Pacem in terris [Peace on Earth] (1963) on peace and nuclear disarmament; intervened for peace during the Cuban Missile Crisis (1962)."
    1958Van Allen proposes putting a Geiger counter on a satellite, which lead to the discovery of the Van Allen radiation belt around the Earth.(2019) YT: CD - Earth Mag FieldWhere the Van Allen belt touches Earth's atmosphere, Aurora Borealis are formed from the exchange of charged particles. Another odd section is the South Atlantic Anomaly just above Brasil, where it dips down unusually low.
    Jul1958Convertability of currency under Bretton Woods becomes widespread.Wiki - Bretton Woods ConfWestern European IMF members finally set exchange rates for their currencies, about 14 years after agreeing to do so.
    1958Milutin Milankovitch uninstalls.NASA - Milankovich Cycles
    1958Brussels World Fair(2021) Imgur - Human zoosA young girl is kept on the far side of a wooden fence from a sprawling crowd, who look at her as though they've never seen a young girl before.
    Aug1958GE delivers the first of 30 next generation GTELs to Union Pacific (UP), rated for 8.5k HP (6.33 MW).(2021) YT - MP: UP GTELEach included one of the 24k gal (91k L) fuel tenders. UP's engineers claimed to get 10k HP (7.5 MW) and 138k Lb/ft (197.9 kNm) of torque from this engine in cool and dense air. They weighed 1.2 million lbs (600k ton or 544.3k metric Tons). These engineers wanted to add traction motors to the fuel tenders too, which wouldn't be done for several years until LA routes were added.
    1958British railway ridership peaks briefly, at about 1.05 billion passengers served that year, before continuously falling off.(2018) YT: Mustard - HovertrainsAt 250 working days a year, this is 2.1 million daily commuters.
    1958Walt Disney's Magic Highway USA movie predicts color-coded highway lanes and other innovations to simplify interstate travel in cars.(2020) YT: HL - Past PredictionsLarger and easier to read signs, and big fog-fans along roads were among the innovations.
    1958Cultural events this year:(2019) YT: JHEB - The Fire[2]
    • Lebanon’s President Camille Chamoun refused to cut ties with Britain and France during the Suez War, so Egyptian President Gamal Abdel Nasser called her names, and then wouldn't let her Lebanon join his new political union with Syria. Her political opponents, politically-inclined Muslims, made political demonstrations for Lebanon to also join the alliance, and by May the demonstrations became an insurrection. So the US Military took the only sensible course of displacing thousands of Palestineans and forming a new government.
    • 4th French Republic fails, after which Charles de Gaulle is elected French President. He wanted France to be free of the superpowers of the day - US and USSR - and envisioned joining a more European superpower, the EU. He amassed a nuclear arsenal and withdrew France from the military command of NATO, following his own views on foreign policy.
    • The Brooklyn Dodgers move to become the LA Dodgers, and the NY Giants copy them by becoming the SF Giants. (Was this a new California expansion, moving the team out there and giving NY a new expansion team?)
    • Charles Starkweather, a 19yo rebel without a cause and James Dean wanna-be with his kitten-with-a-whip girlfriend Caril Ann Fugate, uninstalled 10 people, including her family. After a high-speed chase, he eventually received the (Uninstall) Penalty, while she was sentenced to life in prison with the infamy as one of the youngest Americans ever charged with first-degree murder.
    • Morning sickness inhibitor thalidomide found to cause severe install deformities, and uninstalled thousands of babies, before being removed from the market. This led to much more rigorous drug testing.
    1958Antarctic Snow Cruiser last seen.(2021) YT: Mustard - Antarctic Snow CruiserIt was dug out of a snow bank on the Ross Ice Shelf. Since then, it might have been buried again, or fallen through and into the ocean.
    1958The number of lawncare articles hits a peak of 40.(2019) NYT: Great American Lawn
    1958US Gov't has deficit of $3 billion (2021 equivalent $28.71 billion or 452.13k GD), increase by 0.6% of $6 billion (2021 equivalent $57.42 billion or 904.25k GD) blamed on Recession ended.TheBalance - US Deficit, GDP, Events
    3Jan1959Alaska joins USA.(2012) YT: A9 - State Admit
    Jul1959USSR hosts the American National Exposition in Sokolniki Park, Moscow.(2021) YT: DS - Pepsi NavyNumerous products were showcased, including an entire model house. Some companies got individual booths, including Disney, IBM, and Pepsico.
    1959Sten Gustaf Thulin (Sweden) patents the plastic shopping bag.BBC - Plastic BagHe envisioned people reusing them numerous times, and always had one folded up in his pocket.
    23Jul1959Pepsico International Division head Don Kendall asks US Vice President Nixon's advice on getting a Pepsi in USSR Premier Nikita Khruschev's hand.(2021) YT: DS - Pepsi NavyThe USSR were a notoriously tough business partner, and Kendall's goal was to get Khrushchev addicted to Pepsi. The next day, Nixon guided Khruschev to Pepsico's stand, which had 2 varieties: one with USA water, the other with USSR water. Khruschev proudly declared the one with USSR water to be superior - and as he kept drinking it, he insisted his colleagues have some too. The photos of world leaders uniting over a Pepsi were tremendous free advertising.
    1959USSR satellite crosses around the dark side of the Moon, taking the first human images of that side.(2019) YT: JMG - strange moon aspects
    21Aug1959Hawaii joins USA.(2012) YT: A9 - State Admit
    1959CIA awarded the OXCART contract to Lockheed.CIA - OXCART
    1959Cultural events this year:(2019) YT: JHEB - The Fire[2]
    • Musicians Buddy Holly, Richie Valens, and JP Richardson uninstalled in a plane crash. (Also called The Day The Music (Uninstalled). Legend says they were smoking freebased crack cocaine instead of operating the airplane. (In chemistry, freebasing is unlocking a potent molecule by adding a base as a chemical key. Combining cocaine HCL in water with a base, often baking soda, allows the HCL and base to form a soluble salt, while the insoluble cocaine crystalizes into "crack", a crystal that crackles loudly when smoked.)
    • Ben Hur (starring Charlton Heston as a young Jewish prince who encounters Jesus Christ) opens to critical acclaim and wins a record-breaking 11 Academy Awards.
    • Able and Miss Baker (monkeys) became the first primates to survive the journey home after being launched into space by the USA (Part of the Space Race). They were sent up in the nose cone of a modified ICBM, which was modified slightly for human launches and used into the 21st century. (Just take out the bomb and put people there.)
    • 20 members of the mafia/mob micropower were arrested in NY and convicted of various crimes. This forced the FBI to actually investigate crimes comitted by the micropower's members, instead of pretending they don't exist. (Sounds like UAP all over again.)
    • Marlex Hula Hoops invented and soon sold 100 million units. But the inventor didn't formalize the distribution contract and never received any profits.
    • Fidel Castro leads a Cuban revolution and takes a victory lap around parts of the USA, where he denounced Communism, before returning home to form a Cuban Communist Republic.
    • The Ford Edsel was a labor of desperation and commercial failure, selling for just 3 years after costing $250 million across the previous decade (2021 equivalent sums to $2.575 billion or 40.6k GD) to create. After this, nobody wanted to name their son after the lame car, so the formerly-common name Edsel immediately fell out of popularity.
    1959US Gov't has deficit of $13 billion (2021 equivalent $123.56 billion or 1.95 million GD), increase by 2.4% of $8 billion (2021 equivalent $76.04 billion or 1.2 million GD) blamed on Fed raised rates.TheBalance - US Deficit, GDP, Events
    1960PanAm signs $115 million (2021 equivalent $1.06 billion or 16.7k GD) office lease in a brand-new building in downtown Manhattan.(2018) YT: BSF - Pan AmThis was a good advertisement in NYC.
    1960World population hits 3 billion(Reference Missing)
    May1960Francis Gary Powers (USA) was shot down over the USSR, and the U-2 he flew in on.CIA - OXCART
    1960Sony creates the first fully-transistorized TV, the TV-8-301(2018) YT: TC - TrinitronIt had a small screen, and was a tiny device.
    13Aug1960RO(S)Korea President Syngman Rhee term ends and President Yun Posun term begins 109 days later.Wiki: Korea
    1960John Dobson invents Light Bucket Telescope(2018) YT: IA - Megatelescopes
    5Oct1960A new early warning system on Greenland had just come online, providing trans-polar coverage.(2015) YT: LEMMiNO - ApocalypseThe system slowly went from a risk 0 to risk 5, indicating incoming attack. Panic slowly went up the chain of command, until they realized the USSR's leader, Khrushchev, was visiting the USA at the time - not where he'd be during an attack. A later investigation found they had mistaken the rising moon for an incoming USSR attack.
    19609.5 Earthquake hits Valdiva, Chile.(2021) YT: hochelaga - Biblical ApocOne of the most destructive earthquakes on record.
    1960Cultural events this year:(2019) YT: JHEB - The Fire[2]
    • Gary Powers (USA)'s U-2 reconnaissance plane was shot down over USSR, and the USA disavowed any knowledge of the flight. Khrushchev called it an "aggressive act" and didn't retaliate militarily, but instead turned it into a diplomatic incident which stalled the upcoming Paris world power summit with the US, and UK & France.
    • Syngman Rhee becomes the first president of the Republic of (South) Korea on suspicious terms, and has his police shoot into crowds. He was eventually forced to resign and was evacuated by the CIA.
    • The "payola" scandal saw most radio DJs (disc jockeys) investigated for taking bribes to promote certain songs and records, instead of openly taking advertising fees. (The "I know a guy" part of the bribery is likely what made it illegal, since that makes it not open to everyone - not the money changing hands part. A Promotions Department that anyone can use is much more legal.)
    • John F Kennedy's presidential term starts.
    • Chubby Checker's The Twist started a dance craze that led him to international fame.
    • Alfred Hitchcock’s controversial Psycho was an instant classic, with people sharing a bed, crossdressing, and a toilet flushing. (Caused some people to switch from showers to baths. Hitchcock used chocolate syrup instead of blood in the black & white classic, since chocolate's higher contrast gave a better visual effect.)
    • The DRC (Democratic Republic of the Congo) gained independence from Belgium after a long and brutal war. (The Belgian Congo was seen as the personal property of the King of Belgium, not a national colony.)
    1960Gary Powers shot down over USSR.(2021) YT: DS - Pepsi NavyThis chilled diplomatic relations and put an immediate freeze on all business with US American companies.
    1960US Gov't has surplus of $0 billion (2021 equivalent $0 billion or 0 GD), increase by -0.1% of $2 billion (2021 equivalent $18.69 billion or 294.33k GD) blamed on Recession.TheBalance - US Deficit, GDP, Events
    1960sSino-USSR split.(2016) YT: GN - China
    1960sArthur Okun creates the "misery index"InflationData - The 1980sAdd the unemployment rate on top of the inflation rate to get this simple measure of the well-being of the average citizen.
    1960sUS dollar devaluedCurrencies Fandom - Swiss FrancThe Swiss franc was also devalued, as it was tied to the dollar. The silver in Swiss coins became worth more than the coin's face value, so mailing coins to other countries for smelting was widespread. This continued even after laws were passed to ban it, and only stopped when the face value again exceeded the silver value.
    1960sRailways were in decline as ridership was plummeting.(2018) YT: Mustard - Hovertrains

    Rail was becoming perceived as slow and outdated - often because it was. In the UK, some routes were still served by steam locomotives, which were competing with auto highways and inter-city air travel (that might show a movie).

    1960sThe increasing popularity of rail and air travel led to a dramatic decrease in bus passenger numbers across the next 30 years.What Things Weigh: Bus
    1960sCharles Tillinghast becomes CEO of TWA.(2019) YT: BSF - TWAOne of his first actions was to push Howard Hughes out of the company. (Did they buy him out like GM later did to Ross Perot?) Air travel became glamorous this decade, and TWA was on board, being the first to show a full-length feature film during a flight (in first class, of course). They were working to get out of PanAm's shadow and made several showy purchases, like Hilton International and Canteen Corporation - these would hurt later but helped for now.
    1960sCryptography was very big in popular culture.(Reference Missing)In these times before personal computing, these were done by hand. Newspapers would have a crypto puzzle next to the crosswords in the same way that Sudoku puzzles would accompany crossword puzzles in the late 2010s. Cryptography books were popular, and tricks - like secretly encrypting a message by playing solitaire with a 52 card deck - were learned by enthusiasts.
    1960sCity of London banks set up branches in the UK's overseas territories.(2018) YT: IPOV - Britain's 2nd EmpireCayman Islands are a complete backwater - legend says that the mosquitoes were so thick, they would choke cows. Accountants and lawyers from London would set up financial secrecy laws and in the UK's other overseas territories, turning them into Secrecy Jurisdictions. These colonies hosted and laundered huge amounts of drug money and evaded taxes.
    1960sChase Manhattan sets up a branch in Saigon, Vietnam.(2018) YT: IPOV - Britain's 2nd EmpireThe Vietnam War was pulling huge amounts of money from the US into Vietnam, and this branch was established to prevent this money from flowing into foreign banks. It was a fortress with no windows, and was unprofitable for Chase. But the other option was for the money to go into French banks and eventually to Charles De Gaulle, who would exchange it for gold and the USA wouldn't have any left. (Is this part of why Nixon ended Bretton Woods?)
    1960sCultural events and lifestyle in the USA:(2011) YT: ak01 - MST3k 204
    • Smoking tobacco was common - mothers smoked in the home and TV stars smoked on The Tonight Show.
    • Men wore double-breasted suits, had double-chins, and drank double-bourbons with no chaser before, during, and after business meetings.
    • Day drinking was common, especially before driving.
    • Seatbelts in cars went largely unused. (Wouldn't want to look weak.)
    • Typewriters went largely unused. (Wouldn't want to look nerdy.)
    • Frank Sinatra was the Chairman of the Board, and ran the Rat Pack. They chose Joey Bishop to be their comic relief. Jerry Lewis had a falling out with Dean Martin. Quick with a song, Dean could just say a word and beautiful people would show up. They'd take Important Calls from Palm Springs, or The White House, and massage Peter Lawford's neck. Then Sinatra would exit the sauna and say the word, and the beautiful people would exit.
    • Hugh Hefner has the Playboy Mansion in Chicago, with George Kennedy, Geroge Hamilton, Tony Curtis, Bill Bixby, and innumerable belles du jour [(female) beauties of the day].
    • Stars: Twiggy, Abby, Peter Paul and Mary, Dion, Donovan, Melanie, Abraham Martin and John. (Everyone just went by their first name?)
    • Everyone believed the US President. (Why shouldn't they?)
    • Sexual humor wasn't on TV - it was on cocktail napkins.
    • Children's toys were made from sharp metal, with pieces that could break off and injure a child.
    • Playground eqiupment was put up over asphalt, increasing injuries.
    • Corporal punishment against children was encouraged, both for humiliation and to cause pain.
    24Jan1961A B-52 bomber, carrying 2 hydrogen bombs, crashes into an empty field in North Carolina.(2015) YT: LEMMiNO - ApocalypseWhile official reports immediately said there was no chance of contamination or risk of explosion - 3 of the 4 controls on one bomb had been activated, and only a broken wire prevented the bomb from exploding.
    1961Dwight D. Eisenhower presidential term ended and John F. Kennedy presidential term started.(2020) YT: FOL - President
    1961Lawrencium created.(Reference Missing)
    Apr1961French lobster uninstalling ships ordered to leave the coast of Brasil.(2021) YT - COA: Lobster WarFrench fish uninstalling companies on the coast of Mauritania were looking to expand operations, and had been granted by Brasil a permit to research lobster numbers. But instead they researched how many they could catch, and with 4 boats instead of 3.
    1961Sony engineers visit the 1961 IEEE trade show, and saw the Autometric company's Chromatron tube.(2018) YT: TC - TrinitronSony was so impressed that they bought the entire Autometric company from Paramount Picures. Instead of 3 electron guns and a perforated shadow mask, the Chromatron focused a single electron gun at green phosphorus, and used vertical wires to deflect the electron beams left or right to hit the red or blue phosphorus. This was much brighter because most of the electrons weren't hitting the shadow mask.
    1961The Niagara Falls hydroelectric project comes online, becoming the largest hydropower facility in the Western world.Wiki: Niagara Falls
    1961Barack Obama installs.Wiki: POTUSes
    1961The majority of US coal consumption is to generate electricity.EIA - Coal explained
    1961The US Navy commissioned 9 nuclear-steam surface ships across the next 19 years.Defense Media - Nucear Power Nuclear-steam ships give 3 main benefits:
    1. No tankers to refuel them, obviating defenseless tankers and costly escorts.
    2. Maintain max speed for extended periods. They couldn't go any faster than diesel ships, but they could keep that speed far longer. This speed advantage would grant a type of protection for a few years, until other world powers got equivalent technology. (There are Klingons off the starboard bow? Super Runaway!)
    3. Much quieter than diesel engines, with submarines able operate silently underwater for months, while diesel submarine batteries last days or less underwater.
    And some downsides:
    • Cost much more to build or buy, and crew because the 2 reactors require so many nuclear engineers.
    • Multiplying these costs, Adm Hyman G.Rickover, chief of the US Navy's nuclear program for decades, required intensive training of engineers.
    • Civilian use of nuclear power was expanding rapidly, leading to continual headcount attrition to civil nuclear reactors.
    • Every refuel was also an expensive refit, because the reactor is built into the ship and servicing it (often more to remove the xenon nuclear poison than to add uranium) requires cutting a big hole in the ship's armor.
    • Environmental danger of the reactor sinking if the ship sinks, or having a reactor meltdown if the ship takes a critical hit. (By the 21st century, 2 nuclear-steam submarines had sunk, and the US Navy has to monitor the wrecks to ensure the reactors don't become hazardous.)
    Military leadership treated warships as disposable, because they only planned for the next war or skirmish - combat might only last a few weeks, which is longer than it takes for a ship to be repaired once damaged. But the US Navy couldn't continue to afford nuclear-steam surface vessels as Congress reduced its budget. After this, ships were increasingly repaired for future battles, with nuclear-steam ship lifespan instead being set by their remaining nuclear refuelings.
    Nov1961French lobster uninstalling ships return to the coast of Brasil.(2021) YT - COA: Lobster WarThey stationed themselves outside of Brasilian waters, on the continental shelf.
    1961Cultural events this year:(2019) YT: JHEB - The Fire[2]
    • Ernest Hemingway uninstalled himself. He was a major voice of the Lost Generation, a group of American writers disillusioned with life after WW1. (Did the atrocities of industrial warfare shock him out of the American Dream?)
    • Adolf Eichmann (Germany) was found hiding in Argentina, and was tried & uninstalled by the State of Israel for his extensive uninstallings in the Jewish Holocaust.
    • Robert A Heinlein’s Stranger in a Strange Land follows the challenges a human raised on Mars faces while trying to relate to customs on Earth, and becomes an icon of 1960s counterculture, with its themes of questioning social norms (and a micropower of spreading knowledge through free loving).
    • Bob Dylan became a voice for the burgeoning counterculture, while reaching vast commerical success by selling tens of millions of folk and rock albums.
    • Berlin Wall constructed literally overnight, funded by the USSR, to prevent people from fleeing the Communist half of Berlin for the Capitalist half. This became a physical symbol for the Cold War dividing the Earth in half.
    • The CIA's long-planned invasion into the beautiful Bahía de los Cochinos [Bay of Pigs], Cuba consisted of a few airplanes dropping a few bombs... followed a few days later... by a few Cuban exiles landing there to fight Castro's actual armed forces in the area. But bad planning, information leaks, and canceled air support led to humiliation for the USA, and Castro gloating that he had successfully repelled a US American invasion.
    • Yuri Gagarin (Russian) becomes the first person in space after completing a single orbit around the Earth.
    1961US Gov't has deficit of $3 billion (2021 equivalent $27.75 billion or 437.01k GD), increase by 0.6% of $3 billion (2021 equivalent $27.75 billion or 437.01k GD) blamed on JFK & Bay of Pigs.TheBalance - US Deficit, GDP, Events
    2Jan1962French lobster uninstalling ship Cassiopée seized by Brasilian navy.(2021) YT - COA: Lobster WarThis marks the beginning of the French-Brasilian Lobster War. At this time, there was much debate over rules governing territorial waters.
    • Brasil argued about the importance of the lobsters to the Brasilian economy, and that they're part of the continent as they walk around on the shelf's seafloor.
    • The French argument started with the Geneva Convention of the Law of the Sea granting free fishing rights, and that lobsters were fish since they could occasionally propel themselves upwards off the continental shelf.
    While this was being debated, 3 more French fishing boats were caught and released on probation of not returning to Brasilian waters.
    Jan1962Houston Astrodome construction begins.(2019) YT: BSF - Astrodome18 stories tall, with a 642 ft (196 m) diameter dome that covered 9.5 acres (3.84 hectares), it could hold 42k humans in regular seating (each included a cushion, take that temples!), plus 53 luxury boxen and 5 restaurants. Also it was the first to use Astroturf. (Was this named after the MLB team or the stadium?) This was the largest domed structure in the world, and the shape reminded many of a landed flying saucer - to compliment this, wait staff wore space suits and called themsevles Cadets.
    1962Walt Disney sees To (uninstall) A Mockingbird.(2017) YT: LE - PocahontasWalt would later lament how his brand was well-known for fun cartoons, and couldn't create a hard-hitting movie more like this.
    1962President John F. Kennedy gives speech.(Reference Missing)"We choose to goto the Moon - we choose to goto the Moon - we choose to goto the Moon, in this decade, and do the other things, not because they are easy, but because they are hard." Kennedy originally wanted to go straight to Mars, until NASA head James Webb talked him out of it.
    23Mar1962RO(S)Korea President Yun Posun reign ends.Wiki: Korea
    1962Phillips develops the Compact Cassette tape.(2017) YT: TC - Dolby
    1962Cassette tape created.(2016) YT: TC - TransistorsOriginally meant as a dictation format, tape moved too slow and were too small to get good music audio. Soon, tape formulation changed to work much better at slow speeds.
    1962Harry J Anslinger is no longer Commissioner of the US Federal Bureau of Narcotics.Imgur: now you knowAnslinger had help spreading his campaign against marijuana from William Randolf Hearst, owner of a huge chain of newspapers. Hearst had many reasons to help:
    1. Hearst irrationally disliked Mexicans.
    2. Hearst had invested heavliy in the timber industry to support his newspaper chain, and didn't want to see the development of hemp paper as competition.
    3. Hearst had lost 800k acres (323.7k hectares) of timberland to Pancho Vlila, which he irrationally attributed to all Mexicans, increasing #1.
    4. Telling lurid lies about Mexicans (and the "devli's marijuana weed" causing violence) sold newspapers, making him extremely wealthy.
    1962Dr James C Munch stops being the "official expert" on marijuana for the US Gov't.Imgur: now you knowDr Munch testified in court, under oath, that he had smoked marijuana and it turned him into a bat. Dr Munch also supported the testimony of an uninstalling defendant who claimed insanity because he had been in the same room as a bag of marijuana - the defendant was acquitted by reason of marijuana-induced insanity.
    Dec1962USAF ordered six "reconnaissance/strike" or SR aircraft for high-speed, high-altitude flights over hostile territory: the SR-71 Blackbird.CIA - OXCARTA modified version of the A-12 OXCART, the SR-71 Blackbird was about 6 feet (1.8 m) longer, weighed an additional 15k pounds (7.5 ton, 6.8 metric ton) fully loaded, had a more prominent nose and body chines, a 2 seat cockpit, and carried additional optical and radar imagery systems.
    1962TWA's 2nd East Coast hub opened.(2019) YT: BSF - TWATheir main hub was Kansas City.
    1962TWA orders 6 Concorde supersonic aircraft.(2019) YT: BSF - TWAThese would be canceled in the next decade, partially for 747s.
    1962The Jetsons by Hanna-Barbera Productions shows on TV.(2020) YT: HL - Past PredictionsThis futuristic slice-of-life show followed the Jetsons around as they flew to work and school, and the Servile Snarker was robotic. The city showcases the early-futuristic Googie architecture that helped define the "space age".
    1962Cultural events this year:(2019) YT: JHEB - The Fire[2]
    • Lawrence of Arabia, a 210 minute historical epic, quickly became a classic and popularized its unknown lead actor Peter O’Toole.
    • The Beatles began rising in popularity, a phenomenon termed "Beatlemania".
    • USAF veteran James Meredith had been repeatedly denied entrance to the University of Mississippi solely due to his pigmentation and sued over this, so the school was forced to admit him. USA Attorney General Robert F Kennedy called in federal protection in anticipation of racist mob violence, to provide Meredith with a safe learning environment.
    • John Glenn became the first US American astronaut to orbit Earth, completing three orbits.
    • Sonny Liston (USA) knocked out Floyd Patterson in the first round of their match to become the world heavyweight champion.
    Oct1962Union Pacific buy an old GTEL engine body from Great North railway and install a modified first-generation GE GTEL turbine.(2021) YT - MP: UP GTELIt was modified to run off coal gas, but this wasn't without problems. This experimental unit produced 7k HP (5.2 MW), but the very high maintenance costs from the coal more than offset the reduced fuel cost, and the engine only ran for 2 years.
    1962GM releases the 327 (in3 or 5.4 L) engine.(2021) YT: AG - GM EnginesUsed in basically every GM car of the time. It had an 11:1 compression ratio and was the most powerful small block GM engine.
    1962GM introduces the Oldsmobile Jetfire.(2020) YT: d4a - Turbo HistoryGM also introduces the Chevrolet Corvair Monza Spyder, whose name is 2 words too long. They were the first to have turbocharging. These were so unreliable that dealerships were offering to remove the turbos free of charge, and these models were canceled the next year. Fun fact: The Jetfire had a 215 (in3 or 3.5 L) engine named the Turbo Rocket, which took Turbo Rocket Fuel (distilled water + methanol) to reach its promised 215 HP (288 kW). The Turbo Rocket Fuel was really a methanol injection system, to reduce engine knock (preignition) caused by the draw-through carburetor system combined with the 10.25:1 compression. Most people neglected to refill it, causing the car to underperform instead of knocking, by design.
    1962US Gov't has deficit of $7 billion (2021 equivalent $64.11 billion or 1.01 million GD), increase by 1.2% of $10 billion (2021 equivalent $91.59 billion or 1.44 million GD) blamed on Cuban Missile Crisis.TheBalance - US Deficit, GDP, Events
    Jan1963French delegation seeks diplomatic agreement with Brasil to allow lobster uninstalling.(2021) YT - COA: Lobster War

    At the start of negotiations, French diplomats let on that French fishing boats were headed to Brasil to fish during the negotiations, which the Brasilian diplomats requested be stopped, as they wouldn't authorize fishing until after the negotiations, at the earliest. Time magazine reported that French fishing companies were importing $3 million (2021 equivalent $26.8 million or 422 GD) in Brasilian lobster per year - which Brasilian diplomats wanted.

    At first, President João Goulart (Brasil) granted 3 French boats permission to fish, but this was quickly rescinded.

    Feb1963President João Goulart (Brasil) gives French fish uninstalling boats a 48h ultimatum to leave Brasilian waters.(2021) YT - COA: Lobster War

    President Charles de Gaulle (France) replied by sending a French (battleship) destroyer to protect the fishing boats. Foreign minister Hermes Lima (Brasil) said this was an "act of hostility" and "our government will not retreat. The lobster will not be caught."

    27Feb1963French warship Tartu spotted by a lone RB-17 off the coast of Brasil.(2021) YT - COA: Lobster WarWhat was concerning was not the lone destroyer, but the nearby task force from which she was dispached. The Clemenceau - a French aircraft carrier (and its retinue of 7 destroyers and 1 cruiser), was off the African west coast - just 3 days away. Brasil mobilized both navy and army. But this was the evening before Carnival, and a lot of sailors were on shore leave. Still, they assembled two forces:
    • Cruiser Almirante Tamandaré and 4 destroyers. This cruiser had boiler problems which would take at least 15 days to repair, and so was eventually sidelined.
    • Cruiser Almirante Barroso, some destroyers, and 1 submarine. This force left later, and headed northeast. Barroso also had boiler problems, and could only run on half of her boilers. This cruiser also had several damaged main guns and no ammo for the working main guns. It had a total of 30 minutes of muntions, and their munitions depot could only resupply 20mm (78 caliber) guns.

    Brasil's navy didn't have their own tankers to resupply ships in combat, so leased one from Petrobras. And some of their ships weren't fit for combat. Nearly the whole fleet were refit WW2 ships bought from the USA, and their carrier Minas Gerais was the British exception, a venerable 22 years old. Damage and crew safety systems were in horrible condition on most ships. Brasil's helicopter-only air force was in somewhat better condition, with one modern class of helicopter.

    France's navy were much more modern, with the Tartu being only 5 years old, and the Clemenceau was the baby-faced 3 years old & capable of launching fixed-wing planes.

    The Parana would find the Tartu the next day, and shadowed her for 3 days, when the Tartu tag-teamed with the aviso Paul Goffney, a much-less capable warship. Eventually more Brasilian ships were sent into the area.

    10Apr1963French warship Paul Goffney and 4 French fishing boats depart Brasil for Africa.(2021) YT - COA: Lobster WarThis marks a quiet end to the French-Brasilian Lobster War. This would lead to an official agreement for 26 French fish uninstalling boats to capture lobsters off the Brasilian coast for the next 5 years, in exchange for payments to nearby Brasilian fish uninstallers.
    3Jun1963Pope St John23 papacy ends and Pope St Paul6 (PAVLVS Sextus) (Giovanni Battista Enrico Antonio Maria Montini) (Italian) papacy begins 18 days later.Wiki: List of PopesMotto: Cum Ipso in Monte (With Him on the mount) Last pope to be crowned. First pope since 1809 to travel outside Italy. Closed the Second Vatican Council. Issued the encyclical Humanae vitae (1968) condemning artificial contraception. Revised the Roman Missal (1969).
    Aug1963After an initial contract for six Blackbirds, the Air Force ordered 25 more.CIA - OXCART
    20Sep1963Kennedy gives speech asking why a Moonshot has to be a Nationalistic proposal, and why the USA and USSR can't work together on space exploration, instead of against each other.(2015) YT: LEMMiNO - Space Top10 [p6]He was uninstalled 63 days (9 weeks or about 2 months) later.
    Nov1963Nikita Khrushchev (USSR Prime Minister) has a change of heart and decides to acccept John F. Kennedy's invitation to have the USSR join the Apollo program.(2015) YT: LEMMiNO - Space Top10 [p6]Khrushchev saw the USSR's superior rocket technology combined with the USA's better computers, not to mention the lunar resources whose profits could be shared.
    22Nov1963John F. Kennedy uninstalled.(2020) YT: FOL - PresidentLast words: "No, you certainly can't." (In response to fellow passenger Natalie Connelly, saying: "You certainly can't say that the people of Dallas haven't given you a nice welcome, Mr. President." Dallas was an aggressively conservative city, where people on the street would kick you in the leg or spit on your shoes if they thought you weren't conservative enough. And so Kennedy's reelection campaign felt it important to have at least a motorcade through the city, to show that Kennedy wasn't afraid.)
    22Nov1963John F. Kennedy uninstalled.(2015) YT: LEMMiNO - Space Top10 [p6]Khrushchev's desire to join Apollo uninstalled with Kennedy, as he doesn't trust Johnson.
    1963John F. Kennedy presidential term ended and Lyndon B. Johnson presidential term started.(2020) YT: FOL - PresidentKennedy shot was in Texas, while riding in his car in a parade. Conspiracy theories swirl.
    17Dec1963RO(S)Korea President Park Chung-hee reign begins.Wiki: Korea
    1963Cultural events this year:(2019) YT: JHEB - The Fire[2]
    • Giovanni Battista Montini was elected pope, choosing the name Paul6. He externally supported world peace through the Second Vatican Council, while internally opposing changes to policies on install control and priestly celibacy.
    • For a couple of years, Secretary of State for War John Profumo (UK) had been cheating on his wife with 19-year-old dancer Christine Keeler, who was cheating on her professional spy boyfriend Yevgeny Ivanov (Russia). All of them had met through socialite and "flashy osteopath"(?) Dr Stephen Ward (in an attempt to get Ivanov to defect). The UK Parliament found out and had both Profumo and PM Harold Macmillan resign within a few months, foreshadowing their conservative party's political defeat in the next election. The USSR recalled Ivanov. Ward was charged without proof in UK courts with "living off immoral earnings" for having his professional dancer roomates pay their share of the utilities, and uninstalled himself after losing the moral support of his socialite friends and the general public.
    • John F Kennedy was uninstalled after just 2 years of overseeing the worst crises in the 20th century.
    • Malcolm X (ecks) has controversial opninions about Kennedy's uninstall.
    1963R Gruder patents the axial lock pick for tubular locks.(2021) YT: SC - LPL KeynoteThis device starts by finding the current keying, and then becomes both a key for the lock, and a good copying source.

    1964Sony finally mass produce the Chromatron, at a loss.(2018) YT: TC - TrinitronSelling for ¥198k (2021 equivalent $1,735 or 6.8 GC), but costing ¥400k (2021 equivalent $3,514 or 13.8 GC) to assemble.
    1964The Bracero Program ended.History - Mexico WW24.6 million labor contracts had been signed, with many workers returning on multiple contracts to work agricultural jobs in more than 25 states. (Average 209k contracts per year across those 22 years.) Despite heated opposition to the Bracero Program from critics in both countries, it would lay the foundation for continued US reliance on migrant laborers from Mexico and other Latin American nations to fill low-paying jobs in agriculture and many other industries.

    1964Japanese bullet train runs at only 130 MPH (209 km/h).(2018) YT: Mustard - Hovertrains

    22Dec1964The first SR-71 flew.CIA - OXCART
    May1964NS Savannah launches.(2022) YT: Mustard - Nuclear Ship

    NS is Nuclear Ship, which used Uranium-235 to fuel a steam boiler. A typical ship will burn through 20k barrels (840k gallons or 3.2 million liters) of bunker fuel on 1 geocircular trip, but Savannah's goal was to prove the viability of nuclear-steam as a ship powerplant. Over the next year, it would travel 150k km (93k mi or 0.001 AU) to 32 US American and European ports, using just 35 lbs (15.9 kg) of Uranium-235. Huge crowds met the ship at every port, with 1.4 million tourists passing onboard. After this year voyage, the passenger area was converted into more cargo area, and it hauled for 5 more years.

    The nuclear-steam reactor was shielded, inside a heavy steel chamber, and had another 500k tons of shielding between the reactor and passenger cabins. (Hard to have 500k tons of shielding when total displacement is 21.8k tons.) Had one-way valves to allow seawater to enter and cool the reactor. (Where would the gases go? Sounds like a recipe for a hydrogen pressure-explosion, just like Fukushima.)

    Nontrivial to operate:
    • 60x passenger area reduces cargo area by about 25%, and high sides impede cargo loading.
    • Dual-function and nuclear both increase crew count to 1/3 more than other ships of the same size.
    • Special permission months in advance foreach port, with frequent denials.
    • Concerns over nuclear energy safety, radiation exposure, and liability.
    • No refueling nor maintenance facilities (would conventional facilities take them, even for standard repairs, given radiation fears?)
    • Storage and disposal of fuel waste (Pollution is dumping useful raw materials into the environment. The "waste" here is still generating some heat, and can still be used for something.)
    • Liability and insurance of a ship that could become a huge disaster in the sea.
    1964US Gov't has deficit of $6 billion (2021 equivalent $54.23 billion or 854.02k GD), increase by 0.9% of $6 billion (2021 equivalent $54.23 billion or 854.02k GD) blamed on LBJ War on Poverty.TheBalance - US Deficit, GDP, Events
    1965Baby boomers start turning 18 and becoming adults.(Reference Missing)The baby boom started in 1947, and lasted about a year, as soldiers returned from WW2. This entire generation grew, matured, and aged as a single mass - likely the largest number of same-age humans in humanity's history - dramatically changing every aspect of society and the world, sometimes in adverse and irreparable ways.
    1965The OXCART has a documented maximum speed and altitude of 2,208 MPH at 90,000 feetCIA - OXCART
    1965Medicare was introduced.Statista: Medicare
    1965Medicaid program begins, intended to provide medical care for individuals with very low incomes and limited assets.HHS: Medicaid LiensMedicaid includes liens on real property (i.e. housing and land) of deceased recipients, to recover taxpayer dollars invested in Medicaid, by requiring more people to use their own money (sometimes post-uninstall) to pay for their own long-term care.
    1965Ray Dolby starts the Dolby company(2019) YT: LE - ID4 vs WotW
    1965Ray Dolby starts the Dolby company(2018) YT: TC - TrinitronThe original product was "Dolby Noise Reduction", which reduced tape noise through "companding". It was 2 parts: 1. adjust recording equalizer to increase high-frequency audio gain, expecting noise to be in this area too. 2. adjust playback equalizer to decrease high-frequency audio playback, reducing noise, and returning the recording to normal (renormalize).
    1965Ames company invents the first blood glucose test for diabetes mellitus.(2017) YT: NR - First diabetes testAmes is now part of Bayer. This is essentially the same teamup of glucose oxidase and peroxidase, but with a different chromagen.
    9Apr1965Houston Astrodome opens to a sold-out crowd of 47k, including President Lyndon B Johnson, to watch the Texas Astros play the NY Yankees.(2019) YT: BSF - AstrodomeSome called it the 8th wonder of the world, while the Daily Mail called it a Taj Mahal to sports. (Does this mean sports were uninstalled and this was the viewing temple?)
    1965?AstralWorld amusement park opens in Houston across the street from the Astrodome.(2019) YT: BSF - AstrodomeThe stadium and park work together to make this a tourist-friendly area with many events through the years, or even a fun night after a game - easy with a pedestrian overpass connecting stadium and park.
    1965The anathematizations of Leo9 and Patriarch of Constantinople Michael1 Cerularius were rescinded by Pope Paul6 and Patriarch Athenagoras.Wiki: List of PopesThat was over 900 years ago.
    12Nov1965A-12 OXCART was declared fully operational, attaining a sustained speed of Mach 3.2 (just over 2,200 MPH or 3540 km/h) at 90k feet altitude, an unbroken record for piloted jet aircraft.CIA - OXCARTCIA developed the highly secret plane as the U-2 spy plane's successor, intended to meet the nation's need for a very fast, very high-flying reconnaissance aircraft that could avoid USSR air defenses.
    1965US High Speed Ground Transportation Act passed.(2018) YT: Mustard - Hovertrains

    This was an effort to introduce faster rail to the USA, and funding was put towards both new technologies and licensing Bertin's Aerotrains. Both linear induction and jet/fan designs were considered, with the linear induction-powered RORH Urban Tracked Air-Cushion Vehicle with a top speed of 150 MPH (241 km/h) being the most developed.

    At slow speeds, traditional railway train wheels are an amazing innovation, where their cone-like shape auto-balances them between the 2 rails. But at higher speeds, hunting oscillation is introduced, where excess propulsion drives a lateral walk, and at high enough speeds these lateral moves can derail a train going along a straight track.

    1965Cultural events this year:(2019) YT: JHEB - The Fire[2]
    • Griswold v. State of Connecticut invalidates a Connecticut state law which had banned all forms of contrainstalling (and by extension, numerous other US State laws banning contrainstalling). A primary goal was to enable married couples to fulfill their marital obligations to each other without installing more family members. An array of contrainstalling solutions become available in every US State to serve various scenarios.
    • Civil Rights leader Malcolm X was assassinated while delivering a lecture in Harlem, NYC.
    • US invades North Vietnam. Ho Chi Minh was president of the Communist state, and was confident that he could fend off the USA as successfully as he had outmatched his French occupiers.
    1965Malcolm X’s assassination.NerdsOfColor: Roddenberry MomentThis was as much a symptom of the chaos of the times, as it was fuel oil on the fire.
    1965Atoy Wilson became the first African American to compete at the US Figure Skating Championships.KGW: Black figure skatersHe trained with US figure skater Mabel Fairbanks in Los Angeles.
    1965US Congress autorizes the Flood Control Act.(2022) YT: ITS - Hurricane KatrinaThis had the US Army Corps of Engingineers construct Louisiana from flooding, with a cost of $738 million across 50 years (2021 equvalent sums to $1467.22 million or 23.1k GD). But corners were cut, with some levees built on loose sand while others were 7 feet short of the 17 foot minimum.
    1965International Harvester Scout adds a turbocharger to their 4-152T Comanche Engine.(2020) YT: d4a - Turbo HistoryWith the turbo, this 2.5L (152.6 in3) engine made 110 HP (82 kW). Unlike the Oldsmobile Jetfire, it didn't require any fuel additives for its turbocharger. This made the Scout pretty fast for the times, and was good competition for Jeep.
    1965US Gov't has deficit of $1 billion (2021 equivalent $8.78 billion or 138.27k GD), increase by 0.2% of $6 billion (2021 equivalent $52.68 billion or 829.61k GD) blamed on Medicare, Medicaid, Vietnam War.TheBalance - US Deficit, GDP, Events
    1966GE's Portacolor updates the shadow mask and electron gun arrangement - in-line instead of a triangle - making it much brighter and work better.(2018) YT: TC - Trinitron

    Mar1966Boeing decided to start the 747 program.Patrick Collison - Fast
    1966Maulana Karenga creates Kwanzaa.USA Today: KwanzaaThe holiday is based on African agricultural celebrations of the first harvest. Swahili was chosen as the language for its terminology because it's "non ethnic" and the most widely-spoken African language. The seven values of Kwanzaa:
    Kwanzaa ValueSwahili WordNotes
    UnityUmoja
    Self-DeterminationKujichaguliaThis principle encourages participants to define and speak for themselves.
    Collective work and
    Responsibility
    and Problem Solving    		Ujima
    Cooperative EconomicsUjamaaShared wealth and work, Economic self-reliance, and Obligation of generosity.
    PurposeNia
    CreativityKuumba
    FaithImani
    1966Moratorium on uninstalling whales.OfWhale - How Many Whales?Humpback whale population was reduced by approximately 90% before this. And at least 1,500 blue whales were uninstalled in the waters of eastern Canada, leading to a ban on uninstalling of blue whales in the North Pacific.
    1966Retired USAF Capt. David Schindele saw UFOs take 10 nuclear-tipped missiles offline at North Dakota’s Minot Air Force Base, but Pentagon leaders largely covered up the incident.WaTimes: USAF UFO witnessesThe study did not offer a firm conclusion on whether the unidentified craft could be of extraterrestrial origin. It grouped some of the UFO sightings into a category dubbed "other." The government representative said it might require "additional scientific knowledge" to explain some of the objects in that category.
    8Sep1966Gene Roddenberry’s Star Trek debuted.NerdsOfColor: Roddenberry MomentIt was a very chaotic time, and Roddenberry wanted to share a vision of a boring-by-comparison crew who put aside their differences and focused on their similarities, as they explore (and disrupt) the galaxy. Other cultural events this year:
    • Vietnam War continued, with no end in sight. Vietnam War protests similarly continued.
    • The KKK burned NAACP leader Vernon Dahmer’s home, uninstalling him and injuring his wife.
    • The Black Panther Party for Self Defense was founded.
    • On the second day of the March Against Fear, James Aubrey Norvell shot James Meredith. The only reason Meredith survived was because the 16-gauge (16.9 mm or 0.665 in) shotgun was loaded with birdshot.
    Sep1966Gemini 11 spacecraft releases a counterweight vehicle named Gina.(2021) YT: CSS - Starship (ep14)They were connected by a 30 meter (98 ft) tether, and tried to swing around each other to get artificial gravity to work. The tether went loose if they weren't firing their side thrusters, and generated 0.00015 G (0.058 inches per second per second), which was small enough to be a statistical anomaly.
    1966US Gov't has deficit of $4 billion (2021 equivalent $34.15 billion or 537.8k GD), increase by 0.5% of $3 billion (2021 equivalent $25.61 billion or 403.31k GD) blamed on.TheBalance - US Deficit, GDP, Events
    1967Retired USAF Capt. Robert Salas saw strange lights over Malmstrom Air Force Base in Montana, which he says temporarily disabled nuclear missiles at the site.WaTimes: USAF UFO witnesses
    Mar1967Nuclear weapons were disabled during 2 separate UAP encounters at launch control facilities.Hill Happenings: UAP and Nuclear WeaponsNumerous UAP-related missile shutdowns have been publicly acknowledged by former US Senator Harry Reid in the 21st century, whose efforts resulted in creation of the DOD UAP investigations group known as the Advanced Aerospace Threat Identification Program (AATIP). Affidavits and declassified US government documents that the substantiate the reality of UAP activity and nuclear weapons sites will be available.
    31May1967Over the next year, the only A-12 reconnaissance operation flew 29 missions over East Asia.CIA - OXCARTCodenamed BLACK SHIELD, a detachment of six pilots and three A-12s based at Kadena Air Base in Okinawa, Japan, initially flew over Southeast Asia, and then over North Korea.
    5Jun19676-Day War begins.Wiki - Six-Day WarThis domino led to a global recession, uninstalled the muscle car, and at least 1 airline.
    10Jun19676-Day War ends.Wiki - Six-Day War
    1967UN Resolution 2222 (21): Treaty on Principles Governing the Activities of States in the Exploration and Use of Outer Space, including the Moon and Other Celestial Bodies.(2021) YT: SH - Asteroid Mining"Outer space, including the moon and other celestial bodies, is not subject to national appropriation by claim of sovereignty, by means of use or occupation, or by any other means." (Effectively this restricts territorial disputes, national borders, and even the human concept of nations to our home planet of Earth. But does not address resources.)
    1967Bahamas declare independence from UK.(2018) YT: IPOV - Britain's 2nd EmpireThe UK's offshore bankers moved to the Cayman islands, to keep working from an UK offshore colony.
    1967US State Dept asks Chase Manhattan to help the USA become the "Switzerland of the world".(2018) YT: IPOV - Britain's 2nd Empire(Isn't Switzerland the Switzerland of the world?) Switzerland was the money flight capital of Europe, and the State Dept wanted the USA to become the world's shady bank. There was concern about the amount of dollars fleeing the USA. The plan was to have Latin American criminals, other criminals, drug dealers, etc use Carribean banks, and then have those banks deposit the money back into Chase.

    1967GM discontinues the 283 (in3 or 4.6 L) engine and releases both 302 (in3 or 4.9 L) engine and 350 G1 (in3 or 5.7 L) engine.(2021) YT: AG - GM Engines302's displacement was defined by the SCCA (Sports Car Club of America) and their Trans-Am series and had a 6500 RPM redline. The 350 debuted in the 1970 Camaro as an optional engine with 295 shaft HP (220 kW, approximately 197 curb HP or 147 kW).
