    1967International Harvester Scout removes their turbocharged 4-152T Comanche Engine.(2020) YT: d4a - Turbo HistoryThe 2.5L (152.6 in3) was replaced with a 3.2L (195 in3) naturally aspirated (non-turbo), because the larger non-turbo got better fuel mileage.
    1967Archaeologist Melvin Fowler excavates Cahokia Mound 72.(2022) YT: AA - CahokiaHe noticed it lined up with the equinox, not Cahokia's grid, and with Monks Mound - he believed there would have been a post in the middle, and he found one there. It was aligned with an older woodhenge, and built over an elite graveyard, including remains of a man buried with 20k Gulf Coast seashells. And 270 who were ritually uninstalled - this level of ritual uninstalling was unheard of among other Native micropowers and nations - was more reminiscent of the Mayans - and might be why nobody talks about Cahokia.
    1967US Gov't has deficit of $9 billion (2021 equivalent $74.53 billion or 1.17 million GD), increase by 1% of $6 billion (2021 equivalent $49.69 billion or 782.52k GD) blamed on Expansion.TheBalance - US Deficit, GDP, Events
    29Feb1968Wally Trabing writes article "Mostly About People" continuing the "uphill both ways" story.Quora - Uphill Both Ways"They live in the past and tell you they walked 12 miles to school in the snow, uphill both ways!"
    5Mar1968Soldier Bill Ehrhart (USA) returns from active duty in Vietnam.(2018) YT: DH - Vietnam Soldier

    Walter Cronkite's The Twentieth Century sold active service with the same glamor as WW2 liberators, and Ehrhart had expectations of being showered with flowers and kisses. But he was largely ignored. The strong aromatic tropical bouquet overwhelmed his delicate North American olfaction. One of his first jobs involved questioning Viet Cong [Vietnamese community] detainees, whom the Marines would toss bound hand-and-foot off tall flatbed trucks, breaking their bodies and Ehrhart's misunderstanding of the reality of the war.

    The Viet Cong micropower's snipers and mines had a brutal psychological impact on US American soldiers - having no visible enemy to fight, the soldier would call an airstrike on whole villages - and this would radicalize any survivors into more Viet Cong soldiers. Ehrhart was taught in US American high school that Viet Cong leadership were brutal dictators who forced friendly Vietnamese to fight the US Americans, but a few days in Vietnam taught him that high school was wrong. And too US American soldiers were losing friends and battle buddies every day, with only the local villagers present to receive their anger, leading a viscious cycle of more villages bombed and more Viet Cong soldiers to snipe more US American soldiers.

    But none of this was clear in the moment, clouded by the emotional jungle, and young Ehrhart's lack of political savvy while deployed - he came to understand the above only years later, after learning the Vietnam War's political background. While in Vietnam, all Ehrhart could understand was that this insanity wouldn't end, no matter how hard he fought. The constant terror of being uninstalled by sniper wore down his heart and mind until he could only focus on keeping himself alive, which is one of the curses of war. (The USA lost the Vietnam War because we lost even our own soldiers' hearts and minds.)

    Adding to the surreality of it all, Ehrhart's subscription to Time magazine was delivered to him in Vietnam. He would read what President Johnson and his advisors Robert McNamara and Dean Rusk said about the war, which had no connection to the war Ehrhart was fighting. One example involves USA soldiers finding a Viet Cong weapons cache, which Stars and Stripes reported as setting Viet Cong plans back 4 months - but Ehrhart heard about numerous subseuqent Viet Cong attacks that Stars and Stripes did not report, showing Viet Cong soldiers were hardly set back at all.

    When Ehrhart returned to Treasure Island, he felt like an immigrant, immersed in the grandiosity (and thick fog). He took a taxi to the airport, reveling in the relative luxury. He went back to a woman he'd idolized in Vietnam, but she had moved on as he hadn't kept in touch while there.

    1968Nauru gets indepenence from UK, buys British Phosphate Commission and renames to Nauru Phosphate Corporation.(2019) YT: SN - Tiny NationInstead of fixing damage to their island ecosystem, they double down on mining phosphorus.
    28May1968President Johnson ordered retirement of the A-12 OXCART.CIA - OXCARTThroughout its operational career, the SR-71’s primary operation base was also out of Kadena Air Base in Japan, although other bases also hosted Blackbird operations, including Beale AFB in California, and RAF Mildenhall, England. Because the Air Force was developing the Blackbird, there was little value in maintaining both the overt SR-71 and covert A-12 fleets with similar capabilities. By then, CORONA satellites were regularly launched to collect thousands of images worldwide each year, and although its imagery was less timely and of poorer resolution than that from the A-12 and SR-71, CORONA was safe from anti-aircraft missiles and much less provocative than aircraft overflights. This A-12 was the first of the operational fleet to be certified to fly at Mach 3, and during its lifetime, it logged 453 hours on 232 test and training flights.
    1968Rutherfordium created.(Reference Missing)
    1968US EPA sets car exhaust limits.(2021) YT: NM - Fuel InjectorFuel injection allowed cars to easily meet these standards without additional costly (both in money and HP) emissions compliance accessories, so this was a way of making the efficiency level of fuel injection mandatory without codifying any technologies into law.
    1968Sony engineers updated Chromatron to have a single electron gun with 3 cathodes, and updated the vertical wires into an aperture grill of long slits.(2018) YT: TC - TrinitronSony wins an Emmy for this new TV, named the Trinitron.
    9Aug1968NASA decided that Apollo 8 should go to the moon.Patrick Collison - Fast
    28Aug1968The Battle of Michigan Avenue.Wiki: DNC ProtestsPolice in riot gear were aggressively attacking unarmed protesters on live TV. Counterculture and anti-Vietnam War protest groups had planned protests and demonstrations in response to the convention, and the city promised to maintain law and order, which they did by deploying police in riot gear against the protesters. Police deployed tear gas widely, and used protesters to destroy private property such as business windows, then attacked the injured protesters for the property destruction. The offiical investigation found that most protesters were attempting to peacefully assemble, and that was prevented by the overwhelming police overreaction to the few violent protesters.
    1968CIA starts Operation Condor to encourage conservative political leadership in South AmericaWiki: Operation Condor
    1968A USSR November-class submarine intercepted the USS Enterprise en route to Vietnam.Defense Media - Nucear PowerThis was a very graphical demonstration of the superiority of nuclear-steam propulsion over diesel.
    1968Boeing launches the 747.(2019) YT: Mustard - 747 Carrier2.5 times larger than any jetliner before it, this was the first "jumbo-jet" and transformed air travel. It was at least partially due to the work of Juan Trippe, president of PanAm, who foresaw how such a large plane could easily empty crowded airports and bring down the cost of flying middle class.
    30Sep1968Boeing rolled out their first completed 747.Patrick Collison - Fast
    1968A two-tiered pricing system was created for the official US Government gold price, and the market price for gold has been free to fluctuate since then.NMA - Historic Gold Prices
    1968Milankovitch cyclces start to gain scientific acceptance.NASA - Milankovich Cycles
    Nov1968Solar Cycle 20 maximum.Wiki: List of solar cycles
    1968First report of health issues from MSG.(2021) YT: XJZ - USA Chinese FoodAn unnamed doctor sent a letter to the editor of New England Journal of Medicine, complaining of headaches and tingling limbs after eating Chinese food, and specualting that it was from the MSG in the food. This wasn't a scientific study, only a causal letter. Other doctors started trolling with their own letters to the editor, complaining of ridiculous health issues after eating Chinese food. The general public misunderstood these for serious health complaints, and trollish doctors started treating these fake symptoms also. Unblinded studies (which allow bias) were used to create fallacious support - sometimes even giving MSG intravenously. Later blinded tests found no correlation between MSG consumption and MSG sensitivity.
    16Dec1968The Alhambra Decree was formally and symbolically revoked, following the Second Vatican Council.Wiki: Expulsion Jews Spain

    A full century after Jews had openly begun to practice their religion in Spain and synagogues were once more legal places of worship under Spain's Laws of Religious Freedom.

    (Numerous other changes came out of the Second Vatican Council, including that Vatican City's religion stopped advocating anti-Semitism. Before this, every person of Jewish heritage was held personally responsible for the uninstall of Jesus (Nazareth).)

    21Dec1968NASA launched Apollo 8 towards the moon.Patrick Collison - FastThis was 134 days after the launch was decided.
    1968Richard Nixon is elected US President, promising to bring home the USA's soldiers in Vietnam, but he doesn't.(2019) YT: JHEB - The Fire[2]This is years after serving as Eisenhower’s vice president. His official visits to both China and the USSR improve relations with both empires.
    1968Mickey Mantle ended his 17-year baseball career, having helped the NY Yankees win seven World series and having hit 536 home runs.(2019) YT: JHEB - The Fire[2]This averages to 31.5 home runs per season, or one about every 5.5 games.
    1968GM releases the 307 (in3 or 5.0 L) engine.(2021) YT: AG - GM EnginesThis replaced the 283, because cars were getting heavier and needed more torque. This was the crank from the 327 and the block from the 283.
    1968First Lockheed C-5 Galaxy delivered.(2021) YT: MP - C-5 GalaxyThe largest cargo plane before this was the Douglas C-133 Cargomaster, whose engines would shake it apart. And it was simply too small to fit modern cargo demands, such as several tanks. C-5 Dimensions:
    • 248 ft (75.5 m) long, wingspan of 222 ft (67.6 m), cargo area 121x19x19 ft (37 x 5.8x 5.8 m or 1,244,680 L, or 328,810.7 gal).
    • General Electric (GE) TF39 engine, which was 4x as efficient as previous models, meeting the USAF's efficiency predictions.
    • Max:
      • Speed: 570 MPH (917 km/h or 497 knots).
      • Payload: 300k lb (150 tons or 132 metric tons)
      • Weight: 840k lbs (420 tons, 381 metric tons, or the weight of 3 blue whales, possibly inspiring the Star Trek4 legend.) Wings to support 150% of this. (Meaning the USAF planned to overload these. Testing showed they only supported 125%.)
    • It can fit one of:
      • 2x 55 ton M1 Abrams tanks
      • 10x 10 ton LAV (Lightly Armed Vehicles)
      • M60 AVLB, a tank that deploys a bridge for other tanks.
      • 6x 40ft city buses (in theory).
    • Fitted for aerial refueling since most runways are too short. Requires 8300 ft (1.5 mi or 2.3 km) to takeoff at full capacity, and 4900 ft (0.92 mi or 1.5 km) to land. Some logistical innovations:
      • Massive tail hatch.
      • Entire nose of the aircraft can swing up to allow access to the entire front of the cargo hold.
      • Landing gear can kneel to a normal truck loading dock height, allowing cargo to be forklifted from the truck directly into the airplane.

    Became the first project to exceed its budget by $1 billion (2021 equivalent $7.1 billion or 111.8k GD) - so expensive that US Congress abandoned and rewrote its reimbursement process, and investigated Lockheed. Whistleblower Henry Durham reported to Congress that Lockheed's board were using substandard and untested materials. Durham was harrassed into quitting his job, but eventually got the Elliot Black Award from the American Ethical Union, while Lockheed got some bailouts and eventually made 75x C-5A.

    1968NS Otto Hanh (Germany) launches.(2022) YT: Mustard - Nuclear ShipThis nuclear-steam research and ore carrier was inspired by the NS Savannah. But it didn't have the same promotional team flying ahead of it, and so wasn't allowed to enter most ports, nor the Suez nor Panama canals. It would be converted to diesel about 2/3 through its life.

    11Apr1969Bank of England, in a classified note, recognizes the importance of retaining its own capital, but is indifferent to other nations' currency situation.(2018) YT: IPOV - Britain's 2nd Empire"We need to be quite sure that the possible proliferation of trust companies, banks, etc which in most cases would be no more than the brass plates manipulating assets outside the islands does not get out of hand. There is of course no objection to their providing boltholes for non residents, but we need to be quite sure that in so doing opportunities are not created for the transfer of UK capital to the non sterling area outside of UK rules."

    1969US National Science Foundation takes over Aricebo Telescope from US Military.(2021) YT: PE - Arecibo TelescopeOriginally a missile defense system, it could detect extremely faint radio waves, and even send radio waves out, radar-imaging other solar system objects. It was also used in a Nobel-prize winning observation of binary pulsars slowing slightly as their obital momentum was slowly converted into gravitational waves across 30 years.
    1969Cultural events this year:(2019) YT: JHEB - The Fire[2]
    • Neil Armstrong (USA) was the first human to step onto the Moon’s surface, saying: "That’s one small step for (a) man, one giant leap for (hu)mankind." Buzz Aldrin joined him, but Michael Collins had to stay inside the lander.
    • The Woodstock Music and Art Fair in Bethel, NY became a rally for the anti-war, free love counter culture that was developing as a response to the continuing brutal Vietnam war.
    • Ho Chi Minh's uninstall damaged chances for an early settlement of tensions between Vietnam and the United States.

    1970Ames (Bayer) company invents a blood test strip reading machine to give a more precise reading.(2017) YT: NR - First diabetes testThese machines were expensive and required monthly calibration, and were only sold to doctors and hospitals.
    31Jul1970Black Tot DayUncommon - GrogThe last of the daily Grog rations were handed out aboard British Ships. How to make grog:
    • One Part Sour - .5 ounces (14.2 ml) lime juice
    • Two Parts Sweet - 2 teaspoons (9.86 ml) sugar
    • Three Parts Strong - 1.5 ounces (42.6 ml) rum (about 1 shot or 1.5 Utah shots)
    • Four Parts Weak - 1 ounce (28.4 ml) water
    This is basically a daquiri - the sugar and water combine to make simple sugar syrup, and modern daquiri recipes round both the rum and lime juice to full ounces (multiples of 28.4 ml). Hemingway would substitute Maraschino cherries for the syrup, and add grapefruit juice equal to the lime juice.

And no perpetual contracts - they must have a set duration.

    1970sMoon trees, germinated by former US Forestry Service fireman Stuart Roosa, were planted and grown, had cuttings, and those planted.(2019) YT: JMG - strange moon aspectsPoor record keeping means some will never be found. Some are at US Goddart Flight Center and a Girl Scout camp in Indiana.
    1970sGreat Red Spot on Jupiter measured by Voyager 1 to be 20k km (12.4k mi) long, big enough to hold 1-1.5 Earths.(2020) YT: PS - Red SpotThis is 1/2 as big as in the 1800s.
    1970sSatanic Panic startsAtlasObscura - P&G Satanic PanicThis was a potent fear of Satanic cults across the United States.
    1970sStagflation invented.InflationData - The 1980sThis is where the economy stagnates (sees high unemployment) in spite of rampant inflation. (General increases in the prices of goods and sometimes increases in income to match. Banks regularly take out loans from larger banks, and The Fed is the biggest in the USA. The Fed can vary the interest rates they charge for these loans:
    • lowering interest rates lets banks pass on the savings, letting businesses take out cheap loans to grow and hire people, reducing unemployment but increasing inflation.
    • raising interest rates forces banks to pass on the price hike, stifling businesses and hiring, increasing unemployment but reducing inflation.
    This was seen as a "lever" to fine-tune the economy, and graphs were drawn showing the slope between inflation and unemployment that this created. But increases in the cost of energy after the 1973 oil shortage increased both, and left The Fed powerless - any change they made would only make things worse for the average American.)
    1970sChinese restaurants in NYC invent food delivery.(2021) YT: XJZ - USA Chinese Food(A collection of empty paper boxes on a conference room table quickly became a semiotic for burning the midnight oil.)
    1970sHovertrains were seriously considered as the modern replacement for declining old railways.(2018) YT: Mustard - Hovertrains These would generate an air cushion by moving fast enough to redirect air from giant ramscoops (funnels) on the nose, and out the bottom (against the track), to float above its concrete center guideway much like a hovercraft. This was sold as a solution to both hunting oscillation and traditional rolling resistance.
    1970sVatican Bank was plunged into disrepute after many years of rumours about money laundering on behalf of the mafia.World Finance: Vatican Bank
    1970sHumans expected to reach Mars within 50 years.(2020) YT: HL - Past Predictions(We have robots there - does that count?) Space travel was expected to start by the early 21st century, with stations orbiting Earth as the first step in a ladder of stations, to get to Mars.
    1970sUSSR builds BTA-6, a 6 m (19.7 ft) telescope.(2022) YT: SM - Biggest TelescopesBolshoi Teleskop Alt-azimutalnyi [Bolshoi Alt-azimuthal Telescope] 6. It was less useful than it should have been due to weather effects of the nearby mountains.
    1970sSheridan Hotels was a growing luxury hotel brand in the USA and Canada.(2022) YT: BSF - Days InnThey opened numerous well-known high-rise towers in major cities, and also had sprawling "destination" motor inns [motels] with convention centers and banquet halls in less-traveled locations.
    1970sViking missions fly past Mars.(2021) YT: SM - Rocks from MarsThese provided the data to determine if a meteorite found on Earth originated on Mars.
    15Feb1971The UK and Ireland switched to decimal currency.(2021) YT: BM - Nightmare CurrencyThere were 19 coins in medieval times, but this was reduced to 8 coins and paper Pounds by the 1900s:
    CoinPenceShillingsPoundsNew PenceNew Pounds
    Half-penny1/21/241/4801/21/200
    Penny11/121/24011/100
    Threepence31/41/80
    Two pence21/50
    Sixpence61/21/40
    Shilling1211/2051/20
    Florin2421/10101/10
    Half-Crown302.51/8
    Crown6051/4251/4
    Pound2402011001
    The old system made digitisation and electronic transactions more complicated. The old and new Pound Sterling were the same and/or traded at parity. Some banks continued to use mainframes for some time after this that were programmed to handle the old system.The switchover even had a catchy tune.

    1971Bishop Paul Marcinkus led the Vatican Bank.World Finance: Vatican Bank
    1971Stan Kaplan (USA bike mechanic) patents the Kryptonite U-shaped bike lock.(2021) YT: LPL - Kryptonite U-lockThis was a 2-foot long piece of flat 2" steel bar bent into a 1 foot U shape, with the tines of the U about 6" apart. 2 slots allow an 8" piece of 2" steel to go through. One end is bent to keep it (from going all the way through) and the other has a hole for a padlock. A bent steel shroud guarded the lock shackle and prevented direct cutting. The lock came with Unican tumbler core padlock, same for Kryptonite2 the next year, and Kryptonite3 would include a tumbler lock a few years later. This was before the advent of modern tumbler lock impressioning tools and other high-precision lockpicking tools.
    Oct1971Submarine USS Halibut arrives in Ohtusk Sea.(2021) YT: DS - Super Secret Sub

    The USS Halibut - a long-range missile sub - had been heavily upgraded for the mission, replacing the internal missile storage with a darkroom, 24bit mainframe computer, and submerged entry hatches. This was a "shell conspiracy":

    • They were there to install a wiretap on a USSR undersea cable between the USSR Pacific Fleet base in Vladivostok and their submarine base in Petropavlovsk, which was classified with the cover story:
    • They were on a classified mission looking for remains of an USSR SSN12 sandbox supersonic antiship missile, to collect the thousands of pieces of debris and design countermeasures, which was also classified with the cover story:
    • Unsure, possibly a geologic survey?

    They found the cable from the warning signs to prevent local fishermen from damaging it. An induction tap was used to prevent damage, connected to a reel-to-reel tape recorder - it had to be changed monthly. The NSA performed the analysis. (Why not the CIA?) Later, nuclear-powered (betavoltaic?) devices allowed a full year of recording.

    1971GM lowers the compression ratio of all of their engines, to help them run better on unleaded fuel.(2021) YT: AG - GM Engines
    1971Nixon holds an international business conference with USSR head Alexi Kosigan.(2021) YT: DS - Pepsi NavyThe USSR were willing to buy Pepsi, but their money legally had no value outside the USSR. Their deal gave Pepsico an exclusive deal, and blocked other brands.

    1972Cabaret movie released(2016) YT: LE - Phantom
    21Mar1972Regent Lt. General Georgios Zoitakis (ΓεώργIος ΖωIτάκης) reign ends and Regent Colonel Georgios Papadopoulos (ΓεώργIος Παπαδόπουλος) reign begins.Wiki: Greek Head of StateRegent, For Constantine2, Strongman of the Greek junta, declared himself regent
    1972Sociologist Stanley Cohen (UK) coined the phrase "moral panic"AtlasObscura - P&G Satanic PanicIn his seminal study, Folk Devils and Moral Panics, the phrase is used in reference to events like this, which appear suddenly to threaten societal norms. These events are misrepresented in sensationalistic fashion in the media and eventually reporting on the subject comes to define it for the public.
    1972Nixon visits China(2021) YT: XJZ - USA Chinese FoodPhotos of Nixon at the banquets raised questions about the "actual" Chinese food he was served, and made Chinese food again a focus of USA normie attention. The CCP's continued takeover of the continental provinces caused many on the continent, and also the Island Taiwan, to flee to the USA. One of whom was inventor of General Tso's Chicken - 彭長貴 (Peng Chang-Kuei) was the National Government's banquet chef. He made it with memory of his native Hunan cuisine, and named it after 左宗棠 (Zuo Zongtang), a famous Qing general.
    1972The official US Government gold price was raised from $35 (2021 equivalent $228.59 or 0.9 GC) to $38 (2021 equivalent $248.18 or 0.98 GC) per troy ounce.NMA - Historic Gold PricesThe dollar had inflated to nearly 3x its previous value, reducing the price of gold from 2021 equivalent $713.07 (2.8 GC) in 1934. 1 troy ounce = 31.1 grams.
    Nov1972Work started on the Xerox Alto, the first GUI-oriented computer.Patrick Collison - FastWork started because of a bet: Chuck (who?) said that a futuristic computer could be done in three months, and a Xerox exec bet him a case of wine that it couldn't be done.
    1972USA Marine Mammal Protection ActOfWhale - How Many Whales?Banned all US Americans but Alaska Natives from uninstalling Beluga whales, but international whale uninstalling continued to hold down Beluga numbers. Also banned the import of Narwhal tusks.

    1972SAE switches from SAE Gross (shaft HP) to SAE Net (curb HP) to measure engine output.(2021) YT: AG - GM EnginesThis lowered horsepower numbers by about 30% across all cars.
    1972USSR trades Stolichnaya to Pepsico in exchange for Pepsi soda.(2021) YT: DS - Pepsi NavyThis let Pepsi sell the Stolichnaya in the USA and keep the profits, (close to $110 million, 2021 equivalent $713 million or 11.2k GD), and in exchange Pepsico set up bottling plants in Novorossisk, Evpatoriya, Moscow, Leningrad, and Tallinn in Estonia. The soda sold for $0.43 per bottle (2021 equivalent $2.79), giving about $250 million (2021 equivalent $1.6 billion or 25.2k GD) in profits (to whom - did these go back into the USSR's revenue?)

    1973Young Frankenstein released.(2018) YT: TC - DVD Laserdisc
    1973Skylab launched.(2015) YT: LEMMiNO - Space Top10 [p6]The craft's interior was large enough that designers were concerned a human could get "stuck" in the middle, with no way to reach any of the station's hand holds. But astronauts found they could just "swim" - cup hands and push, or move legs, to create enough minor thrust to navigate the cabin without other means.
    1973USA has lines at gas stations for oil shortage.(Reference Missing)Odd numbered license plates could fuel on odd-numbered days, and even license plates on even days. 10 gallon limit? Not sure about letters or vanity plates.
    1973PanAm was unsystematically impacted by oil shortage.(2018) YT: BSF - Pan AmOther airlines retracted to just flying domestic or local routes, while PanAm had only long, international routes which could not be retracted or otherwise reduced. Losses from fuel increases were multiplied by the reduced disposable income of both business and leisure passengers, due to fuel prices impacting all market segments systematically.
    1Jun1973Regent Colonel ΓεώργIος Παπαδόπουλος (Georgios Papadopoulos) establishes a military junta, ending the Kingdom of Greece and deposing Κωνσταντῖνος Βʹ (Constantine2).Wiki: Greek Head of StateThis would eventually form into another republic - presidential this time.
    29Jul1973Greece's military junta holds a rigged vote to abolish the monarchy and approve going back to democracy for a 2nd time.Wiki: Greek Head of StateThis was supposed to legitimize Colonel Παπαδόπουλος (Papadopoulos) as President under the Junta.
    1973Nixon ended the gold standard.TheBalance - Paul VolckerThe dollar's value plummeted on the foreign exchange markets. That made import prices higher, inflating prices of goods in general. (Another entry says this happened on 15Aug1971.)
    1973The official US Government gold price was raised from $38 (2021 equivalent $233.65 or 0.92 GC) to $42.22 (2021 equivalent $259.60 or 1.02 GC) per troy ounce.NMA - Historic Gold Prices
    1973Law on the Conservation of Endangered Species Act in USA.OfWhale - How Many Whales?Humpback whales were one of the first species protected, as they were in danger of extinction wherever they were found.
    1973Jean Bertin (France) and team build a hovertrain that can carry 80 passengers.(2018) YT: Mustard - HovertrainsBertin called these "Aerotrains" and the most advanced used a Pratt & Whitney JT8D (airplane jet) engine that produced more than 12k lbs (53.3 kN) of thrust. The public and media marveled at how fast and smooth they were.
    1973TWA hit hard by gas crisis and Flight Attendant Strike.(2019) YT: BSF - TWA

    TWA had ordered way too many 747s - trying to match PanAm's fleet size, not because they needed the capacity - so their 747s were vastly unprofitable and losing money with every flight. TWA began desperately selling planes for cheap to get quick cash, and changed CEOs to someone who implemented cost cutting measures and got the company somewhat back on track.

    This was also when they canceled their Concorde orders, partially due to the fuel crisis and recession this year. (And partly due to delays? They had ordered these over a decade ago - how long does it take Concorde to make a plane? PanAm also canceled their Concorde orders at about the same time. By comparison, the USAF also ordered 6x SR-71s in 1962 and Lockheed delivered them in 2 years.)

    1973USAF asks Boeing to research using a 747 or C-5 to act as a flying aircraft carrier.(2019) YT: Mustard - 747 CarrierThe newly released 747 and C-5 were large enough to both carry fighters and act as refueling tankers. This plan would have had one system to drop the fighter and another to recover it from midair. It would carry 44 personnel: 12 to fly the 747, 14 fighter pilots, and 18 "mission specialists" to sit around and then take all the credit later. There would also be sleeping quarters, and a pilot's lounge above the plane.
    1973Nigeria switches to a decimal-based currency.(2021) YT: BM - Nightmare Currency
    1973GM discontinues the 307 (in3 or 5.0 L) engine.(2021) YT: AG - GM EnginesOPEC shortage both increases gas prices and also causes long lines at the pumps.
    1973C-5s used during Operation Nickel Grass (Yom Kippur War) to deliver food and ammo to the Israeli army.(2021) YT: MP - C-5 Galaxy
    1973BMW introduces the 2002 Turbo, their first turbocharged car.(2020) YT: d4a - Turbo HistoryThey coupled the turbocharger with a mechanical fuel injector instead of a carburetor, which made the fuel distribution more even. This 2.0L (122 in3) engine made 170 HP (228 kW) and had very low 6.9:1 compression to reduce knock, giving pedal lag. But the 1973 oil crisis hit just months after it was released, ending the car after just 1000 sales.
    1973US Gov't has deficit of $15 billion (2021 equivalent $93.44 billion or 1.47 million GD), increase by 1% of $31 billion (2021 equivalent $193.11 billion or 3.04 million GD) blamed on End of gold standard.TheBalance - US Deficit, GDP, Events
    1974Richard Nixon presidential term ended and Gerald Ford presidential term started.(2020) YT: FOL - President
    1974Nixon resigned over the Watergate scandal, before he could be impeached.(2019) YT: JHEB - The Fire[2]This layer cake of crimes starts with five burglars who broke into the Democratic National Committee headquarters in the Washington, D.C., Watergate hotel complex, to tap their phones. Investigations into multiple layers of presidential misconduct found that Nixon had covered up White House involvement in the break-in, participated in money laundering schemes to help elect Republicans to Congress, illegally sabotaged political opponents, and wiretapped many more phones. But he faced no penalties beyond this, since his VP Gerald Ford gave him a full pardon.
    1974World population hits 4 billion(Reference Missing)
    1974Seaborgium created.(Reference Missing)
    5Mar1974French train smashes speed records by exceeding 250 MPH (402 km/h)(2018) YT: Mustard - HovertrainsReaching nearly 260 (418), it might have gone faster if it had a longer test track. This success led to Bertin to plans for Aerotrain links throughout France, and months later contracts were signed to construct the first one.
    1974Australopithecus afarensis Lucy (Danakil) discovered.(2019) YT: SS - Danakil DepressionThe Danakil Depression (near Addis Ababa) where her skeleton was found, is a tectonic divergence, where a mantle plume is separating the Nubian plate from the Somali plate, and pushing both away from the Arabian plate. The area has become beautiful from the colorfully toxic oxides and hydrates, home to "poly-extremophiles" - bactiera that can survive in multiple toxic environments (acidic heat). The archaeologists were listening to The Beatles, and named her after the song Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds. She was the oldest and most complete fossil found, from just over 3 million years ago. Colloquially called the "Missing Link", this was very convincing proof that we humans had evolved into our current forms, and had not been created this way.
    1974Hawking Radiation invented.(2018) YT: PBS ST - Hawking RadiationStephen Hawking predicts Hawking Radiation will cause black holes to evaporate. This was before he got ALS, and he walked around like any university student or professor.
    1974Stephen Hawking calculated gravitational solar collapse, and how black hole formation affects quantum fields.(2021) YT: SCE - Hawking RadiationThis led to the discovery of Hawking Radiation, which converts virtual particles into real ones, so a black hole is basically surrounded by a white hole, and we can tell black hole size based on the color of the glow of this entirely thermal radiation. The equation pretty simple: Temperature (T) is equal to (Planck's constant around a circle (Hbar) times the speed of light in 3 dimensions (c3)) divided across (Radius of a sphere (8π) times the gravitational constant (G), times Boltzmann's constant (kB), times the mass (M)). Like a balloon's skin increasing pressure on its contents as it deflates, black holes get hotter and radiate more energy as they shrink.
    18Dec1974Lt. General Φαίδων ΓκIζίκης (Phaedon Gizikis) ends the Republic under the Greek junta, and ΜIχαήλ ΣτασIνόπουλος (Michail Stasinopoulos) term begins the Third Hellenic RepublicWiki: Greek Head of StateThe military junta was overthrown and democracy restored. They held another vote to abolish the monarchy - a legitimate one this time - 10 days before this. (For those keeping score: since becoming independent of the Ottoman empire, this is the ending of Greece's 2nd attempt at monarchy, and beginning of their 2nd attempt at democracy.)
    1974USA implements national 55 MPH (88.5 km/h) speed limit.(2021) YT: AG - GM Engines

But then the Iranian Revolution canceled these planes.
    1974NS Mutsu (Japan) launches.(2022) YT: Mustard - Nuclear ShipThis nuclear-steam cargo hauler was supposed to be the first of a fleet, but only spurred anti-nuclear sentiment after a radiation shielding leak was found, and misreported as a nuclear fuel leak. A flotilla of fishing boats blocked it into a port for 2 months, and it only traveled 82k km in 20 years before being converted to diesel.
    1974US Gov't has deficit of $6 billion (2021 equivalent $33.66 billion or 530.08k GD), increase by 0.4% of $17 billion (2021 equivalent $95.38 billion or 1.5 million GD) blamed on Budget process created, Watergate.TheBalance - US Deficit, GDP, Events
    1975Nauru Phosphate Corporation earns (2021 equivalent $2.7 billion or 42.5k GD) across only 7000 residents.(2019) YT: SN - Tiny NationThis was from massively mining the phosphorus that was pooped by birds on the island over thousands of years, and the income wouldn't last long. (GDP per capita was 6x that of the average American in 2021.)
    1975Laura Mulvey writes Visual and Other Pleasures.(2017) YT: LE - Lady Robots

    Mulvey saw men as subjects, identifying with agents who drive the plot - and women as objects for masculine desire and fetishizing, like cars or houses or jobs. She lays out a combination of semiotics, Althusserian Marxism, and Lacanian psychoanalysis.

    To Mulvey, cinema movies were a Kulishovian series of Chekovian symbols - aka semiotics - which displayed narratives of men performing acts to gain assets, including not just female attention and companionship, but dominance over the woman as another asset. This sort of pandering to the Male Gaze is especially obvious in early beach movies - Catalina Caper comes to mind, with the commentary that it helped form the sexuality of the Boomer generation. This pattern, which Mulvey perceived, was cemented into American culture as a traditional cinema experience.

    1975IBM released the first mass-produced portable computer, the 5100.Stranger Dimensions - Titor

    It was an incredible feat for the time: An integrated 5-inch CRT monitor, up to 64 kilobytes of random-access memory (RAM), and the ability to run programs meant for larger, more expensive computers, all in something the size of a briefcase. In fact, the IBM 5100 was extraordinarily close to becoming the world’s very first Personal Computer, a title taken a few short months earlier by the Altair 8800.

    But the IBM 5100 contained a hidden feature - at a time when most computers could only support the BASIC programming language, the IBM 5100 had the ability to emulate programs in both BASIC for system/3 and APL for system/370. (The "system" in this case refers to IBM mainframes). According to Bob Dubke, one of the IBM 5100 engineers, this function was hidden "because of worries about how (IBM’s) competition might use it." Even if the function weren’t hidden, however, the general public, especially around 2000-2001, most likely had little idea that such a machine even existed.

    While this is only one very small part of the John Titor legend, it seems to be the genesis for the entire story. Looking at it as a narrative, without the 2038 timeout and the need for an IBM 5100, Titor would have never been sent on his mission through time. And what’s interesting is, the IBM 5100 did contain functionality that was hidden from the public.

    We need the system to "debug" various legacy computer programs in 2036. UNIX has a problem in 2038. - John Titor

    1975John Titor arrives from the future, using a rudimentary time machine, in search of an IBM 5100 PC.Stranger Dimensions - TitorJohn Titor legend. Titor belonged to a team of seven individuals selected to embark on a journey through time. He had lived through unimaginable horrors in a world destroyed by selfishness, cynicism, and corrupt government, ravaged by nuclear war. To make matters worse, what little remained of their technology was threatened by a looming UNIX timeout error. An IBM 5100 was just what they needed. Its ability to debug and emulate code between various programming languages made it an important component in keeping the technological architecture of their fallen world alive. Unfortunately, none could easily be found in 2036.

    1975Mid-Cold War, USA and USSR space ships dock and mingle for 9 days.(2021) YT: UVA CFP - Bill NelsonThis started an international cooperation around space that continues into the 21st century.
    1975Porsche introduces the 911 Turbo, their first turbocharged car.(2020) YT: d4a - Turbo HistoryThe non-turbo version was the 930. The fasted production car on Earth, and heavily styled, this car changed public perception of the turbocharger. Before this, turbo meant "unreliable and bad MPG" but now it meant "SPEEDY". Like the BMW 2002 Turbo, the unrefined turbochargers of the era meant it had severe pedal lag. This 3.0L (183 in3) flat engine made 260 HP (348 kW)
    1975US Gov't has deficit of $53 billion (2021 equivalent $272.48 billion or 4.29 million GD), increase by 3.1% of $58 billion (2021 equivalent $298.18 billion or 4.7 million GD) blamed on Ford budget, Vietnam War ended.TheBalance - US Deficit, GDP, Events
    Mid-1970sGlobal recession reduced funding for alternative rail, such as hovertrains.(2018) YT: Mustard - HovertrainsMaglev was beginning to replace hovertrains, but both were squashed by this. Instead, a series of improvements were made to the more than a million miles (1.6 million km or 5.3 light seconds) of existing rail:
    • Rail networks were modernized by straightening out curvy sections, or making the curves gentler.
    • New signaling technologies give more lead time for speed and track changes.
    • More advanced suspensions can handle high speed turns better - UK's APT-E tilts into corners and takes sharp turns more quickly.
    • Precision-machined wheels with yaw dampners allow for less cone angle, reducing hunting oscillation.

This led to the numerous airplane hijackings of the time.

Within an hour of the arrival of armed teams in Entebbe, Uganda, the hostages had been freed and the seven PFLP micropower members had been uninstalled.

    1977Introns discovered.(2010) YT: iBiology - RNA SplicingThese sections of DNA are transcribed to RNA then often immediately deleted. The amount of information needed to specify (not delete) an intron varies per organism, and requires 37 bytes in humans. There are also exons, which are between introns and always joined to RNA. Exons are consistently short, while introns can be hugely variable in length.
    20Sep1977Massive jellyfish-shaped explosion occurs over USSR.(2022) YT: WU - Elon's AliensTASS (Russian State News) made unusually thorough interviews of the eyewitness, which caught CIA attention. CIA noted the phenomenon was semicircular, with a red center and white edges. It was visible from Finland to Vladivostok (and likely Tehran and Beijing too).

    1978Endangered American Wilderness Act of 1978.FS -Wenaha-TucannonThe Wenaha-Tucannon Wilderness was created, encompassing 176,557 acres in the northern Blue Mountains of southeastern Washington and northeastern Oregon. The wilderness is characterized by rugged basaltic ridges and outcroppings separated by deep canyons with steep side slopes. Elevations range from 2k feet on the Wild and Scenic Wenaha River to 6,401 feet at Oregon Butte.
    6Aug1978Pope St Paul6 papacy ends and Pope Ven. John Paul1 (IOANNES PAVLVS Primus) (Albino Luciani) (Italian) papacy begins 20 days later.Wiki: List of PopesMotto: Humilitas (Humility) Abolished the coronation and opted for the papal inauguration. First pope to use 'the First' in papal name; first with two names for two immediate predecessors. Last pope to use the sedia gestatoria."

(This caused the bottom to fall out of the market, as numerous independent carriers popped up overnight to undercut the previous "Regulation Darlings".)
    28Sep1978Pope Ven. John Paul1 papacy ends and Pope St John Paul2 (IOANNES PAVLVS Secundus) (Karol Józef Wojtyła) (Polish) papacy begins 18 days later.Wiki: List of PopesMotto: Totus Tuus (Totally yours) Polish, first pope of Slavic origin. First non-Italian pope since Adrian6 (1522-1523). Travelled extensively, visiting 129 countries during his pontificate. Second longest papacy after Pius9. Founded World Youth Day (1984) and the Pontifical Academy of Social Sciences (1994). Canonized more saints than all his predecessors. (Saintmaker) Youngest individual to start his papacy since Pius9 (1846)."
    1978South Vietnamese Major David Tran fled from Vietnam with his family and 3k other refugees.(2021) Twitter - Trung Phan: SrirachaThey were on a boat named the Huey Fong [Gathering Prosperity] (Taiwan). After arriving in LA, he started making a variation of the sauce from the Sri Racha village, replacing Vietnamese chilis with the locally-common jalapeño. He named the sauce Sriracha and named his business Huy Fong Foods after the optimistic name of the boat they were on. He sold product in recycled baby jars from a Blue Chevy Van, making $2300 the first month. (2021 equivalent $9,559 or 37.6 GC). Tran used a rooster logo on all products, as he was born in 1945, which was the Year of the Rooster in the Chinese Zodiac.
    13Oct1978Nancy Spungen uninstalled while sharing a hotel room with Sid Vicious, at the Hotel Chelsea in NYC.(2022) YT: DTG - Sid ViciousHe gave the police 3 stories, one of which was a confession, and was arrested. Nancy had a troubled life, and some said she would have been too obnoxious and abrasive for the highly obnoxious and severely abrasive punk rock scene, without Sid.
    1978Porsche refines the 911 Turbo with a turbo intercooler and larger engine.(2020) YT: d4a - Turbo HistoryThis post-turbo air cooler increases the amount of air that can be compressed before preigntion, allowing much higher compression ratios. This 3.3L (201 in3) flat engine made 300 HP (402 kW), cementing turbochargers as an essential sportscar accessory.
    1978Mercedes releases the 300SD.(2020) YT: d4a - Turbo HistoryThis turbodiesel showed that turbochargers and diesels are an ideal combination, since diesels can't have preignition - preignition is how they ignite the fuel.
    1978US Gov't has deficit of $59 billion (2021 equivalent $250.29 billion or 3.94 million GD), increase by 2.5% of $73 billion (2021 equivalent $309.68 billion or 4.88 million GD) blamed on Carter budget, Recession.TheBalance - US Deficit, GDP, Events

So his friends were partying with him, as was their way. The police closed Nancy Spungen's uninstall case because their only suspect had uninstalled, despite others being in the room and other things not adding up. The Sex Pistols had been close to breaking up, partly due to Sid's laziness and heavy heroin use.

    1979US Gov't has deficit of $41 billion (2021 equivalent $156.20 billion or 2.46 million GD), increase by 1.5% of $55 billion (2021 equivalent $209.54 billion or 3.3 million GD) blamed on Recession.TheBalance - US Deficit, GDP, Events
    1980World in a major recession and the USA had massive inflation and unemployment.InflationData - The 1980sAt the beginning of the decade the American auto industry was suffering partially due to the poor economy. Japanese cars were produced on modern rapidly customizable assembly lines so quality defects could be rapidly corrected while American assembly lines were not so easily upgraded. This led to the popular perception that imports were of higher quality than American made vehicles. Unions began a "Buy American" campaign which helped a little but Chrysler and American Motors were near bankruptcy.
    Jan1980Inflation was 13.91% and Unemployment was 6.3% in the USA.InflationData - The 1980s
    1980Dolby releases Dolby C(2017) YT: TC - Dolby
    20Jan1980The Iranian hostage crisis ended after 444 days, precisely at the conclusion of Reagan’s inaugural addressInflationData - The 1980sReagan was a staunch believer in laissez faire [let it be] capitalism and a follower of Austrian economics. He emphasized reduced government intervention, lower taxes, and deregulation of the stock markets which lead to an economic revival in the mid-late 1980s.
    1980PanAm badly handles a merger, and it fails.(2018) YT: BSF - Pan AmThe CEO decides that they have to sell some assets after this loss, so sells their Manhattan office lease for $400 million (2021 equivalent $1.328 billion or 20.9k GD), along with The Intercontinental hotel chain.
    Mar1980The first article on the Satanic P&G rumor, "Rumor Giving Company a Devil of a Time," appeared in The Minneapolis Tribune.AtlasObscura - P&G Satanic PanicSatanic panic was hitting its peak.
    Mar1980The Volcker Shock raised the fed funds rate to its highest point in history to end double-digit inflation.TheBalance - Paul VolckerPaul Volcker fought greater than 10% annual inflation rates with contractionary monetary policy (restricting bank funds) and raised the fed funds rate to 20%. He briefly lowered it in June. When inflation grew again in December, Volcker raised the rate back to 20%, and kept it above 16% until May 1981. This reduced inflation back to manageable levels by causing the 1981 recession.

    1981Maserati release the Biturbo, with 2 turbochargers.(2020) YT: d4a - Turbo HistoryV-8 engines have two exhaust manifolds - one foreach V arm. Biturbo is a way of turbocharging these with a turbocharger on each exhaust manifold, instead of combining the exhaust for an individual turbocharger. On the intake side, these turbos drew air from a shared intake manifold and provided pressurized air to the same pressure manifold. It was popular despite using a carburetor.

    14Oct1982King David Jones (U of Newcastle upon Tyne, UK) tests some of Napoleon Bonaparte's wallpaper and finds a significant amount of arsenic.(2016) YT: PV - ArsenicThis wasn't enough to poison him, but could explain why there was some arsenic in his hair.
    10Feb1982Thomas Zimmerman (USA) patents the optical flex sensor.(2015) YT: TGH - Power Glove
    • This device used an LED and phototransistor, connected via a tube. He mounted these to fingers of a garden glove, so the amount of light picked up by the phototransistor represented the amount of bending of the finger. Accompanying software could read sign language and play music. This was inspired by daydreaming with a college friend at MIT about conducting virtual symphonies.
    • Zimmerman enrolled in an Assembly programming course, and became friends with other students, including Nancy Mayer, wife of Atari co-founder Steve Mayer - who was in NYC to open a resarch lab. He told Zimmerman that Atari had just opened a digital entertainment lab in California (and to keep Zimmerman away from his wife?)
    • While at Atari, Zimmerman showed off the glove, and Atari offered to buy for $10k (2021 equivalent $25.3k or 99.6 GC), but he took a friend's advice to turn down the offer.
    1982Argentina's miltary lays more than 20k land mines on the Falkland Islands, to deter the British from taking them.(2021) Imgur - WaddlePenguins are too light to set off the land mines, and so the islands have accidentally become a huge penguin preserve.
    1982UN Convention on the Law of the Sea enacted.(2021) YT - COA: Lobster WarThis establishes 3 zones: within 12 miles (19 km) of the Territorial Sea Basin (approximate start of continental shelf) is the Territorial Sea, and another 200 miles (322 km) beyond that is the Exclusive Economic Zone. Both are within a country's jurisdiction. Beyond 200 miles is the High Seas, with "no applicable mechanism for access and benefit sharing of marine genetic resources".
    1982Anaconda Copper Mine shut down(2019) YT: TS - Toxic PitPumps were pumping out 300 liters/sec (79.25 gallons/sec or 0.00004 CR) of water, but were shut down too. The iron pyrite of the mines mixes with rainwater to form rusty dilute sulfuric acid. It raised 6 to 7 feet (1.8 to 2.1 m) per year.
    1982Bank of Credit and Commerce International (BCCI) goes bankrupt.(2018) YT: IPOV - Britain's 2nd EmpireThe CIA used this bank to support overseas operations. This bank also comitted extensive fraud, money laundering, and terrorist financing. A report came out stating that the Bank of England (BoE) was aware and complicit for 15 months, but instead of trying to fix things, they helped the bank to collapse. Whistleblowers from BCCI kept calling the BoE but were ignored. "The present system of supervision has served the community well, if we closed down a bank every time we found an incidence of fraud you would have rather fewer banks than we do at the moment." - Robin Leigh Pemberton, BoE governor. (This means he knew fraud was occurring at some of the banks. Like running a gun store and saying that if you didn't serve uninstallers you'd have no customers.) City of London became an unregulated Knockturn Alley for bankers to engage in whatever dark financial wizardry they couldn't perform in the open of Diagon. Bankers wouldn't goto jail, just get scolded or maybe fined.
    1982GM discontinues the 267 (in3 or 4.3 L) engine.(2021) YT: AG - GM EnginesThe LG4 Camaro with a 305 (in3 or 5.0 L) had 145 HP (108 kW) at 4000 RPM but only 165 lb-ft (223.7 Nm) at 4200 RPM. Car makers had to resort to heavy styling, decals, graphics, and anything visual to sell cars, as fuel efficiency was monarch and horsepower was servile.
    1982Pacific Bell creates a 911 emergency phone service for San Diego.(2022) YT: BS - Ruth PriceSan Francisco had built theirs a year before, and based on this, Pacific Bell predicted only 30% to 40% of emergency calls would use the 911 service during its first year. (Guessing the remainder would go through traditional channels of normal phone numbers and word of mouth.)
    1982Rock A81005 recovered from Alan Hills, Antarctica.(2021) YT: SM - Rocks from MarsAnalysis showed the elemental and mineral ratios matched the lunar surface, so this was declared the first lunar meteorite the next year.

    Early 1980sTWA's owner sells them to Carl Icahn.(2019) YT: BSF - TWATWA wre showing off Boeing's new 767 with long-haul flights to exotic destinations, in competition with their rivals. This was arguably their cultural peak, as TWA-branded Boeing planes became the sets for numerous TV shows and movies, including the David Letterman 4th Anniversary Show.

Him and coworkers went on to found a company named VPL to develop and market this technology. The product they came up with was the Data Glove, costing $9000 (2021 equivalent $23,648 or 93.1 GC).

    11May1983Comet IRAS-Araki-Alcock closest approach to Earth.(2021) YT: LEMMiNO - Apocalypse9 km (5.6 mi) across, came within 4.6 million km (2.9 million mi or 15.3 light seconds) and wasn't detected until 2 weeks before this.
    1983Three more Space Shuttle orbiters enter service across the next 2 years.InflationData - The 1980s
    1983USA's FCC proposes to lift the Fin-Syn Rules.CSMonitor - Fin-SynThey argue that they are no longer justified since the film and television industry landscape has changed. But Ronald Reagan - champion of reduced government intervention, lower taxes, and deregulation - stops the attempt to eliminate Fin-Syn Rules.
    1983The 1976 Betamax Case arrives at the US Supreme Court.Mental Floss - Mr Rogers VCRUniversal Studios vs Sony Corporation of America, nicknamed the "Betamax Case," was argued for a year. (The actual exterior case of a Betamax tape was polyethylene terephthalate.) Nearly 50% of all homes in America had a (Panasonic VHS) VCR and sales of videocassettes were competing with theatrical box office. VHS replaced Betamax, mainly because its tapes had much longer recording times. Universal called on Jack Valenti (MPAA leader), who yelled about the "savagery and ravages" of the VCR. Sony called on mild-mannered Fred Rogers (minister and children's TV show host), who supported non-infringing uses, such as time-shifting his show to a better time for a kid to watch. US Supreme Court Justices were so touched that a TV star was concerned with more than just money that they sided with Sony. Two of the implications of this case:
    1. Time shifting is fair use
    2. Manufacturers can't be held liable for copyright infringement if substantial non-infringing uses exist.
    1983Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar wins the Nobel Prize for discovering the Chandrasekhar Limit.(2021) YT: PE - Chandrasekhar limitThe Chandrasekhar Limit of 1.4 solar masses was mathematically derived by balancing electron degeneracy pressure against gravity to create a stable body, reforming with quantum mechanics, and generalizing to 3 dimensions.
    1983Cultural events this year:(2019) YT: JHEB - The Fire[2]
    • Astronaut Sally Ride (USA) became the first US American woman in space, 20 years after cosmonaut Valentina Tereshkova (Russia) (and a year after Svetlana Savitskaya (Russia)).
    • Ozzy Osbourne (UK) and the band Judas Priest were two of the heavy metal bands sued for their fans' auto-uninstalls. (Was this parodied in Metalocalypse?)
    • More than 25 countries across Africa, Eastern Europe, and Latin America defaulted on their loans from USA's international banks. They had all borrowed beyond their ability to repay - this was initially seen as a way to pump money into developing countries which do not produce oil. The USA's debt level was nearly 40% of GDP, and inflation was rising, both caused by growing foreign debts and their defaults. Borrowers, lenders, the IMF, World Bank, and OPEC worked together to shoulder the burden created by these loan defaults. But still it led to a huge amount of currency flight from Latin America and into the USA and Europe.
    • A growing homeless population of Vietnam War veterans exposed the lack of quality health care (including mental health care) and other resources available to veterans in the United States. (Soldiers would return home from an exhausting and badly run military operation and into the unloving hands of Vietnam War protesters, who blame the soldiers for being part of the problem. Many uninstalled themselves after feeling they had lost the moral support of the general public.)
    • USA CDC (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention) identifies HIV as the virus which causes AIDS, a new lung disease spreading between homosexual and intravenous drug communities. (Reagan used sexist terms to minimize the virus and refused to acknowledge it until it had uninstalled thousands.)
    • Cocaine epidemic, as cocaine (both powdered HCL and freebased crack varieties) became widely available in USA cities, despite being illegal. (This intensified Reagan's racist War on Drugs with the institution of Mandatory Minimum sentences for drug crimes.)

    1985PanAm CEO, after buying some Airbus A300s to replace aging Boeing 727s, decides to sell off 25% of their routes - the entire Pacific fleet - to United for $750 million (2021 equivalent $1.927 billion or 30.35 million GD).(2018) YT: BSF - Pan AmPlanes were bought as a long-term investment in decreased operating costs. But PanAm had lost $762 million (2021 equivalent $1.958 million or 30.83 GD) since 1980, so this would close that to just $16 million (2021 equivalent $41.13 million or 647.72 GD). This left PanAm with transatlantic and transamerican routes, so they focused on European tourism.

    Dec1985Anthony and John Gentile (USA) have an idea to make Rambo action figures.(2015) YT: TGH - Power GloveThey ran a marketing & design firm, mostly for movie posters. Partnering with toy industry veteran Marty Abrams, numerous companies turned them down since it was an R-rated movie. But Coleco accepted and these were one of the hottest toys of the holiday season. The trio would form a company - AGE (Anderson Gentile Entertainment), with a focus on 3D & VR, and soon found Zimmerman and his Data Glove, and eventually pivoted to networking it with an NES through an Apple Mac computer.

    1985US Gov't has deficit of $212 billion (2021 equivalent $544.95 billion or 8.58 million GD), increase by 4.8% of $256 billion (2021 equivalent $658.06 billion or 10.36 million GD) blamed on Increased defense spending.TheBalance - US Deficit, GDP, Events
    24Jan1986Voyager2 flew past Uranus.King5 - Bubble from UranusThe planet’s hazy bluish color is due to the methane in its atmosphere, which absorbs red wavelengths of light. Voyager2 may have flown through a plasmoid for about 60 seconds. This was the closest to the planet that any Earth probe has reached. Space physicists Gina DiBraccio and Dan Gershman with NASA’s Goddard Space Flight Center believe the plasmoid could account for between 15% and 55% of atmospheric mass loss at Uranus. "With enough time, escaping plasmoids can drain the ions from a planet’s atmosphere, fundamentally changing its composition." DiBraccio and Gershman believe Uranus' plasmoid is a cylindrical shape at least 127k miles (204k km) long and up to 250k (402k km) miles across and is likely charged with mostly ionized hydrogen particles.

He worked with more than 100 clients, and had full access to their files. He found: arms trading, avoiding disclosure, bribery, conflicts of interest, contract kickbacks, fraudulent invoicing, insider trading, market rigging, mispricing, political donations, and tax evasion.
    1986Porsche releases the 959, with the first sequential turbochargers.(2020) YT: d4a - Turbo HistoryOne would spool at high RPMs, like a normal turbo. The other spooled at low RPMs, to make up for the low-end lag. Later on, the variable geometry and twin scroll turbocharger designs would also attempt to make up for the low-end lag.
    1986Dr Robert Ballard and the French Oceanographic Institute study the Titanic's wreckage in the north Atlantic.(2013) YT: FJT4 - Titanic SunkOne of the pieces they verified was the name engraved in 4 foot tall letters into the uppe bow plate. The name Titanic had been riveted on, but 2 of these had since rusted off, revealing the original letters M and P underneath.

Some use glucose oxidase, others use glucose dehydrogenase.

This caused TWA's balance sheets to go negative.

    late 1980sEnthusiasm for the expensive SR-71 program waned as the performance of space-based systems grew.CIA - OXCARTAlthough the A-12 was officially retired, the SR-71 continued to fly and remained a vital tool for intelligence gathering, providing information that was vital in formulating successful US foreign policy.
    Jan1988A Swedish sub was cut in half, and an AIP module added, then the sub reassembled.(2021) YT: HIS - AIP SubsThis was the first modern Air Independent Power (or Propulsion, AIP) submarine created. AIP stores energy as compressed air within a tank, and releases it over time to drive electric motors to power electric ship propulsion motors - or sometimes drive the ship propulsion directly at low speeds (under 10 knots). This allows the batteries in diesel submarines to be used less often, meaning the sub doesn't need to surface and run the diesel engines to charge its batteries as often. In the 1950s, AIP was used to increase speed, but in the 1980s it was used to increase stealth, as it extends the submerged duration from a couple days to a couple weeks. AIP *can* charge batteries, but the batteries have much more capacity - and since it's also a battery, it's more effiicient to just drive a generator. Countries using AIP:
    CountryClassGenerators
    ChinaStirling, others.
    FranceStirling
    Germany/ItalyType-212AHydrogen Fuel Cell (9x 34kW (304kW) / 2x 120kW (240kW))
    ItalyGerman Fuel Cell in large subs
    Various in Special Forces subs.
    IndiaFrenchRetrofit custom AIP to old French subs.
    JapanSwedish Stirling
    NorwayGerman Fuel Cell
    PakistanHistoric French Mesmer system
    New will use China's Stirling system.
    South KoreaGerman Fuel Cell
    SwedenA-26 Blekinge3x Stirling
    ThailandChineseChina's Stirling system.
    TürkiyeGerman Fuel Cell
    (Note that 2014 US sub power plants generate about 100x more power than these AIP systems.)

FAA charged airline with 19 security failures, willful misconduct, and families filed a civil suit for $300 million (2021 equivalent $701 million or 11 million GD). PanAm goes from business mode, to "seeking a merger" mode.

It's the only nuclear-steam powered cargo ship in the 21st century, and usually hauls Russian military cargo in the far north.

    1989Nintendo Power Glove redesigned to lower costs, in anticipation of a December release.(2015) YT: TGH - Power GloveAGE and VPL would get royalties. They worked with Mattel. The optic fibers were replaced with a conductive ink, common in flexible circuit boards. Expensive magnetic tracking was replaced with much more common ultrasonic tracking, including VPL's own Z-glove. After 5 months of crunch time, the glove was down from $9000 (2021 equivalent $23,648 or 93 GC) to $23 (2021 equivalent $60 or 0.24 GC) each. Called the Power Glove, it would retail for $80 (2021 equivalent $176 or 0.69 GC (nice!)). Then came difficult negotiations with Nintendo, who finally licensed the product if it came with extra set up instructions. Finally, Mattel had workers start testing all Nintendo games to work with it, and start making custom games that required this controller.
    1989Ronald Reagan presidential term ended and George HW Bush (Sr) presidential term started.(2020) YT: FOL - President
    1989PanAm starts letting their expensive employees retire early, to hire much cheaper, less experienced workers.(2018) YT: BSF - Pan AmEarly retirees were counting on a "lifetime" (aka until 2030) of free flight, medical, pension and other retirement benefits.
    1989Canada and the United States agreed to a "Free Trade Agreement" further facilitating trade between the two North American countries by eliminating tariffs.InflationData - The 1980sInflation had decreased drastically to 4.65% and unemployment had declined to 5.4%. Over the next decade, the New York Stock Exchange would nearly quadruple from just over 500 to almost 2000. At the same time the Consumer Price Index increased 62% from 77.8 to 126.1 so the stock market outpaced inflation by about three-fold.

    3Jun1989Weeks of mass protests in Tiananmen Square in Beijing, China culminate with the CCP losing control by declaring martial law.(2019) YT: JHEB - The Fire[2]Thousands of people filled the square, concerned with the country's future and the vast inequalities in the new free market economy. The military uninstalled hundreds and injured thousands of their own citizens while trying to make the protesters' stop voicing their concerns. The incident shocked the CCP so badly that they find their actions to be unredeemable, and thus desperatey seek to coverup their shame well into the 21st century. The CCP's leadership is unwilling to embrace the Western philosophy of Redemption - through its process of "apologize and move on" and corollary "forgive and forget". Many of China's discussion websites go offline so reliably that June 3rd has become known as "Internet Maintenance Day".

    1989USSR trades a fleet to Pepsico.(2021) YT: DS - Pepsi Navy17 submarines, 1 cruiser, 1 frigate, and 1 destroyer, immediately making Pepsico the 6th largest navy. The Pentagon didn't like Pepsico having more naval force than most nations, but Pepsico's Don Kendall reminded Pentagon officials that they had just dismantled a significant part of the USSR's navy, which was more than The Pentagon had done. But the ships were in sorry shape, with only 1 being seaworthy, and these would soon be sold as scrap for at least $150k each. (2021 equivalent $328k or 5.2 GD.)
    1989Mazda RX-7 2nd Gen adds a twin-scroll turbocharger.(2020) YT: d4a - Turbo HistoryThe turbocharger improved performance and reduced lag on the rotary engine.
    1989Henrik Fisker designs the BMW z8 Roadster.(2020) YT: BSF - Fisker AutoThis design was an instant classic, with sleek yet modern lines that reminded of a 1990s European update to GM's C1 Corvette from the 1950s.
    1989Hairdresser Phil McCrory (AL, USA) has the idea for using hair to absorb oil from water while watching the Exxon Valdez oil spill in Alaska.(2022) YT: BI - Hair MatsHe was watching the news at work, and saw news footage of an oily otter surrounded by an area of water that was less oily than most of the water. Then he looked down at the head of oily hair that he was shampooing, and it occurred to him that hair naturally collects oils, and the reason we shampoo hair is to remove those oils. He realized that all of the hair he had been sending to landfills could have been absorbing oil out of the ocean. (Pollution is dumping useful raw materials into the environment - in this case, both the oil and the hair.) Early designs were hair-filled nylon stocking "booms".

    Oct1990Rare completes Super Gloveball - and the Power Glove is discontinued.(2015) YT: TGH - Power GloveThe only game made specifically for the Nintendo Power Glove is released. Mattel hired a programmer who hated the Power Glove, Novak, to come up with game concepts, and all he could think of was digital handball. Rare, a UK developer, was contracted to create the game. A year after a strong release, Power Glove sales had heavily declined. Controls were too imprecise and inconsistent to play games that weren't made for it. While non-gaming press thought this was a vision of the future, gaming press just yawned in boredom at the lack of games for it. While a failed product, it wasn't a money loser - earning Mattel a total of $88 million (2021 equivalent $193 million or 3039 GD) across its one year of sales.
    1990TWA is desperate for cash so Carl Icahn sells their London-USA routes to American Airlines for $445 million (2021 equivalent $933 million or 14.7k GD).(2019) YT: BSF - TWAThis is like selling your Boardwalk to someone else in Monopoly - keeps them in the game but they're missing out on all those sweet, sweet transatlantic profits. So they work on their domestic flights instead of international ventures.
    1990USSR signs a $300 million deal with Pepsico to buy soda.(2021) YT: DS - Pepsi NavyThis was the largest deal ever brokered between the USSR and a private company. In exchange for the rights to open Pizza Hut restaurants in the USSR, Pepsico agreed to keep selling Pepsi in the USSR for 10 more years. Pepsi would upgrade its bottling plants in the USSR, while the USSR would build oil tankers for Pepsi to lease to Norwegian companies.

    1990sMainland China opens.(2021) YT: XJZ - USA Chinese FoodAmerican perception of Chinese food was established, and new Chinese restaurants had to match the existing flavors. Regional associations would set up new immigrants as restaurant owners, teach cooking and food prep, given a starter pack for an instantly-recognizable Chinese restaurant, and sent to a predetermined parcel of the USA to maximize coverage.

    1990sMuscle Cars start to become Classic Cars in the USA.(Reference Missing)Car longevity increases, and some vehicles had the benefit of being lost under a sheet in the back yard for decades. Some states allow the removal of emissions control devices on cars older than 25 years, allowing 1960s muscle cars to be unhobbled. Classic Car shows became popular and form a few micropowers, with shows admitting automotive enthusiasts, historians, and anyone looking to reminisce.

    1991USSR disassembles into 15 individual nations.(2021) YT: DS - Pepsi NavySuddenly Pepsico was dealing with those individual nations, instead of one federated empire. They had to scramble to get business licenses, cargo permits, and other paperwork completed in order to keep doing the same business as before. Also, instead of the complicated deal wth the oil fleet, companies in Belarus and Ukraine wanted payment in US Dollars. So they had to scrap the oil fleet to recover some of the losses. Also they had to compete with Coca-Cola, and soon became the #2 cola provider in former USSR nations.
    1991Collapse of USSR.(2021) YT: DB - Aeroflot Flight 593Airline carrier Aeroflot (Russia)'s monopoly ends and is forced to compete in a market, as hundreds smaller carriers pop up literally overnight. Additionally, the restricted airspace over Russia opened up, allowing European flights to reach Asia directly instead of a long route around, meaning more competition.

    1993US Gov't has deficit of $255 billion (2021 equivalent $488.10 billion or 7.69 million GD), increase by 3.7% of $347 billion (2021 equivalent $ or 10.46 million GD) blamed on Clinton signing the Budget Act.TheBalance - US Deficit, GDP, Events
    1994Russia was one of the few airspaces to use meters instead of feet.(2021) YT: DB - Aeroflot Flight 593

    Pilots had to do some math when they changed airspace. Not unlike doing mph to km/h conversions when crossing the US-Canada border. Distracted flying is a bad idea, hence numerous pilots. If they were lucky, they remembered to pack a pocket calculator.

    1994Darmstadtium created.(Reference Missing)
    22Mar1994Aeroflot Flight 593 departs Moscow's Sheremetyevo (Cher-e-met'ye-va) airport for Hong Kong at 4:39 PM local time.(2021) YT: DB - Aeroflot Flight 593

    The flight rose to a cruising altittude of 10,100 meters (33,136 ft or 6.26 mi). Off-duty Aeroflot pilot Vladimir Makarov had been entertaining the children of Captain Yarosloav Kudrinsky.

    • 12:40 am - Moscow time, now the morning of the 23rd and almost 8 hours into the flight, Makarov surprised Kudrinsky by bringing the kids into the cockpit.
    • 12:43 am - Kudrinsky had let his 13yo daughter Yana sit in his seat, in full control of the airplane. He even let her manipulate the control wheel, which is a major breach in international avation regulations. He then played with the autopilot, switching from the pre-programmed route to a heading mode, so it would mirror her motions on the control wheel. Makarov photographed her time at the wheel. First officer Igor Vasilyevich Piskaryov left the other seat and moved to the back of the cabin.
    • 12:46 am - Next was 15yo Eldar Kudrinsky's turn, and again Kudrinsky mirrored his actions with the autopilot, before switching back to the pre-programmed route mode.
    • 12:47 am - Eldar continued to push on the now-stiff controls, and pushed hard enough to switch the Airbus 310's autopilot from "command" mode to "control wheel steering" mode. This put Eldar in full control of the ailerons, and thus the banking roll of the airplane. Meanwhile, the autopilot managed the speed, pitch, and yaw, keeping the plane airborne. Kudrinsky and Makarov were expecting a loud autopilot-disable sound common in USSR-built planes, which was absent from this French model, so they were unaware that Eldar had some input into the plane's flight.
    • 12:50 am - The plane started banking under Eldar's unwitting pressure to the right. Eldar told the flight crew, who watched the navigation display from behind the seats, and discussed in confusion how the autopilot was banking into holding pattern. Quickly, the banking turn became steep enough to pull passengers deep into their seats, and everyone in the cockpit were pulled by gravity against the cockpit's right wall - except Eldar in the captain's seat.
    • 12:54 am - The autopilot had been pulling hard down on both elevators and hard left, to keep the plane aloft - but the banking soon became steep enough to fully disable the autopilot - and now it starts beeping like they were expecting. Kudrinsky and Makarov both issue orders to young Eldar, the only person who could reach the controls.
    • 12:56 - Piskaryov had climbed back into the other seat and got the plane to climb - but he overcorrects due to disorientation, and the plane climbs too sharply as Eldar and his dad Kudrinsky swap the main seat- and the two original plane commanders deal with the now-stalled engines and spinning plane.
    • 12:58 - Unfortunately they did not quite have enough time-as-altitude to regain speed, and had only started to pull up when the plane hit a densely-wooded hillside about 85 km (52.8 mi) southeast of Novokuznetsk (Novo-kuz-nyesk), uninstalling all 75 onboard.

    Investigators were stunned by the children being on the flight deck, and recommendations were made to Aeroflot and the Russian Civil Aviation industry to improve safety.

    1994Project Stargate created by USAF.(2017) YT: OH - StargateStargate legend. USAF Special Operations soldiers are sent to a planet in the legendary Caelian galaxy, supposedly on the "other side" of the known universe (maybe rim of the visible universe?) from Earth. (Why didn't they send Army infantry or Marines?) These soldiers find a human micropower living in and around a pyramid in the desert of this unfamiliar planet, mining an extremely rare superheavy element (N=120+?) that this planet has in abundance. Ra (Goa'uld) returns to the planet, and as the USAF soldiers return to Earth, they detonate a massive bomb to uninstall Ra - which ignited the superheavy element being mined there, causing the entire planet to explode.
    1994Project Star Gate created by USAF.(Reference Missing)This was a program to investigate the scientific, historical, military, political, or other utility of Remote Viewing and telekinesis. Apparently the program was successful enough to require further compartmentalization and higher classification.

    Late 1990sUS Navy decommissions their nuclear-steam powered cruisers.Defense Media - Nucear PowerSince all world powers have nuclear-steam powered naval vessels, there's no longer an advantage to going 30 knots fast - and going that fast means you're overdriving your sonars, for which you can only go 20-25 knots, which diesel can easily do for cheaper than nuclear-steam, because of lower gasoline (hydrocarbon fuel) prices.
    Late 1990sThe Internet gains cultural significance.(Reference Missing)While previously a micropower phenomenon, America Online (AOL) led Internet Service Provider (ISP) companies in a marketing push. This international Internetwork of peering Autonomous Systems would become the primary means of communication and content delivery for most humans by the early 21st century.

    28Mar1996John Leonard (USA) mailed 15 Pepsi Points, along with a check for $700,008.50 (2021 equivalent $1.24 million or 19.5 GD) (including shipping), to Pepsi and politely asked for his jet.TheHustle - Pepsi sued for fighter jet Pepsi had just started a new promotion, where billions of Pepsi products around the USA were marked with "Pepsi Points". Customers could save up the points and redeem them for the 53 items listed in a Pepsi Stuff catalog:
    ItemPepsi PointsRate2021 equivlaent
    10 cents*+1$0.10 per liter$0.18
    2-liter bottle+21 point per liter(price $1.48)
    12x 12oz (355 ml) can (4.26 L)+51.17 points per liter(price $5.28)
    T-shirt75$7.50$13.50
    Blue-tinted sunglasses175$17.50$31.50
    Leather jacket1,450$145$261 or 1.03 GC
    Harrier fighter jet (TV ad only)7 million$700k$1.3 million or 20.5 GD

    *A minimum of 15 points of each redemption had to be cut from soda packages and could not be paid in money.

    Pepsi declined, saying that this was obviously a joke, and Leonard sued. The jet cost about $33 million (2021 equivalent $58.4 million or 919.7 GD) to manufacture and wasn’t available to the general public in militarized form. "Even if the lad were able to get the plane from Pepsi, it would not be one he could fly," said a Pentagon official at a briefing.

    One Pepsi executive called Pepsi Points "by far the most successful promotion" the company had ever run. The New York Times said it was the "largest promotional campaign in the company’s history", costing Pepsi about $200 million (2021 equivalent $354 million or 5.6k GD) to roll out, of which 62.5% or $125 million (2021 equivalent $221 million or 3.5k GD) was merchandise. (This implies they sold an additional $1.25 billion (2021 equivalent $2.2 billion or 34.6k GD), for about $625 million (2021 equivalent $1.1 billion or 17.3k GD) in ebitda, assuming $0.50 (2021 equivalent $.89) from each liter. Had this been a submarine 5 years before, Pepsi could have given one of their USSR subs.)

    1997GM discontinues the 350 (in3 or 5.7 L) G2 engine then introduced the 346 (in3 or 5.7 L) G3LS engine in the C5 Corvette.(2021) YT: AG - GM EnginesLS had 5 major upgrades to Small Block:
    1. Completely redesigned with no parts in common with the Small Block.
    2. Aluminum block on all car and some truck engines.
    3. Cylinder head design increases power.
    4. New technologies like variable valve timing, active fuel management, coil on plug.
    5. Aluminum blocks can contain 700 HP (522 kW) and iron blocks can contain 1k HP (746 kW).

    5Aug1999Judge Wood ruled resoundingly in Pepsi’s favor, denying John Leonard his Harrier jet.TheHustle - Pepsi sued for fighter jetThe decision came down to 3 key points:
    • Advertisements are generally not considered offers in contract law: "Ads for the sale of goods (TV, radio, newspaper, newsletter)… are merely the requests to offer or negotiate" and an advertiser must accept an offer from a customer for it to be legally formed.
    • The ad was obviously a joke: An "ordinary, reasonable person" would conclude that a soft drink company would not give away a fighter plane as part of a promotion.
    • An enforceable contract requires both parties’ signatures: Under existing law, any contract for the sale of goods worth $500+ must be evidenced by writing; Pepsi did not sign anything.

In accordance with Swiss law, this amount was transferred to the Swiss Fund for Emergency Losses in the case of non-insurable natural disasters.

    2000Matter of Trust begins collecting human and animal hair to turn into oil-absorbing mats.(2022) YT: BI - Hair MatsThese mats are one of the only ways to pull oil out of water. The animals include sheep, buffalo, and llama. The hair strands are laid on a bed of dull nails until there is a mat, and a modified sewing machine tightens them into the consistency of a doormat.
