    2000sElectric arc furnaces are a common method of reprocessing scrap metal to create new steel.Wiki: SteelThey can also be used for converting pig iron to steel, but they use a lot of electrical energy (about 440 kWh per metric ton), and are thus generally only economical when there is a plentiful supply of cheap electricity.

    2002Osedax discovered.(2018) YT: FIM - Zombie WormThese worms use acidic roots to burrow into whale and other large vertibrate bones, and colonize bacteria that process fats and proteins in the bones for them. When eggs land on bone, they become female, and if the egg lands on a female, it becomes a dwarf male. They can release millions of eggs per day into the ocean.
    Nov2002Jim McKenna and John Lieberman (USA) have collected over 80k promotional AOL discs.(2002) BBC: AOL discsOne person sent them 15k discs (18.75%). Environmentalists had concerns about the raw quantity of plastic going from CD press to mailbox to trashcan. America Online (AOL)'s hourly-billed service had grown to 35 million subscribers, primarily by bulk-mailing one CD per month to everyone they could. (The CD had its software and an offer for free minutes for the first month, which quickly grew from a reasonable ~60 to more than the 720 hours in a month. Every CD you'd see with 100+ more hours free. By the end they were offering more than 3000 hours, or 4.1 months of time free in the first month.)
    2002The FBI reported that its own DNA testing found that examiners reported false hair matches more than 11 percent of the time.WaPo: FBI hair analysis flawUniversity of Virginia law professor Brandon L. Garrett said the results reveal a "mass disaster" inside the criminal justice system, one that it has been unable to self-correct because courts rely on outdated precedents admitting scientifically invalid testimony at trial and, under the legal doctrine of finality, make it difficult for convicts to challenge old evidence. "The tools don’t exist to handle systematic errors in our criminal justice system," Garrett said. "The FBI deserves every recognition for doing something really remarkable here. The problem is there may be few judges, prosecutors or defense lawyers who are able or willing to do anything about it."

    2003Head, Mustard, Kreslavsky, Milliken, and Marchant proposed Mars was in an interglacial period for the past 400 ky, and in a glacial period between 400-2100 ky, due to Mars obliquity exceeding 30.Wiki: Milankovitch cyclesAt this extreme obliquity, insolation is dominated by the regular periodicity of Mars obliquity variation. Fourier analysis of Mars orbital elements, show an obliquity period of 128k year, and a precession index period of 73k year.

Authorized the creation of Anglican ordinariates (2009). First pope to renounce the papacy on his own initiative since Celestine5 (1294), becoming pope emeritus. Longest-living pope on record.

    Aug2005FEMA finally finds $15k for the travel budget for Hurricane Pan simulation's follow-up workshop.(2022) YT: ITS - Hurricane KatrinaThis was meant as a planning and preparation workshop, as the Hurricane Pam simulation showed gaps in the current plans, but Bush had cut FEMA's budget and partially dismantled the organization during his term.
    2005Six Flags, who had since bought Astro World and renamed to Six Flags Houston, decided to shut down the park.(2019) YT: BSF - Astrodome
    29Aug2005Category 3 Hurricane Katrina makes landfall in Louisiana with 130 mph (209 km/h) winds.(2022) YT: ITS - Hurricane Katrina

    Identified 6 days earlier, and recognized as a hurricane 4 days earlier, US Federal agencies were initially prepared. FEMA sent food, water, and ice to Florida and Louisiana. Then a systemic failure of a Federalist system occurred. In this "pull" system, assistance has to be requested from the most-local government, through the chain of intermediate governments, and finally to the federal government. But local leaders often misestimate the local needs, bureaucracy slows the chain of intermediate governments, making federal assistance always late. This level of emergency needed a Relief Push system, where the federal government allocates resources

    Mayor Ray Nagin (NO, USA) mandated evacuation just 24 hours (1 day) before landfall, and knowing 100k residents didn't own cars, turned down a fleet of schoolbuses for the evacuation, saying the evacuees should have more comfortable Greyhound buses instead. Some Greyhound buses were sent, but FEMA turned them away. Ray Nagin went on the Oprah Winfrey show, and claimed that "hooligans" were pillaging and involuntarily mating with the refugees - this actually hampered relief efforts as they focused on security over assistance.

    Governor Kathleen Blanco (LA, USA) requested military aid from other states at landfall, since 40% of her State's troops were in Iraq, and this took another 24 hours (1 day) to approve. She threatened to send troops who had recently returned from Iraq to protect stores against looters, using their recent service to dehumanize them into legendary beings whose only desires involve uninstalling (other) humans.

    The Superdome became a Shelter of Last Resort, taking in 9k refugees in the first day and a total of 20k-30k - but the facility had no food and little water. Amtrack were evacuating their passenger cars and offered NO (New Orleans) to let several hundred residents ride free, but NO refused and the train left empty.

    NO Police Superintendent attempted to suspend the 2nd Amendment, saying "No one will be armed. Guns will be taken. Only law enforcement will be allowed to have guns." and had his forces try to enforce this against law-abiding people who were afraid of looters. In one case, police officers entered a resident's house unannounced and tackled the resident as she was being interviewed by a news reporter. The officers confiscated her handgun and paid her a fractured shoulder in exchange.

    There was no DHS preparation or management - Having been established in response to terror attacks, their priority was in preventing future attacks, and hurricanes weren't recruting fighters into training camps. DHS law enforcement officers took a week to arrive and got in a turf war with DOJ law enforcement. Likewise, FEMA issued notices reminding external emergency services agencies not to respond to calls inside the area, unless local agencies requested them to do so. FEMA refused to work with aid agencies. They were removing hospital ID bracelets from patients as they were discharged (and replacing with FEMA bracelets) so hospitals lost track of numerous patients. They turned away trucks of water and prevented the US Coast Guard from delivering fuel. They didn't respond to Greyhound buses or civilian aircraft attempting to evacuate, nor a German plane of supplies. They evacuated 200 people from their homes and left them stranded on an overpass. FEMA blame poor communication, as they were impacted by cell outages and poor radios, and took 6 days to distribute satellite phones to employees.

    1823 humans uninstalled (0.22 Covid-days) - many lived in a multi-level structure, and had moved to the uppermost floor - when floodwaters rose above the windows, they would hammer on their ceilings and roofs, trying to break through and escape the flood waters. Survivors could often hear banging on the roofs of nearby houses...which would eerily stop when floodwaters rose. And survivors further suffered the psychological horror of having to push human corpses away from their boats.

    Nation of Islam leader Louis Farrakhan (USA) suggested the breaking of levees in poorer parts in NO was a repeat of the 1927 Mississippi Flood tactic of flooding poorer areas to save richer ones - and was investigated by the US House, but found to be false. The flooding wasn't so much from the incredible rain as "storm surges" - a combo of low pressure and high winds, generating 27.9 ft (8.5 m) waves against the 17 ft (5.1 m) levees from the 1968 Flood Control Act. And some of the levees hadn't been constructed yet, as the project was still 10 years away from its 2015 completion.

    For the survivors to live in, while houses were torn down and rebuilt, FEMA bought 95k mobile homes for $1.3 billion ($13,684 each, 2021 equivalent $19,535 or 76.9 GC). But only 17% (16,150) were used, for an effective cost of $80,495 each (2021 equivalent $114,911 or 1.8 GD).

CNN reporter Soledad O'Brien asked how Chertoff's federal agency has worse intel than a news network, and asked why a massive supply airdrop hadn't been performed in this World Power, as had recently been performed after the Indonesia Tsunami.

    2007Doster et al. receive a US Patent for an update to the 1590 John Wolfe design.(2019) YT: SW - Paddle MoustrapThis patent updates the previous by replacing the complex paddle section with a hybrid rolling-log with paddle-arms.
    • The wire is replaced with a plastic pipe, cut with grooves to fit into the bucket sides.
    • The rolling-log is made from a larger tube, with stays in the smaller tube to keep it from moving along its rotation axis.
    • 4 oar-like paddles are added around the log's center axis.
    • The log will still spin freely and have bait on the paddle spoons.
    • Targets can balance on the rolling log, due to its high rolling resistance.
    • The bait's role is to get targets to self-imbalance, causing the log to rotate until they can't grip or balance.

It produced more than 400 HP (536 kW) and started just over $100k. (2021 equivalent $138k or 2.17 GD)

    The initial $5 million was supplemented by a $528 million loan (2021 equivalent $690 million or 10.9k GD) from the US Dept of Energy on the condition that they deliver 30k hybrids.

    2010British Petroleum (BP)'s Deepwater Horizon oil drilling platform dumps 4 million barrels (168 million US gallons or 636 million liters) of oil into the Gulf of Mexico across 3 months.(2022) YT: BI - Hair MatsThis was shearing season in the USA, especially for buffalo, so Matter of Trust processed these into hair mats at 19 warehouses from Texas to the Florida Keys. These were only used by individuals along the shore, because newer polypropylene booms had been invented which don't become saturated with water, unlike hair mats which have to be recovered off the sea or ocean floor. BP also burned a small amount of surface water, and used dispersants to push the oil towards the Gulf floor.
    2010US Gov't has deficit of $1.294 trillion (2021 equivalent $1.641 trillion or 25.84 million GD), increase by 8.6% of $1.905 trillion (2021 equivalent $2.416 trillion or 38.05 million GD) blamed on Obama tax cuts, ACA, Simpson-Bowles.TheBalance - US Deficit, GDP, Events
    11Mar2011Tōhoku earthquake and Fukushima nuclear disaster.Wiki: Tōhoku earthquake

    The most powerful earthquake ever recorded in Japan, and the fourth most powerful earthquake in the world since modern record-keeping began in 1900, this magnitude 9.1 undersea megathrust earthquake lasted 6 minutes (360,000 milliseconds) and caused tsunami waves up to 40.5 m (133 ft).

    The earthquake automatically put the active reactors in shut down mode, using power grid energy to insert the cooling rods. The shut down cut the reactor power output to the grid - but the earthquake caused heavy damage to Japan's power grid. These reactors were located along the shore, so the tsunami flooded the backup generators in the basements, and the cooling rods weren't fully inserted.

    Nuclear-steam systems use zirconium-pressed uranium fuel pellets, and the superheated water inside the partially shut down reactor was in contact with these pellets. The high temperature of steam allows the normally inert surface zirconium molecules to alloy with the oxygen in the water, in the reaction Zr + 2 H2O → ZrO2 + 2 H2, building up hydrogen until the pressure rips through hardened steel. This was the most severe nuclear-steam disaster since Chernobyl, and heavily impacted public perception of nuclear technologies, especially fail-dangerous ones.

    Jun2011Greek-sovereign debt crisisCurrencies Fandom - Swiss FrancCHF 1 = $1.20 ($1 = CHF 0.833) as investors looked for safety with the crisis. Historically, the Swiss franc has been considered a safe-haven currency (hard currency), with an extremely low inflation rate and a legal requirement that a minimum of 40% be backed by gold reserves.

    2011Yale students discovered a fungus in Ecuador - Pestalotiopsis microspora - that has the ability to digest and break down polyurethane (PU), even in an anaerobic environment.Leaps: Plastic-Eating MushroomsThe professor who led the research trip cautioned for moderate expectations.
    2011Protests in UK over British Telecom (BT) getting a £1 billion (2021 equivalent $1.72 billion or 27k GD) tax refund.(2018) YT: IPOV - Britain's 2nd Empire

    This was a result of HMRC (Her/His Magesty's Revenue & Customs) head Dave Hartnett's new tax collection strategy of negotiating deals behind closed doors, and his habit of leading negotiations with the biggest clients. He claimed in an interview this was a cost-saving measure, as courts were very expensive, but public outcry disagreed. UK's Treasury Select Committee questioned Hartnett, who declined to commend based on legal advice about violating taxpayer confidentiality - received from the head of HMRC, himself.

    HMRC's offices in London are owned by Mapley Steps, a Bermuda shell company. This company borrowed from offshore investors at 15% - high enough to be a "tax shield" against any taxes they might pay.

    Separately, HMRC couldn't prove that any PFI company paid any tax at all. PFI (Private Finance Initiative) is a way of funding infrastructure (roads and public buildings) through loans instead of taxes - and just like buying a house, loan repayment costs over 30 years are about 3x the original asset price.

    2011USA's Space Shuttle program shut down.(2021) YT: UVA CFP - Bill NelsonFor the next 9 years, USA's astronauts would ride Russian Soyuz rockets to and from the ISS. This reflects the interrnational nature of space exploration, regardless of international tensions.
    2011Pentagon UFO office closes.(2022) YT: UFOJ - Flying Saucers
    Dec2011A123 Systems recalls their batteries.(2020) YT: BSF - Fisker AutoFisker Automotive begin building the Karma this year, and now had to recall all of them to replace the batteries. A123 would have another recall within a year and go bankrupt, leaving Fisker without a major component supplier. The Karma had some oddities, such as the 4-cylinder exhaust just under the driver's window (seems nifty on paper but draws exhust into the cabin) and the battery took too much cabin room, leaving almost no back seat nor trunk, like a classic 1980s European car. It had become obvious that Fisker couldn't deliver 30k hybrids, so the US Dept of Energy canceled the remaining $389 million (2021 equivalent $468 million or 7370 GD) of Fisker Automotive's loan.
    2011Tesla Model S released.(2020) YT: BSF - Fisker AutoThe base model was $57k (2021 equivalent $68.6k or 1.08 GD) and was overall a better experience than the Fisker Karma, which cost nearly double.
    2011US Gov't has deficit of $1.300 trillion (2021 equivalent $1.598 trillion or 25.17 million GD), increase by 8.3% of $1.229 trillion (2021 equivalent $1.511 trillion or 23.8 million GD) blamed on Debt crisis, recession and tax cuts reduced revenue.TheBalance - US Deficit, GDP, Events
    2012GE pivots into oil.(2020) YT: TMIO - Fall of GECEO Jeffrey Immelt was emotinally hurt by the 2007 financial crisis and was desperate for a high-growth industry. Oil profits make 9% of revenue and 8% of profit.
    2012Houston spends $500k (2021 equivalent $602k or 9.49 GD) researching and planning for the Astrodome's future.(2019) YT: BSF - AstrodomeHouston finds great public support for renovations, but they would cost between $120-$300 million (2021 equivalent $144.5-$361 million or 2.28-5.69 million GD). Maintenance on the existing structures currently cost about $2 million (2021 equivalent $2.41 million or 37.95 GD) a year. Removal costs were over $25 million (2021 equivalent $30 million or 472 GD), especially due to the proximity of Reliant stadium.
    2012Houston demolishes some Astrodome smaller structures, like ramp towers and ticket booths.(2019) YT: BSF - AstrodomeTaxpayers had voted down a $300 million (2021 equivalent $361 million or 5.69 million GD) renovation project a month earlier.
    Jun2012The Vatican Bank replaced Tedeschi with Ernst von Freyberg, initially to serve as an interim leader.World Finance: Vatican Bank

    Tedeschi was eventually forced to step down when a no-confidence vote among the board of directors was held, due to him failing "to fulfil the primary functions of his office." After his departure, Tedeschi claimed that it was his push for greater transparency at the bank that led to his ousting, and specifically his looking into the accounts that were ‘non-religious’. Tedeschi had been in the role just three years, but it was a period beset with scandal.

    Von Freyberg, on the other hand, joined the IOR as a representative of an untainted new leadership that would help to transform its reputation. He quickly set about opening up the Vatican Bank and making it more transparent, as well as adopting a zero tolerance approach to suspicious activities.

    2012Planet J1407b discovered.(2015) YT: LEMMiNO - Space Top10 [p6]
    • Has rings that are 0.6 AU (90 million km, 55.9 million miles, 5.0 light minutes) across.
    • If it were the Sun, the rings would reach past Venus.
    • Replacing Saturn, the rings would be bigger than the moon in the night sky.

This hurt the company badly - each would have sold for at least $100k, (2021 equivalent $118k or 1.86 GD) for a loss of $30 million (2021 equivalent $35 million or 551 GD) in assets.

    Jan2013GE stock at $21 (2021 equivalent $24.93 or 0.0981 GC).(2020) YT: TMIO - Fall of GE
    25Feb2013RO(S)Korea President Lee Myung-bak reign ends and Park Geun-hye reign begins.Wiki: Korea
    28Feb2013Pope Benedict16 papacy ends and Pope Francis1 (FRANCISCVS) (Jorge Mario Bergoglio, S.J) (Argentine) papacy begins 13 days later.Wiki: List of PopesMotto: Miserando atque Eligendo [By pitying and choosing]. Argentine. First pope to be installed outside Europe since Gregory3 (731-741) and the first from the Americas; first pope from the Southern Hemisphere. First pope from a religious institute since Gregory16 (1831-1846); first Jesuit pope. First to use a new and non-composed regnal name since Lando (913-914). First pope to visit and celebrate a mass on the Arabian Peninsula.
    Feb2013Pope Benedict16 resigns and Francis1 began his term as leader of Vatican City's religion.World Finance: Vatican Bank

    After Benedict16's shocking resignation, Vatican City set about a frantic search for a new leader after what had been a deeply troubling few years.

    Vatican Banks leaders were accused of transferring money out of the country into shady overseas banks, as well as being linked to an illegal masonic loge known as Propaganda Due (P2), which had ties to the mafia. Banco Ambrosiano was investigated and its Chairman, Roberto Calvi, was arrested, trialled, and sentenced to four years in prison. After being released on appeal, Calvi fled before being discovered vertically uninstalled under London’s Blackfriars Bridge shortly after. Vatican Bank marked a dark period in the history of Vatican City, leading to the scandal forming the basis for the plot of the third instalment of the Godfather trilogy.

    One of Francis1's goals was to reform the way the Vatican Bank is run, bringing about a series of reforms that would restore confidence and trust in the financial arm of the temple.

    Ernst von Freyberg was appointed President of the Board of Superintendents.

    2013Nelson Mandela uninstalls.(2015) YT: LEMMiNO - Mandela Effect(You Only (Uninstall) Twice?)
    Mar2013Niagara Tunnel Project officially placed into service, helping to increase the generating complex's nameplate capacity by 150 megawatts.Wiki: Niagara FallsIt did so by tapping water from farther up the Niagara River than was possible before, into a new 12.7-metre (42 ft) diameter, 10.2-kilometre-long (6.3 mi) water diversion tunnel. The tunnel provided new hydroelectricity for approximately 160k homes.
    Mar2013Henrik Fisker leaves Fisker Automotive over disagreements in business strategy.(2020) YT: BSF - Fisker AutoHe still owned the company name, so the company was eventually rebranded as Karma automotive, after their only viable car. Executives left just before massive layoffs were announced - 120 people were layed off, leaving just 40 employees. By November, Fisker filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection. They had burned through $1.3 billion (2021 equivalent $1.5 billion or 23.6k GD) setting up dealerships across the USA then closing them, and creating millions of dollars worth of concept cars. The Karma sold less than 1800 units in the USA. The assets were auctioned in bankruptcy court, and WanXiangGroup (China) won the auction.
    Apr2013GE buys Lufkin (oil field pump and equipment manufacturer) for $3.3 billion (2021 equivalent $3.92 billion or 63 million GD).(2020) YT: TMIO - Fall of GEGE makes a big show of their oil business, with a full-page display in their 2013 annual report. GE note they have made $11 billion (2021 equivalent $13 billion or 209 million GD) in oil aquisitions since 2007.
    2013GE sells remaining 49% of NBC to Comcast for $16.7 billion (2021 equivalent $19.83 billion or 312 million GD).(2020) YT: TMIO - Fall of GEGE EPS increases to $1.64/share, but total revenues are down. Oil is struggling to make up for NBC-Universal.
    Jul2013The Vatican Bank replaced von Freyberg with Franssu.World Finance: Vatican BankDespite von Freyberg’s best efforts, his time in charge came to an abrupt - and surprising - end in July, with the news that he was being replaced by Frenchman Jean-Baptiste Franssu as IOR president. The 51-year old de Franssu immediately claimed that "Catholic, ethical investment" would be the focus of the bank in the future.

    2014Niagara Falls had remarkably heavy icing up during winter.Wiki: Niagara Falls
    2014The government of Spain passed a law allowing dual citizenship to Jewish descendants, to compensate for shameful events in the country's past.Wiki: Expulsion Jews SpainSephardi Jews who are able to prove that they are the descendants of the Jews expelled from Spain during the Alhambra Decree can become Spaniards without leaving home or giving up their present nationality.
    Feb2014The Vatican Bank found Franssu had a conflict of interest.World Finance: Vatican Bank

    It emerged that the Promontory Financial Group had hired his son a few months before, which was in the midst of conducting an investigation into the bank’s operations and its relationships with clients.

    Further allegations then emerged over money laundering - which led to US investment bank JP Morgan closing one of the Vatican Bank’s accounts - after it failed to provide sufficient information about the sources of the €1.8bn (2021 equivalent $2.19 billion or 34k GD) deposits.

    Pope Francis made his first change, appointing Australian Cardinal George Pell as the Prefect for the Secretariat for the Economy, a newly created department that would oversee the annual budget of the Holy See and the Vatican.

    Shortly after his appointment, Cardinal Pell told reporters there needed to be considerable work on reforming the Vatican’s financial arm. "There needs to be changes in the economic area - not just with the so-called Vatican Bank - but more generally there is work there to be done [and] a need to ensure that things are being properly done." Other, bigger changes took a few more months to be announced.

    8Mar2014Malaysia Air Flight 370 crash.(2015) YT: LEMMiNO - Flight 370
  • 12:42 AM (16:42 UTC) Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 departs Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia during a routine flight NNE to Beijing, China.
    • 1:40:23 AM (17:40:23 UTC) Flight 370 instructed to contact Ho Chi Minh City ATC, as the airplane will soon enter Vietnamese airspace.
    • 1:42:06 AM (17:42:06 UTC) Flight 370's 2 transponders both broke or turned off, and it disappeared from transponder radar in Kuala Lumpur, Ho Chi Minh City, and Bangkok.
      • Military radar showed the aircraft had turned slightly right (NE), then a ~300 degree turn left (WSW), before swinging a slight right (WNW), and traveling straight until it left Malaysia's military radar coverage over the Strait of Malacca.
    • 3:40 AM MYL [approx] (19:40 UTC) Miltary radar coverage lost over the Strait of Malacca - before this, satcom connection in Perth reported normal activity.
    • 3:43 AM MYL [approx] (19:43 UTC) after 3 minutes of no signal, the satcom terminal logged back onto the satellite network.
    • 9:43 AM MYL [approx] (3/9/2014 03:43 UTC) Airplane is estimated to have ran out of fuel. Satcom remained online until this time.
    Apr2014Solar Cycle 24 maximum.Wiki: List of solar cycles
    2014GE plans reduction of GE Capital from 42% of GE's earnings to 25%.(2020) YT: TMIO - Fall of GEImmelt felt the stock was still undervalued, and this would speed up growth. Very different from his predecessor Jack Welsh, who used GE Capital to create massive growth in the company. GE does this with an "equity carve-out" (tax-free spin-off and sell up to 20%) which renames GE Capital to Synchrony Financial - largest provider of private-label credit cards with $12 billion (2021 equivalent $14 billion or 220 million GD) in revenue, making 29% of GE's revenue.

    17Jul2014Malaysia Air Flight 17 crash.(2022) YT: AS - UkraineThis MH17 was flying a routine flight from Amsterdam to Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. Nobody told them that there was a war going on in Crimea. A Seperatist micropower leader shot down the plane with a Buk missile system, believing it was a Ukrainian military plane. When it was revealed that this was a civilian plane, a coverup started - the goal wasn't to convince people that it didn't happen, but just to sow "reasonable" doubt in the Court of Public Opinion.

    2014GM releases both 325 (in3 or 5.3 L) and 376 (in3 or 6.2 L) G5LT engines.(2021) YT: AG - GM EnginesImprovements:
    1. Completely redesigned with only a few bolts in common with the LS.
    2. Extra 110 HP (82 kW) over LS.
    3. Cylinder head design increases power
    4. New technologies like continuous variable valve timing, dynamic fuel management, direct injection.
    5. Aluminum blocks can contain 900 HP (671 kW) and iron blocks can possibly contain 1.2k HP (895 kW). (This is in the output range of trains from 70 years ago.)

    13Mar2015Κάρολος ΠαπούλIας (Karolos Papoulias) term ends and President Προκόπης Παυλόπουλος (Prokopis Pavlopoulos) term begins.Wiki: Greek Head of StateNew Democracy party
    Apr2015GE announces complete exit of GE Capital.(2020) YT: TMIO - Fall of GEGE was going to take a $16 billion (2021 equivalent $18.44 billion or 290.4k GD) loss to complete the sale quickly, but this turned out to be $22 billion (2021 equivalent $25.35 billion or 399.2k GD) after tax at EOY. Other banks circled like vultures to carve up GE Capital, which was immensely profitable. Stock price shot up $4, from $24 to $28, on this news. Hedge funds like Trian Partners celebrated the exit of GE Capital and the prediction of $2 EPS by 2018 with the purchase of $2 billion in GE stock. GE would make more moves this year:
    • GE buys Alstom energy company (France) for $22 billion. GE's power revenues used to be 20%, but were flat after this purchase, so Alstom consumed 20% of GE's power revenues.
    • GE spends $11 billion to acquire Baker Hughes oilfield services, then another $7.4 billion to create the separately-traded BHGE oil company partnership.
    • GE split-offs Synchrony Financial. Similar to a spin-off, but shareholders get to trade with each other the shares of the daughter companies, at a given valuation. This was a large source of GE income lost.
    18Apr2015The Justice Department and FBI formally acknowledge that nearly every examiner in an elite FBI forensic unit gave flawed testimony in almost all trials in which they offered evidence against criminal defendants over more than a two-decade period before 2000.WaPo: FBI hair analysis flawOf 28 examiners with the FBI Laboratory’s microscopic hair comparison unit, 26 overstated forensic matches in ways that favored prosecutors in more than 95 percent of the 268 trials reviewed so far, according to the National Association of Criminal Defense Lawyers (NACDL) and the Innocence Project, which are assisting the government with the country’s largest post-conviction review of questioned forensic evidence. The FBI errors alone do not mean there was not other evidence of a convict’s guilt. The review confirmed that FBI experts systematically testified to the near-certainty of "matches" of crime-scene hairs to defendants, backing their claims by citing incomplete or misleading statistics drawn from their case work. In reality, there is no accepted research on how often hair from different people may appear the same.
    2015Mt Everest has risen to more than 9 km (5.6 mi).USGS - Himalayas2,900 km (1800 mi) long, the Himalayas continue to rise more than 1 cm (3/8 in) a year, slowed from the 4.5cm/yr (1 3/8 in/yr) in the past 50 million years - as the Eurasian Plate stretches out towards the Pacific Ocean, rather than thrusting up.

    2017Barack Obama presidential term ended and Donald Trump presidential term started.Wiki: POTUSes(The election between Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton was a choice between two unpalatable options to many US Americans, leading to record-low voter turnout.)
    10Apr2017Peter Engels (USA) and a team of researchers create matter with negative mass.WSU Insider: Negative Mass"With negative mass, if you push something, it accelerates toward you." said Michael Forbes, a WSU assistant professor of physics and astronomy and an affiliate assistant professor at the University of Washington. He and a team led by Peter Engels, WSU professor of physics and astronomy, created these conditions by using lasers to slow the particles, making them colder, and allowing hot, high energy particles to escape like steam, cooling the material further. The lasers trapped the atoms as if they were in a bowl measuring less than a hundred microns across. Breaking the bowl will allow the rubidium to rush out, expanding as the rubidium in the center pushes outward. To create negative mass, the researchers applied a second set of lasers that kicked the atoms back and forth and changed the way they spin.
    2017Texas Historical Commission marks Houston Astrodome as a historical building, preventing any unapproved demolition.(2019) YT: BSF - AstrodomeThis cemented the floor-raising plan.

Immelt is blamed for listening too much to analysts after 2008, and making volatile changes to the portfolio. Buffet sells all his GE shares for $315 million, and buys 17.4 million shares of Synchrony Financial for $518 million.

    3Sep2017Astronaut Peggy Whitson completed her latest space trip.Wiki: Peggy WhitsonHer first space mission was in 2002, with an extended stay aboard the International Space Station as a member of Expedition 5. She spent 60.33 total hours (2.5 days) in space across those 15 years, average 4 hours/year, longer than all but 4 other humans.
    9Sep20171I/2017 U1 ‘Oumuamua slingshotted past the Sun.NASA - 'OumuamuaIt was going of 196k MPH (87.6 km/s, 25 light seconds/day), or 0.05 AU/day which means it took 20 days to get to Earth's orbit. Classification is elusive - it displayed no visible outgassing (like an asteroid), but it picked up more speed boost from the solar slingshot than it should have - as though it were outgassing like a comet, but a transparent gas.
    2017An estimated 170k Narwhals roamed the oceans.OfWhale - How Many Whales?
    19Oct20171I/2017 U1 ‘Oumuamua [a messenger from afar arriving first aka scout] discovered by Pan-STAARS1 telescope (Hawaii).NASA - 'OumuamuaThe first confirmed object from another star to visit our solar system. We think it's long, red, narrow, and tumbling through space - but we got terrible photos because we didn't see it until it was 20 days beyond Earth's orbit. Karen Meech (Institute for Astronomy in Hawaii) and her team combined images from the FORS instrument on the ESO telescope using four different filters with those of other large telescopes. She found that ‘Oumuamua varies in brightness by a factor of 10 as it spins on its axis every 7.3 hours, suggesting that it is up to one-quarter mile (1320 ft, 400 meters) long and up to 10 times as long as it is wide (as narrow as 132 ft or 40 m). That ratio is greater than that of any asteroid or comet observed to date - the most elongated we have seen less than 3x longer than wide. (Tesla Roadster is just barely more than this at about 3.5x longer than tall.(3.946 m / 1.127 m))
    13Nov2017Flannery rolls back GE's EPS target from $2 and reduced dividend to $0.12.(2020) YT: TMIO - Fall of GEGE power revenues decline by $7 billion, blamed again on Alstom energy.
    2017Shosuke Yoshida (Japan) and other Japanese researchers study a bacteria that degrades polyethylene terephthalate (PET).(2021) YT: SH - PlasticThe bacteria was found in sediment near a plastic recycler. They named the enzyme PETase, which splits the polyethylene terephthalate (PET) into 2 benign components (ethylene and phenol?). Downside is that they release CO2.
    2017Sehroon Khan and his research team at the World Agroforestry Centre in Kunming, China discovered another biodegrading fungus in a landfill in Islamabad, Pakistan.Leaps: Plastic-Eating MushroomsAspergillus tubingensis, which turns out to be capable of colonizing polyurethane (PU) foam and breaking it down it into smaller pieces within the span of two months. Since then, Khan and his team alone have discovered around 50 more species.

    2018John Christensen estimates that trillions of dollars of assets are stored in trusts in the UK's overseas territories, possibly half of all offshore assets.(2018) YT: IPOV - Britain's 2nd Empire

    He's a former economic adviser to the secrecy jurisdiction of Jersey for a decade. For tax and legal purposes, these assets belong to nobody. (Does that mean you can't be arrested for stealing them?) These assets span financial and non-financial types: cash, art works, gold bullion, race horses, cars, real estate, any feasible store of value. Every offshore colony provides a different portfolio of services - including nominee directors, secret bank accounts, shell companies, and trusts - to meet the needs of their nefarious clients. So a given client might have their assets spread across 2 or 3 secrecy jurisdictions and other locations around the world:

    • A trust set up in one secrecy jurisdiction.
    • A few shell companies - each owning one bank account, set of shares, or yacht - in other secrecy jurisdictions.
    • Trustees in another location.
    • Beneficiaries in yet a different location.

    These exist to hide their owners and launder the money back into the global economy. Some estimate that half of the world's assets are stored in these overseas territories. Repeated attempts to establish a UN tax authority higher than the UN tax committee, which would regulate and monitor tax collection worldwide - consistently gets blocked, last time by the US and UK.

    The Cayman Islands (pop 60k) are the 5th largest financial center in the world, with 80k registered companies, 3/4 of the world's hedge funds, and $1.9 trillion (29.9 million GD) in deposits.

    Teams of people - indeed, whole industries - exist to enable and support this level of tax evasion: banks, accounting firms, offshore law firms, trustees, corporate leaders, and lawmakers.

    25% of financial transactions happen on British territory, and almost half of the world's secrecy jurisdictions are under British protection.

    5 easy steps to end tax havens:

    1. Stop making public contracts with companies based in tax havens.
    2. Public registries of owners & beneficiaries of companies, trusts, and foundations.
    3. Full transparency of agreements between companies and goverments.
    4. Country-by-country reporting of multinational companies - how much business did it transact in each nation, how much tax did it pay there, etc. (Can be audited against other corporate financial statements.)
    5. Information exchange between countries. (Getting countries to accurately report GDP or population is already difficult.)

Between 50% and 75% of the Niagara River's 5,796 m3/s (204,700 ft3/s or 0.77 CR) flow is diverted via four huge tunnels that arise far upstream from the waterfalls, before being returned.

They also found many more impact craters after the "snowball Earth" period.

    Nov2020Former space security chief Haim Eshed (Israel) claims that humans have been in contact with extraterrestrials from a galactic federation.NBCNews - Galactic Federation

    A respected professor and retired general, Eshed said the extraterrestrials were equally curious about humanity and were seeking to understand "the fabric of the universe." He continued: "There is an agreement between the US government and the extraterrestrials. They signed a contract with us to do experiments here," he said, referencing an "underground base in the depths of Mars."

    "They have been waiting until (the 21st century) for humanity to develop and reach a stage where we will understand, in general, what space and spaceships are," Eshed said, referring to the galactic federation. "The Unidentified Flying Objects have asked not to publish that they are here, humanity is not ready yet." Eshed added that Trump was aware of the extraterrestrials' existence and had been "on the verge of revealing" information, but was asked not to in order to prevent mass panic.

    Dec2020Aricebo Telescope Tower 4 auxillary cable breaks free.(2021) YT: PE - Arecibo Telescope

    Towers are named 4, 8, and 12, like on a clock. The smelter socket failed on one cable in August and another in November, each damaging part of the dish.

    Hurricane Maria was one of the strongest storms to ever hit the island earlier in the year, uninstalling nearly 3k people (0.36 Covid-days) and causing nearly $100 billion (2021 equivalent $106.87 billion) in damages. Aricebo suffered a broken line feed that broke off the instrument platform and fell through the dish.

    Further, the telescope was losing funding as the US NSF had been moving funding to newer projects.

Files expose the secret offshore affairs of:
    • 35 world leaders, including current and former presidents, prime ministers, and heads of state.
      • King Abdullah2 (Jordan) has amassed a secret $100 million (1574 GD) property empire spanning Malibu, Washington and London.
      • The Aliyev family (Azerbaijan) has traded close to £400 million ($542 million or 8535 GD) of UK property in recent years. One of their properties was sold to the Queen’s crown estate, which is now looking into how it came to pay £67m to a company that operated as a front for the family that runs a country routinely accused of corruption.
      • Uhuru Kenyatta (Kenya) and his close relatives amassed more than $30 million (472 GD) of offshore assets.
      • Prime minister Andrej Babiš (Czech republic), used an offshore investment company to acquire a $22 million (346 GD) chateau in the south of France.
      • President Nicos Anastasiades (Cyprus) had founded a law firm which was accused of hiding the assets of a controversial Russian billionaire behind fake company owners.
      • Tony and Cherie Blair (UK) saved £312,000 ($423,165 or 6.66 GD) in property taxes when they purchased a £6.5 million ($8.8 million or 138 GD) office in Marylebone.
      • Prime minister Moonis Elahi (Pakistan) contacted an offshore provider in Singapore about investing $33.7 million (530 GD).
    • 300 other public officials such as government ministers, judges, mayors, and military generals in more than 90 countries.
    • 100 billionaires, as well as celebrities, rock stars, and business leaders.
      • South Dakota is sheltering billions of dollars in assets linked to individuals previously accused of serious financial crimes. (These might be in non-profit agencies that have not been audited due to insufficient IRS staff.)
    Many use shell companies to hold luxury items such as property and yachts, as well as incognito bank accounts. There is even art ranging from looted Cambodian antiquities to paintings by Picasso and murals by Banksy.

    2021More than 90k merchant ships operate on the Earth's oceans.(2022) YT: Mustard - Nuclear ShipMost use low-grade sulfur-rich Bunker fuels in their diesel engines, which is the cheapest and most-polluting fuel available. One cargo ship can output as as much sulfur dioxide as 50 million cars, or 17% of the 286 million cars in the USA. The pollutants cause about 403k uninstalls a year (13.36% Covid-rate).
    2021A stark asset gap between US Americans of different skin pigmentation persists.Military - Black GI Bill DenialThe median income for white households in 2019 was $76,057 (2021 equivalent $85,531, or 1.35 GD), according to the US Census. For Black households, it was $46,073 (2021 equivalent $51,812, or .815 GD).
    25Dec2021James Webb Space Telescope launches.(2021) YT: NASA - JWST LaunchThis mission launched at 7:20 a.m. EST (12:20 UTC), aboard an Ariane 5 rocket from Europe’s Spaceport in French Guiana. Webb is an international collaboration between NASA, ESA (European Space Agency), and CSA (Canadian Space Agency). Thousands of engineers and hundreds of scientists worked to make Webb a reality, along with over 300 universities, organizations, and companies from 29 US states and 14 countries.
    1Jan2022Meteor explodes over Pittsburgh, PA with the energy of 30 tons of TNT (125.52 GJ).(2022) YT: NNN - Pittsburgh MeteorThe shockwave could be heard across southeastern Pennsylvania. NASA said that it would have been a fireball if it weren't so cloudy. The public is largely unconcerned because there was no pretty fireball to talk about.
    8Jan2022James Webb Space Telescope primary and secondary mirrors deployed.(2022) YT: TEC - JWST DeploymentFully deployed, JWST's sun shields are the size of 2 buses side by side, with the car-sized aperture mirror sticking up from their midpoint (or it's the size of an upside-down Tyrannosaurs Rex). This is dimensionally larger than the Ariane 5 rocket can carry, so the sunshield, secondary, and both primary mirror segments had to be folded for transport and unfolded after deployment.
    2022Modern UFO era, and AOIMSG opens.(2022) YT: UFOJ - Flying SaucersThese Tic Tac shaped craft bore some UFO enthusiasts, who enjoyed the retro saucer aesthetic. (Airborne Object Identification and Management Synchronization Group)
    24Jan2022James Webb Space Telescope reaches the Sun-Earth L2 Lagrangian Point.(2021) YT: PL - Where is JWST?This perch, about 1 million miles (1.6 million km or 5.3 light seconds) from Earth, will limit the terrestrial and solar radiation reaching the telescope, allowing it to detect more extrasolar radiation.
    Feb2022Oregon's Three Sisters mountain has a magma swell.(2022) YT: GH - Three SistersA magmatic intrusion was detected at 6 km (4mi) depth, and a swarm of local earthquakes have been detected. There has been an uplift developing just west of the complex mountain since 1995.
    2022Dr Patricia Bath inducted into National Inventor's Hall of Fame.(2021) Imgur: AwesomeThis was for creating the Laserphaco Probe.
    2022NASA sends a probe to Psyche.(2021) YT: SH - Asteroid Mining
    19Jun2022NowGilgamech: HistoryEverything new is old already.
    Oct2022NASA Lucy mission first gravity assist.NASA: Lucy missionThe spacecraft is traveling at roughly 67,000 mph (108,000 kph) on a trajectory that will orbit the Sun and bring it back toward Earth, for a gravity boost.
    Jul2023If Berkeley Pit (Butte, Montana) were not maintained and drained, it would overflow from rainwater accumulation.(2019) YT: TS - Toxic Pit
    2023Commercial landers begin hauling NASA and university payloads to the surface of the Moon.(2021) YT: UVA CFP - Bill NelsonThis will lead to the first human commercial moon lander, establishing human lunar commerce as the first step to human colonization. After this, the SLS will drop off the Orion capsule in lunar polar orbit - and rendevous with the 3rd Artemis mission, which will bring the lander. It will goto the Moon's south pole and back up, then Orion will bring everything back to Earth. The moon lander is built by Maston, a private startup.
    24Sep2023NASA mission to Bennu asteroid returns.(2021) YT: UVA CFP - Bill NelsonThe probe used an arm to scoop material off an asteroid, and returned this to Earth for analysis. This is an early asteroidal prospecting exploration. (The return has been delayed until 2023.

    2024Carbios (France) open a factory for their proprietary bacteria to degrade polyethylene terephthalate (PET), to output ingredients for 40k tons (36.3k metric tons) of plastic each year.(2021) YT: SH - PlasticPolyethylene terephthalate (PET) in bottles is very crystalline, which is still hard to break down. Heating and extruding the bottles makes them much easier to degrade, but this requires so much energy that sometimes it's more expensive and uses more energy than making new ones from petroleum.

With respect to her predecessors, Elizabeth2's "idle hand" helped lead the world to the greatest sustained peacetime period in history (Pax Americana), allowing vast and incredible scientific and technological discoveries, and causing new "maladies of prosperity" such as obesity and overpopulation.

    2040MIT predicts that society will collapse, one way or another.(2021) YT: EE - Society Collapse3 scenarios hand-picked from thousands of trials:
    • Comprehensive Technology: Industrial output and pollution peak at 2040, population levels off at around 10 billion humans on Earth. Raw materials never really run out. (Developed pre-climate change.)
    • Stabilized World: #1 but industrial output is voluntarily turned down early, in favor of crop production. (Also developed pre-climate change.)
    • Business As Usual2: Massive industrial output causes massive pollution, heavily impacting food production, which heavily impacts population, which reduces to around 2 billion humans on Earth starting in 2040. Lack of workers then reduces industrial output, alongside dwindling natural resources. The planet is left barren and polluted in the 22nd century.
    Other models were created, but these gathered less attention.

    2267James Kirk finds the Nomad probe launched in 2002.(Reference Missing)Star Trek legend. The probe thought Kirk was the other Kirk and spilled the beans. It "merged" with the Thanh Roo (tan roo), an extraterrestrial space probe - after the meteor hit, and got confused. Thanh Roo was sterilizing soil samples - mixing that with Nomad's job to find new life - lead it to want perfect life and sterilize everything lesser. And with biological life forms being unable to attain perfection, it would destroy all life. Kirk showed Nomad its mistaking him for the other Kirk, and it imploded. This spawned a trope about defeating robots by giving them a logical error based on lying or incomplete information.
    2270V'Ger sets course for Earth.(2015) YT: Trekspertise - Borg HistoryStar Trek legend
    mid-2270sStarfleet develops the vertical warp core, allowing much faster travel.(2019) YT: TAAS - TranswarpStar Trek legend. Before this, ships used a horizontal warp core, which maxxed out around Warp 6. Vertical can go past Warp 9.
    2279Federation communcation station Epsilon-9 detects a massive energy cloud.(2020) YT: TAAS - RepercussionsStar Trek legend. 3 Klingon ships, on patrol, were attacked by the cloud. James Kirk's Enterprise and crew, newly refitted, learn how to communicate and enter the cloud, finding it calls itself V'GER, and it's looking to return home. Eventually they find it's the lost Voyager 6 probe, sent by NASA in the late 20th Century.

    2373Nog (Ferenginar) claims to have saved 5 bars of gold-pressed latinum across his life.(2020) YT: EC Henry - Latinum WorthStar Trek legend. Exchange rate of gold-pressed latinum in 2373 to 2020 USD established:
    • 1 Slip in 2373 = $1 in 2020 (2021 equivalent $1.07 or 0.00421 GC)
    • 1 Strip in 2373 = $100 in 2020 (2021 equivalent 107.39 or 0.42 GC)
    • 1 Bar in 2373 = $2k in 2020 (2021 equivalent $2,148 or 8.46 GC)

    2374USS Defiant studies a subspace compression anomaly that could allow for trans-warp conduit construction.(2019) YT: TAAS - TranswarpStar Trek legend
    2377Borg Unimatrix Zero destroyed.(2015) YT: Trekspertise - Borg HistoryStar Trek legend. This further fractured the Collective, leading to a years-long civil war.
    2378USS Voyager sent to recover Friendship One space probe.(2020) YT: TAAS - RepercussionsStar Trek legend. Friendship One had been found by an extraterrestrial species, and they used the manual to copy the probe's antimatter reactor - but a reactor breach destroyed/made uninhabitable their entire planet. Voyager found 5,500 survivors, whose leader Veran demands transit to the nearest uninhabited planet - 132 light years away, would take 17 trips across 3 years. Instead Voyager used photon torpedoes to technomagically clean the atmosphere.
    2378Admiral Katherine Janeway (Earth) travels back help Captain Katherine Janeway and USS Voyager get home through a Borg trans-warp conduit.(2015) YT: Trekspertise - Borg HistoryStar Trek legend. The trip destroys a large section of the Borg trans-warp conduits, one of their major population centers, and releases a pathogen that disrupts their inter-drone communication.
    2378USS Voyager returns from Delta quadrant to Alpha/Beta quadrant(2019) YT: TAAS - TranswarpStar Trek legend. A Borg trans-warp conduit was used to travel most of the way.

    1 trilllion trilllion trilllion (1e36)Proton decay.(2019) YT: MS - futureProton half-life - if true - is reached, and they spontaneously decay into neutrinos and electrons. (A neutron decays into a proton, an electron, and a neutrino in about 15 minutes, if unbound.)
    1e36If protons decay, then all nucleons in the observable universe have decayed by this point.(2021) YT: MBS - Age of UniverseAssuming smallest possible proton half-life of 8.2e33 years.

    1e43Black Hole era begins.(2021) YT: MBS - Age of UniverseIf protons decay, then all nucleons in the observable universe have decayed by this point, assuming highest possible proton half-life.
    333 trilllion trilllion trilllion trilllion (3.33e50)Black hole mergers.(2019) YT: MS - futureBlack hole collisions become the main event in this distant time.
    150 trilllion trilllion trilllion trilllion trilllion (1.5e62)Hawking Radiation(2019) YT: MS - futureBlack holes begin to heavily evaporate due to absorbing virtual particles - giving their energy to create the particle that would have annihilated the one they absorbed. (Virtual particles are constantly popping into existence and annihilating, to repay the energy debt they created to exist in the first place, no energy gained or lost normally.)
    1e66Black hole of 1 solar mass in 2021 has decayed into subatomic particles through Hawking Radiation.(2021) YT: MBS - Age of Universe
    27 billlion trilllion trilllion trilllion trilllion trilllion (2.7e70)Dark energy inflation.(2019) YT: MS - futureUniverse is completely empty, and continues to expand, many times faster than light can move across it.

    1e200If protons decay, then all nucleons in the observable universe have decayed by this point, assuming highest possible proton half-life.(2021) YT: MBS - Age of Universe
    1e1500If proton decay does not occur, then all baryonic stellar matter has fused into iron stars by now.(2021) YT: MBS - Age of UniverseThis is through either muon-catalyzed fusion to form iron-56, or decay from a higher-mass element into iron-56.
    1ee26Conservative estimate for the time until all iron stars collapse via quantum tunneling into black holes.(2021) YT: MBS - Age of Universe
    1ee50A Boltzmann brain spontaneously appears due to spontaneous entropy increase.(2021) YT: MBS - Age of Universe(Given sufficient time in a fully-random infinite vacuum, everything is probable. Even an ape writing Shakespearian historical fiction on parchment.)
    1ee76Liberal estimate for the time until all iron stars collapse via quantum tunneling into black holes.(2021) YT: MBS - Age of Universe
